title: Nice location
text: This hotel worked out well for us. The location was good, the size of the room was fine, and it was quiet. While we only used it once, it was nice to have the food and drink available. There are lots of restaurants nearby and broadway theaters are convenient. I would stay here again.

title: It was everything we needed for a packed weekend of sight seeing.
text: The room was small but nice and clean. We felt safe with having to use a keycard to enter the building. Staff was very friendly. They held our luggage in a locked room until we were able to check in so we could go on about our day without carrying our things with us.

title: Central NYC hotel
text: The hotel is OK but the best is its location on West 40 Street.  Very central in NYC.  The rooms are a bit larger than many in NY.  I was on the 26 floor so there was no street noise at all. Comfortable bed, small shower but ll in all  OK. The staff were helpful also.

title: Does the job
text:
Basic hotel but great location.

Positives -

Location 
Friendly service 
Great customer recovery 

Negatives : 

The room was basic and small

We stayed here for 3 nights over Christmas, no major complaints and it’s close to all the sights and restaurants.

title: Great stay but offer some free coffee already
text: Great staff, very professional and courteous, was a terrific location with ability to see all the area, Christmas events and sites that New York City has to offer. Also was a good place to stay and mix in a business visit. Only complaint I would have is why not offer free coffee in the morning to guests. This is something all the courtyards do not do and I can’t figure out why

title: Prope acuillent
text: Super prope , le personnel  super gentil ,  l'ambiance cosy  , la literies  super  il nettoye régulièrement  les chambre  juste le petit déjeuner  avec notre voyage  qui étais toujours pareil memais bon  après ya quand même Starbucks   dedans   super  expérience  surtout à proximité  de tous

title: Finally a hotel with storage in NYC
text:
The staff is so friendly here! Thanks to all of you guys!

I really like that they have storage and accept packages without charging you $10 for each parcel. 

The rooms are standard. I like that it wasn't too tight a fit like others I've been to in NYC but it's not spacious either. Enough room to open a suitcase or two and still have room to walk around the room.

title: Clean, comfortable, great staff
text: This was just an overnight to see a show. The location was great, there is a parking garage very close and reasonably priced for New York standards. The staff was very friendly. Crystal Morales- guest service agent was very helpful. She told us about the parking ahead of time, she was very welcoming and friendly.  The room was very clean and quiet.  Every place, the restaurant and show was within easy walking distance.  Thank you Crystal Morales in helping to make our stay there great.

title: Great stay for good price
text: For our room rate, I was very impressed. The room was clean, not bad for size, and the bed was very comfortable. On check-in, they let us know they were putting us in a lower floor room because they tend to be bigger. Our window had no view other than other roof tops but we didn’t pay for a beautiful view. It was very quiet at night. Only criticism would be that we missed housekeeping however, I suspect we left our do not disturb sign on the door so I won’t take any stars off for this.  For a value priced hotel in a great location to Midtown theaters and restaurants, I would definitely choose this hotel again. Bonus; coffee shop in lobby staffed with lovely and friendly folks.

title: Perfectly acceptable hotel and even better if needing MSG/Penn Station
text: I was here last week spending the night/day transiting from Italy.  I chose the hotel due to its proximity to transit.  I don't know what one reviewer is thinking, but the rooms are the opposite of spacious, but hey this in NY!

title: Good hotel, good service, modern large rooms
text:
Very good. Excellent location. Large, well, modernly-furnished, large rooms, good service, cordial and effective staff.  

breakfast overpriced and very disappointing. what else can you get though from something run by starbucks?

title: Comfortable stay in NYC
text:
Arrived on a red eye to JFK and navigated the AirTrain and Long Island Railroad to New York Penn Station. From Penn Station walked to the Courtyard Marriott Times Square West.  As a Marriott Bonvoy member I was very happy that our room was ready early.  We stayed in a two queen guest room. 

Highlights:

Within walking distance to many restaurants, subway station, Times Square, Theatre district, Garment district, shopping

Friendly and courteous staff

Secure with doorman at the entrance and hotel key card to access lobby and in elevator to access guest floors

Clean room with shampoo/conditioner/body wash dispenser, bathtub with shower, small bottles of lotion, hand soap, make up remover, room safe, mini fridge, iron/ironing board, hair dryer, electrical outlets throughout.

You can choose to have housekeeping daily or every other day.

We were able to request a late check out which was very convenient.

Tips:

The hotel is on a fairly “quiet” street and busy 8th Avenue is at the corner.  We felt safe walking to and from the hotel but you should always be aware of your surroundings.  One morning there was a man passed out by a sharps collection box nearby who was there most of the day which was sad to see.

Nearby Angelina Bakery, The People’s Café, Best Bagels and Eats, and White Castle were our go-tos for light bites.  We had a nice Italian dinner at Tavola .

We walked or took the subway everywhere we wanted to go to.

Refilled our water bottle at the hotel fitness center.

title: Nice hotel, Good location, Friendly staff
text: Visited for 2 nights pre cruise.  Arrived late due to flight delay and the front desk was polite and helpful.  Room slightly larger then the “standard New York” size room.  Beautiful decorated and clean.  Had coffee machine for me is a plus.  No delay for elevators like some hotels. Fab location to Penn station and Madison Square gardens.  Lots of bars, restaurants, and shops (CVR etc) nearby.  Have stayed in several hotels in Manhattan before that I would not go back to but would definitely stay here again.  Thank you for taking care of me – see you soon.

title: Amazing staff
text:
Rooms are standard size for New York. Not enough outlets near the bed ( 1 out of 2 didn't work) but bed was really comfortable and the staff was amazing. Crystal was super friendly and helpful and Rosa lent us her umbrella during a freak rain storm. I'd happily stay here again. 
Location was great and easy walk to Javits, Times Square etc. 

Elevator came quickly every time.

title: Fine hotel, great staff, Wifi sucks. Do not book for business
text:
Hotel location is great for midtown. Staff is great. Hotel seems totally normal. But my Wifi only works for a few limited at a time. I connect and can pull up a few web pages but it only lasts a few minutes. I’ve had to mostly rely on my phones hotspot. It’s 2023, shouldn’t be having these issues. Unable to work and will he sure to tell coworkers not to stay here. I wife t had this problem at a hotel in many years (think 10 years ago when you aid to pay and the Wifi still don’t work). 

Also the chargers by the beds won’t hold a plug, they’re too work out and it falls right out. Had to go to a staples to buy some king cords to run from the bathroom to keep Lu phone and laptop charged. 

Do  it recommend staying here

title: Prompt and courteous service
text: Great customer service the minute I walked through the doors for the first time. I arrived hours earlier before check in and was greeted by Angel, who had a room available for me right away. I had no issues in the duration of my four-day stay. The staff was courteous throughout.

title: Good hotel in great location
text: We typically stay at Marriott properties so we chose this location for a week stay.  $75 taxi ride for LaGuardia.  It is about 4 blocks to Times Square in one direction and about 3 blocks from Madison Square Garden in another direction.  Thus, the location made it easy to walk to many attractions.  Subway stations are close too.  Checkin was easy with staff being very helpful. The room was nice, larger than I expected in New York.  It was not fancy but it was very nice and clean.  The staff was helpful during our stay…meal suggestions, ride help.  The only issue that worried me was the elevators.  They would act up from time to time.  One lady got stuck once.  Other than that, good choice and I would probably stay there again.

title: Excellent, très calme et propre
text: Personnel vraiment très gentil, je me souviens en particulier d'Aaron et Angel, mais tous étaient aux petits soins. La chambre était très propre (2602), vue sur Manhattan très appréciable. De la place pour les affaires, grande salle de bain, lit king size (180cm) très moelleux et confort. Machine à café . Très très calme (bien insonorisé), clim. Emplacement idéal (coin 37th/8ème Ave). Excellent rapport qualité prix. Nous reviendrons ! Merci

title: Great location and spacious rooms
text:
The location of the hotel is excellent. Close to subway station. 

The customer service during checkin process was very good.

The rooms are very spacious considering regular NY rooms. Very clean and confortable. The only are of opportunity that always i need to highlight are the pillows; a extra soft; you need two to be pleasant. 

The hotel offers breakfast and is very good. 

We could stay again.

title: Terrible ****Marriott*** property
text:
I requested front desk agent to remove my credit card since I checked out paying CASH $1132.00. They billed my credit card over one month with a ***pending transaction $1200.00 **** which I discovered from my credit card that decreases the cardholder's available credit balance. 

The 9th floor Cooridor plus the w lifts were muggy and you can feel no a/c at all. The guest room welcome brochure stated by the GM- Bob that there is a whirlpool on premises but that was false lies.

The staff ****unfriendly***as other Marriott properties I stayed in past are always friendly -especially when interacting with guest anyway in hotel should greet them as politeness.

One front desk agent refused to accept my cash as payment a previous night to my checkout until I got upset.
I sent an email directly to GM -Bob plus -Angel -mgr but no **Adam response back as I'm the customer -to state how they can improve and make me happy camper. Nothing.

Good thing was plumbing, a/c, and no noise from my room 916.

title: great location, but older rooms
text: great location but rooms are old and still have carpets that can smell moldy. staff are really friendly and accommodating but the rooms are tired. elevators are really slow, give yourself a lot of time in the morning/evening if you're staying here for business. it was a really LONG wait (close to 20 mins) in the morning for an elevator!

title: Book in this hotel and pray that they haven't resold your room before your arrival.
text: Unforgettable Experience for a First Night in New York: It's midnight, and I find out that the room I had reserved ten days in advance and confirmed on Booking.com has been resold to another guest. So, no more available rooms. The only solution? Sleeping in front of the reception area, waiting for the next day. No help from the staff, no solutions offered, and the hotline was constantly busy... I make another reservation through Booking.com, this time with advance payment for a second night. But guess what? The room gets canceled in the same fashion, without any explanation. Avoid this place at all costs. It's nothing short of a drama and lacks any sense of professionalism.

title: Poor customer service
text:
Location is very good, near to most sites, staff helpful apart from when I reported an item missing from our room. 
I left my phone charger on the bedside cabinet, the only people that had access that day, were the housekeeping staff, and on my return, the charger was no longer there.

Help with this issue was minimal, and I must say that I was made to feel as if it was somehow my fault. The wording "Items that you may have lost", not appropriate, I did not lose anything.

Hello,
Whilst staying at The Courtyard, room 2714, i have experienced a problem, which I reported, and I would like an up date. 
After leaving the room on the morning of Sunday 14th May 2023, and returning at approx midnight of the same day, I discovered that my Samsung mobile charger, was no longer on the right hand side bed  cabinet. 
Missing items 

1. USB-A to USB-C Data Charging Cable
2. 25W Travel Adapter (Super Fast Charging with USB Type-C Cable)
and 
 3. USA to UK   Adaptor Plug

Housekeeping, were in attendance that day, would it have been possile that the cleaner placed them on the bed, and as they were white they became mixed up with the sheets?

Anyway, please let me know, what has happened to my items, and what compensation / replacement of the items is forth coming? Thank You 

RESPONSE
Thank you for bringing to our attention about the missing ......
  ITEMS YOU MAY HAVE LOST ........
during your recent stay with us. Our team has conducted an extensive search throughout your room and common areas as well has the housekeeping linen chute and room attendant storage carts yet unfortunately we were unable to locate the items you have described.

Please rest assured that we take matters like this very seriously and have a strict protocol in place to handle lost and found items. Despite our efforts we did not locate the items in question.

Thank you for choosing the  Courtyard By Marriott Times Square West for your recent trip to NYC.

I would like to apologize again for any inconvenience caused during your recent stay at our hotel. In regard to the items reported missing during housekeeping service, please know that we take complaints very seriously and have thoroughly investigated the matter of the missing charger/adapter with management and staff and have found no evidence of missing items.
Our housekeeping staff is very forthcoming when it comes to handling guest items that are LEFT BEHIND  and are instructed to not touch any personal items during service as per Marriott standard. We will not be providing compensation but truly regret any frustration or disappointment this may have caused you.

SO I DID NOT LOSE THE CHARGER, IT HAS NOT BEEN FOUND IN THE ROOM, HOUSE KEEPING DO NOT HAVE IT.

And no one at Courtyard seems to care !!!!

Zero Marks on Customer Service

title: Lovely receptionist Crystal made our stay
text: This is an excellent hotel with friendly staff in a central location in Manhattan. Crystal at reception was especially kind and helped us with a problem we had with our room on arrival. She quickly swapped us to another without any problems. She always welcomed us with a smile too. The doormen are also very friendly and quick to assist eg with baggage . There’s no free Bfast but there’s a nearby 7/11 that does good Brazil blend coffee and fresh bakery items . We enjoyed our stay - thank u crystal!

title: Great Family Stay
text: Excellent hotel within a 10 min. walk of Times Square. We were a family of four (2 parents/2 teens) looking at colleges in the area and wanted to spend a night downtown. We needed two queen beds which is very hard to come by in NYC and this fit the bill. Rooms are updated, extremely clean, and really quiet for sleeping. Security was top-notch with guards at the front desk/door, room keys needed to access elevators, and front doors locked at night. I didn’t feel unsafe for a minute! For those who have written reviews about it being a sketchy area, I think you need to realize where you’re headed. You’re in downtown New York City by Times Square. You’re going to see homeless, you’re going to smell pot. You need to use street smarts when you’re walking around, but that’s part of visiting a large city. I live outside of Boston and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone.

title: Excellent stay!
text: This stay was the best from beginning to end! Clean and quiet room, very convenient location, PLENTY of places to eat and entertainment near, easy access to transportation. My husband and I were able to walk basically everywhere we wanted to go which I really appreciated. ALL of the staff were amazing! Special shout out to Crystal who checked us in and made sure everything was going good with our stay … we had one issue with the television and she got it rectified right of way and even called our room to follow up. Also thanks to the bellman (didn’t get his name.. young, dark complexion curly hair, slim build) who helped us with our bags with a very pleasant attitude. Thankyou Courtyard Times Square for an EXCELLENT STAY!!

title: Neighborhood is sketchy
text:
Good: the hotel staff was great. Our room was very clean. The bathroom immaculate. Early check-in was a breeze. The location is convenient to Penn Station. There’s a Starbucks in the morning in the lobby.

Bad: unfortunately the neighborhood is super sketchy.  I’m from a big city and have seen a lot so I’m writing this for others who may not have. Upon arrival in the early afternoon, there was a man being revived from an overdose right in front of the hotel. There were needles everywhere, 20 minutes later when we were leaving, he was still outside shooting up again.  There is a needle disposal box on the block / enough said.  We found a lot of people like this in the surrounding blocks. I feel bad for the people who work at the hotel because they clearly need to deal with this regularly.  I don’t write a lot of reviews but really felt like I needed to warn folks.  Not the hotel’s fault but NYC needs to get on the homeless situation.

title: Fab 5 days in NYC
text: Excellent location. Friendly staff. Large comfortable room with lovely beds after a busy day exploring the city. Super clean. Dunkin Donuts at the end of the block is great for a coffee and donut on the go. Highly recommend 2 Bros Pizza round the corner - $1.50 slices are yummy!

title: You have been warned!
text: Usually not staying at Marriott properties, but we decided to give this one a try. What a miserable and nasty experience indeed! Very expensive room rate, disengaged staff, dirty and small rooms, non-existent housekeeping etc.  I would urge you to think twice before considering a stay at this hotel. The location is really great, but there are many other hotels nearby that are substantially better, many even at a lower price.

title: The best staff!
text:
Courtyard Times Square West has the absolute best staff! Crystal and Steven always had a friendly word and were very, very accommodating. Ditto with Aaron!

I stayed here for over a month January/February 2023, and again in March for a week when my travels brought me back to the city. 

Rooms are large for NYC and very clean. Very walkable to Times Square and the theater district.

title: Very friendly staff!
text:
My husband and I recently spent one night at this hotel.

We took the train into Penn Station from New Jersey, and easily walked a few blocks to the CBM.  We have stayed in this area before and find it very convenient.  We were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready for an early check in at approximately 11:30 AM.

Although our standard room was on the small side (typical for NYC), it was very clean, and the bathroom was large.  We were on the 4th floor, which had very little natural light.  Had we waited for a room on a higher floor, this probably would have been improved, but again, it was nice to settle into our room early.

The hotel is walkable to the theater district.

Our room was located directly across from the elevators, but we did not hear any noise during the night.  

Food service is minimal at this hotel.  Starbucks is served during the morning hours in the breakfast area.  They advertise bar service in the evenings, but it was closed during our stay.  There are many bars and restaurants near the hotel, so it wasn't an issue.

Upon checking out, we left our luggage at the hotel's reception area, and enjoyed a day in Manhattan, reclaiming it later in the day.

The staff was very polite and friendly.  The hotel was very secure.  We would not hesitate to return.

I gave 4 stars rather than five, due to the lack of facilities at the hotel.

title: Enjoyable family stay - comfortable double Queen rooms
text: In town for the Feb. long weekend and needed 2 rooms with either 2 doubles or 2 queen beds. Had a game one night @ MSG so being somewhere between Times Sq & MSG was key. What looked like good sized room in the pictures and mainly positive reviews online led to the decision to stay at this location. The rooms were indeed comfortable, good sized washrooms with plenty of counter space and good quality towels for a Courtyard. For a family travelling with older teenagers, this hotel fit the bill perfectly.  Very short walks to MSG, Times Sq,  the Empire St Bldg and very good transportation options to get around elsewhere. Many good family food options within short distance as well. There are some quirks however to consider - one room had a full sized mini fridge, the other room had one half the size. For those needing only one bed, looking at the room map on the door, some rooms are indeed tight and tiny with not much room. The front deck staff were very friendly, but for Bonvoy Elite members, this hotel "does not participate in room upgrades" so there is no possibility of booking a lower floor and switching  to a room with a better view, or a higher floor at check in. Finally, the area in general is very busy from morning to evening, but still better then the heart of Times Sq, so for folks looking for quieter surroundings, they will not find it here. Overall, it was a good family hotel that was close to our needs. If it was just myself on business or a getaway with my spouse only, I would maybe consider other locations due to the no upgrade policy and leaving it to chance of getting stuck with one of the very small  sized rooms.

title: Gem of a hotel!
text: We stayed here last week for our first trip to New York!,What a gem of a hotel, down a quiet street but yet near alot of sites to explore!It was spotless and we had grand comfy beds.The staff were so friendly and helpful, would highly recommended staying here.We were a family of 3 with a teenage son.

title: Convenient location, cosy and friendly atmosphere
text: This is one of the places where I feel like home, the moment you arrive, you'll be greeted with a warm welcome, the check-in procedure, especially through the app, has been extremely efficient, the room itself and their facilities have been clean, tidy and attention has been taken into detail. Mr. Miguel has been extremely supportive and it's been a great stay, thank you!

title: Convenient base for a New York weekend
text: This hotel checked all the boxes for a Broadway weekend.  The room was typical size for NYC standards, with not much more than a desk and desk chair, wardrobe, and dresser, but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  There was an in-room coffee maker, and while housekeeping was not provided, we could call or go down to the front desk to get extra coffee and cups any time.  The location was very convenient to both Penn Station and Broadway theaters.  We were on the 20th floor, but rarely had to wait for an elevator.  Staff was pleasant and helpful.  I would stay there again.

title: Great  location and spotlessly clean rooms
text:
Hotel is in a great location just away from the busiest parts of Times Square but close enough to get to everything. Room was a great size, bigger than we expected for New York. Room was clean and daily housekeeping were great. Staff were welcoming and friendly. Would definitely consider staying here again.
Reviews talking about homeless people could apply to every hotel in a 10 block radius. The problem wasn't any worse here, if anything, it's location just off 8th Avenue corner was quiet.

title: Posizione centrale
text:
Posizione centrale a 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square e 2 minuti alla fermata della metro. Tutto il personale gentile e disponibile.
La nostra camera Queen con due letti, piccola ma sufficiente ad un soggiorno breve. Letti comodi e finestre insonorizzate.
La colazione non a buffet un po' ridotta. Consisteva in un bevanda calda a scelta e a due ordinazioni tra dolci/frutta/cereali.
Il rapporto qualità prezzo è buono considerata la posizione e la città.
Nel complesso soggiorno positivo e da consigliare per una visita a New York.

title: I recommend Courtyard Marriott
text: It's in a great location, close to everything; Rockefeller  Center, Times Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park. 5th Avenue shops, close to subway stations.  They have a coffee station with great choices of coffee, chai, hot cocoa, the place is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, beds are comfortable. Had a great time in Manhattan.

title: Great position close to Times Square and Maddison Square Gardens
text:
Great quiet location off the main streets but walking distance to Times Square, Madison square gardens and Broadway for the shows.
Plenty of restaurants delis, and food carts close by. Easy access to the overseas terminal.
Staff were responsive to our needs and the cleanliness was excellent.

Would recommend to anyone

title: Up to the Marriott standard, but on the small side
text:
We stayed at this Marriott overnight on Sunday.  It felt new, clean and well maintained, but the hotel is on the tiny side.  The price was right, about $225 a night.

The hotel is located on west 37th street between 8th and 9th Avenues.  It’s about three blocks north of Penn Station, a good location.  It’s not in midtown, but it is in the Fashion District, previously known as the Garment District.

The hotel is secure.  This is not meant to imply it needs to be secure, but that the staff and design of the hotel has taken this into account.  After you check 8n, your keycard opens the front door.  To enter the hotel otherwise, the front desk staff sees you and opens the sliding glass automatic door.

The elevators need your keycard to activate the floor buttons.  Obviously your room lock works the same way.  When we returned to the hotel in the evening, the front desk staff asked our room number.  I assume they checked us off a list.  All these are good things.

The rooms are modern, but small.  The bathroom is modern, but it has a tub and shower curtain, not a walk in shower.  There are plenty of towels.  The room was quiet and the bed was comfortable.  The room had a coffee maker.

The staff was friendly and accommodating.

The cafe opened at 6:30 AM.  You bought your breakfast if you wanted one.  I think the cafe served as the bar on weekday evenings.

title: Very dark room, terrible shower with extremely poor quantity of water, no lobby space. No bar. So expensive for all that
text:
You expect much more when is hotel under Marriott brand. Very bad expiriencies about lights in the room, room is very dark, extremely poor shower, room is noisy at all and uncomfortable. Staf is Ok. Lobby actually not exist, so small space,
There is poor bar, what is open only in the morning, during all day is closed.
This hotel should be max 3 stars, very expensive for all that you get.

title: Nice staff and clean, not the greatest area
text: The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Gyselle at the desk was so sweet and super helpful. We were right by the elevator and well,NY never sleeps lol. It was loud and waking us up all night. We wanted to change hotels after arriving as we were celebrating our 35th anniversary. Gyselle was very courteous and helped us get a refund.   This location was close to Times Square, unfortunately had alot of homelessness and goings on right out front.

title: Wonderful Staff.. Rough Neighborhood
text:
In any other location this hotel would be a 4 star.  

1.   A for cleanliness... the lobby and my room was immaculate
2.  A  for the staff... the team couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating
3.  A for hotel security.  All guests need to use their room card to enter the hotel and ride the elevator to their floor
4.  B I had issues with the wifi and had to go to the lobby several times...when I checked in ...my room outlets could not charge my computer or phone... the hotel responded immediately and the issue was resolved
5.  B The only food is for purchase ( other than snacks in the lobby) is breakfast.  The menu is limited but run by Starbucks.  There are no options for drinks late afternoon so if you feel like having a glass of wine or cocktail you need to leave the hotel
6.  C While the hotel is close to times square and the theatre district , I felt the location was farther west than I prefer and I don't care care for Hells Kitchen area overall
7.  D The neighborhood is very sketchy...I walked out of the hotel in the afternoon and saw a man just a few feet from the hotel front door shooting up,,syringe in hand...many homes sleeping on the streets within 1 block from the hotel
8.  D  I found the hotel to be  expensive considering the location and lack of full service.  There was a small gym in the hotel.. a plus
9  D  the bathroom was very small ..very little counter space

title: Hidden little gem in the heart of NYC
text: OMG, what a great hotel in the heart of the Big apple. I checked in on Sunday morning, I had tickets to the Rage Against The Machine concert at the MSG. Only 2 blocks away from the venue!!! Very clean, cozy room, great housekeeping staff and amazing Front Desk staff, very attentive, friendly and super professional. Very accommodating and service forward. Congratulations to the managers for having such a great assets at the Front Desk like Mr Robert Clarizio who was just more than professional, offering alternatives for my better stay. He was next to Ms. Gyselle Bera which also was very professional. Thank so much for your great hard work and professionalism.

title: Hotel personnel have to do a better job..
text: Went for a family reunion booked 2 rooms our stay was for a week.Reception was great very attentive,Informative.. I had an option of cleaning service every  day which I did and it was the worst… I had to tell reception most of the time to let them know to change my sheets and the one time they did change the sheet they were ripped from the corners, old and smelly… bathrooms were not properly cleaned. I was very disappointed it… its a really beautiful hotel but housekeeper have to do a better job.. at the end of my stay I told the receptionist and he didn’t even care…

title: Great Trip and Hotel was central made great by door man who could not do enough
text:
Great Trip and Hotel was central made great by door man who could not do enough.
Room was nice and clean. Staff friendly. Lots of places to eat local. Fridge in room very useful and lots of very nice takeaways to eat in room when too tired to go out.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of so many popular New York attractions. 

The room was modern and very spacious for a solo traveller. It had a coffee machine, safe, hairdryer, toiletries, tv, air-con and wifi. The room did not have a significant view but that didn’t bother me as I didn’t spend much time in it. There was a water and ice dispenser on the 5th floor which was very welcome during the hot weather.

I found the reception staff very helpful and welcoming. There was added security knowing that only residents could use a key card to access the main door and elevators.

Starbucks has a presence on the ground floor, with various breakfast options. There are numerous eateries nearby for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

It was very convenient getting the subway a couple of blocks away from the hotel to the JFK AirTrain. 

I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to a return visit.

title: Good Hotel, Neighborhood Not Great
text:
We had a good five-day stay in this hotel. Staff were friendly and very accommodating. The hotel is in close proximity to public transportation and tourist sites. The room was clean, but we had to ask for a roll of toilet paper every day. Housekeeping should just leave an extra roll as standard practice. 

I lived in New York 10 years ago and I can not believe how much this area has changed. I know this is not the fault of the hotel, but I feel it is worth mentioning here. This area, particularly 8th avenue from Penn Station to 37/38th streets is full of slumped over junkies who can hardly stand up or who are laying in the middle of the sidewalk. One morning we came out of the hotel and there was a man sitting in a doorway shooting up. There were times we could not get by on the sidewalks and had to walk in the street because groups of people were camped outside the free clinic next door to the hotel. There are needles and broken crack pipes on the streets. Another night we came home and could hardly get by the sidewalk on 8th Avenue because they were handing out methadone pills. It was here where we witnessed a woman chewing her wrists to the bone. We witnessed drug deal after drug deal go down as we walked home from various outings during the day. I know this is NY. I’ve lived here before and have lived in many big cities around the world, however, the state of this area of NY is like I have never seen it before. 

I will state again, the hotel and its staff were great, however, due to the current state of the surrounding area, I would choose to stay in another neighborhood the next time I visit NY.

title: Not clean, indifferent staff.
text:
The hotel was not clean at all. There was blood on the sheets, hair ties and other trash left over from the previous guest, and the bathroom needed additional cleaning. My stay could have been perfectly fine, but due to the lack of cleanliness, I would highly recommend that you stay elsewhere, especially if you are looking to stay near Penn Station. 

The staff was also not particularly friendly nor warm. I was never greeted when walking into the hotel despite how close the front desk is to the front door. The staff seemed rather indifferent towards the needs of the guests. 

Maybe bringing back daily housekeeping would help keep the rooms cleaner. I would also recommend improving upkeep as all the outlets in my room were loose and could not hold my chargers.

title: Great staff and location!
text: Had a wonderful time here!  Excellent location. Nice clean hotel - good size rooms.  Have fridge and coffee maker too!  Staff was super friendly and helpful, especially Carmelo who assisted with our luggage and Crystal - who checked us in and out - both very nice and went out of their way to assist!  Thanks and we will return!!

title: Bon hôtel pas loin de Time square
text:
Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans cet hôtel trouvé avec booking.
Les prix étaient excellents pour New York et la chambre est propre et literie au top ! 
Il manque juste un peu de rangement pour les affaires 
Sinon il y a une laverie aussi 
Un point à signaler est le centre de soin de santé pour sdf juste à côté de l’hôtel avec la population qui va avec 
Mais rien de gênant et l’hôtel et les chambres sont très calmes.
On peut prendre son petit déjeuner dans plein d’endroit à proximité

title: Tacky and Cramped
text: I spent five days here and wish I hadn't.  I rarely criticize hotels for having small rooms -- that's fairly standard for big cities.  This room was so small I could not unfold the suitcase stand and open the door all the way.  There was absolutely no space for anything.  There was a cafe open for breakfast that had 3 menu options and some stale pastries.  Despite signs for the bar in the elevator, the bar was not open the entire week.  The common areas were institutionally brightly lit and tacky, while the lighting in the bathroom was not adequate to do make up.  I won't be back and I wouldn't recommend it.

title: Such a great stay!
text: I once again took a red eye from San Francisco and again it was so cold in Manhattan  Angel was able to check me in at 10 am and was just so professional and friendly.  Every time I passed the front desk, not only did he greet me but I was able to get my questions answered.  I love the closeness to Penn Station because I take New Jersey Transit from Newark Airport to Manhattan.  You are close to so much in the area, and walking is just so convenient.  Again being in Manhattan, the room are NYC small but it is clean, and everything you is there. I even forgot my toothbrush, I could have easily walked to Duane Reade but the front desk had one of me.  The room had alcohol wipes and it seems like all the precautions were taken for Covid.  Thank you Courtyard and thank you Angel.

title: Perfect stay, no issues
text: Greeted by friendly reception staff, our stay was without issues and i'd happily stay again. Room was clean, up to date and serviced daily.  Location couldn't get much better... Penn station around the corner, times square a few blocks away and one of the best Bagel cafes on the next street. Don't hesitate to book

title: Good Stay, Convenient Loction
text: Chose this hotel because of its proximity to Penn Station. It was a comfortable stay with an accommodating staff. Our flight arrived early in the morning and they allowed us to check in early at 9AM. Rooms was nice for the price and very clean.

title: Convenient Location for Penn Station
text: Returned to the Courtyard Times Square West for one night as a Bonvoy Plat. The hotel's location is excellent for Penn Station arrivals and departures, and also very convenient for downtown access using the E trains (the 35th St entrance on 8th Ave opens directly to the WTC bound E platform). The room I was assigned as a Plat seemed smaller than one I had received before as a Gold but it was not a big deal for a one night stay. As other users have pointed out, Shower Gel is not offered by default. The US$10 credit had to be manually adjusted after check out but I did appreciate that the restaurant was able to make me a latte about 10 minutes after the breakfast cut off time. Somewhat oddly the hotel does not offer complimentary water to guests, including elite guests, though the Front Desk comped a bottle from the pantry during my stay. Will return for the convenient location.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: i stayed myself and i have no expectation of hotels in Manhattan. but then this hotel was nice enough, the room was quite big and clean. facilities are good they have laundry machine and dry machine so you can do your laundry during the stay. location was really great you can reach MoMA, central park, Chelsea market etc on foot, it will take 30mis.

title: Very disappointing
text:
I am here already  for 7 days - the room was cleaned only once. No shower gel. I need to chase the stuff for everything - shampoo, soap, towels, toilet paper...
The room is very small.
Good location, but this is the only advantage. 
I would not stay here again.

title: good stay but poor communication
text:
great stay, clean rooms; however I’ve tried contacting the hotel about my security/ accidental damage deposit and i can’t get in touch for my money to be refunded. Quick enough to take it off me but it’s been 8 days since we left and still no money back and no response to emails. I was told if I did not have the refund within 7 days to email the @ that they have given me, but that email does not receive emails and has an automatic response.  
I need this money refunded as this was the agreement. 
Please can somebody get back to me ASAP. 
Thanks

title: Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location
text: If you’re looking for a hotel in New York look no further! This hotel is in the perfect location, all the theatres, Time Square, Empire State, Rockerfeller are all within less than half an hours walk away. Central Park is just over half an hours walk and if you don’t want to walk the subway is a few minutes walk from the hotel. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and quite large. It’s not ultra modern but if you’re exploring New York like we were you’re not going to be sat in the room admiring the decor.

title: Great stay
text: My mom and I had a great weekend stay at this hotel. The room was very small, but that’s to be expected for the city and we didn’t spend much time in the room. Most importantly, the room was clean and comfortable. The location was great- we walked nearly everywhere. The front desk staff was very friendly. Breakfast wasn’t included but had some good options to purchase. Only complaint is that I requested extra pillows a few times and never received them. This is a no frills hotel but was a great option, more affordable than some other nearby options.

title: Not so good.
text: Titanium membership is not Appreciated here with no upgrades.A very low budget hotel with tiny rooms. Old and run down. No housekeeping service. Front desk staff not very nice . Room was not ready at check-in time. Not as close to time square attractions etc. that I thought given the name. Not nearly the Marriott experience being a titanium member we are used to.

title: Good value
text: Nothing particularly remarkable about this hotel, but the price was reasonable and the service was good. Great location for sightseeing with easy access uptown or downtown. We spent 4 days here and were pleased.

title: Great stay in 34th st / Times square area
text:
Great stay. I stayed across the street at both Homewood suites and Hilton garden Inn and both don't compare in service or cleanliness to this property.

From check in by friendly front desk clerk to the large and very clean and great smelling room  everything was up to marriot standard.  As a Hilton Diamond I'm now looking at spending my hard earned money with Marriot more often. The only downside to Marriot is you pay for the microwave . I will return when in this area again

title: SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE PUTS GUESTS IN JEOPARDY
text:
I stayed at this hotel for three nights in October during New York Comic Con. The 27-story hotel was fully booked (or so I was told during check in). Yet on the evening of 10/9/2021, there were ONLY TWO STAFF ON DUTY to handle possible emergencies AND THERE WAS NO WAY TO REACH EITHER STAFF PERSON FROM INSIDE OR OUTSIDE THE HOTEL. I leaned of this only because I tried unsuccessfully calling the front desk from my in-room phone and even when I used my cell phone to contact the front desk there was no answer and no ability to leave a message (because the mailbox was full).  When I went down to the lobby I learned from Antonio that he and the housekeeping person were the only two on duty.

That immediately raised red flags because, in the event of a police, fire or medical emergency, guests would not be able to be assisted by staff. Indeed, guests would have zero way to contact staff to alert them to an emergency and would thus need to fend for themselves. In the rare situation where a full evacuation of the tower might be required, there would be insufficient staff numbers to assist disabled guests. In my opinion, that is not consistent with the duty of care owed by innkeepers. 

Significantly, EVEN MARRIOTT CS COULD NOT REACH ANYONE AT THE HOTEL! Indeed, recognizing the serious safety issues posed by the understaffing, they tried repeatedly during a 37-minute call to reach someone at the at the hotel and were unable to make contact.  

Finally, this safety risk was completely preventable to the extent the general manager, Bob Handler, apparently knew weeks in advance that the hotel would be at or near capacity. The reason I am raising these safety concerns is because nothing like this has never happened during any of my more than 550 previous nights at Bonvoy properties over the course of the past 20 years. That reality highlights just how serious the issue is and why folks considering this hotel should book elsewhere.

title: Clean big rooms for NYC
text: Pretty good location, me and my 19 yo daughter stayed here. Room was big for nyc! Beds were very comfortable. Close enough to Times Square but wasn’t interested in spending much time there was good to see a timer to. Sketchy outside of the hotel of course that’s typical in New York but not as sketchy as some other areas near a time square. Hotel was very clean everything was very new. Would stay again if I was interested in staying in the Times Square area

title: Pleasant stay!
text: I completed a weekend stay at the Courtyard and had a pleasant experience. From check-in to check-out, the staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Penn Station which is convenient for Amtrak travelers. The room was comfortable with modern amenities. While food options are limited due to COVID-19, there are a number of cafes and restaurants nearby. Highly recommended!

title: Great location, Near everything
text: Checked into this conveniently located hotel in midtown Manhattan this past Saturday. We got to hotel early in the afternoon and they let us check in early (1:00pm) which was a plus. Hotel room was clean and comfortable. Hotel followed all COVID protocols. This hotel was great for walking to Times Square or Empire State Building. Highly recommended

title: Convenient hotel. very friendly front desk
text:
This typical Courtyard is very convenient if you need to be in midtown. It is a 5 minute walk from Macys, Penn Station and MSG as well as Times Square. The king room is big enough for a side chair, bed and desk/chair. The bathroom is rather large - shower only, but a good shower at that. While the bistro is not open due to COVID, it is quite large and there is also a large outdoor space for enjoying food and beverage when it gets warmer and they can re-open the bistro. 
The hotel is close to a lot of fast food places and restaurants though again COVID is limiting a lot of the options. (I hope these food places will survive the lengthy shutdowns.) 
I regret I did not get the name of the woman working the front desk but she was very friendly and welcoming. 

I have been staying at the Renaissance Midtown when in town, but given the price difference, this will be my new go-to place.

title: Ubicacion.-
text: Excelente hotel, muy buena ubicación, cuartos muy limpios y el personal fue muy amable. No hace falta decir que queda cerca de muchisimos restaurantes y por supuesto tambien queda cerca del metro. Penn station queda a unas cuatro cuadras.

title: Me encantó
text: Estuve en el cuarto 921 y es grande limpio todo súper bueno! Me encanto y muy económico justo lo que necesitaba para mi y mi familia! A pasos de Time square! Volvería de seguro! El staff del lobby muy amable, me sentí segura y feliz de estar aquí!

title: Great location and clean room!
text: The location is excellent to everywhere in midtown Manhattan. The staffs are lovely. But they did not provide the room services to clean up my room after I had stayed there for 4 nights. I felt a bit disappointed. Other than that, everything was fine. The room is big enough in NYC.

title: どこに行くにも便利なホテル
text: 2019年9月のニューヨーク旅行で3泊しました。正午ごろに到着し、アーリーチェックインはできず、荷物を預けて少し観光と買い物後、15時にチェックイン。タイムズスクエアに徒歩圏内で便利。部屋もコンパクトながら清潔感があり、ベッドも快適でした。

title: Steven is awesome!
text: I wanted to leave a huge shoutout to Steven for being so considerate and accommodating. You went out of your way to make sure I had everything I needed in order to make the most out of my stay and I truly appreciate it.

title: Great location, clean decent sized room
text:
Great location for wandering around the city, close to Times Square but not too close or noisy. 
Lovely reception area and staff.
Room was clean and modern, decent size for NYC too.
Handy cafe and breakfast floor with lots of seating and tv to watch the news.

title: Jonathan is the best
text: I was actually having a real rough night and I booked this hotel, the First Lady who I went to was not only unhelpful, she was super rude. I sat down and made a few calls, then found my ID and approached Jonathan, not only was he helpful, he was super easy going, friendly, and got me in fast. He truly saved the night

title: Centrale buono ma...
text: Una settimana a Manhattan, buon albergo, centrale a 3 minuti da Times Square sulla 40th. Ma: bagno senza bidet caro a noi italiani ma quasi ignorato ovunque, frigo bar vuoto (ti fornivi alla reception), personale non al massimo della cordialità (una cameriera ci ha passato l’aspirapolvere sui piedi mentre eravamo seduti nella hall). Morale: prezzo da 4* a 240 € al giorno (senza colazione) ma servizio da 3. C’è di meglio a Manhattan.

title: NY
text: Hotel molto ben posizionato, discretamente elegante con  camera confortevole e ben attrezzata, bagno ampio, letto comodissimo. Buona insonorizzazione, eravamo al 17esimo piano. Prima colazione molto scarsa in un locale starbucks al piano terra, con scelta di dolce o salato (una brioche o un tramezzino), caffè o succo arancia.... Decisamente un menù incompleto.

title: Clean, Comfortable Bed, Hot Shower, Good Wifi and a GREAT price
text: WHAT A BARGAIN! I stole this room at a GREAT price and was skeptical. Clean, Comfortable Bed, Hot Shower, Good Wifi the hospitality was very good and it was a GREAT price!!! I am on the road 90+ nights a year. I know hotels, these guys did a great job, in Manhattan at a reasonable rate...

title: Great stay at the Courtyard
text: This was our first time staying at this hotel. We were only staying one night as we were catching a flight out of JFK the next day so accessibility  was most important to us. We picked this hotel due to closeness to Penn station.  The hotewas 4 blocks away. The folks at the front desk are very helpful and welcoming.  Our  room was spotless and the size of a typical NYC room. Breakfast was included.  It was buffet style. Rather,  you had a choice of sandwich which came with a fruit salad and a beverage.  Will take this kind of breakfast over a buffet any day. Special thanks to Shade and Isaac for their warm welcoming and assistance.

title: centrally located
text: room was clean and decent.location was ideal. however i was required to carry the luggage to my room myself after check in at the hotel which was a pathetic feel being in a marriott. Hilton the next door is far better and at a better price

title: Amazing Experience!
text: Kevin was so cool and sweet! Nicest front desk agent, check in was swift and I had a pretty nice view! Thank you for being helpful to someone that just wanted rest and a sympathetic ear.Have fun on your future travels😊

title: Five stars for the location
text: A short walk from everything you will need visiting New York. So close to the Empire State Building, many restaurants and shops, 20 minute walk to the World Trade Center memorial. The hotel itself was very clean and welcoming, the room was comfortable, climate was perfect, lots of TV channels to enjoy. The bathroom was very spacious and there were computers in the lobby to do any work I needed to do and to print boarding passes. We took advantage of the bistro for breakfast, be prepared to spend $10 on a couple bagels. Definitely want to shout out Shade and Joseph for their genuine hospitality as well as Edward in maintenance for quickly addressing the refrigerator issue. Turns out you have to keep the light on at the door for it to work. Kind of rinky dink but not the worse thing to deal with I suppose. I would highly recommend this hotel in you're planning a trip to Manhattan or NYC.

title: Excellent stay in NYC
text: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend in January. I was very pleased with everything. Every staff member we interacted with was polite and kind. The facilities were clean and modern. The room is quite small, but that's to be expected in NYC. The location is excellent. You are within easy walking distance of Times Square and all the Broadway theaters, but it's on a much quieter street than you'd expect. In fact, that was our favorite thing about our stay - the room was quiet! The only time I heard anyone was when we were resting there in the middle of the day, as other guests walked in the hallway to their room. At night, we couldn't hear any other guests or street noise (we were on the 16th floor). You are also within a 5-minute walk of two different train stations, so you can easily access several different lines to get to different parts of the city. The only negative part was one night we went to the dining area and ordered an appetizer to eat before we went to a show. It took 30 minutes from the time we ordered to when they brought it out. We had to ask them to wrap it up and we ate it as we walked to the theater. There was only one woman working the front (taking all orders, making all drinks, delivering all food), so I think they were just short staffed. Definitely not the end of the world, but just be cautious if you have a time crunch to make a show!

title: Benissimo
text:
Posizione perfetta per visitare a piedi tutta la zona, vicinissimo a times square e bryant park, 3 minuti a piedi da Penn Station che ha sia la linea blu che la rossa, quindi è un ottimo punto di partenza per esplorare tutta la città. Avevo una camera al quinto piano con "vista" città (la finestra dà su il palazzo di fronte e la via è stretta, quindi dalle camere ai piani bassi non si vede molto), ma era molto silenziosa, sia di giorno che di notte. Pulizia ottima, con tutti i comfort necessari. Stanza spaziosa e ad un prezzo non basso ma abbordabile, per gli standard di new york.
Lo consiglio e ci tornerei!

title: Amazing customer service
text: I can’t say enough good things about the staff at this hotel! I’ve stayed twice and both times they’ve been excellent. They care for you like you’re at a small boutique hotel, not a chain. I will definitely be back!

title: Excellent Experience. Highly Recommended.
text: Everything from the staff to the service, I thoroughly enjoyed. The suite was spotless. The housekeeping was incredibly accommodating. The complementary food served was fresh tasting and delicious. I highly recommend anyone to stay at The Courtyard Marriott.

title: Great Location for Time Square Experience
text: A good location for a property in Manhattan. Not very close but its a decent walk to Time Square. Shopping, restaurants and few touristic places can be done by foot as well. Good hotel with friendly staff.

title: Property was neat and clean
text: Conveniently located, right next to Macy’s for Christmas window viewing!  Short walk to Radio City. The front staff was nice enough, the remaining staff excellent. Didn’t park as I took a train in and out of Penn (also short walk). I’d stay here again.

title: Poor Customer service
text: Check in was at 4:00pm . I got to the hotel at 5:00pm & was told by the receptionist that my room was not ready. After a long day of driving, that was the last thing I wanted to hear. However, I was patient, understandable- since it's the holiday season & plenty of guests are checking in/out. Before taking a seat,  I asked about the checkout policy because I remembered reading that this location has a strict 12:00pm checkout policy & it's currently 5:00pm - I didn't understand why the room was not ready. The receptionist then went on to tell me that I was not an Elite customer & that those(elite) customers has the option of moving their checkout time to 4:00pm & that other elite customers had to be checked into their room before they can honor my reservation. Needless to say, she got frustrated at all my questions at this point & said "OH we have a room" - here is your key!

title: Exquisite hotel and wonderful staff!
text: This hotel met all my expectations. The room was comfortable and spacious for two persons (double queen bed). Went for a conference at the Javitts Centre which was an easy 5 minutes walk away. Shopping wasn't far away either with Macy's about 4 blocks away and other popular stores also as well as dining options. It would be remiss of me to not mention how helpful the staff are. They are so friendly and eager to assist you. I have to mention two front desk lobby personnel, Kevin and Michelle. They went above and beyond in their assistance to help in making my stay memorable. For example, Michele going out into the freezing cold to hail a taxi for me.. I was so touched. The door persons were also very friendly and welcoming. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Hotel muy bien ubicado
text: Limpio ordenado con excelente ubicación en el corazón de Manhattan, con habitación confortable y cómoda. Los alrededores algo sucios al igual que la ciudad y mapas de cortesía poco amigables con checkin algo tarde a las 16 horas.

title: Brand New Hotel, some kinks still to work out, but still a very nice stay.
text:
I checked in 4 days after the official opening. I was in town for business.
Pros;
Brand new hotel
Well appointed room/good quality bed/ nice linens/ robe and slippers
Good water pressure/lots of hot water when needed
Safe/fridge/coffee maker and Microwave in room
Great location
Quiet area/ windows are good double pane-almost soundproof. 
Lovely/helpful staff.
Restaurant/bar on premise. Food was quite good although very limited menu.
Several banks of elevators, so quick and easy up and down.
Nice work out facility.

Cons;
Floors 16 and above were not finished or available at the time of my stay.
A/C Heating unit a tad difficult to work with, inconsistent performance.
Guest laundry was out of service during my visit.
Some limited hours on when food service available at the restaurant.(Breakfast and Dinner only).
 

There is construction happening on the building directly across the street(in NYC something is ALWAYS under construction) so, best to ask for a room on the back side of the hotel.

title: Buena estadía en zona céntrica
text:
Cómo es de esperar en Manhattan las habitaciones son compactas. Sin embargo, bien equipada y prolija. El servicio de limpieza fue muy bueno. El baño es lo suficientemente amplio. Por supuesto, en esa zona, es inevitable el ruido casi permamente, pero no es nada que sorprenda.
La mayoría de las lineas de subte se encuentran en un radio de 500 metros, en especial todas aquellas que pasan por Penn Station.

title: 大した事ないマリオットグループホテル
text:
ビジネスユースで2泊しました。マンハッタンなので仕方ないかもですが、プラチナ会員に対しても日本のビジネスホテルと同じサイズの狭い部屋が与えられました。悪いことに２日目の夕方に部屋に戻ってきたら、部屋が清掃されていませんでした。さすがに腹が立ちました。
場所は色んな場所が徒歩20分圏内でした。しかし寒かったので移動は全てタクシーかUBER使いました。
これで一泊税サ込みで平均230USD。マリオットポイント/宿泊数を稼ぎたい人以外はお勧めできないです。

title: Nice clean hotel close to Penn Station/Madison Sq Garden
text: The hotel is very clean, room was clean with a nice firm bed.  Amenities are new.  I had a king size bed, so there was not a lot of extra space in the room.  Bathroom was a good size and very clean with plenty of hot water.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Just OK option for a NYC trip
text: Finding accommodation in NYC can be tough and expensive. Finding a balance between location, amenities, and budget is tough; this hotel is slightly lowered priced but rooms are small, service is below average (I encountered a serious attitude problem and rudeness at check-in when asking questions), but the location is well placed. Gym is tiny and equipment is outdated, small lobby area and restaurant in the back (did not go to).  Little market place bar was overpriced, unfortunately as expected, especially with a CVS around the corner. Disappointed for a Marriott property given my loyalty to Marriott and in comparison to their other properties in NYC.

title: Newer hotel, rooms not well designed
text:
I recently stayed at the Courtyard on business.  I had a room with a king size bed on the 14th floor.   The hotel is certainly newer and had nice furnishings.  The furnishings were typical of the brand - dark wood desk and nightstands.  The bathroom was spacious for New York City.

My biggest challenge with the stay was the room configuration.  The king size bed dominated the room, so there was limited space to move around the room.  The closet is tiny and the hanging bar is too low to hang suits or even dress shirts.  There is a safe and refrigerator on the floor that really limits what can be hung.  I had to take the ironing board out of the closet and put it near the bathroom so I could hang my suit and not have it crumple up on the safe.  There was just enough room to hang the suit, I couldn't hang my shirts without them crumpling up on the safe.

The bathroom is great; however, they don't have a great place to hang shirts etc to steam while taking a shower.  They had one hook that was really just designed to hang a towel.  The placement of the hook was too close to a perpendicular wall to hang a shirt, so steaming shirts was a bit of a challenge.

In general, the hotel was fine, but I was frustrated with the room configuration to make my business travel efficient.

title: オシャレ使いやすい
text: 地下鉄の駅も、電車の駅も、バスターミナルも近くて便利。近くに美味しいデリもレストランもバーもドラッグストアもコンビニもあり快適。エレベーターはカードタッチしないと目的の階を押せないので安心。コンパクトで無駄がなく、でもオシャレなので気に入りました。歯ブラシなし。シャンプーとトリートメント、ドライヤーあり。メイク落としはふき取りペーパータイプ。一回にスタバあり。

title: Très bien
text: Super bien placé Times square à 5 minutes. En plein cœur de la ville proche de beaucoup de centres d’intérêt. Hôtel très propre et le ménage dans la chambre nickel . Rien à dire très bon séjour et personnel sympathique

title: Not what I expect from Marriott
text: As a lifetime Titanium member I have stayed at marriotts far and wide.  My room was extremely small even by NYC standards.  Funky smell, noisy air handling system.  Worst was that when I got up in the morning my toilet would not flush and the sink had no water pressure.  Hammering noise coming from it.  I had to get going so I had to do the best I could and leave.  Hope to never see this place again.

title: Super emplacement
text:
L’emplacement est vraiment le gros point fort de l’hôtel situé à quelques pas de Times Square et du Rockefeller Center 
Même Central Park est faisable à pied!
Nous avions une chambre familiale où les deux lits doubles n’étaient séparés que de quelques centimètres !
Gros bémol le petit déjeuner : déjà peu de choix et premier arrivé premier servi !
Le service est censé être fait jusqu’à 11h et arrivés à 10h45 c’est déjà remballé!
On nous demande de venir plus tôt le lendemain ! 
Je retournerai malgré tout dans cet hôtel pour la situation géographique mais je ne prendrais plus le petite déjeuner sur place!

title: Good Option for a Weekend Getaway
text: I chose this hotel for a one night stay during a weekend trip in New York. I expect the rooms to be small since it is in the city but the way the room was set up, worked really well. I had a view of the street and other buildings around but it was high enough to be worth the view. The room is a standard Marriott fare so I wont spend the time on that. The hotel offers a Bistro with a limited variety of food choices and many beverage options, including Starbucks coffee. The bar was a great place to have a glass of wine or just hang out. There is an outdoor space that I didnt use since it was raining. Otherwise, great service, good rooms, and convenient location.

title: Angel and Joseph Rock
text: I stayed there with my family October 11th weekend! We took a red eye and arrived super early! Joseph helped store our bags and gave us a breakfast recommendation! We explored till we got a call that our room was ready early. We were so grateful, we need a nap! Our housekeeper (I didn’t get her name) but she was the sweetest and always greeted us when we saw her in the hallway. She always made sure we had what we needed. When we checked out Angel and Joseph made it so easy! It was our first time to New York and we had a great time. Thank you for a great stay, we will definitely recommend this hotel, the location is close to so much stuff and the people are great!

title: Kommer til å bo her igjen
text:
Jeg har bodd på flere hoteller i NY de siste årene, men dette er utrolig stille. Et rolig og komfortabelt hotel. Rommene er okei størrelse, og servicen kjempe god. Hotellet ligger nærme time square, og ikke langt unne en subway stasjon. Så du kommer lett til de stedene du vil. 
Kommer til å booke dette neste gang jeg skal til NY

title: Not bad for the buck
text: Booked the accommodations because the price was decent and the reviews were pretty good. Arrived much earlier than check on time and the gentleman at the front desk offered to accommodate me in a double queen. I declined as I really didn’t need the room right away but it was really a nice gesture. The staff is extremely friendly, accommodating and professional. The hotel is full service with a laundry, fitness center, Bistro, etc. the location was within walking distance of everything. The room albeit tiny was clean. I would stay again if the price was reasonable.

title: Marriott
text: Located in  a good place, easy walking to Times Square. Very quiet. Nice staff. Safe neighborhood. Has a nice restaurant attached.Easy to get a cab. Lots of stores close by. 2 delis right up the street that has delicious breakfasts.

title: Best bang for the buck
text: This hotel is a gem in New York City - great location,. competitive prices and really, really good service.  The front desk always is prompt and helpful.  My room gets cleaned - really well cleaned - early and efficiently.  All the staff is courteous - they smile, say good day, ask if I need anything.  Coming to Manhattan for short business trips can be a real grind, but I know I can look forward to relaxing when I get back to the hotel.  My hotel.

title: Bra hotell, bra läge
text: Jättetrevligt hotell som ligger mycket bra nära Penn Station och Madison Square Garden. Rena rum, bra städning, god frukost och promenavstånd till nästan allt. Finns en bar, men Det finns trevligare och mysigare barer på stan för ett glas vin. Rekommenderas!

title: Very accommodating accommodations
text:
This is, perhaps, a misnomer of the Courtyard brand on a small, somewhat older midtown hotel. Like all New York hotels, the rooms are tight, especially with a large bed. The decor in the public areas is very 1980s. 

However, they are more than making the best of it. The staff are efficient, cheerful and welcoming. Unlike most hotels that dismiss you once you’ve checked out, they bend over backwards to store luggage, etc. 

The rooms themselves have good TVs and attractively remodeled bathrooms with luxurious showers. 

The location is primo — walking distance to the Theater District and Empire State Building.

title: 위치와 청결 모두 만족한 호텔
text:
지하철 역이 도보로 4-5분 거리라 정말 편리했습니다. 도착 첫날 브라이언트파크까지도 가볍게 걸어다녀올만 한 정도의 위치입니다. 타임즈 스퀘어도 도보로 가까운 편인데 타임즈 스퀘어에서 좀 떨어진 것이 훨씬 낫습니다. 이쪽은 사람도 많고 시끄럽습니다.
객실상태는 정말 깨끗합니다. 수건도 포송포송할 정도입니다. 다만 생수가 한 병도 제공되지 않아 아쉬웠습니다. 작은 냉장고가 하나 있어 유용하게 사용했습니다.
뉴욕호텔이 정말 비싸긴하지만 이 정도면 훌륭한 호텔인 거 같습니다.

title: Great place at decent price
text: Been to NYC many times and it was our first at this hotel.  Well located, clean, comfortable and good staff but above all, very decent pricing for NYC. Highly recommend it. Will now be our destination of choice in NYC

title: Great location and great staff = great time for our first visit to NYC
text:
The location and staff at this hotel make the difference.  This was our first visit to the big apple and had no idea of what to expect.  The location of the hotel is convenient to Times Square, Penn and Grand Central stations.  The personal advice from the front of house staff was exemplary.  The hotel guys are so friendly and accommodating, often going out of their way to explain things (several times for us naive Aussies), so thank you for being so patient with us tolerating our never ending questioning!  

Our room was comfy and spacious, which was contradictory to what we had heard about NY hotels before we got there (acknowledge maybe we were lucky this time around).  Housekeeping was spot on and the room we had was very clean, so thanks to the back of house staff as well.

The in-house restaurant/bistro menu could have been been a little more extensive as it was limited in its offering, but the food was tasty nonetheless.

Thanks guys for making our first visit to your great city so wonderful.  Thanks especially to Angel and Isaac, you guys are awesome.  Sorry I missed you down in Vegas Angel, hope you enjoyed that Bachelor Party as much as we have been enjoying our US holiday.  

Take care and we will definitely be back based on our experience in NYC alone.

Tony & Maryanne (Melbourne Australia)

title: Clean and Hospitable!
text: The staff knows they are in the customer service industry!  Every person answered questions knowledgeably and professionally.  Our requests were always accommodated with a smile.  We were greeted every time we walked into the hotel.  The hallways and our rooms were clean and inviting.  Everyone we encountered went out of their way to make sure our stay there was a great experience.  On top of that, we were able to walk to Times Square, Broadway shows, great restaurants, and even Central Park!

title: Great staff and location
text: Very clean & excellent location that can walk to Times Square, shows and restaurants. All the staff were all extremely helpful and great to deal with. They were able to get us early check in @ 1 pm. Definitely would stay here again.

title: Nice hotel terrible service from Marriott Group
text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights (Sunday 18th and Monday 19th August). On check in a credit card print was taken for any incidentals. This was done with no PIN or signature. On checkout I did not get a bill as we only had $35 odd on our bill for some drinks. Got home to the UK and discovered that Marriott Courtyard NYC has bill me $616.33 for charges. Got a bill and this is not on the bill. Spoek to my travel agent and they cannot advise as all accomodation was paid for in advance. Spoke to my bank and they refuse to overturn the amount as I authorised the amount of $35 for services. Tried contacting Marriott Group and all I got was a bill stating the room service charges but nothing else. Long story short no one from Marriott is willing to help so I am £500 out of pocket due to this hotel. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE

title: Great staff!
text: Greeted every time you walk into the hotel.  It's a fresh escape from the city. Very accommodating. The patio is a nice private feeling space. Rosa at the desk is so nice and professional.  She is so respectful and professional.  She truly made my trip. The food at the bistro is yuk. Would definitely stay here again. Nice clean rooms.

title: Return home for visit
text: I loved this hotel! It was in a great location. Right near Times Square and very clean and nice! I enjoyed staying here and would recommend it to my clients. I came here for a travel show to do research for clients and this was definitely a great hotel. No complaints. Great service, clean and nice.

title: Great location
text:
- This hotel is in a great location, a 5 minute walk to Penn station and Times Square, with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. 
- Staff is superb, from the front desk people to the cleaning cleaning crew. Very friendly and helpful. 
- The hotel is well maintained and is spotlessly clean as far as I can see. 
- The rooms are small. But, they are clean and the bathrooms are really nice. 
- There is a decent little gym in the basement. 
- The WiFi is pretty good. 
- The breakfast option, while limited, is really good. 

The only drawbacks here really is the price can at times be above what it’s worth, and the rooms are really small. But, if you ever see this place being advertised for about $150-170 a night (including taxes etc) I would snap it up, it’s a steal.

title: Muy buena opción céntrica
text: Excelente ubicación, para moverse por New York fácilmente. Parada de subte cerca y acceso caminando a muchos atractivos de la ciudad. Limpio, habitación cómoda, baño amplio. Muy buen servicio. Rápido check un y check out. Cómodos ascensores. Recomendable!

title: Good location
text: Hotel staff was great however cleaning service was not satisfactory (we had to ask for toilet paper twice, floor in the bathroom was not cleaned daily etc). We stayed 8 nights and the location was great however for such a long stay I would recommend to find a hotel with bigger rooms, our room was tiny and there was no space to put our baggage away. There was 7/11 nearby and lots of breakfast/lunch options around. Close enough to subway stations (34th Penn station). The street was extremely busy so if you get the room with the street view it will be noisy at all times (even at night). Also the AC was a bit noisy but I guess it's common problem...

title: Great spot to be right in center of the action of Times Square
text: This was our second visit to this hotel now in the last year and if available will certainly be our first choice from here on out. It is always extremely clean and comfortable with very helpful staff. The location is perfect for a weekend getaway where you want quick access to the nightlife around Times Square - museums, Broadway shows, restaurants, and bars - all within walking distance. A special shout out to Isaac Dominguez who was extremely helpful as our Bell Attendant when I had forgotten some things that I had stored in my bag! We shall be back!

title: Muy bien todo
text: Nos hemos alojado una semana , y todo muy bien y muy contentos, la habitación muy bien( con cafetera q reponen cada día café ) y el personal aún mejor , a buena distancia de todo , sin duda lo recomiendo y volveríamos a ir

title: Great Location amidst the hustle and bustle of Times Square
text:
Courtyard New York Manhattan Times Square was a total lifesaver for my family and I. Our family was in distress because Cambria Times Square suddenly cancelled our booking 2 days before our arrival date. It was stressful trying to find a hotel so last minute in such a popular tourist destination.

But it was such a blessing in disguise because we found Courtyard Times Square. It was situated so near to Times Square but still away from the crowd and hustle and bustle. Our hotel was only a block away from Wholefoods Market. It was also across Walgreens and CVS. Bryant Park was also a block away. Really loved the location of our hotel. 

The staff was also so friendly and accommodating. Jason and Freddy took care of our airport transfer from hotel to JFK for our group of 7 with 5 bigs bags and 5 small bags. It cost $120, which is pretty reasonable compared to Uber/LFYT/local NYC taxi and we didn’t even have to take 2 separate cars.

The bathroom was a little dated but everything else made up for it. On our first night, the housekeeping only fixed 1 of the beds but I told the front desk and they immediately fixed it.

I’m really thankful that we found this gem of a hotel. :)

title: RETHINK YOUR NEED FOR HIGH-END
text: Usually, I tend to book myself in a high-end boutique hotel or a Four Seasons. But this time around, in order to be near friends, I stayed at the Courtyard West.  It was quite an eye opener.  You do not need to spend a fortune to get what you need;  The room was immaculate, the staff was simply wonderful, it is perfectly located and walking distance from Penn Station and subways and you can buy Starbucks coffee and bagels in the lobby downstairs.  Try "roughing" it for once and start thinking about all the money you will save when you stay at this perfectly comfortable and safe spot on the west side.

title: Great hotel, excellent location and good service
text: We stayed here during our summer holiday last year and had a great time. The room was clean, a good size and service at the hotel was very good. A special mention must go to Michelle, the bartender. She made us feel very welcome and remembered us by name after one day. Excellent service! Would definitely stay here again.

title: Ok ok property
text:
We booked this hotel because of its location. 100 percent points  there . But what I didn’t like was the housekeeping . Our rooms were booked on double occupancy but the essentials like brush ,toothpaste ,towels etc where only for a single person . They didn’t bother renewing the things on second day when we requested room cleaning . Rest it was all good . 

Thanks

title: Couldn't get much better...
text:
On a 3-night show visit to NY, we chose the Courtyard NY in Times Sq West at 40th, btw 6th and Broadway. This hotel was chosen for several reasons: location, trust in Marriott properties and walkability to theaters, restaurants and bars. We were not disappointed.

The hotel staff were cordial and efficient.  Check-in was a breeze, our room was clean, well-appointed and convenient.  Rooms on NY tend to be tight and nearly claustrophobic.  This was a king room with good space for two people.

The bathroom had good lighting with ample open storage under the sink, the shower was clean and convenient with good water pressure and there were plenty of fluffy towels and toiletries. 

The room had very effective black-out shades and draperies. The a/c was also effective and did not disturb our sleep.

Housekeeping did a good job of refreshing the room and replenishing towels and toiletries.

There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a coffee shop across the street, as well as numerous restaurants, within a 30 second walk from the hotel.

Of the three plays we'd chosen to see, the theater furthest away was a 10 block walk, at 49th and Broadway.

This hotel was a winner!

title: Easy Location, Fabulous Staff, Relaxing Retreat
text: I stayed at Courtyard New York Manhattan/Times Square West back in 2015 and it made such a positive impression on me that I decided to book it again for my latest trip to NYC. The location is a few blocks from Penn Station and a walkable distance to the theatre district and Times Square area. This oasis in the middle of Manhattan is clean, comfortable and is a fantastic place to crash after a bustling day in The Big Apple. However, what makes this hotel top my list is the fabulous staff. Friendly, helpful, and prompt, they bring hospitality with warmth and professionalism. Staffers Isaac, Angel, were two that were very helpful but, every encounter I had with the staff was a positive one. Thanks so much! And see ya next time!

title: "Close to key attractions and great service"
text: This hotel is located in a very good area and the service was very attentive, specially Isaac Dominguez, who helped us a lot. Our room was spacious and confortable and the cleaning staff kept the room clean during our stay.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Visited NYC in July for a Mother/Daughter weekend.  Every associate we interacted with was friendly and helpful!  From the gentleman checking us in, to the buildings maintenance associate.  Found the 5:00pm to 6:30pm happy hour faboulous way to start my evening after a long day of activities.  And finally during our viist NYC was in the middle of a heat and the air conditioner in our room was AMAZING!

title: terrible
text:
This hotel is located right in the heart of NYC, but the service was not what I expected. Horrible experience at the hotel from the moment started to chat with an agent online, to the check in, to check out everything was just awful.
Our refrigerator wasn't cooling our things and we called down to the front desk and the agent said " it takes a little while to cool" we went to bed and woke up the next morning with our things ruined/warm because that refrigerator didn't work at all!
