We called down to the desk and all they could do was recommend ice knowing we were about to check out. I have stayed at many marriotts and I know this chain of hotel offers better service than this. Never staying here again! Especially after I personally emailed the "manager" about this matter and hasn't replied. Horrible communication skills/service.

title: Definitely a great place to stay!
text: Although the rooms are small (typical for NYC hotels), the cleanliness was there!  The best part about this place has to be the staff.  Angel and Erick helped me get checked in on my arrival, super friendly and over the top helpful!

title: Small But Good!
text:
If you've got a full weekend, this is the place for you! The rooms are small - very small, but they're clean and the bed is honestly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in on vacation. 

It's good to pop in and clean and change clothes, but I wouldn't count on spending a ton of time here.

title: Excelente Ubicación
text: Me hospede con mi mujer y mis dos hijos, el hotel está muy bien ubicado, cerca de time Square y estaciones de metro, restaurant, tiendas etc. Habitaciones amplias y cómodas (para el común de New York) en el lobby hay personas que hablan español.

title: Smack in the middle of Manhattan, but a bit noisy
text: A really good choice if I say so myself. Picked this hotel purely because it was a 20 minute walk to the July 4th Firework by the Brooklyn bridge but was surprised by how close I was to WTC & Wall street. Pretty much right next door. The check in was easy, the room was well equipped but pretty small. Clean and smelled nice. Internet TV was a definite plus plus! The only downside was the noise due to constructions and you don't want to spend much time in the room as it's pretty small.

title: Coourtyard Marriott NYC
text:
Sending along the highest commendation to assistant guest services manager Emily Sosa. This exemplary Marriott employee went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure our vacation in the Big Apple was chock full of great memories. No request was too large or too small for Emily to address, and she often came up with some terrific solutions. Maybe best of all, each time my family and I would return from an excursion, we would be greeted by name as Emily flashed that winning smile. She made us feel so welcome, like we were coming home.
The hotel itself was comfortable and pretty much suited all our needs. Great thing about New York (we were in Midtown Manhattan) is that you can walk everywhere to find what you need. There's just so much available in terms of various ethnic foods and restaurants, entertainment, sightseeing, etc. To save money and the hassle of driving and parking, we walked everywhere and took the convenient Metro subway. On our busiest day, we logged 18,000 steps. Took in two Broadway shows, the best which was My Fair Lady. Also had a wonderful night in LIttle Italy.

title: Vacation in New York - Férias em Nova York
text:
Excelente localização e custo benefício. Atendimento por parte dos atendentes educado e cordial. Acomodações confortáveis e ambiente agradável. Excelente bar and café. Recomendo e com certeza voltarei.

Great location and value for money. Attendance by the attendants is polite and friendly. Comfortable accommodations and pleasant surroundings. Excellent bar and cafe. I recommend it and for sure will be back.

title: Exceptional Hotel
text: Our stay at this hotel was fantastic. The staff was very polite, and our room was always thoroughly cleaned. The central location was another great feature of this hotel, with so many attractions within walking distance. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, but I only wish we could have stayed longer!

title: Comfortable hotel in great location
text:
I stayed here for a week in July. The rooms are very comfortable with decent bathrooms. The rooms are slightly dated with dark interiors which could do with a freshen up. Our room wasn’t serviced one day which was annoying and when we asked reception in the evening we were informed that the cleaners leave at 5pm so all we were offered was fresh towels.
The location is good with the subway a couple of blocks away. The gym is quite basic but acceptable for the standard of hotel. Overall, a comfortable stay in a good central location

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel du 13 au 21 Juin 2019. Il est très bien situé, à 5 minutes à pieds de Time Square, de l'Empire... Personnel tres aimable et à l'écoute. Les chambres sont spacieuses, la litterie impeccable et confortable. Nous étions au 27 ieme étage et pas un bruit le soir pour s'endormir. Mention spéciale pour Joseph de la réception qui nous a été d'une grande aide pour notre transfert retour.
Nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel.

title: Buena ubicación, recomendable
text:
Hotel bien ubicado en la calle W37st. entre las Avenidas 8th y 9th; el personal es amable y cordial. Me asignaron una habitación que daba a la parte de atrás muy cómoda y limpia. Habitación 2412. Hay cafetera en la habitación.
En la planta baja hay un bar, donde por la mañanas puedes desayunar.

title: Great Stay
text: Nice, large clean room with 2 queens on ninth floor(917.) Big enough for 3 adults. Good bathroom lighting. Large bathroom. Refrigerator. Decent closet. Wonderful, friendly and efficient front desk. Great bellman went out of his way to get us a taxi from down the street in the pouring rain. Not much of view. Breakfast had several choices for reasonable cost. Evening happy hour half priced beer, wine and cocktails. Several food choices as well, also reasonably priced. Not open at lunch. Had to call for help with internet service but was easily resolved in a few minutes. A few blocks from subway. Walking distance to Hudson Yards, Broadway shows and large shopping area. Was very pleased with stay.

title: Muy buena ubicación, habitación pequeña e higiene deficiente
text: No creo que hayamos acertado del todo con este hotel. La ubicación es muy buena, a un paso de Times Square; pero la habitación que nos dieron fue muy pequeña y nada nueva ( el hotel en general no lo es) y la limpieza escasa a pesar de que dejábamos propina cada día. El personal de recepción correcto sin más y el de cafetería muy poco agradable.

title: מלון ישן
text: הגענו למלון ללילה אחד מאחר והמלון שלנו היה בתפוסה מלאה, והעבירו אותנו אליו, חדרים ישנים וקטנים מאוד, לא הייתי מזמינה חדר במלון כזה, ארוחת בוקר ממש עלובה, וגם לא טעימה, טעם סינטטי לא מרגיש שהוכן טרי במקום, כל המלון מוזר.

title: Great location, great value, great service
text:
I love New York and am delighted when business takes me to Manhattan.  You gotta love the fast pace of this competitive market.

This gives you the latitude to put a premium on service and this hotel exceeds expectations, starting at the smiles from the front desk crew.  But it's the chambermaids I can't say enough about.  My recent stay was 3 days and I saw the same woman twice on my hallway, so I presume she was the one cleaning my room.  Both times, she greeted me with a genuine "Good day."  English clearly was not her native language but she made a real effort to ask if everything in my room was okay, if there was anything else she could do for me, gave me the extension to call if I needed anything, and warmly wished me a Good Day.  I sheepishly admit I don't always remember to tip the chambermaid, but this one made such a great impression, I couldn't forget her.

I've stayed in a lot of places in New York but I can't wait to stay here again next time I return.

title: My new NYC Hotel
text:
As long as they don't price themselves out of contention, this will be where I will always stay when in NYC. This is an OUTSTANDING hotel. I used to stay at another hotel that was similar but they have now outpriced themselves.
I can't overstate how good this hotel is. The staff were very, very polite and helpful (I wondered if they were from outside of NYC they were that  polite lol). The room was a great size, was pleasantly surprised (we had a twin room - 517). The entire room and bathroom was clean, bed comfy, could not fault it.
Its close to everything you need, subway only a couple minutes walk. I didn't try the bar or the food so can't comment there but if it's anything like the hotel, it should be good.
I would not waste time looking anywhere else for a great priced hotel, ive paid much more for way less at other hotels.

title: Superb hotel
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 7 days. Hotel is very central to times square, pann station,Madison square garden,theatres and restaurants. The hotel is very clean, rooms are standard size and very well maintained. I checked out 11am but my flight to UK was 10pm the staff allowed me to leave my bags and collect later. I had time to go shopping beforeclecting my bags for the airport. 
I recommend this hotel whenever you are in Manhattan Ney York

title: Value. Service, Location, location, locastion
text: Manhattan is a competitive market.  If you want great value, great location, great service, this is a jewel.  They take care of your every need, pay close attention to details.  Housekeeping is impeccable.  You couldn't ask for a cleaner room and, whatever you need, they respond quickly and in a friendly manner.  Front office management the same.  I have been coming to New York for years and have stayed all over the city, but Courtyard Times Square is my destination from now on.

title: Ideal, cerca de Times Square
text: Está muy bien ubicado en Manhattan, en la 37ª con la 8ª. El personal es amable, se puede desayunar bien, hay wifi gratuita e incluso plancha para la ropa en la habitación. En España podría ser un hotel de 4 estrellas perfectamente. Todo muy limpio, con neverita en la habitación, potente aire acondicionado o bomba de calor. Muy recomendable sin duda.

title: Great location and reasonably priced for NYC
text:
This hotel is nice and comfortable, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the rooms, while smaller than most, are very functional and quiet.

The best aspect of this hotel is location.  It's just a five minute walk to Times Square, a five minute walk to Penn Station (great way to get to the airport), and near many restaurants and stores.

While not glitzy, this hotel checked all the important boxes for me.

title: Perfect one night stay in NYC
text: We stayed at the Courtyard New York Manhattan/Times Square West for one night ahead of a cruise.  Yes, the room was small,  but it was what we expected and not an issue.  The room was sparkling and what we expect staying in a Marriott room.  The bed was also what we expected and exceedingly comfortable.  Staff were great and very helpful.  The room was also excellent value for the NYC location.  This kind of value and service is what keeps us coming back to Marriott lodging.

title: Excellent Place To Stay
text: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel, from 8 May 2019. All the staff were friendly & professional, nothing was too much trouble for them. Shade, the lady on reception was outstanding in her knowledge of New York & surrounding areas, giving advise on how to travel around & what to see, without being pushy. Rooms were very clean & comfortable. We had a very nice stay at this hotel.

title: Ótima localização em NYC
text: O hotel foi reformado e suas instalações estão novas e limpas. Muito agradável. O quarto e o banheiro possuem tamanhos excelentes e dispõe de frigobar e cafeteira com café e chás à vontade. O restaurante é bastante agradável e o atendimento é muito bom! Todos os dias tem um horário de Happy Hour com bebidas beba 2 e pague 1. Camareiras simpáticas e serviço de concierge muito atencioso. Mesmo após realizar o check out, deixei as malas no hotel e fui sair para almoçar.

title: Très bon hôtel bien placé
text: Hotel à 5 minutes du métro, de Times squares et de l'Empire Stade Building. Hotel calme malgré sa situation centrale, très confortable. Lit king size chambre très propre et moderne. Personnel fort sympathique. Je retournerai dans cet hôtel pour un futur voyage à New York.

title: Rooms are small but clean place
text:
Rooms are small howver the place is ok and location is just 5 min walk to time square.
Sevice is very good and attentive.
If you want a larger room ask for lower floor. The rooms here are much nicer but you lose some view.
The parking is one minute away and they charge 45 usd for 24h including in and out.
Overall a good experience.

title: Postage stamp sized room
text:
If you are going to stay in this area, stay at the Homewood Suites or the Staybridge Suites, have stayed at both and the rooms are much, much larger.  When I inquired about the room I was told that all their rooms were NY sized, well I question that! 

Also, it would have been nice if they called us when our room was available.  We tried to check in at 11 am and never heard from the hotel when the room was ready.

title: Convenient hotel with brilliant staff
text: I stayed here with 3 friends end of April 2019 for 4 nights. From the start the reception staff were good offering us another room as ours wasn't ready. The room was on the 7 th floor with 2 queen beds and plenty of space for our cases and shopping. Our view as expected was of another building which didnt bother us, as we were out all day . We never heard any noise through the night either.  This hotel is close by to many attractions and Carlos bakery is 3 blocks away for authentic American cookies.  We ate our breakfast in the hotel, it's much easier than wandering around with all of us trying to agree where to eat. Best of all were the staff, Erick was fantastic sorting out our transfers as there was a mix up with the company, the young man (sorry didn't get his name) who unlocked one of our cases after the keys were lost and Isaac who walked with me to the Main Street and got me a taxi so I wouldn't be late meeting my friend. All in all this is a very nice hotel with excellent friendly staff. I would definitely return here if I went back to NYC and would recommend this hotel to anybody thinking of holidaying in this city

title: Excellent location
text:
This hotel has great location in the corner of 8th Avenue and 37th Street. It’s in the middle of Manhattan just few minutes walk away from Penn Station which is easy to reach from JFK airport.
My room was ok view nice view to Empire State Building. There is restaurant in the hotel but it’s not open all the time. Service at reception was friendly and quick enough. For some reason they forgot to clean my room in the second day and that’s why I don’t give 5 stars.

title: Good location, clean with good amenities.
text:
This hotel is in a very handy location. Room (the one we had) was fine, with all that was needed. Easy check in and check out, except be warned to get a receipt for the final check out - we were unlucky enough to have to contest the fact that we paid prior to arriving at the hotel and it turns out someone was not to savvy and charged the credit card for the total stay, which took a while to sort out.
Admin error, but it does not leave you feeling feeling warm and fuzzy.
Other than that a fine hotel for mid range.

title: Great Stay - Good Location
text: This is a good location if you want to see the mid-town Manhattan sites. You are 2 blocks north of a the subway station and a few blocks away from bus terminal.  You can easily walk to Time Square, Broadway theaters, Macy's at Herald Square, and Madison Square Gardens. The staff was great. Erick was great in helping us check in. We were a little early, but he made sure our room was being prepared and that it was feather free. We only had to wait a few minutes. He also helped with a late arriving family member to make sure she could access the room.  Joseph helped us arrange transportation to the airport and made sure everything was set on our days of departure. Both would greet us by name when we either left or arrived at the hotel if they were on duty. The other staff member were also great about greeting us. The rooms were well maintained and clean.

title: Fantastic Stay in NYC
text: I travel a lot for work and was really impressed by this place. It's a great value for the money and perfectly located close to transit and Times Square. Most importantly, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Erick went out of his way to take care of an issue caused by my late arriving travel mates. I'll definitely be staying here next time I'm in town.

title: Etablissement à recommander
text:
Très bon emplacement à proximité de Times Square et du Madison Square Garden, et donc de toutes les commodités (train, métro...)
Idéal pour notre premier séjour en famille (2 adultes et un ado)
Hygiène irréprochable, chambre spacieuse et très bien insonorisée (notre chambre était orienté côté rue)
Un petit bémol sur le petit déjeuner (nous nous attendions à un breakfast typiquement américain et avons été un peu déçus)

title: Great Location
text: Close to Times Square, Broadway and Penn Station, this hotel is in a great location. It's comfortable too and the staff are lovely. Great easy access to JFK via train from here. Would highly recommend.

title: Supersemester
text: Har bott jättebra, bra läge, rent, bra service, trevlig personal, bra gym, restaurang med enklare måltider. Skulle bokat frukosten där för gott och bra. Heltäckningsmattorna är inte så bra för allergiker annars mycket bra.

title: Perfect stay and top location
text:
Perfect location and very quite in the room.
Friendly staff and room was spotless !
Nice and quite because there are only max 6 rooms on 1 floor . Room is not that big but very comfortable. Great stay at an affordable price for NY standards .

title: It was another great experience in the same hotel.
text: Workers are very kind and helpful, you will always get a possitive response to any inquire, bar/restaurant in lobby level is really cool, gym is great to work out at any time. Bell Attendant, Isaac Dominguez is always very helpful organizing laugage and transportation. Really nice to be back and enjoy the same great experience as previous visits to NY.

title: Très bon emplacement
text: Nous avons passé une très bonne semaine dans cet hôtel, idéalement situé à quelques blocs de time Square. Les chambres sont de taille correcte et propres.  Un Starbuck se trouve au rez-de-chaussée pour les petits déjeuners et les en-cas. L'idéal après une journée à la découverte de New York.

title: Good proximity to Javits—pretty minimal on the perks
text:
So very clean, great location for us (short walk to Javits) and nice/helpful staff all around. 1st experience with a Courtyard hotel, surprised that parking was down the street, garage 4 doors away and not valet.  (as the bellman said upon arrival “if you were expecting valet, you’re at the wrong hotel man”). That being said, parking was pretty easy and car emerged unscathed. 
Also surprised there were literally no perks for platinum members. No club level, no upgrade to better room, no breakfast, no nothing. What do I have this Ritz VISA  and Bonvoy (dumb name) AMEX for again? Not sure. Paid for 3 rooms, full pay no points used. Even the crappy doubletree my business partner booked last year had free breakfast...but maybe courtyard is just bare bones. 

Anyway. Would stay here again if they did something for loyalty. Otherwise I’ll keep looking for the next.

title: Отличное место
text: Отличный отель, отличное месторасположение, но вид из окна никакой, если вас интересует вид из окна то вас точно не сюда. Персонал очень френдли, номера чистые, завтраки неплохие, кофе, круасаны, омлет, йогурты. Рекомендую завтракать в отеле, потому что в радиусе 200-500 метров нормальных завтраков нет.

title: Wonderful staff, convenient location
text: The whole staff at the front desk is the real standout at this property. They are warm, welcoming, professional, and effective.  The location is convenient and the facilities are as you would expect for Courtyard.  Everything was comfortable and in order, but the desk staff was top notch.

title: Para volver
text:
El hotel está bien ubicado , cerca de Time Square y Pen Station
El personal es muy amable
Las habitaciones adecuadas para una ciudad como New York
Cuenta con un café que se puede desayunar o tomar algo como en cualquier café de la calle
Muy recomendable

title: Great Location
text:
This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. I forget how convenient it is to Times Square and Penn Station. I made a last minute reservation to see the Big East Championship game on a Saturday night and I wanted to stay out of Times Square proper. The hotel still looks new. The service is friendly, courteous and immediate. The bed was super comfy and there are full size pillows! The bathroom is small, but adequate. I was on the 26th floor and the door barely clears the bed. This room is very city size, but for 1-2 people you can manage. Room 2605 is a corner room and if you looked left you could see the Empire State Building. I was truly surprised the windows open. This isn’t a room for young children who like to explore.  The desk is small, there is a small wardrobe and the heating/cooling system is responsive and fairly quiet. Again, I was hardly in the room. Yes, I wanted Villanova to win.  Mission accomplished. 

Breakfast is available, but is not complimentary. The Starbucks coffee is actually good! In the evening there is a Happy Hour every night. The bartender couldn’t be nicer and remembered me when I returned after the game. Well, I was practically dancing so it would be hard to miss me. There are 2 TV’s at the bar. 

Back to the room. Get rid of bathtubs and give us a great shower. Use the large dispensers of product in the shower and do away with those tiny bottles. Shower gel instead of soap would reduce waste. The room needs more USB outlets and they need to be tested to make sure they work. The room is well lit. 

The area, like almost all of NYC, has a ton of construction going on. I was there on a Saturday night so it wasn’t an issue. I suspect it is much noisier during the week. 

My overall experience here was better than at the PGA Resort the week before. Except for the weather.

title: Great price and great location
text: I just stayed at this hotel for a business trip March 10-12th. The location was close to the train station, Bryant park, Rockefeller center, convention center, great restaurants ect. The value was great! The rooms were very clean and nice and the staff was always accommodating. Ww loves that we could grab a Starbucks before we headed out early in the morning and the options for drinks and snacks at night. Definitely reccomend and will be staying here on future trips to the city!

title: Nice stay near Penn Station
text: The Courtyard New York Manhattan/Times Square West is conveniently located near Penn Station, subways and the Theater District. It's a typical Courtyard - comfortable rooms and up to date. It has a nice fitness room. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful.

title: Unbelievable value!
text: Five nights cost us $682 all-in, room and three taxes, senior rate.  Parking yet to be seen but it shouldn't be any worse than any other mid-town hotel.  Rooms no smaller, and many bigger, than average in this part of town.  But the real selling point of this hotel, besides the price, is the front desk staff. Cherese, Shade and Paula are as first class as any hotel staff I've known, and I've worked in several and stayed in hundreds around the world. Cherese showed us several rooms when we asked if there were any bigger than our original room and was more than accommodating in moving us to a bigger room (lower floor rooms are bigger than higher floors, she said). If their boss is listening, these three deserve a gold star and even better, a raise!

title: Location, Location, Location
text: This was a great value in an amazing location. Close to everything without the expensive. The rooms have everything you need and wifi was included. The carpets were a bit worn but everything was clean and I will definitely stay here again! Easy walk to Times Square!

title: Great Place
text: Thank you, for the great vacation. We we walking around at 1:00 am in Times Square after checking out of the Pennsylvania Hotel were we refused to stay.( Do to the deplorable conditions of the hotel) The courtyard advised they had one room available. This hotel was clean and the breakfast was great. Thank you again for a great experience in New York.

title: Sauber, praktisch, zentral!
text: Praktisches Hotel, sehr gut gelegen in walking distance von Times Square, Empire State Building und Madison Square Garden. Freundliches Personal an der Rezeption und im ganzen Hotel. Die Zimmer sind gut und klassisch amerikanisch ausgestattet. Besonderheit: das Restaurant ist morgens ein Starbucks Café und wandelt sich dann am Abend in eine Bar! Guter Tipp für alle die mitten in der City solide unterkommen möchten!

title: Good value for the price
text:
A hundred dollars a night cheaper than the hotel in NYC that I stayed at two weeks before.
Not much to the lobby or elevators, and the small dining area converts to a smaller bar.
But the room was large, the bed comfortable, the bathroom and shower larger than usual (though the door had a goofy angle) and the staff uniformly competent and polite. Just figure out what's interrupting the CNN signal every so often!
The hotel also is walking distance to Penn Station, a plus for travelers to Newark Airport and beyond, especially if you have a flight early or late in the day.

title: Great location
text: The rooms are tiny.  We had a king bed and there was not room for much else.  The bathroom was a good size and the entire space was clean.  The value was good for the low price I paid and will visit again.

title: Just Love it!
text: Arriving there from Washington DC and getting of at Penn station, walking for hardly 7 Minutes and the hotel was there. Warm greeting from the staff who welcome you as if you have known them for years. Room was cozy and warm, clean and comfortable Kind bed with nice pillows for those who want to sleep, bathroom has all the necessities. Lots of TV Channels and the food is delicious. Walking around is nice, restaurants, coffee shops and grocery stores that are all open 24 Hours. Walking to the Empire state building and the times square is also joyous as ya pass by the stores and theaters.

title: 5 star service, hotel and staff. Highly recommended you stay here
text: I just needed a room for the night and decided to stay at this courtyard. The lobby is gorgeous and very spaceious , I didn’t have to wait in line. When checking in there was a very minor issue that Rosa immediately assisted me in completing . Rosa was very helpful. Marriott is always great at finding outstanding employees who truly care for the guest and she was no different. The room was very pretty and very very clean. I recieved a very welcoming call from Rosa ensuring the room was good, which it was. Everything was in stock, which is such a convenience for me. Bed is super comfy and the view (24th floor) was beautiful. This hotel is probably pound for pound the best bang for your buck hotel in New York , highly recommended you stay here. They also have a vibrant lobby bar and happy hour from 5pm-630pm everyday.

title: Queen Beds and a Top Notch staff
text:
Our family of four had a very enjoyable weekend stay at this Courtyard Marriott.  When booking, make sure you get the right Courtyard because there are quite a few in the area.  
Positives:
1) EASY walking distance from Penn Station (a couple of blocks)
2) Walking distance (1-2 miles) from many attractions:  Rockefeller Center, Macy's, Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Times Square, and many restaurants.
3) CLEAN and well maintained
4) Nice amenities- fitness room, laundry, small market, business center, locked facility to store luggage before/after check in/out.
5) TOP NOTCH STAFF- helpful and friendly at every turn. Check-in and out was quick and easy.  The staff at this hotel is it's best asset.  
6) QUEEN BEDS- two of them!  Couldn't find too many hotels in NYC with two queen beds in this price range.
7) Room was quiet, clean, and spacious given NYC standards.  Mini fridge, coffee pot and flat screen tv.  Only thing I would change is a sink outside the bathroom so families could have more space and someone can shower while another washes up.
8) Healthy and yummy breakfast available (extra charge)
I have no complaints at all and would stay again!

title: Great Place to Stay in NYC
text: Close to everything yet just enough off the beaten path to offer some respite. The staff was great in handling our bags well before our check-in so we could see the city.  The hotel seems designed for business travelers, but saw many families there as well. Rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. The dining/bar area is small with limited hours, but the staff let us order in pizza! Next time in NYC will definitely look to stay here.

title: Worst experience ever!!
text: I thought the hotel staffs were my boss. They showed a very good ability to make customers feel uncomfortable in terms of their attitude to respond to customers, their neglecting tone. I had the worst experience of my life. I am very grateful to all of the hotel front staffs, especially to Ryan who made the worst experience of my life, on Christmas season. They seemed to know that a single customer would have a very small impact on them even if they get a complain. Moreover, I was very surprised at the attitude of the employees who showed a racial tendency. Eventually, after two days of booking for six days, I decided to stay in another hotel. Finally, I see how the hotel staff should respond to the customer in another hotel.  Please, do not stay here especially if you are not a caucasian.

title: Great stay
text: This hotel was centrally located. The room was nice and clean! The hotel staff was friendly. They have a microwave in the lobby available for use. They do store your luggage after checkout which is nice! I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great find in the middle of NYC
text: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights over Christmas weekend. Very happy with the services provided. The staff were kind and professional. Nice gym in lower level. Room was spacious with very comfortable bed and bedding. Bathroom roomy and clean. Nice toiletries. Close to everything in NYC. Would stay there again.

title: Good services and clean
text: We stayed over before Christmas Eve. Good customer services, room and bathroom were very clean and was not outdated. The price was good during the holiday. We loved the soap, shampoo and lotion they provided. We definitely will return again.

title: Worst hotel experience
text: The hotel double-charged me for a room. I was using a debit card so they effectively wiped my account of cash. It's more than 2 weeks later and they still haven't refunded the extra charge - nearly 400$. When I called to talk to the manager - again, after waiting more than two weeks for the money to be refunded to my account - she was incredibly unhelpful and after essentially telling me she could do nothing for me, told me, in a snarky way, that there was no point in repeating myself since there was nothing she could do. This is the day before Christmas eve. All I can say is I'm glad I wasn't depending on that money for the holidays. Never staying with Marriott again if I can help it.

title: Bra hotell i lugnt område
text: Har varit i NYC tidigare och bodde då mittemot MSG. Detta hotellet har dock ett mycket bättre läge & standard. Det ligger några minuters gång till allt man vill se, tex Times Square & MSG. Vårt rum var inte klart i tid, men som kompensation fick vi några frukostkuponger. Det är perfekt att bo lite vid sidan av huvudstråket där poliser/brandbilar ständigt har sirenerna igång.

title: Quiet and comfortable
text: We stayed one night and although we didn't spend any time there other than sleeping, it was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The room was clean as was the bathroom. The staff was also very friendly and the gym is better than most I've seen with this chain. There wasn't any bottled water which would have been nice and of course we paid far too much as it was December, but that is the case with all hotels this time of year. I would stay here again for sure.

title: Would definitely stay here again
text: The hotel was clean and well maintained.  The staff was very friendly.  I loved that we had the option of 2 queen sized beds, which is hard to come by in the City.  The bistro was of course pricey but the breakfast burrito was huge and came with a little side of fruit.  We stayed over Thanksgiving and the price per night showed it but they seemed to run some specials if you would pay in advance and they did accept Marriott points as well.

title: Consistently Good Choice for NYC Tourists
text: I reviewed this property a year ago and I remain quite satisfied with the property.  Even more so when I checked a few weeks before arrival and found the rates for my room had dropped 66% so I rebooked and saved hundreds of dollars.  This was a few days before the Macy's parade, so I guess occupancy was low just before the Thanksgiving rush.  The room and the overall property were very clean and the staff was friendly.  I can't account for the reviews about unfriendly service, but the hotel lobby is always busy and a bit chaotic as people are checking in and out often at the same time.  So  be patient with the young staff.  One day when I came back to my room in mid afternoon my room was not yet made up--not until 4 pm, which was an inconvenience, but that's how it goes sometimes.  Housekeeping did a great job keeping the bathroom sparkling clean.  I am not sure the HVAC was heating the room as high as I had set the thermostat (75 degrees), but the bedding was warm enough so I didn't follow up on it. The location is always super---northbound 8th Ave. buses to 42nd St and the Broadway and Off-Broadway theaters but also an easy walk.  Diners and delicatessens are in the area and Penn Station and the subways are close by as well.  Stay here if you can, but constantly check the rates.  Sometimes booking far in advance can be a good thing, but if it is during a cold period or just before a holiday the rates may go down.

title: Great value!
text:
I was able to book this hotel for a great rate for a stay just before the Thanksgiving holiday. 

Thumbs up: Good location walking distance to subway, restaurants, attractions.  Friendly staff (a shout out to Felisha in the Bistro).  This hotel is VERY QUIET! which is just amazing!  The staff cares:  the House Keeping Manager introduced himself on the elevator and inquired to see if we were happy with our accommodations.  The room and bathroom were CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN!  I would definitely stay here again.

Note:  The room is small … but rooms in NYC are always small.  This did not bother us as we were there to see NY! :-)

title: Avoid Avoid Avoid
text:
This hotel must have the rudest and least helpful staff on reception. Clearly they need training or they are in the wrong job. 
I was ignored for a long time and when I eventually checked in the staff were rude and just did not provide any smile or humanity. I use the Marriot chain for business and leisure worldwide, but this experience has seriously made me think. 
I have used this hotel on many occasions and the level of service has gradually gone downhill over the last 3 years. 
There are much better hotels in the area for less or the same price - I will be using one of these in the future.

title: Convenient Location, Super Friendly Staff
text: Budget friendly, convenient location, clean and simple room. The staff were the friendliest and most helpful I have ever encountered. A breakfast bar on the first floor was great, reasonably priced healthy options served FAST! We were impressed with all aspects of this hotel and will return.

title: Perfect Room
text: We recently stayed at the Courtyard Marriott on West 37th St.  The room was small, but it was reasonably priced and clean.  Just what we were looking for.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  We look forward to staying here again.

title: Good Place to Stay
text:
My wife and I stayed here during our first visit to NYC.  We thought the hotel was a good place to stay in that it was close to Times Square, the subway at Penn Station as well other places close by.  My wife and I do a lot of walking so it was a great location for us.

The front desk staff was very helpful with any question we had and help with advice needed.  The person who really made our stay/visit a wonderful was Michelle.  Michelle is the bartender in the lounge and she was amazing.  We would relax with a drink at the end of the day and MIchelle  was friendly and always interested in what we had done that day and suggested other things we might want to do while there.  Because of Michelle, rather than go to some of the other highly rated bars for visitors, we found ourselves preferring to go back to the Marriott and have a drink there and visit with Michelle.

title: Quiet, low floor rooms near MSG
text:
Clean, quiet hotel conveniently located near several transportation options.  Very easy access to/from Lincoln Tunnel and convenient to both Penn Station and Port Authority.  Several casual food options nearby and MSG was a safe 5 minute walk.  If traveling with someone who dislikes heights/elevators, the hotel has both low floor rooms and easy to access stairs!

Room was on the smaller side for a Courtyard but a comparable size to other city hotels.  Despite the size, the room had everything you would need for a short stay, including a coffee maker and mini fridge.  Bathroom was quite large with a spacious walk-in shower.  The hotel overall was very quiet- I was especially surprised by the lack of noise, given that we were in a 2nd floor room and directly across from the elevators.

Staff was very friendly, accommodating of requests made prior to check-in, and responsive to communication in the Marriott app.  Parking is off-site through a private garage further down the block, which was a little inconvenient but wouldn’t discourage me from staying here again.  For the location and accessibility, I would definitely keep this hotel in mind for future visits.

title: Nice hotel and wonderful bar tender
text: The hotel is in a good area close to Bryant Park, Times Square, and 5th Avenue.  The rooms were great for NYC.  The best part was how welcoming Michelle, the bartender was... she made the hotel feel like home.  Her humor and ability to deal with many different personality types sitting at the bar was amazing.  I’ll be staying here more often solely to see Michelle and know that it will always be a positive experience!

title: Great hotel
text: We found pretty cheap offer for double queen room for our family. Room was great. Staff was friendly. Location was superb. Gym worked. Network was quick. I mean it’s is difficult to find anything other to complain than that there was only 1 caffeinated coffee available daily as the other was decaffeinated. So really good place.

title: Convenient and Functional
text: We stayed for the weekend. The hotel is convenient to a number of sites including Times Square, MSG, subway etc. The hotel is not large but the rooms are sufficient in size. They are plain but clean. Bed was comfortable. Surprisingly we heard very little noise considering that it was so close to Times Square. The Nosh restaurant located in the hotel had some food for breakfast and snacks but it was limited. Bar service in the afternoon was convenient after a long day.

title: Gerne wieder
text:
Alles sauber. Sehr freundlich und immer sehr hilfsbereit. 
Super Lage zum Time Square, Broadway! 
Der Madison Square Garden befindet sich auch direkt ums Eck. 
Würden beim nächsten Besuch wieder dieses Hotel auswählen!

title: Excellent hotel
text: Awesome hotel to stay overnight at after a night of partying. It is conveniently located between many bars, restaurants, and places to see. Not too far from central park either. It has a very clean room and good bar in the fridge.

title: Do not go near this hotel!!!
text:
I wish to bring to your attention the outrageous and quite frankly dangerous situation you placed myself and my daughter in last week.
The circumstances were that I booked via Booking.com a 4 night surprise for my daughters 21 birthday. I made the booking 9 months previously. 
I use Marriott on many occasions for work and leisure as do my friends and family. We have never had a problem. 
On 17/10 I landed at JFK ar approx 2100 hrs. I switched on my phone only to receive a message From Courtyard Marriott via Booking.com that my reservation had been cancelled. The message was timed earlier in the day whilst I was in the air and unable receive the tsunami/emails. 
I immediately contacted the hotel who literally did nothing but stated that they were overbooked and that this was the reason for the cancellation. 
Both my daughter and I broke down in tears as not only did will feel vulnerable but we did not know what to do. I contacted Booking.com who stated that the hotel had cancelled and offered nothing apart from a $25 taken without prejudice. I have, since returning home sought legal advise for this despicable treatment that you feel is satisfactory. I have been advised that the legal fault sits with the hotel 
To date, I have not recorded any explanation or apology from Marriottt How they feel can treat people like this on what was supposed to be a joyous occasion is beyond comprehension. And the duty of care for us being none existent.
I am still furious and will take it further if a satisfactory response is not forthcoming. 
I want to emphasise that we were 2 women , myself and my daughter , left alone in an foreign airport, vulnerable without anywhere to stay despite having booked the room and break 9 months previously 
We eventually found a place to stay some 3 hours later by our own determination and through our own device, literally to ensure we were not sleeping dangerously in a vulnerable place.
I would also like to add that I had been in contact with the hotel right up until a few weeks before my daughters 21st birthday regarding additional surprises

title: Right in the heart of time square
text: The location is great and convenient to walk to The Time Center or part of The New York Times building. There are plenty of places to eat around the area. The room is surprisingly spacious and nice. The staff is courteous.

title: Excelente alternativa, cerca de todo
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado en la 37, a escasas cuadras de Times Square, Port Authority, Penn Station, entre otros lugares.

El personal fue muy amable, nos recibieron super bien y facilitaron el early check in ya que viajamos con un niño de dos años.

title: Rude Lobby workers
text: They don’t have workers to take my stuff from the lobby to the room , they told they have 1 worker for 200 rooms !!! , I waited 45 minutes till my pack been delivered to my room , the worst Marriott ever.

title: Friendly Staff...OK property
text:
Our family spent 2 nights at the Courtyard New York Times Square West.  The location is not as crazy busy as being right in Times Square.  It is walkable to many sites and great shopping and a few short blocks from Penn Station. There was barf in 2 sections of the sidewalk next to the hotel that we had to dodge the whole weekend. 

Front desk staff were accommodating, but be aware that some of the rooms are very small, especially for the price.  We were traveling during our fall school holidays and the nightly rates seemed much higher than their normal nightly rates.  We booked quite late, so that probably didn't help with pricing.  

The rooms are clean, but there isn't really anything special about the property that would make me want to return.

title: Good enough
text: Convenient location with very friendly staff who are always willing to help and make things right where they went wrong. They helped resolve some booking issues, which eventually got sorted out. Room is small but bed is comfy with nice linens.

title: Ci siamo trovati bene
text:
Avevamo optato, grazie ad una buona offerta, per una camera king con vista città.  
L'albergo si trova praticamente all'angolo con l'8 av., con i pro (vicinanza attività commerciali e metro), ma è molto trafficata e rumorosa, anche di notte (noi che abbiamo entrambi il sonno sensibile abbiamo dovuto usare i tappi).
Alla reception ci hanno voluto bene e ci hanno dato una camera all'ultimo piano (27esimo), da cui non si vede tutta Manhattan ma solo alcuni grattacieli, fra cui l'Empire...quindi vista gradevole che è piaciuta molto alla compagna. 
Il letto era oltre che bello largo, anche confortevole e il bagno molto spazioso, al contrario della camera che era un po' risicata.
Era presente una macchina per il caffè (sfruttatissima) e il frigo (che invece non abbiamo usato).
Oltre alla mancanza cronica dei bidet all'estero, nel bagno mancava anche lo scopino?!
Noi non abbiamo usato né aria condizionata né riscaldamento...mi sa che il fancoil non sia molto silenzioso.
Comunque il rapporto qualità/prezzo, la vista e la posizione mi fanno consigliare l'albergo chiaramente scegliendo le camere con vista.

title: New York City Business Stay
text:
Stayed at this Marriott property for a business convention - four nights total.  Checked in with Angel, he was super friendly and helpful.  

I liked our room.  It was a decent size, for NYC standards.  King sized bed, desk, closet, nightstands on both sides of the bed.  Small refrigerator with a handy counterspace in the bedroom.   The bathroom was large for the city, in my opinion.  I liked that the sink and toilet and tub were all in the same room.  

Great location - wide variety of restaurants and shops nearby and handy to Penn Station, Times Square, the subway, etc. 

I would have rated this property 5 stars but there were two negatives: 

(1)  The room seemed clean but there was a large amount of dust on the bathroom baseboards, especially behind the door. 

(2)  Coffee.  The room coffee maker had one packet of caffeinated coffee - made one tiny cup.  I went downstairs for more coffee and there was no free coffee.  No free breakfast either.  I thought the café was rather pricey so we ate elsewhere.

title: Good location, front desk staff not friendly and not helpful
text:
I stayed here for a few days with my family. I have 2 young daughters.
From the moment we arrived  we were pretty much ignored by front desk staff. Check in took over 10 mins. Front desk staff are in no hurry here. and even when there was a long  queue of guests, you don't see front desk manager or other staff jumping in to help. 

 We had a lot of luggage which I unloaded myself from the taxi, since there is no doorman or  concierge out front. were asked to wait for concierge to take our bags up to room. After 10 min I told front desk never mind we will take it up ourselves. With a sleeping 3 Yr old on one shoulder and dragging  suitcases up, they never batted an eyelid.

Rooms in hotel are very small, but that's NYC for yo5 hi

We had hassles with the room Keys every day. We were told don't put them next to your cellphone or other cards. This is the only hotel I experienced this at. 

Housekeeping failed to top up the coffee/tea in the room on the second morning. 

As a Marriott Platinum Elite guest I had expected at least a warm welcome on check in. And some little extra care to solve my any small problems. 
I got zero. 

The Concierge desk was their saving grace. very helpful and friendly guy on the desk. 

Overall its a 3.5 star hotel with 1-star service. Location is great and price is very reasonable. But service here actually drags down the whole Marriott groups name. 

I would not recommend to stay here if you expect friendly or helpful service from front desk.

title: Small rooms with no view
text:
I had a business trip to NYC and was looking for a not so expensive Hotel room. 
The Courtyard Times Square West was my choice because the price was acceptable.
Unfortunately the room was very small and had only a viewof the opposite backyard.
Therefore the room was very dark inside and it looks very sad. There’s no view at all.
I wouldn’t recommend this hotel at all.

title: Przestarzały , ale wygodny
text: Hotel przyzwoity , łóżko wygodne , pokoje czyste . Dobra baza wypadowa na time square i empire state. Pokoje i korytarze nieco przestarzałe , przydałby się remont .Klimatyzacja za głośna .  Personel uprzejmy i pomocny .

title: Short 3 night visit was adequate
text:
We have gold cards for the Marriott group. There were a number of issues. 
We arrived late and nobody could help us with our bags so we had to do this ourselves. 
On one day the room was not cleaned and this was only done late one night and we were asked to leave the room whilst the woman was working. This was odd. 
We were offered points as compensation and this was reasonable and acceptable. 
The rooms don’t have a view but the location is great and the reception team are very good.

title: Perfect Location, Perfect Service, Perfectly Safe
text: Location was perfect to walk from/to our MegaBus drop off. All of the staff were friendly, from the front desk, to the doorman, to housekeeping. The room was small but as I understand, acceptable for NYC room size standards. The room and bath were very clean. The hotel is very secure, key card required to enter the building via front door after 12:30 am. Key card required for elevator to stop on any floor other than the lobby. We walked everywhere, Rockefeller Center, to Time Square, to Hell’s Kitchen, from Greyline tours Time Square Location. Front desk securely help our bags. It was really great.

title: Dirty around the hotel and service is not great
text: Besides construction, it was also dirty right outside of the hotel which made entry to hotel unpleasant.  In addition, their attitude and service was not great.  No breakfast offered at this Courtyard.  Better off staying at a Fairfield Inn either near Times Square or Central Park.

title: MUY BUENA OPCIÓN A UN PASO DE LAS PRINCIPALES ATRACCIONES
text:
Muy buen hotel, en la 37. Cerca de todo, a escasos 10 minutos andando de Times Square, con el metro muy cerca. Las habitaciones pequeñas, pero muy aprovechadas y limpias. Cama muy cómoda, todo limpisimo. Wifi y aire acondicionado funcionando a la perfección. La tele de un tamaño muy bueno. El baño de muy buen tamaño, y con champú, jabón y gel. Hotel de casi 30 plantas. En recepción muy amables.
La habitación cuenta con cafetera para poder hacerte tu mismo té y café, aunque no la utilizamos.

Ojo con el chek-in que es a las 16:00. Como he dicho en recepción muy amables ya que nos dieron la habitación a las 15:00

Multitud de sitios cerca para desayunar, o cenar. Resumiendo, por el precio; una opción muy aconsejable en Manhattan.

title: Great hotel in prime location!
text: Arrived late Friday night and were welcomed by smiling front desk faces. Room was a bit small - but it’s Manhattan so what do you expect?! Clean place. Helpful staff. Good bar. Right next to Broadway and blocks away from either Central Park or Times Square. Would stay here again!

title: Well located Hotel
text:
The hotel is good located, the metro station is just a few feet’s away, the biggest  Macy’s is right across de street, and you all night life right outside, also it has roof terrace club for young people with an excelente view!! 
The room are small and tight but they have all the things you need!!

title: Easy going hotel in Manhattan
text: Walking distance to everywhere in Manhattan. Surprising quiet specially if you are in the upper floors. Friendly and helpful front desk staff with smile in every greeting. Clean corridors and well maintained. The rooms are a bit small, but that is expected in hotel with small footprint in the middle of a bustling city. Our room in the 16th floor is accessible to elevators but quiet. The view is expected to be some old buildings. Bed is king size clean and comfortable. Linens and pillows are soft with free extra options. Bathroom is fairly small but manageable if you are just yourself or with a partner. Cabinets and drawers are just fine and made of wood resin. Carpets are wall to wall and small office chair and table is for some workaholic few. 40 inch Flat screen, coffee maker and 2feet fridge are some of the fringe items available. I recommend this hotel for individuals who doesn't require luxury in their stay like me.

title: Standard Courtyard, clean, good location
text: Platinum member.....Seemingly new Courtyard, very clean, bedding, linens, all topnotch. Obviously being NYC rooms are tiny and there are just three overtaxed elevators (during AM and  PM rushes) but this is to  be expected being NYC. Excellent location (public transportation-wise).....close to 9th ave. restaurants (tons of options), close to Best Bagel and Coffee (great bagels on 35th). Really nothing not to like for this Marriott brand.  Fitness facilities are average for a Courtyard which means they're terrible.  I'd stay  here again, staff is friendly enough but some of them seem disinterested -- I've had better Marriott customer service experiences, but this is not reason to NOT stay here.

title: Excelente atención de Paula
text:
Como huésped , siempre es grato recibir una muy buena atención , como la que nos brindó la Srta. Paula , quien desde que llegamos siempre nos ayudó a resolver algunas de nuestras inquietudes , dándonos atención como concierge también .
Espero que se rodeen de más personas con este sentido de atención al cliente cálido y eficaz !
Los felicito !

title: Adequate
text:
The room was clean enough, and large enough.  Appreciated the mini-fridge.  The beds are doubles (not queens).  The one complaint is that the washroom had a noisy toilet.  Also, we waited almost an hour for our car upon checkout.  We were on 16th floor and we had a view of a brick wall and office space next door.  This is not a complaint- just a note to set expectations.    

The price was reasonable, given the location and dates (late August).  Adequate is the best way to describe this hotel.

title: Оазис качественного сервиса в привокзальной среде
text: Персонал работал чётко и приветливо. Один из наших номеров был готов с задержкой часа на полтора - это осталось единственным неудобством. Номера по-нью-йоркски компактные, но вполне чистые, со всеми положенными удобствами дял 4 звёзд. Завтраки не особо разнообразные, но качественные. Но так и не смогли привыкнуть к множеству бездомных в округе, которые укладывались отдыхать чуть ли не у входа в отель. Из-за близости ЖД и автовокзала, видимо, и мусора кругом довольно много. А до приличных ресторанов идти минут 15 минимум. Зато очень удобно ездить на экскурсии за пределы Нью-Йорка - рядом тоннель, выводящий на магистраль

title: Friendly staff and quiet location
text: Personable and helpful staff. Room was very quiet for NYC. Good midtown location to get to other parts of the city. Nice workout facility and Bistro for morning coffee. Was on a higher floor and the water pressure dropped frequently so showering at times was not great. Would stay again for location and minimal noise factor.

title: Da consigliare
text:
Ottimo hotel, pulito e nuovo, camere piccole ma solo perché abbiamo scelto i piani alti,bagno provvisto di set di cortesia tra i quali perfino salviette struccanti...
Personale gentile ed efficiente,segnalo Angel che ci ha accolto alla reception in modo impeccabile
Non posso dare eccellente per due pecche: buona climatizzazione anzi forse troppo alta negli ambienti comuni,ma i corridoi privi di climatizzazione e dunque soffocanti
Seconda cosa, rientriamo un pomeriggio alle 16.30 e la camera non era stata fatta... Hanno provveduto dietro nostro sollecito e   sono sicura che le altre camere erano fatte... forse dimenticanza
Per il resto,aggiungo ottima location , la colazione  non inclusa(bar con prodotti Starbucks, abbiamo provato una volta ma non ci ha convinti)
Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo quindi lo consiglio

title: $ giorni a NYC !
text: Posizione eccellente e molto centrale, stanza non grandissima ma moderna e accogliente, frigobar comodo,  hotel molto nuovo, palestra molto pulita e funzionale e servizi ok, colazione alla carte (3 scelte possibili)

title: Nice hotel, very good location
text: My sister and I came to New York for the Mostly Mozart Festival and stayed at this hotel on Saturday and Sunday, August 11 & 12.  The hotel is only a few blocks from Times Square, Macy's and Herald Square.  The room was very nice with a comfortable bed and a pretty large bathroom (the bath tub was small however; I'm 5'9".).  The staff was pleasant as well.  We arrived at about noon on Saturday and our room was ready which was great.  We checked in, rested for a little while then went to Macy's to shop.  We got a good deal as well.  We will stay again the next time we visit.  It would be nice if the hotel had a shuttle from the airports.  This wasn't too much of a problem, however, because we were a short walk from the Port Authority, where my sister got a shuttle to Newark and I got a  taxi to LaGuardia.

title: Buena opción
text:
Hotel situado en el Midtown de Manhattan, bien comunicado. Rodeado de buenos lugares para desayunar, comer o cenar.
Las habitaciones algo pequeñas pero confortables. 
El servicio muy amable y eficaz.
Lo recomiendo.

title: It could be better
text: As a platinum elite member, I think the service at the Courtyard Manhattan Times Square could improve. The room is clean but we did not even get any water in the room. I was expecting some sort of upgrade but didn’t get any of that. I had requested for an early check in but that was not available. When I came back, the room was ready but we had to wait for our luggage to get delivered to the room. This stay is disappointing. As a platinum elite member, I don’t think I am coming back to this place. The location is nice but there are other cheaper hotels around that would probably give me better service.

title: Great location
text:
the hotel is located right in front of the macys, a few blocks from the empire state, and from take square, in korean town, just a few steps away you will find delicious korean restaurants, excellent service, travel with my two children and the first night I  need a mattress for the sofa bed because it was not comfortable for my children, a few minutes later they brought me the mattress, the room is big and the view is very beautiful, I recommend taking a room on a high floor; in the part of the terrace of the hotel there is a very good restaurant bar, with view of the empire state, children are not allowed, on each floor there is ice machine and laundry, the room has a coffee machine, microwave and refrigerator

the subway station is just a block or two walk away, every day they fixed the beds, they put clean towels,  i pay aprox 1400 for  5 nights

title: Pretty convenient
text: Convenient hotel in Times Square.  Close to everything pen station, Macy’s and fifth avenue.  The rooms are comfortable and clean , not very big though.   We didn’t try the restaurant, but an efficient convenient store is located in the lobby.

title: Great hotel close to everything
text: Close to the Jarvis conference center and within walking distance of Times square, Manhattan,  shopping,  The garment district and so much more.  The hotel is nice. Our bedroom looked out onto an office building next-door so the view wasn’t that spectacular but what can you expect in Manhattan

title: Love it
text: Courtyard by Marriott is just lovely and very close to Times Square. Although I’ve been in bigger rooms, the rooms have nice-sized comfortable beds and adequate amenities. Staff is very polite and helpful. The laundry room in basement is a very useful addition! I’d certainly stay there again.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel du 7 au 14 août 2018. 
L’accueil a été excellent, le personnel très sympathique durant tout le séjour et très à l’écoute. 
La chambre était d’une propreté irréprochable, et c’est une chose très importante pour moi. Le lit très confortable. 
Hôtel idéalement situé à proximité de la folle ambiance de Times Square tout en étant au calme. 
Merci pour avoir rendu notre séjour agréable. Nous reviendrons.

title: Family New York Stopover
text:
We flew in from Melbourne, Australia and after a very long flight and being very tired we were met with lovely friendly reception staff. Our check-in was simple and fast. We had access to our two rooms very quickly and were on the same floor as requested in our booking. Our two teenage boys had one room and mum & dad in the other.
We received an upgrade to a higher floor which was received gratefully.
The rooms were clean & tidy and a reasonable size for NYC. The bathroom isn’t huge more ensuite size but has all the amenities needed.
It’s a great central location to most major tourist attractions.
Staying in a city that doesn’t sleep; visitors need to accept noise all hours of the night. It’s interesting to read some of the negative reviews about noise. All hotels we have stayed at in NYC have had some level of noise.
I’d stay here again.

title: Bon établissement, parfaitement situé dans Manhattan
text:
J'ai séjourné ici en famille (2 adultes + 2 enfants + 1 bébé) durant 5 nuits (3ième séjour à NYC). Au global, nous sommes satisfait de cet hôtel confortable qui répond en tous points à ce que nous souhaitions. Chambre d'une taille honorable avec deux lits doubles de très bonne qualité (auxquels l'hôtel a gracieusement rajouté un lit bébé).
Chambre relativement calme et pourtant, située à deux pas de Times Square. Métro et multiples restaurants et commerces à proximité pour répondre à tous vos besoins.
Adresse à recommander sans hésiter.

title: An AWESOME Courtyard close to everything
text:
This Courtyard was simply incredible. We arrived early and Angel took care of our bags. He gave us great suggestions for lunch and dinner. When our room was ready, Issac at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful with finding us a great room. Each day we came back from exploring, either Angel, Issac, or both, would ask how our day went and if we needed anything. They made our stay so enjoyable. We had a King room on a lower floor. They are a little larger than Kings on upper floors. Since we didn’t spend much time in the room, a view wasn’t very important. The room was VERY quiet. The AC was efficient and the bathroom was spacious. The room was spotless. There was a safe in the room, an amenity you typically do not find at Marriott properties. 

The hotel is very walkable to Times Square, Penn Station, and several popular subway stations. There are many restaurants in the area as well. On our 3rd morning, the young lady at the coffee counter knew what size coffee I had ordered and how I took it. The day we checked out, Paula at the front desk went out of her way to help us get to Penn Station. It was a 4 block walk and took less than 15 minutes. 

All in all this is one of the nicest and friendliest Marriott properties we have stayed. This will certainly be our go to hotel on our return trips to NYC.

title: Best visit
text: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days and it was the best decision of our trip it was centrally located indian pakistani food near by super marts penn station everything close by..time square was on walking distance very happening place ..

title: Nicely placed, a few lacks in the other areas
text:
The location of the hotel is very nice. Only 5-10 min walk to central Time Square and calm enough to sleep at night without noise. How ever, the price was pretty expensive for the small size of the rooms and lack of proper restaurant for breakfast. They only have a small single counter where you can order your breakfast through a very limited menu. The rooms where very well sound proofed and were comfortable enough, how ever like I said, for almost 250$/night, the rooms were small.

I would stay here again if I didn't have another choice, how ever I would try to find something a bit better.

title: Great place in NYC
text: I cannot say enough great things about this property - this is what a travel hotel should be.  After a terrible Courtyard experience recently in New Orleans, the exact opposite was experienced at the W. 37th St. Courtyard.  Everyone staff member was friendly & helpful, the facility was super clean, and the room was great.  The bathroom was especially nice, & we think that this hotel may have been recently upgraded.    Highly recommend!

title: Great hotel for business needs in New York
text: I recently worked with Courtyard for a project while our company Philips was in Manhattan in May, June, and July.  We utilized about 15 to 20 rooms per month for those months, and the staff was awesome.  Our Sales Director, Caroline and her assistant Sam were awesome.  They were very attentive to our needs.  They made sure our team were satisfied and taken care of and they gave us very reasonable rates during their peak season.  Hotels can get very expensive in Manhattan, but they definitely worked with our company to give us a reasonable rate. I will definitely work with Courtyard again on future projects that our company may have.

title: Great place for exploring NYC
text: Stayed here with my wife for 3 nights. It was very clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Location was great for exploring Manhattan and going to Broadway/Times Square. Very easy walk but not right in the middle of all the craziness. We had a king room and it was small compared to hotels in other cities, but average to bigger than average for NYC standards.

title: Excelent option in NYC
text: I had a great experience in this hotel. It is very well located just a couple short blocks from the metro. This is a key feature in NYC. The room was beautiful, but I have to say that I expected it to be larger according to the pictures (it was a bit of a surprise). All the Marriott standards were there. The staff was very helpful. I have to say that what tiped the balance to this hotel when I booked was the fact that you can have mail posted in advance of your arrival at no charge. Thank you for that, it was a life saver. I would definitely come back.

title: Nice Location
text: The location is great. Easy access to the subway and theatre district. However, the rooms are extremely small and dark. They were adequately cleaned, but could use a deep cleaning. The staff was very helpful. Too pricey for the moderate accommodations.

title: So Disappointed!!!!
text: Me and my husband will be arriving on sept 1st and we will stay for 4 nights we booked this hotel cause its a very special day for us and were looking forward to have a great stay here for our first wedding anniversary but its already messed up by the front desk , accounting reservation and theres one manager that my husband talked to and she just said they cant do anything about that which i think is very unprofessional cause you have to address your guest issues also i have all the mail about you failed to do it forgot that and it all messed up my credit . We still chose to stay here for our wedding anniversary but hope we get a chance to atleast speak with the head manager in regards to this issue. Thanks a lot !

title: GREAT HOTEL
text:
I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights.  This was a very nice and clean hotel.  The hotel staff were outstanding!  Everyone was helpful and friendly.  The room was bigger than I thought it was going to be.  
The hotel is near Penn Station if you’re using the subway.  I found the subway system very easy to use by accessing maps on my iPhone.  If you take Uber from this hotel, you have to walk to the nearest block and wait for a car.  Each time it showed a different location and make it quite difficult to determine exactly where.  Make sure you contact your Uber driver before he reaches your destination.  
The only complaint I had with this hotel was there was no air conditioning/air in the hallways.  This would not have been much of a problem IF there were more elevators in the hotel and it wasn’t 90 degrees outside.  This hotel has 27 floors and 3 elevators.  It took a little while before an elevator would reach your floor.

title: Short Stay
text: Clean, quiet hotel which is a short walk to Times Square and the Broadway theatres. Close to Penn Station too so if you are coming in from JFK, you can take a train in. That is much faster than the subway. The area looks dicey at night but we have never had an issue. The staff can’t guarantee that you’ll get into your room before 4 PM so if you get there early, you’ll need to check your bags. Also no exceptions to the check out time. First time in years we were asked why when checking in a same sex couple wanted to have one bed. I didn’t expect this from a major hotel in a metropolitan city.

title: A nice quality stay- nothing fancy
text: This CBM rises to the same level of excellence as VBM’s elsewhere. The only thing special is the location-1/2 block from Times Square. Accommodations were clean and staff was very pleasant. None of the classic NYC rudeness.book through Marriott for best rate.

title: great hotel
text: A very good location, near theTime Square,and yet,quiet and peaceful. A big supermarket nearby (I forgot its' name). Friendly and service-oriented stuff. especially Migel from the reception who  was very nice and helpful. The rooms are clean. Beds are super comfortable.  Breakfast is sufficient  and tasty.

title: Great location
text: I was able to easily walk from Penn Station to the hotel.  The staff was very friendly and the room, although small, fit my needs perfectly. The hotel was clean and inviting and I would definitely stay here again.

title: Close to the centre of the planet!
text: Stayed here recently with family. It is a predictable Courtyard Marriott venue which means you expect everything to be a certain way. Which it is. The location is obviously exceptional and you are close to everything a tourist needs to be close to. Definitely we will put this place on the short list when we return to NYC.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Booked the accommodation few days before our trip. After reading several reviews, decided to book Courtyard by Marriotts on their reputation. The hotel did not disappoint me. Excellent rooms, friendly, professional and great service. Good, decent sized rooms, close to Times Square (10mins walk), loads of pubs, food places around. Definitely recommend to stay and will definitely return.

title: Great Central Accommodation
text:
This is a further update on our accommodation in New York. 

We have been here for 9 days now and have found this location perfect for seeing all of the sights.  Great location for food and entertainment as well as access to the subway. 

The staff here are friendly and very helpful, especially Michael who always greets us with a smile and some helpful tips every time we see him. With laundry, gym and wifi this has been a great choice. Two days to go and we will be sad to say goodbye.

I hope this helps those of you looking for some great accomodation.

Cheers

title: Good but Not as Good as First Visit
text: This was our second time at this property while visiting NYC this year. Front desk was friendly and efficient in getting us checked in and again we could get in early which was great. Excellent location as a quick walk from penn station and to the theatre district and times square. Only issue this time was not being able to sync up with the cleaning crew to get our room clean. We were not out early and would come back after being out for a few hours. We thought, incorrectly, when we left for awhile and saw the housekeeping cart in our hallway that we would be getting cleaned. That didn't happen either of our two days. Now when we did call they said they would send someone up to clean but we were then relaxing.Never had this issue before but now we've learned to call and tell them you're out and that you prefer cleaning in that time. Best to communicate those desires at this hotel if you'll be in and out as you will probably be missed otherwise. Wifi response was spotty this time. They do have a happy hour and the breakfast/starbucks in the lobby is a fast and convenient way to grab something.

title: Great stay and great location
text: We stayed at the Courtyard for 4 nights in June 2018.  We had a king room overlooking 37th Street.  The room was much more spacious than I expected being in Manhattan.  The bathroom was spacious as well.  The room had a refrigerator and coffee maker, as well as a desk area.  The bed was incredibly comfortable.  The only down side to this room was that garbage pick up is every night around 11pm, so you would hear the garbage trucks outside (we were on the 2nd floor).  They didn't stay long and most night we weren't trying to sleep yet.  Otherwise, there was not a lot of street noise even though we were facing the street.  There is a nice little cafe on the first floor we visited the first night for happy hour (half price drinks from 4 to 7).  We had an enjoyable time here as well.  It also serves food though we didn't eat here.  The location of this hotel is about a 8-10 minute walk to most of the Broadway theaters and Times Square.  It's only a few blocks from Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and several different subway stops.  We found it really convenient for most of the activities we had planned during our stay.  We would not hesitate to stay here again.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.

title: Toppen läge
text: Jätte fint och modernt hotell med toppen läge nära time square. Trevlig och hjälpsam personal. Hotellet har en starbucks på bottenvåningen där man kan äta frukost. Men det finns gott om restauranger och barer som man kan gå till.

title: Muy recomendable
text: Excelente ubicación , cerca de times square y con transporte para todas partes.  Con respecto al hotel,  lindo , el personal muy amable y  las instalaciones cómodas. . Volvería A hospedarme en ese lugar sin dudarlo en mi próxima visita a Manhattan

title: Noisy A/C Kept Waking Us Up,stay away from room 1408
text: We have stayed at this hotel before and really liked it. The staff are very nice and the location is terrific. This time we were only there for one night and it wasn't our best expereince. We were in room 1408 and I would not recommend it. It is a smaller corner king bed room. That in itself was fine, but the A/C unit was incredibly loud. So much so, that it woke both my husband and I up every time it would kick in and turn on. It was crazy. We let the front desk know and put it in our response to the 'How was your stay' email. Unfortuantely, I did not get the impression that either understood what a true disturbance the A/C noise was to being able to sleep. It is right next to the bed as there is not much space, you almost have to walk sideways to get in on that side.  It was not the normal humming noise, but the noise decibel level was similar to your alarm clock going off.

title: premiere a new york
text: Pour la première fois à New York nous avons été comblé. Accueil chaleureux et souriant, la chambre grande et spacieuse  avec tout le confort que l'ont peu souhaiter, très calme. Le petit déjeuner  intéressant par sa conception. Très agréable séjour.

title: Great location
text: This hotel was clean and in a great location near the public library and park. Plenty of restaurants around, and a pub right next door. You nave to use the valet parking, but the return was quick. Rooms/bathrooms/shared spaces were very clean and welcoming. Breakfast was a la carte and fine (I'd recommend venturing out to get a bagel instead - it's NYC!). There's a Whole Foods grocery within a block if you want to stock up the kitchenettes.

title: Stop looking for hotels and pick this one!
text: Our family of four stayed here for three nights. We have two teens so got two rooms. Eric at the front desk was awesome and exemplifies hospitality. He greeted us each day and helped us with questions we had about our plans. The rooms were great. Very new and clean and pretty spacious for New York. The beds are comfy and I’m super picky about beds and pillows! Nice flat screen tv. Rooms are quiet. Ac works very well and is quiet too. The location was very convenient for tourist activities. They have in room coffee too but there is also a Dunkin’ Donuts just outside the hotel. We will come back for sure.

title: Great comfort in a great location.
text:
This hotel turned out to be great choice for our stay in New York. Walking distance from Penn station and close to Times Square, it was very convenient to visit all the attractions in a short period. 
The staff was very pleasant and friendly. They immediately gave us a room for an early check-in on our choice of floor. 
Our double queen bed room and bathroom were very spacious, more than what we expected in Manhattan. They serve Starbucks coffee during breakfast. 
We had such a comfortable experience, that we decided to choose Courtyard Marriott even at our next destination at Niagara.

title: Jewel of a hotel
text:
Located at a distance of 5 mins from times square this hotel is a absolute vaue for money, spent 2 nights here and from the room to the bed to the staff everything was spot on.

Rooms are decent sized and so is the toilet, beds are very comfortable and rooms are well insulated to noise.

Only drawback was the elevator wait time buts thats expected at most hotels in MANHATTAN .

title: Férias
text: O hotel atendeu as expectativas. Tem excelente localização, perto de várias atrações e do burburinho da Times Square. Fomos super bem atendidos pelo Guilhermo, que foi super atencioso o que facilitou muito o nosso check in

title: Great staff
text: I stay here once or twice a month and am always impressed with the friendliness of the staff. My room is always ready, even when I’m early. They also have a sizable gym for a Courtyard. Overall, I definitely recommend this Marriott!

title: Boa opção
text: Bem localizado, próximo á Macys, Madison Square Garden e Penn Station. Hotel correto, sem luxo, porém limpo, agradável, com 3 elevadores que atendem bem às necessidades. Diárias caras, mas dentro do padrão Manhattan. Wifi muito bom. Café da manhã não testado.

title: Great Location, Room and Service
text: This is the best location when you need an early morning departure to catch a train at Penn Station.  The room was clean, quiet and the bed was very comfortable.  Staff were really helpful and I can't fault the hotel.

title: Bien.
text: Hôtel  très bien situé..chambre spacieuse ,tres bonne literie mais manque de propreté. .service conciergerie  très professionnel pour réserver vos spectacles et tours. Vous pouvez prendre le petit sur place si c'est inclus sinon beaucoup de choix a l'extérieur.

title: Not One Complaint
text:
Recently visited New York city on a overnight trip with my wife and two teenagers. We stayed at the Courtyard on 37th street...what a great property. 
First the location is perfect, you can walk to a lot of the major sights such as Bryant park, Times Square, Empire State building and Central Park. If you don't want to walk, the Metro station is literally steps away. Second the staff are super friendly, very courteous and helpful.
