The rooms themselves are very spacious by New York standards, quiet, clean and the beds were very comfortable. There literally is nothing to complain about this property...will definitely be back

title: Excellent Stay
text: I'll make this short and sweet. Hotel lobby and my room were very clean. Comfortable beds. Clean bathrooms. Friendly service. It wasn't our check-in time yet but they let the bellman take our bags off our hands so we could explore the city! Couple blocks from Time Sq, Penn Station, and K-Town. Would recommend others to stay here. Their bar also has happy hour!

title: Excellent
text: Just returned from a NYC overnight to see Hamilton. I arrived about 10:45 am and other friends were arriving by 12 noon. Yelissa was at the front desk when I arrived. We had reserved 3 rooms, and one was ready even though check-in is 4 pm.  Moreover, when I explained to her that friends were arriving by noon, she blocked the other rooms and those rooms were ready before they arrived. She recommended an excellent place for breakfast the next day, calling me by name (how did she remember my name?). Rooms were immaculate. Shower was great!  Bed was comfy. I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you to all the staff at this Courtyard!

title: Perfetto
text: Hotel molto carino, camera piccola ma curata nei dettagli e bagno oltre le aspettative. Bella la doccia. Posizione ottima, a due passi dalla fermata metro “Linea blu Penn Station” è vicinissimo a Times Square ed alle principali attrazioni. Dall’aeroporto di JFK abbiamo preso un autobus al costo di 19$/pax che ci ha fermato a briant Park (fermata più vicina all’hotel) ed al ritorno ci siamo fatti chiamare un taxi che ci ha portato in aeroporto al costo di 70$ totali, prezzo modico data la piazza ed il tragitto di poco più di un’ora. Dovessimo tornare a New York sceglieremmo di sicuro questo hotel.

title: โรงแรมทำเลดี
text:
ห้องก็ใช้ได้ โรงแรมดี พนักงานต้อนรับ วันแรกตอนเช็คอิน บริการกลางๆ ไม่ค่อยประทับใจเท่าไหร่
แต่ รอบค่ำ บริการดีมากๆ แนะนำดีสุดๆ ตอนเช้าก็เจอพนักงานดี รวมๆแล้วน่าพักมากๆ อาหารเช้า มีให้เลือกน้อยไปนิดนึง แต่ก็ไม่แย่อะไร

title: Would highly recommend!
text:
We just stayed one night, but here are the highlights in a nutshell:

- Check-in was quick and easy.
- Rooms were clean, modern, well-designed, extremely quiet and very spacious for New York Standards.
- Hotel is in a convenient location to Penn Station,Times Square and plenty of dining, things to do, etc.
- Julieth at the front desk went out of her way to make our night in NYC special (we were celebrating our son’s birthday - Thanks Julieth!)
- The Bistro is a low key bar/cafe for quick bites if you don’t feel like leaving the hotel. (Try the banana bread French toast).
- Free WiFi worked great!

Will definitely stay again.

title: Good Option
text:
Great location, just a few blocks from Penn Station in one direction and Times Square in the other.
We chose the fifth floor which was ideal, not aware of any noise and elevators were reasonably quick.
The room was great, large bathroom with good shower power, most comfortable King size bed, small fridge and free safe.
If I ever return to New York I will stay here.

title: Location Perfect, Room was Quiet
text: Nice clean room with king sized bed.  Bed was comfortable, sheets were soft.  AC was a bit cold at times and didn't regulate as well as I would like, so turned on and off a lot.  Room was perfectly located only a couple blocks from everything you need in Manhattan.  Very quiet, we were on 27th floor and didn't hear any sirens.  Heard door next door close a few times, but didn't hear any hall noise or neighbor noise.   WIFI was good, but the cell service was not good from our room.  Would definitely stay again.  Hoping to not to go back to NYC, too busy for me, but if I have to, I would stay here again without hesitation.

title: Eh.
text: Rooms and showers are clean, some stains on bedding, but breakfast sucks. When we tried checking into breakfast, the lady was very rude and said some unkind things under her breath when we walked away. Breakfast is very limited, just fruit, yogurt, and bread. For what we are paying, we at least deserve some eggs and bacon!

title: お湯がでない
text:
3泊滞在しました。
3泊目の夜にシャワーのお湯が出なくなりました。
フロントに尋ねると10分お湯を出し続けろ。とのこと。
試しましたが、お湯は出ませんでした。
7時にマネージャーに連絡するからと言われましたが、7時チェックアウト予定だったので、それは困ると伝え、ならば6時にマネージャーに連絡するから待ってくれと言われました。
チェックアウトする7時まで音沙汰なし。

冷たい真水でシャワーを浴びる訳にもいかず、シャワー無しのホテルです。

ドミトリーやゲストハウスにもシャワーはあるでしょうから、1泊$250で、ドミトリーやゲストハウス以下のサービスを体験できます。

周辺にたくさんホテルがあるので、他のホテルを検討することを勧めます。

抜群の立地だと思いますので、
1泊$250でシャワー無くても許せる人は
宿泊しても良いかもしれませんね。

同じような金額でホテルたくさんありますので、お湯が出ないホテルより、他のホテルを検討した方が良いでしょう。

この件をクレームいれたところ、5000マリオットポイントを提供されました。
$250の支払いで、シャワーが使えないことの報いが$50相当ということです。

たくさんのゲストがたくさんのお湯を使用した為に起きたアクシデントとの返答でした。

もし、停電などのトラブルであればしょうがないかな？とは思いますが、多数のゲストがたくさんのお湯を利用するなどホテル側は想定すべき事象です。

こちらのホテルはお湯が使えなくなることがあると考えた上で宿泊予約をおススメします。

title: Un hotel recomendable
text:
La localizacion del hotel es perfecta.Las camas son muy comodas y todo esta muy limpio.
Quizas la habitacion es algo pequeña en comparacion con otros 4 estrellas, pero estas en Manhatan...
El gimnasio del hotel esta fenomenal.
Tiene WIFI gratis, un gran plus...
En mi caso, encontre una buena oferta.. si no, seria algo caro

title: Good base for exploring NY
text: Did everything we wanted for a reasonable price considering it is New York. Clean, good sized rooms. Service was excellent, very friendly and helpful. Location is spot on for exploring NY. Air con a bit noisy. As always, hotel reviews should  take into account  location - as a city hotel in NY it is very good and I'd use again.

title: Hôtel très bien placé, bon séjour
text:
Nous avons séjourné 10 jours dans cet hôtel.
Nous avons été bien accueillis et avons pu accéder à notre chambre dès notre arrivée. 
Pour New-york, la chambre ainsi que la salle de bains étaient d'une taille correcte. L'ensemble était propre. La literie était très bonne. 
Le personnel était sympathique et à l'écoute. 
L'emplacement est exceptionnel : à 10 minutes de Times Square et à moins de 5 minutes de deux bouches de métro desservant tout Manhattan. 
Nous étions au 17ème étage (sur une trentaine), le bruit ne nous a donc pas dérangé, étant précisé qu'une demande de séjourner le plus haut possible avait été formulée.
Attention il n'y a pas de petit-déjeuner inclus, mais il existe un Starbucks au RDC.
Nous avons été tout à fait satisfaits de cet hôtel dans l'ensemble.

title: Début compliqué
text: Le grand plus de l'hôtel est sa location, il est à deux pas de Times square, à une rue du métro, en face de restaurants, bref le top. En plus la chambre est plutôt agréable bien qu'un peu vieillotte et le personnel très accueillant. Cependant nous avons eu une bien mauvaise surprise en arrivant, il était 23h (donc 5h du matin pour nous, après être parti de chez nous depuis plus de 12 heures) et nous nous sommes présentés à l'accueil quand l'hôtesse nous a annoncé que la réservation avait été annulée et que malheureusement l'hôtel était complet. Ils m'avaient écrit un mail à 18h (heure française) (alors que l'avion décollait à 17h30) pour me dire que ma carte n'était pas passée et que si je ne répondais pas dans les 6 prochaines heures (donc toujours dans l'avion) la réservation était annulée. Après avoir râlé, ils ont finalement trouvé une chambre (alors qu'ils devaient être complets), réservée aux handicapés. Je recommande cet hôtel mais à condition de s'assurer que la réservation est bien confirmée quelque temps avant.

title: Melhor hotel
text: Experiência maravilhosa, equipe super simpática, ótima localização, bem próxima ao penn station e da Times Square, quarto muito bom e espaçoso, eles possuem um frigobar, cama maravilhosa excelente para quando vc chega cansado de andar, possui um café dentro do hotel, muito bom recomendo a todos, voltarei com certeza.

title: Calme et bien placé
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits dans cet hôtel. 
Idealement placé,  à quelques minutes de Times Square, tout est a proximité,  supérette,  starbucks, magasin de souvenir.... 
Hotel propre, personnel souriant.
Les  chambres sont bien insonorisées et la literie est parfaite, ainsi que les oreillets.

Les seuls points negatifs à signaler :
Chambres un peu sombre (même au 13ème étage)
Le manque de choix au niveau du petit déjeuner

title: Great location, well run hotel, reasonable prices
text: Close to Penn Station, walking distance to Times Square. Off of 8th ave so it is quieter. Near mass transit. Desk is very efficient and friendly. This is one of my go to hotels in the City and perfect when you come in for a weekend

title: Great Stay! Staff is AMAZING!
text: From the moment I spoke to Julieth about my room reservation, I knew my stay was going to be fantastic. I spoke to her a few times prior to my arrival and she answered every question I had in detail. It was my son & daughter's 1st time in the city and I wanted everything to go smoothly. From the check in the first night with Eric to Julith and Julissa (name?) to Bryan and the rest of the guys at the Front Desk, I couldn't have asked for a more pleasant staff. By the 2nd night, we were on a first name basis. Rooms and housekeeping up to par..Bartender, Johanssen was super cool and the location was very convenient. See you in a few months..Jennifer Sanchez (Miami, Fl)

title: Great location and nice staff
text: Being in town for BikeMS NYC, hotel was convenient and accommodating to all the riders staying there. Staff was great! Bar was awesome, nice simple selections for snacks and meals. Location was convenient and easy to get around.

title: nice place!
text: stayed here for a couple of nights.. very convenient location near times square and central manhattan... rooms are nice and comfortable .. restaurant is average and the breakfast options very limited... the staff at restaurant was pretty rude!

title: Perfect! Very clean, perfect location for sightseeing
text:
5min Walk from Penn Station
Close to Empire State Building 
A lot of good restaurants very close by

Small rooms, but very clean and with new interior.

Good bar
Starbucks coffee
International breakfast
Not noisy

title: Location!!!
text:
Stayed a couple of nights at this centrally located Marriott property - which is walkable/accessible to most NYC attractions. The service is excellent as is the cleanliness. The only shortcoming is the size of rooms - but then considering NYC, its just about OK.

Will stay again!

title: Convenient and well located
text:
On arrival the hostess could not be more accommodating and welcoming. It was a pleasure to feel appreciated. Location great   Lots of things to do in the area. Near Penn Station,Macy’s. 
Room very comfortable. Nice view oif city. Breakfast was good

title: Zentrale aber ruhige Lage
text: Wir haben hier 4 Nächte geschlafen und aus zentraler Lage new york erkundet. Das Essen haben wir nicht getestet da es in der Umgebung genug typisch new Yorker Lokalitäten gibt. Unser Zimmer nach hinten raus war groß genug und modern eingerichtet. Service war gut und wir hatten nichts zu meckern

title: Great Location for a NYC visit
text:
i was looking at a hotel that can accommodate a family of 4 (2 adults 2 kids)  that is well located and is of high standards. I am so pleased I have chosen the Courtyard Marriott hotel . 
The hotel is within walking distance to all main attractions so location is TOP. We were greeted at the reception with a welcoming smile and were informed that our room will be ready in 1.5h time as we were early. We went for a walk to Time Sq which was only 15mins away. 
The room was spacious with two double very comfortable beds and with a very nice and super clean bathroom with a shower. This is what you are looking for a city break .Although I didn't try the gym I had a look around and it was nicely equipped. In addition the hotel has a small cafe/Bistro that you can have breakfast drinks/dinner etc. We only had some light breakfast there once and the service was very good.
As I said the Hotel is in the perfect location. From there we were in no time to Time Sq,  Empire Sate Building, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Tower   , USS Intrepid at Hudson River, the Sky Line and many more . Also there are tons of restaurants and diners within short distance with a lot of non tourist ones on the 9th and 10th avenues 
We had a very pleasant and happy stay at the hotel and we definitely have it on top of our list for any future visits. The last day we checked out early and we left our bags to storage so as to enjoy the rest of the day in NYC. Chis was super helpful with that and when we return late in the afternoon he had our taxi and bags sorted for us for the trip back home
Definitely a very good experience so would highly recommend it to everybody. Friendly staff, clean and spacious for NYC standards rooms and great location what else can you ask

title: Just as expected
text: Marriott does it again, just as I expected, clean, well located, reasonably priced, reliable and more. Another fantastic experience in NYC at this great hotel. We chose Times Square location because we wanted to be in midtown and we were going to do plenty of shopping and shows, or else, its too loud of an area to unwind. I used the fitness center once, it was empty and had it all to myself, very good. Also used the dry cleaning when I spilled wine on a shirt at one of our dinners; it was expensive, but fast and reliable. Free wifi, fast as well.

title: Excelente 100% recomendable
text: Hotel 100% recomendable, nos hospedamos en este hotel en el mes de marzo de 2018, simplemente puedo decir que es un excelente hotel, su personal es muy amable, las habitaciones son de muy buen tamaño, colchones y almohadas súper cómodas, la limpieza excelente. Su ubicación es muy buena. Muy cerca del metro, de Times Square y de muchos lugares imprescindibles de conocer en NY. Ni un instante dudaría en hospedarme en este hotel nuevamente. Gracias por todo.

title: Typical Marriott Excellence
text: Although we have found all Marriotts to be comfortable, clean and pleasant, this hotel was exceptionally so.  Very friendly staff, very clean and great location.  Spacious room with all the amenities needed.

title: Perfect hotel for a first time stay in New York
text: Stayed here with husband and daughter (we stayed 10 nights and daughter 7 as she was moving on). Delightful and personal welcome by Erik, at the front desk who took so much trouble to make checking in smooth, find us suitable rooms, give us tips for restaurants and make our daughter welcome, when she arrived. Whenever he was on, Erik always had a word to say and ask us how we were getting on. Delighted with the room (we had a choice of lower down and more spacious or higher up and quieter) and the cleanliness and housekeeping was tip-top. All staff members, from front desk, to bar and cleaning staff, were incredibly kind and smiley. If I ever return, THIS is where I will stay!

title: Excellent staff. Clean and quiet.
text: I've stayed here five nights and will stay again given the opportunity. The staff is remarkable, very friendly and accommodating. A short walk to Penn Station, Times Square, Madison Square, and Broadway. Prices get a little crazy when there's a big event in town, but very reasonable otherwise for a hotel of this quality. It's half a block from 8th Avenue on a safe and quiet side street. KIng beds pretty well fill the room, but double queens have plenty of space.

title: Clean & Comfortable
text: Checkin process was excellent. I arrived in town earlier than planned and was appreciative to checkin 4 hrs early. The front desk provided me a map and brief explanations of where main attractions were located and then guided me to the elevators. Room was small, but clean. Happy to see Paul Mitchell toiletries. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Room was on the 14th floor and the view wasn't that great but that's fine. About a 4-5 block walk to Times Square. Many stores/restaurants nearby, including Heartland Brewery. Starbucks (drinks & breakfast) available on the lobby floor. I was happy with my stay and would return in the future.

title: Super Lage sowie gutes Preis- und Leistungsverhältnis
text:
Tolle Lage nahe am Times Square und doch in einer ruhigen Seitenstrasse gelegen. Es hat viele Restaurants und Shops in der nahen Umgebung und ist in wenigen Gehminuten mitten im Kuchen. Man erreicht sehr gut alles, was New York zu bieten hat.
Die Zimmer sind sauber, nicht gross aber ausreichend geräumig, die Betten sind komfortabel und das Personal hilfsbereit und freundlich.
Ich kann dieses Hotel sehr weiterempfehlen und werde hier wieder übernachten.

title: Good location
text:
Arriving to nyc for s short stay between flights I found this hotel convinient and comfortable.
Good helpful service, quiet room and free wifi.
I had dined outside... so many options all around.
Enjoyed it.

title: Convenient location between Penn Station and TImes Square
text: The location is convenient, between Penn Station and Times Square. We were pleasantly greeted by the front desk upon arrival, however not recognized as Marriott Elite Guests. Our room was mid-way up, on the 17th floor. The room was quiet, we couldn’t hear the elevator nor traffic which is a plus, having had both those problems at other hotels in recent weeks. It was a small room, but I have had smaller. We had a king which worked okay for two people. The free internet worked well. I was able to complete a full day’s work in the room without the internet dropping out. This is better than my Comcast internet at home that dies a few times day. The room had the standard amenities but nothing special. There is a small refrigerator and in room safe. The view wasn’t all that great, but the there was ample space between buildings that let in a pleasant amount of natural light.

title: Very Nice First Stay
text: First time staying at this property on one of our NYC visits. Very nice two night stay. We were greeted and checked in by the very pleasant Yelissa. I hope I was close in getting her name or at least close. We got there a little after 1200pm and were able to get into a room which was great! Room was on 24th floor and right off the elevator. We were a little concerned initially that this could be noisy as we try to stay away from the elevator but we did not hear a peep during our stay and it was very quiet. Not too many rooms on each floor. Appears that this room and bathroom have been renovated as all appeared brand new. Very clean and sufficiently spacious with a safe in the room. Free wifi but we didn't use it. We did not eat in the hotel so can't speak to the restaurant bar but nothing was included in our room rate. Plenty of options for food close by including one of our favorite diners for breakfast - the tick tock diner on 8th ave. Also had a great lunch of some light italian fare at close by Casa Nonna but pricey. We'll be back to this Courtyard in May and certainly a worthy repeat location.

title: BON SEJOUR. HOTEL BIEN PLACE
text: Séjour de 3 nuitées. La température de l'eau dans la salle de bains n'est pas au top : Le vendredi soir nous avons eu une douche tiède et le lundi matin l'eau était quasiment froide. D'autre part le petit déjeuner est très succint : pain de mie, quelques cakes, morceaux de fruits frais yaourts et lait. Sinon, l'hôtel est bien placé, le personnel est chaleureux. Les chambres sont modernes et confortables. Nous avons passé un séjour agréable dans l'ensemble.

title: Great location if you want Midtown but not Time Sq
text:
Good spot to access restaurants, shows and transportation.  Near the Lincoln Tunnel. 

Clean and efficient. They have the standard fare , breakfast and a happy hour in lobby. 

Parking is available at a garage just a couple doors past hotel.

title: Nice hotel
text: A very nice hotel located within walking distance of times square, Madison square garden. The rooms were very clean and of good size for new York. Only 2 negatives was the restaurant was closed due to kitchen renovation  and when we checked in early the front desk never called when are room was ready. Overall a very good experience. Those were very minor things. Would definitely stay there again

title: Great Stay at the Courtyard in NYC
text: Great location near excellent restaurants, coffee shops, etc. Clean, and I would say, normal size hotel room. The staff couldn’t have been nicer and accommodating. Stored our luggage due to an early arrival and called us when room was ready. A little bit of a walk to Times Square, (5 blocks), but staying a few blocks away isn’t necessarily a bad thing. Highly recommend this property.

title: Service is Exceptional
text: There are a few things I rate my hotel stays on...cleanliness, comfort of bed/room and service.  This hotel hit top marks on all three areas.  I checked in late on Sunday evening after a long trip, dinner out and a trade show at the Javits.  I was welcome by Erick who let me know they were expecting me, thanked me for my mobile check in and offered me a warm caring attitude as I checked in.  He walked me to the elevator and waiting until the elevator came.  He wished me a warm goodnight and asked I call down if I needed anything.  It is so nice to be greeting warmly when you check in to any hotel.  The room, as with most Courtyards, was clean and comfortable.  I was disappointed because the vending machine on the floor was empty of water and when I ordered the large bottle from room service it was a $10.00 +_ bill.  But, I was so thirsty and needed to hydrate so it is the price you pay for convenience.  My stay was great.  Every staff members acknowledged you when they met you in the hallway, elevator, front door.  Everyone was eager to help.  I would say the service at this hotel rivals that of any of the Marriotts I have visited.  Thank you for making my trip to the city a little more enjoyable.

title: Tight but Fitting
text: Talk about a really small room, basically you open the door and boom there you are bed, tv and all. I was there for less than 24 hours thankfully. Check in was a breeze, quick and efficient just like NYC.

title: Perfect hotel in the perfect location
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights in March 2018. The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes from the subway at Penn Station. Our room was on the 13th floor. Never a long wait for an elevator. The room was modern and well presented - clean, tidy, well kept. The room had a safe and fridge which were both big enough for the basics. The bed was comfortable and we both slept well every night. 

The hotel is staffed by a great team. They were all very welcoming and helpful. Special mention to Erick at reception who is a charming man who always seemed to be so happy and so willing to help in any way. Thanks also to Yelissa for helping out with our check out. Great hotel + Great Staff = winning combination. 

I choose my hotels very carefully and did a lot of research before choosing this one from a vast array of mid-price midtown options. Let me save you the bother - just go book this one!

title: Great location!
text: I don’t normally rate a chain hotel or restaurant but this place warranted a review! First off the location is perfect! A stone throw away from MSG and Times Square, there are tons of restaurants and bars nearby. The Check in experience was absolutely perfect and professional. When the front desk person remembers your name the next day you know he’s professional. First class Courtyard!

title: Bien placé
text:
Hôtel proche de Time square et de Madison Square garden. Métro accessible rapidement. 
Chambre correcte mais sans charme. 
Par contre, petit-déjeuner très décevant. Un petit pain, un croissant, un jus de fruit et merci au revoir. Bref, le minimum... bon, ok, il y a avait quand même quelques fruits et du café, mais cela reste loin des petits déjeuners « continentaux » ou nous pouvons avec du choix (salés ou sucrés par exemple).

title: Tres bien placé, de belles chambres!
text:
Cet hotel est tres bien placé dans Manhattan, les chambres sont grandes, les salles de bain bien équipées.
Dommage qu'il n'y ai pas vraiment de buffet pour le petit déjeuner car c'est un bon endroit pour passer quelques nuits à New York

title: 5th Ave Value!
text: This Marriott Courtyard is on East 40th St just off 5th Ave! Great location for restaurants, theater’s and the heart of the NY vibe. I was here on business. Neat clean rooms. A bit small but nonetheless very comfortable. A Starbucks is located in the lobby and a great cafe/ market is right next door for a bagel or egg sandwich in the morning. Valet parking makes it easy to leave your car for the night. Good service, good value in the heart of Manhatten!

title: Comodo y bien ubicado
text:
El hotel esta en reparaciones de su fachada ,por lo que sus andamios tapan un poco su entrada ,nos asignaron una suite alta con vista al Empire ,nos recepciono Malvin ,excelente atención ,destacó su amabilidad y el deseo q nuestra estadía fuera perfecta ,y así lo fue !! Muchas gracias 
El aseo es diarios con café de cortesía ,el desayuno de pago bien ,servido con café y budines de sturback en la esquina hay 2 farmacias 24 ha con todo lo que se pueda pedir ,aún comida,excelente ubicación ,volvería con mucho gusto

title: Good location, nice room.
text:
We had a one night stay there. They don't offer free breakfast for gold or platinum member. But that's written in the Marriott policy so it's OK.

The location is great. Room is nice and clean. Nothing really special. Check in and check out is very smooth. 

Recommend for travelers with no need of breakfast.

title: Great hotel in a very good spot
text: Staying here while on business and am really enjoying it.  The staff is friendly and really pay attention to their guests.  The room is very comfortable, quiet and, because I'm on a lower floor, large enough to turn around in!  Love the bed as it is nice and firm and the pillows don't squish down too much.  A really good thing is that here, you are within a reasonable walk of much of midtown.  Very cool!

title: Excelente!
text: Pareja mayor acompañados por la nieta en plan d vacaciones, queríamos estar en el centro de Manhattan y nos encanto el hotel, la limpieza y la habitación ambientada cálida y confortable! El Wi fi funcionaba perfecto. Estábamos en Un piso bajo pero insonorizado absolutamente, no se escuchaba nada del exterior. La habitación cómoda y muy buenas camas y un baño excelente con productos de tocador. Una recepción pequeña  pero el hotel lo tiene todo para una buena estadía en la gran manzana a pasos de Time Square y las grandes Avenidas! Sin duda volvería por la seguridad y el confort.La gente de recepción fría y poco agradable, de todas formas el Marriottt cumplió con mucho nuestras expectativas!

title: Immer wieder zufrieden
text:
Die Lage ist sensationell, die Zimmer sind gut und sauber. Der Service ist super und gerade für Touristen ist es die perfekte Basis um NYC zu erkunden. In direkter Nähe gibt es Möglichkeiten zum Einkaufen, Frühstücken und zur Metro. 

Daumen hoch!

title: Hôtel à recommander
text:
Pour un 1er séjour à New-York, nous avions voulu un hôtel situé dans le centre de Manhattan et nous avons très bien fait d’opter pour cet hôtel. Il a 2 stations de métro à proximité (ligne ACE), il est à 10 minutes à pied de Times Square. Emplacement impeccable. 
Concernant la chambre, nous étions au 22eme étage, ce qui a rendu notre séjour très calme. Nous n’avons pas été gêné par les nuisances de la rue. La literie est de très bonne qualité, les lits sont grands et fermes. La chambre est plutôt petite mais la salle de bain est assez grande. Le seul bémol concerne le chauffage, qui était très compliqué à régler et qui se déclenchait en pleine nuit (assez bruyant). 
Le personnel a été très agréable et très souriant durant tout le séjour (possibilité de laisser nos bagages à l’hôtel pour profiter de la dernière journée de notre séjour). 
Nous recommandons cet hôtel, qui démontre toute la qualité de la firme Marriott.

title: Nice location, friendly staff
text: We only stayed here one night as a show we were seeing in NYC ended too late to take the train home.  Price was reasonable for the location.  It is walking distance to many places to eat, as well as 24hr stores to grab water and other necessities.  Walking distance to Penn Station and Times Square.  Check in was fast and easy.  Check out was the same.  The hotel is tall, but only a few rooms on each floor. Rooms were a little "tight".  I feel like we opened the door and it almost hit the bed.  For two people for a short stay it is a good size (we were barely in the room anyway). We had a nice view of the empire state building and the buildings near the river.

title: Clean, spacious and great location
text: This hotel ticked all the boxes for a city vacation, above all it was clean, modern, spacious and the service was excellent. The location is perfect, close to Times Square and Penn subway station. Definitely recommend.

title: Good location
text: Good hotel, well located with good accomodations. Very clean and the person who cleaned the room is very nice. Irina was gentle to attend the guests and made the room very quickly. Close to the main attractions. Only problem is the homeless people living in the front door of the facility.

title: New York Boat Show
text: I stayed at this hotel, along with nine of my associates, for the New York Boat show that is held at the Jacob Javits Center.  The hotel is conveniently located just a three block walk to the show.  There are numerous good, and reasonably priced restaurants in the immediate area around the hotel.  Every staff member I came in contact with was very friendly and helpful.

title: EXCELLENT LOCATION AND GREAT STAFF
text: Chose this hotel because it was centrally located between Penn Station and the theater that we were attending an Off-Broadway show.  We arrived earlier than check-in so our rooms were not ready.  Instead of having us wait for our double Queens, we were given 2 King rooms at no additional charge.  The rooms were quite nice and from the 23rd floor you could see glimpses of the Hudson River.  The rooms were very well appointed and beds were comfy.  Would definitely stay here again!!

title: Excellent staff
text: Great location but the staff really make this place. A noisy party last night in a neighbouring venue made sleep difficult and so the staff arranged for me to transfer to an empty room very promptly without having to move all my stuff. Great response from them and a good night's sleep for me ahead of a long haul flight.

title: Great centrally located place to stay without breaking the bank!
text: This location worked great for us, being within walking distance from Penn Station as we came in by train from Newar and centrally located in Manhattan. Our room was clean and quiet and as promised, had a king size bed. The staff was helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great business hotel
text: Really enjoyed my stay here.  The place was very nice, clean, and well managed.  Felt very modern and safe.  Breakfast (hot or cold, you pay for what you order) was good.  All of the front desk staff in particular were great.  I needed to leave my bags for a few hours after my stay, and Issac was very helpful with that!  Will stay here again.

title: Mediocre, no breakfast, good location, staff is so so.
text: I’ve stayed at much much much better Courtyard. Pretty shocked that this property got Hugh rating. Booked because Of the rating. Pretty disappointed actually. Staff at check in was not at all warm and fuzzy. The day I checked out , they were better. Location is great. You can easily walk to Penn or TS. Room is super tiny. There’s no breakfast. I feel value is minimal. Stay at the element down the street! Much better!

title: Good Courtyard
text:
The location of this hotel is very convenient if you are going to Madison Square Garden, Times Square, Greenwich Village and of course the Garment District.
It is a quiet hotel, the Front Desk Staff were helpful and courteous. The room is a standard size NYC hotel. But it is quiet, clean and nice.
This is a good hotel if you are in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Comfortable and QUIET hotel - easy in and out if you're driving in
text:
Location is great- just a couple blocks from Penn Station.  Times Square and 5th Ave are easily walkable.  So close to the Lincoln Tunnel - even if you don't like NYC driving you can drive in/out with no problem!

We did not expect to find such a quiet hotel!  There was ZERO road/city noise which made for a comfortable nights sleep.  Room was a decent size for NYC.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Convenient for Rangers Game
text: My husband and I stayed here to watch a Rangers game at MSG. The hotel is an easy walk to get there as well as to grand central and the metro. It was very reasonably priced for New York and the room was clean and well equipped. I’d stay here again.

title: Great!
text:
The hotel was a little bit far from the main shopping belt, but still within an okay walking distance. The walk to the main subway lines is further than one would expect though. If you have multiple luggages, it would be preferable to travel here via private transport.

In general, the staff were very helpful - we asked for advice regarding transport to the airport and were very pleased with the help! Staff that we bumped into in the elevator or along the hallways would always give us a hearty greeting.

The exterior of the building is rather ordinary, but the interior is relatively modern and clean. The rooms while a little squeezy, was in good condition and had decent furnishing/appliances. The only issue was that the bathroom's shower had a very low pressure as the bathtub faucet was leaking water.

I would be happy to stay here again if I were to come to New York!

title: Hotel and Broadway show
text: A block away from the Broadway Theatre to watch Miss Saigon. Very convenient place to stay for this purpose. The rooms are a bit small, compare to other Courtyards but i think this is typical for a Manhattan hotel. It is clean though and as always the bed and the pillows are perfect! Parking in Manhattan is expensive, and so does this place.

title: Nice stay
text: Really well localised, close to many touristy attractions and tube stations, the views from the room were breathtaking, the room itself was nice, comfy beds and clean, however, the fact you have to pay for breakfast was a bit disappointing!

title: Courtyard New York Manhattan/Times Square West
text: Stayed for 8 days during the Christmas Holidays. Conveniently located within The Garment District, walking distance from Times Square, Bryant Park, 5th Ave, Port Authority Bus Terminal, NYC-MTA, Madison Square Garden & Penn Station. Great restaurants all in the area-depending what you want. Breakfast in the hotel is great but not free, I would recommend the ham, egg, & cheese on a croissant, with a large cappuccino, & some OJ. Free Wi-Fi is available.  Ms. Julieth at the desk was very helpful making suggestions of places to go & do while in the city.

title: Generally OK but will disappointments
text: The price which was a non-refundable $375 for three nights was a good price for Manhattan. The room was a good size, with a king size bed and was fully equipped. But then came some disappointments:  no newspapers were available, not even for purchase—unacceptable to me. I was told they were discontinued as of Jan. 1, 2018. Then I was issued a breakfast coupon — usable for breakfast sandwich but not for a regular breakfast, which was $3 more on the menu. I offered to pay the $3 difference but that was rejected. Finally it is after 5 PM and my room hasn’t been made up. I called finally at 4:30 and was assured some would be here “shortly.”

title: Great option in NYC
text:
We stayed for a week in this hotel and had a great time. It’s well-located (37st and 8th av), close to Times Square, Bryant park and Grand Central but far enough to avoid the horrible crowds all the time.
The area is full of restaurants with a variety of menus and prices, near Penn station and Time Square stations, so using all Metro lines is possible.
The staff is very friendly, always willing to assist you and rooms are clean and very comfortable. Super recommended!

title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed over Christmas for 3 nights with 2 young children, hotel is the perfect location to get to Times Square and surrounding areas, room was kept clean and the cleaners came in daily, staff always pleasant, only quibble would be the poorly stocked very overpriced bar and that they only open in the morning for a couple of hours and the evening

title: Convienently located in Times Square
text: The Courtyard on 40th St is well located, close to Times Square and very convienent for using the Metro and walking distance to the NYC Port Authority Bus Station.  The hotel itself is a bit sub par comparing to other Marriott Courtyards but the location and friendly staff outweighs the old bedding.

title: Location!
text:
Yes, location is the key when i booked this establishment. Just a 5mins walk from penn station. Walking distance also to touristy areas such as times square, empire state bldg, chic area of chelsea and etc. 

Room is basic and clean. Clean sheets and towels. Nothing to say negative about it. Room size is just right. 

Well functioning gym area is good bonus. Wifi is also great. 

The only setback i would say was the attitude of some front desk people. The cold and borderline rude attitude towards guest was a bit off. Well, theres room for improvement. A touch of warmth is not much to ask for especially in hospitality industry.

title: Nice place. Great location.
text:
Stayed in a King Room for 4 nights. Great hotel, rooms really nice, bed was super comfortable and nice bathroom. TV, iron, hair dryer and air con all great too. 
Staff were very accommodating. 
Great location just off 8th Avenue, 5min walk from times sq, 4 min walk from Penn Station, pretty much the centre of Manhattan. Well worth staying in if you’re look for somewhere central with nice cosy modern rooms with all mod cons.

title: Great experience!
text: From the moment we stepped into the lobby to the moment we left, this hotel met every one of our expectations!  We were able to check in early so we put our bags in our room, freshened up and were ready to go! The room was very clean which is very important......more than spacious for a NYC hotel, staff were kind, accommodating and helpful.   We were able to get a late check out, but even if we could not, they would let us store our baggage prior to and post checkout in a safe, secure area.  We are a few blocks from Penn Station and just a few more from Times Square. Very centrally located! I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone. It’s not fancy fancy, but it’s perfect for everyone. You will be more than satisfied.

title: Good value and helpful staff
text: My friend and I took our daughters to NYC for their birthdays in December and hotels in the area are far from cheap.  We are both used to excellent accommodations but on this trip needed the biggest bang for our buck and this hotel fit the bill.  It was very well located to shopping, restaurants and attractions.  We could walk almost everywhere we wanted to go this weekend but ended up with some bad weather. We used Ubers or yellow cabs to get around anywhere farther than a half mile in the snow and cold.  The hotel staff arranged for a shuttle to the airport for a flat fee and that was a really good deal.  Also, we flew in super early on Friday morning and figured we would just drop our bags and go sight seeing until check in.  However, our room was ready at 8AM so we were able to check in, freshen up and feel more secure with some items in the safe.  We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was a little pricey but convenient. The hotel offered a few more security features, like key card access to all floors of the hotel. This made me feel safer with my teenagers.  Everything was very clean and well taken care of.  All in all, it was a good stay and the deal we found on hotels.com was excellent.

title: Clean, Convenient, Great customer service.
text: In-Laws booked the hotel for 2 daughters (my wife and her sister).  Sister-in-Law and husband traveled with two children 9 and 11.  Our son flew in from college after exams.  We stayed Fri-Mon (15-18 Dec).  Front desk, restaurant, and custodial staff were all attentive, polite, and helpful.  Location is perfect blocks from Penn Station and far enough away from Times Square if you're not interested the hordes of tourists.  Have made multiple trips to NYC and will definitely use this hotel in the future.

title: Nice hotel, shame about Starbucks
text: Location was excellent, easy walking to all tourist locations in NY.  For such a central location it was surprisingly quiet at night.  Clean, bright hotel with friendly staff.  Only niggle was Starbucks on the 4th floor.  Starbucks users tied up the guest elevators meaning long waits.

title: Goede ligging
text:
Goed hotel in de buurt van Times Square, geen toeters en bellen, maar alles aanwezig wat er moet zijn. Kleine en zeer compacte kamers maar wel zeer netjes. Minibar en kluis aanwezig, vrij ruime badkamer. Wel zeer weinig plaats om je kleding kwijt te raken. In het tussenseizoen ben je wel verplicht om voor een deel uit je koffer te leven. Er is een restaurant, maar dat is redelijk duur in vergelijking met wat je in de buurt aan mogelijkheden kan vinden. Personeel is zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Assistentie bij het boeken van bijvoorbeeld een show is er vrijwel altijd beschikbaar.
Patrick & Annick, Mechelen

title: Occhio ai 4 stelle
text: Interessante posizione e cortesia del personale alla reception. Bagno in ordine. La porta non ha la mandata.Verificando il letto le lenzuola non san di pulito e infatti vi trovo due peli neri. Scendo alla reception a dirlo e mi allungano lenzuola simili. Riscendo per ridire che non avevo pagato per un ostello e ancora mi portano lenzuola non plausibili per un 4 stelle. A mezzanotte ho dovuto rifarmi il letto! Il manager il giorno seguente ha fatto un dovuto sconto. Esperienza bizzarra

title: I love New York
text: Abbiamo soggiornato qui per 5 notte durante la settimana del ringraziamento. Struttura semplice ma ben tenuta, camere estremamente pulite, spaziose e letto comodissimo. L'hotel si trova sulla 37^ st. a 10 minuti a piedi da Time Square. Ottima posizione per visitare a piedi il cuore di Manhattan. Il personale è sempre stato molto gentile e disponibile sopratutto il giorno della partenza. Ottimo esperienza per chi non ha troppe pretese di lusso ma si vuole godere a pieno la città!

title: Excelente localização
text: Excelente localização. Perto de tudo e com facilidade de acesso ao Metro, Pen Station! Quarto confortável com uma cama magnífica para descansar após bater perna dia todo em Manhattan e chuveiro muito bom! Aprovadíssimo!

title: Ottima scelta!
text: Visti i prezzi di NY ho prenotato una quadrupla (eravamo 4 donne: 2 mamme 2 figlie maggiorenni) - ed è stato davvero conveniente. La scelta è stata fatta grazie anche alle foto viste su Internet, le recensioni positive e la posizione. Nulla da eccepire. Centrale, comodo, pulito, Il personale giovane e gentile.

title: Excellent stay - prime location for Javits Center conference
text: I stayed at the Courtyard for one night during a conference at the Javits Center.  The location is fantastic as I was able to walk to the conference, and there are both 7 and A-C-E trains relatively close-by.  The room itself was small, but typical for inner-city, although the view I had was very nice.  The room had a fridge, iron, ironing board and a nice bathroom.  The bed was very comfortable and it the wifi was easy to access.  I had a small breakfast in the restaurant downstairs (granola and strawberries), as the bigger breakfasts were significantly more expensive (welcome to NYC).  The staff were kind and the elevators were quick.  Overall, I'd stay here again, especially given the great location.  Side note:  I booked 4 months in advance and prepaid on the Marriott website and got a rate in the $150s.  The going rates were over $200 when I checked again closer to the conference date, so it pays to book early!

title: Alright hotel with ups and downs
text:
Location was for me perfect. I selected this hotel because it is just a 10 minutes walk from Jacob Javits Center where we had a trade show. Also a short walk to Madison square garden where I watched a NBA game and Rangers hockey as well.

The premises are to my taste boring average bulk business hotel levels. No thrills. Everything though is well maintained and very clean.

No good buffet style breakfast available which I would have preferred. Ate breakfast at street cafes.

WiFi and its internet connection was though very poor. The complimentary speed was pathetic. I upgraded that with around 5 dollars per day and the speed did not much improve.

The service was friendly and efficient.

title: Ideally located
text:
Firstly, being located in midtown this hotel is an excellent choice for those looking to do lots of sightseeing. A lot of the main sights are within walking distance, the only place we used public transport for was Lower Manhattan.

The room itself was very tidy, clean and spacious. We had a room which wasn’t overlooking the street, this meant he had no noise issues from outside. The bathroom towels were incredibly soft, and the bed oh so comfy! My only disappointment was the lack of storage in the room, this meant I had to live mostly out of my suitcase. Some tea making facilities would be also nice (not all of us like coffee).

We arrived in NYC very early but the guy in reception was very kind to let us check in early - thank you so much!! They are also able to hold your luggage if you’re going out for a little while.

Would stay here again.

title: Calidez
text: Hotel para pasar excelentes noches de descanso y muy cerca del times square. Está en el centro de todo. Puedes caminar hasta el central park. Hablan español y te dan un servicio excelente. Un taxi al aéreo puerto te lo consiguen en 65 dólares. Desayunos y comidas en los alrededores. Tiendas de recuerdo al lado del hotel y hablan español. Te hacen muy buenos descuentos. Habitación limpia y amplia. Te lo recomiendo.

title: Conforto e localização
text:
Hotel excelente. Boa estrutura, cama confortável, amenites ótimos. Esquipe simpática e solicita. Não cobra taxa de entrega para compras feitas na internet. Tem um bar e starbucks no lob.
Localização muito boa. Perto de tudo.

title: Convenient and Clean
text: I visited here a few years ago but came back because the price was right as is the location.  Very friendly staff and clean room and has a very familiar atmosphere as a Courtyard property.  I especially like the accessible plugs near the bed and on the desk.  Great location just 5 blocks north of Penn Station and 5 blocks south of 42nd St.  Lots of places to eat nearby and  while my room overlooked the street it was quiet on the 15th floor.  If the price is right for you, a great place to stay.

title: Nightmare
text:
Please read this if you are considering this hotel:

I had a confirmed booking made on booking.com. Arrived at midnight with my 6 month pregnant wife & 1 year old son after traveling all day to be told by the front desk that my reservation had been cancelled at 8pm by Marriott reservations!

Not only did I NOT cancel it, but I received NO notification, and on the booking.com app it still said confirmed!

I was also informed that the hotel was fully booked for the night and there was no where for us to stay!

After a desperate call to booking.com, we were rebooked into a worse hotel a few blocks away, also more expensive!

This hotel didn’t even care when they told me to walk to the next hotel in the freezing cold, after midnight, with my pregnant wife and infant son - past the homelessi bums, hookers & crackheads with all our luggage in tow! 

I am a Marriott rewards member, but what is the point?! Terrible service, upsetting for my family & just what we didn’t need at the end of traveling.

title: Good experience; good location
text: My husband and I stayed here in November, 2017, and had a very pleasant stay.  This hotel is located in the Garment District on 37th Street, and in a good location to get most anywhere.  Penn Station is only a few blocks away, and from there, you can get anywhere.  The room was perfect, not huge, but certainly spacious by New York standards.  There is a desk and chair and another lounge chair.  The staff was VERY pleasant and accommodating.  I called one night for an extra bath towel, and someone showed up within a minute with 4 more.  The towels are very plush and smell great.  Toiletries include Paul Mitchell shampoo/conditioner/lotion - they are very small, but good quality.  Air conditioning works great.  There is a mini fridge in the room, which is great.  Not sure why they don't advertise this on their website, as this is something I look for in a room and would book one hotel over another if I knew there was a refrigerator in the room.  There is also a small safe.  There is an iron and ironing board, but the ironing board is small and coffee maker. Room was VERY clean.  Bed is super comfortable.  We didn't want to get out of bed!  There is a 7 eleven nearby and a Dunkin Donuts and an Irish Pub.  Ice machine on the floor works great, but the ice is small pellets - which is not ideal for a cocktail, but not a big deal.  There are plenty of USB ports in the room and a full length mirror with overhead lights.  Did not have any issues with noise, we always bring a white noise sound machine to help us sleep.  This is New York after all!   I would recommend this hotel and would easily stay again.

title: Small - Clean Rooms
text: Not a bad hotel, place was small though which is typical for New York Hotels. I did not go to the restaurants so I cannot comment on that but if you are looking for a no frills hotel and a place to crash this is it. 2 blocks from times square, I would stay here again

title: Bardzo dobry hotel blisko Times Square
text: Hotel znajduje się w świetnej lokalizacji dla osób pragnących zobaczyć najważniejsze miejsca w NYC. Blisko do Times Square, Empire State Building czy Interpid Museum. Nie jest to jednak lokalizacja dla tych, którzy pragną ciszy i spokoju. Z 27 piętra rozpościera się piękny widok na miasto, a nocą można podziwiać oświetlony Empire State Building. W hotelu znajduje się The Bistro, w którym można zamówić kawę lub herbatę i zjeść lekkie śniadania. Dla turystów polecam jednak inne restauracje, w których można bardziej poczuć nowojorski klimat. Po wymeldowaniu można bez problemu pozostawić bagaż w przechowalni hotelowej. Hotel czysty, zadbany, pokoje regularnie sprzątane. Obsługa bardzo miła i pomocna. Serdecznie polecam!

title: Muito bom Hotel
text: O hotel está localizado bem perto do Macy's, do Madison Square Garden e da loja B & H. Metrô facilmente acessível, mas não na porta do hotel. Não é um hotel luxuoso, mas é muito confortável. Está um pouco distante do movimento de Times Square, de dez a quinze minutos a pé, o que torna as cercanias do hotel relativamente tranquilas. Quarto é amplo, silencioso, banheiro idem, cama super confortável, ótimos travesseiros, o que me garantiu uma ótima estadia de uma semana. Staff atencioso, limpeza excelente. Internet grátis sem fio de muito boa velocidade e estável. Canais a cabo, TV tela plana, cofre, geladeira (não é das melhores, mas não faz barulho durante a noite) e bom chuveiro. O café da manhã não estava incluído na minha diária, mas pode ser feito no andar térreo do hotel, mediante a compra individual de itens a gosto do cliente. Café (Starbucks), muffins, croissants, salada de frutas, iogurte, etc. Tem cafeterias nas proximidades.

title: Adecuado
text:
Ocupé una habitación doble en el piso 8. De tamaño adecuado y camas muy comodas. Las sábanas impecables. El baño un poco chico. El piso 8 no tiene vista al Empire State. Luego me pase a la misma habitación pero en el piso 21 en donde sí se podía ver el emblemático edificio.
El hotel está muy buen ubicado
El único problema que le encontré son los ascensores que de 3 solo funcionaban 2 por lo que la espera para subir o bajar era muy importante en algunos horarios criticos

title: Great locaction, noisy
text:
I was there November 2017.

The hotel is located in the middle of Manhattan and you can walk to every where.

Staff is nice and helpfull - as well as bartender.

Hotel is clean.

Rooms are quite small.

It is in the middle of Manhattan, So there is ”action” outside all the time (Ambulance, police...) - So be aware, that it is noisy.

Overall good experience

title: Perfect location
text: We booked this property because of the location. It is so close to everything, theatres,restaurants,shopping,public transport,subway. The staff were wonderful, no request or question was a problem. Clean and comfortable although not very spacious. We would stay here again and would highly recommend it. Lovely to have a bar/restaurant on site.

title: Good experiwnce
text: After staying a week at another hotel that was awful, decided to try a different hotel down the street. What a difference it made in so many aspects! The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. We were greeted immediately and checked in. Every person we passed was very friendly and asked if there was anything they could do. The room was quiet which made for a good night sleep!

title: J'adore!!!
text: Nous avons séjourné deux nuits à cet endroit et nous en sommes heureux ! Le personnel est accueillant et souriant. Notre chambre était au 22ième étage sans vu sur la ville et j'en suis très contente.Car dû à son fantastique  emplacement, les sirènes des voitures d'urgence étaient moins agressantes aux oreilles. Donc, j'ai adoré le confort et la propreté de notre chambre. Nous retournerons à cet hôtel sans hésitation, car il est près de tout. Le stationnement est comparable aux autres, soit à 52$ US/jours. N'hésitez pas vous allez bien dormir!

title: Convenient location, large rooms, friendly service
text: Located near Madison Avenue, this hotel offers large, bright, and quiet rooms.  Staff was friendly, efficient, and informative.  Large bathroom with plenty of towels.  A Starbucks is located next door.  Recommended for business visits.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Stayed for 5 nights as a family of 4 (2 boys aged 11 and 19). Due to diverted flight we didn’t arrive at hotel until 3am. Check in was quick and efficient. Room on 23rd floor. I had communicated with hotel prior to stay and asked for high room. Rooms don’t have iconic views as all other buildings are of similar height, but this was no issue. We also got a lovely hand written card and bottle of wine arranged by David Lew (manager) as it was our wedding anniversary.  Great personal service. 
Room was excellent. 2 large queen beds were very comfortable. Room was a good size. There was plenty of hanging space and drawers for clothes. Desk area and TV, with coffee making facilities. There was also a fridge. Bathroom was good with good shower and a small bath tub which was great after long day walking.  Toiletries by Paul Mitchell provided. We didn’t eat at the hotel, however the cafe and reception looked good and there was a small shop area which even did microwave meals.  Small outdoor courtyard area. Housekeeping was good and the gym was also good with plenty of cardio and weight options.  
The location on 8th Avenue and 37th was fantastic. 5 min walk to Times Square and Port Authority bus station. 10-15 min walk to Central Park and the High Line. We even walked to 9/11 memorial twice which took about 60 mins. Right next to madison Square Garden and Penn Station. We used subway once and got taxi on a couple of occasions, but we mainly walked to see the sights.  Excellent stay, great customer service and great location and highly recommended. Well done and thank you.

title: Accommodated my large group with Grace and Flexibility
text:
Stayed here for a work event and rented the large conference room as well as several hotel rooms. Everyone strived to not only meet and exceed our expectations.  We were there several days, late nights, etc. and the Marriott team always made us feel welcome. 

Samantha (our sales contact) and her group made the sales process easy and fun for us.  From the front desk team to the clean up crew, we had such an exceptional time at the Marriott.  The staff went above and beyond to help us feel welcome and accommodate our every ask.  And TRUST me there were a lot. 

I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers and/or anyone needing a good nights rest.

title: Stayed during a bicycling event
text: Teammate and I stayed here for a bicycling event. Shipped my bike to and from the hotel and they were very accommodating with regards to the size of shipping container. Rooms were the largest of any standard room I have stayed in Manhattan!!!! Rooms were very nice and instead of two full we had two queens, please able to fit one bike container and two bicycles comfortably. Great location near almost any place in or near Times Square. Close to Penn Station, bus terminal, etc...Price reasonable and again staff very helpful and accommodating.

title: Certificate of Excellence my butt
text:
I trust TripAdvisor.  I trust them more when they give a Certificate of Excellence to hotels.  So when i saw the Certificate for this Courtyard it was a no-brainer to stay there for a weekend getaway with my wife.  This is the first time I was sorry to have trusted TripAdvisor.

This is a very average hotel with no special amenities.  In fact, some would say that when you can hear the vacuum toilet flushing every time anyone above or to the side of you flushes their toilet it may be considered below average.  Or perhaps when you can hear other guests using the toilet, that may be in fact quite disgusting.  Well all of the above at this hotel.  

The room size is small; and they located this elite member right across from the elevator which was horrible because you could hear folks at all times of the night as well as the elevator noises.  No complimentary gold breakfast, or any other special amenity -- well perhaps "enhanced" internet, but not really enhanced at all.  

This is an average hotel.  And if you need an average hotel with a pretty descent bathroom and no real view this is the place for your stay.

title: First time to New York
text: A great central location from which we did loads of exploring, and handy for the subway. Marvin the duty manager when we checked in was really helpful and gave us a great room on the 2nd floor at the back of the hotel away from the street noise you would otherwise get. The breakfast staff were lovely and always had a smile. Thoroughly recommend this hotel. 4 blobs just because it’s not a 5 star hotel

title: Wish I could give it negative stars
text:
I stayed there with my family for my stepson's birthday and then again the following weekend for the Presidents Cup...to say it was an experience is an understatement. 

During my stepsons birthday, we arrived and were greeted nicely, very welcoming...that's where it stops.

When we arrived in our room, we noticed a couple of "flying bug"s dead on the comforter...not sure what they were but they were dead...I checked all the sheets and bedding and all was fine.  We thought that maybe the flew in seeing the window was left open by housekeeping probably to air out the room.

The next morning we returned from sightseeing and noticed that our towels were not replenished nor were our soaps.  I had to call down to the front desk and asked for "4 sets of towels"....i figured the word "sets" would indicate the entire "set of towels"...like washcloths, medium and shower towels...not the case...I only received the big towels...this was also after I waited for almost 45 minutes.  

That night, I spoke with the concierge since I saw a subway stop on the corner and asked how I would get back to JFK the next morning....his response was classic...gave me a blank stare and said "I don't know, I've never taken it...." wow!  

The front desk person overheard me and asked if I would need a ride to the airport which I stated yes...he had one waiting for me the next morning....

After calling and complaining about the bugs, housekeeping service and then the transportation, management apologized and asked that I stay there again, since I was coming back to NY the following weekend, I took them up on their offer.

You would think that everything I went through, things would've been better...they were going well up until the end.  

Again, I was greeted with friendly welcome...housekeeping needs some serious work...they left dirty sheets and pillow case on the bench in the room....No bugs this time....but did find smudges all over the mirrors and a half eaten donut in the corner desk...gross!  

My buddy and I were going to the Presidents Cup, we asked concierge how to get to Pier 79...he told us it was about a 20 minute walk...it's doable...then I looked online and knew that was no way a 20 minute walk....The front desk girl that night suggested we take Uber which we did...it was about a 15 minute drive....again, concierge doesn't know much about the city.

When we were leaving the monday morning, I asked the front desk person if they could call us transportation to the airport. Maria stated they don't do that and that if I wanted transportation that I should walk up a few blocks and hail a cab.  Not really wanting to take a cab...hence "transportation" and not "cab".  I explained that the person there last week arranged it, she replied " you will need to walk up the street...its against hotel policy."  As I left I walked by her and stated "please tell (hotel manager) thank you for everything, greatly appreciate it..." i was sincere since they made an attempt to fix the problem. She replied, "enjoy the walk for your cab"...I about did a "about face" but decided to talk to the manager again.  We did....I won't stay there again....

now my points are all screwed up because they gave me points for $129/nt stay...now that's damn cheap for Times Square...seeing that my bill was $439/nt...not sure how that balances out...maybe its "new math"...not sure...but I've invested enough time and energy into this hotel...they obviously can't get it together...they obviously have people not qualified (concierge) that shouldn't be working there either...I'm done....

title: Great Location
text: The hotel is a great place to stay if your going to Broadway shows. Very convenient to all theaters. Near all public transportation. The hotel is very modern and clean. The staff is very pleasant and knowledgeable about the city.

title: Excelente localização!
text: Todo mundo que viaja bastante sabe que se hospedar em Nova Iorque é caro e que os quartos são minúsculos. Logo, o importante é mesmo focar na localização para ganhar tempo durante os passeios, gastar menos de taxi, Uber ou Lyft. Estive com a minha mãe por 6 dias nesse hotel e gostamos muito porque apesar de só termos ido a Times Square uma vez (nem gostamos tanto), fomos ao MoMA, ao Bryant Park,  e a High Line andando (mas gostamos de andar ;) O quarto é bem limpo, ótima cama, ducha forte. Não gostamos muito do café da manhã, achamos que tinha poucas opções, mas tudo bem. Como não incluímos café na reserva do hotel, comemos alguns dias lá e outros em outros deliciosos cafés da cidade.

title: Parfait...
text:
Première visite à New York..... hôtel idéalement situé entre deux stations de métro ( Penn station et port authaurity) à deux pas de Time Square bref un bon point de départ pour explorer big Apple. Hôtel très propre les chambres et la salle de bain sont spacieuses.L'hotel est relativement calme.  Le personnel efficacent et disponible. Bref un très bon établissement que je recommande vivement.
J'y retournerai lors d'un prochain voyage au  coeur de la grosse pomme.

title: Great Value
text: This is a great hotel in a very central location. We could walk to many things and the subway was very close. The rooms are comfortable though small which is typical of NY. The breakfast which was included was good value and the staff were excellent.

title: Perfect location!
text:
This hotel brand is consistent! This is very good, as you always know what to expect!
I love NYC, the people, places, everything! Every staff person that I encountered was just really top notch, professional, and very friendly!! The atmosphere, great, rooms, very nice!

title: Handy position, large room, helpful staff
text: Stayed one night while passing through New York from Manchester to San Juan.  Hotel is in a good spot a short walk from Penn Station. We left our luggage in the Left Luggage store in JFK and got the train from there to Penn with just hand luggage.  Hotel staff are friendly and helpful, and kept checking whether our flight on to San Juan was actually going to go ahead (only a couple of days since Hurricane Irma).  We had a King room on a high floor and this was large for New York with a comfortable bed and large, clean bathroom.  Wifi is free and is fast and stable.  There's plenty of shops, eateries and bars in the vicinity of the hotel and Times Square is less than a 5 minute walk.  There's a 7-11 on the corner and a diner for breakfast a couple of blocks going back towards Penn Station.  I thought that was a bit pricey though.  A good overnight stay in this hotel with no complaints.

title: Localização ótima!
text: Hotel com ótimo custo beneficio! Perto do madison square garden, time square, Bryant park.Localização nota mil.Da para fazer a maioria das atrações a pé ( com pequenas exceções). Instalações limpas e bom atendimento. Voltaria com certeza !

title: Turismo
text: Caro para lo que es!!! Está bien ubicado, pero el hotel no es gran cosa. Es viejo, y oscuras las habitaciones... el desayuno básico, pero está bien! Pero no volvería!! Me resultó caro, y no tan lindo.

title: Clean Modern Hotel In The Heart Of NYC
text: We arrived early at the hotel - around 1pm - and thankfully our room was ready. Check in was fast and efficient. We were on a high floor facing W 37th however the view was nothing to write home about. Room was a bit on the smaller side (not surprising for NYC) but it was very clean, modern and spacious enough for 2 people. Room was equipped with a coffee maker, which we did not use, a mini fridge and hair dryer. We requested for pillows and wine glasses which were brought to our room promptly. Elevators and hallways were very hot however rooms were well air conditioned. Elevators can also be quite slow at times. We had breakfast in the Bistro the day of our departure and it was fresh and tasty. Lots of great little coffee shops and bars around. 7/11 right around the corner which was good for late night snacks - cheaper than the hotel! Good experience here but would probably choose some place else next time

title: Good offering
text: I stayed for one night. It's In a bit of a scruffy street. It was the end of a long day and I was not feeling like it was going to be a good experience. The staff were excellent, the room clean and well fitted. The bed was comfy. My room was on a low floor so it was a little noisy. All in all it was good.

title: Early Arrivals Don't Deserve to Be Disrespected
text:
I was disappointed with the Courtyard on W. 37th Street, but not because of the location or the room.  I chose the location for convenience, and it was near the Metro, Penn Station and Times Square, although the block itself was very drab. The room was typical for the area -- small, with a no view and minimal charm -- but it was adequate and clean.  Closet was good sized and the bathroom seemed fresh and modern.

My stay, however, got off to a poor start.  I arrived at 11 am.  The desk clerk (correctly) reminded me that check-in time is 4 pm.  She said to come back at 4.  She noted that I had elite status with Marriott, but said there was no chance before 4 pm. She gave several reasons why no one should expect a room prior to that hour, as it is well-publicized that check in is at 4.

I sat in the "business center" (which is also the lobby) and did some work on line and even checked on the availability of other hotels nearby, but none had immediate check in at a reasonable price.  I then went out for a walk, even though it was raining.

I came back at 12:30 to try to change clothes, and, miracle of miracles, my room was ready. The crowd in the lobby had disappeared, so I presume others also got rooms well before 4 pm.  It was totally unnecessary for the unsmiling authoritarian at the desk to insist that no rooms would be available before 4 pm.  All she had to say was, "I'll see what I can do; check back in an hour or two" for a loyalty club member.
For failure to treat customers with respect and causing unnecessary resentment that the hotel must be poorly managed if no rooms are normally available until 4, an average rating!

title: Great location for Madison Square Garden
text: We picked this hotel because of the proximity to MSG. As expected our room was quite small, however we were only in it for seven hours. Our room was very clean and quiet with a comfortable bed. The hallway was uncomfortably warm and our card didn't open the door. Many more homeless people in this area compared to the Chelsea property. No valet parking here.

title: Better than expected
text: I normally stay at the courtyard Marriott on 5th and 40th, because right by my office. Because of fashion week, there was no availability. I stayed at this courtyard in 8th, which not as convenient for work, made up for it in price, quality of room and the neighborhood. The staff was ok, not the best. The rooms were very, very nice. The bar and gym were nice. Internet was fine. On balance, if you do not have to be in a different location for work, I would say that this is a god price value.

title: Good hotel, average location
text:
Hotel itself is updated in terms of decor and the staff are very good.
Location is just ok as it is in a commercial area called the fashion district... not fancy but more industrial, you may be better off in a more uptown or eastern end location
Reception was fast and the help getting things out of the car was speedy and efficient.
There is parking 3 doors down, $50 a day with the hotel stamp otherwise $70 per day, they get your car promptly and are courteous.
Rooms:  Small as expected but a disappointment was the very small counter around the bathroom sink... much too small to put almost anything on it. No view to speak of except another building very close to the window. Rooms were however quiet and modern, good sized shower (could have been reduced easily to make counter space...)
Bed was fine and rooms were clean.
There is a room safe, all rooms in all hotels should have such safes, they are much more common in other parts of the world.
Elevators were fairly fast most of the time however can be slow and you may have to skip one since staff use these as well.
Breakfast:  Staff very accommodating but you will get a better breakfast outside the hotel.
Subway is very close, just around the corner but overall a positive stay

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: This was the only hotel available and was not very convenient for my location so I was a bit concerned as I was walking to its location. The check in process was quick, my room was quiet, very comfortable (30th floor), the WiFi was fast and the service staff was responsive and professional. Very happy and will return for sure.

title: Great location
text: Excellent location, close to time square and subway station.  easy check in check out process, comfortable beds  what is big enough room specially for New York city hotels would highly recommend will stay there again

title: Un buon hotel in centro a NYC
text: Ho soggiornato una settimana presso questo hotel. Devo dire che in generale mi sono trovato benissimo sia per la posizione che per la pulizia. Bene -non benissimo- invece mi sono trovato per la dimensione della camera, che per la cifra pagata (1.700 USD prenotata quasi un anno prima) forse un pochino più grande poteva essere ed è il motivo per cui non ho dato 5 stelle. Condizionatore/Riscaldamento regolabili autonomamente, ferro da stiro, phon e minibar (vuoto) presenti. Saponi, docciaschiuma e così via anche presenti. Asciugamani grandi e sempre puliti. Letto grande con lenzuola cambiate regolarmente. Consigliato!

title: Very Good Location, Room and Service
text: We arrived at 7:00 am and our room would not be ready until 3:00 pm so they offered us a handicap room that was ready right away and we took it. It was located on the 4th floor in front of the elevators and had a really big shower - no tub. The view was nothing to look at, but we hardly stayed in our room. The hotel is located in walking distance of almost everything. There is a Starbucks on the ground floor and a small outdoor patio in the back of the hotel. The room and hotel were very clean and the bed was comfortable. The price was $164,00 American dollars a night which is very reasonable for the location. I split the cost with my daughter. I would go back there.

title: Great hotel!
text:
The hotel is in a very good location, near the main attractions. the staff is very attentive, with the confidence that you only find in Marriott hotels.
The room is excellent and with a very comfortable bed.

title: Hotel perfecto para pasar tu estancia en NYC
text:
Acabo de llegar de NYC y no puedo dejar de hacer una reseña del hotel que me ha acogido estos días. Ubicación perfecta. En el centro del corazón de la ciudad pero sin estar en el jaleo del bullicioso Times Square. Tiene también muy buena comunicación con el metro y está cerca de muchos puntos de interés, sea el Madison SQ Garden, Central Park, Empire State, la ya mencionada Times Square, Brodway... Tiene un 7 Eleven al lado. Muy importante para comprar agua para todos y cada uno de los días de la estancia... Porque como ya comprobareis, el agua es más cara que la gasolina y si compras varias botellas a la vez, re sale a cuenta.
La habitación y baños muy amplios. Tiene servicio de cafetería Starbucks lo que te saca de un apuro si vas con prisas.
Yo desde luego cuando vuelva a la ciudad que nunca duerme es muy probable que repita.

title: Perfect location!
text: Rooms are a little small but didn't mind as we were in NYC! They were clean and the bed was comfortable, and given we were that close to Times Square it was surprisingly quiet. Staff is very friendly and helpful with travel and sightseeing advice and directions. We were here for a week on vacation and would certainly come back to stay here, close to everything.

title: Una buona permanenza nel centro di Manhattan
text: Hotel situato vicino a diverse attrazioni di New York con le vicine fermate dei mezzi pubblici (Metro, Bus, ecc.). Camera di media grandezza, confortevole, materassi comodi. Personale gentile. Nel nostro pacchetto non era compresa la colazione. Il prezzo nella media di NY  e quindi un po' alto ma è impagabile la possibilità di trovarsi vicini a Time Square, Madison Square Garden, Central Park, ecc. Consigliabile.

title: Muy bien situado
text:
La localización del hotel es ideal, muy cerca del Empire State, de la Quinta Avenida y de Time Square, tiene una boca de metro en la misma puerta.
El barrio es muy bueno para pasear, hay muchos restaurantes y bares.
En el mismo hotel hay un ascensor aparte para subir a una de las terrazas con mejores vistas de Manhattan y muy visitada.
El hotel tiene internet gratuito y funciona estupendamente.
Las vistas desde nuestra habitación una maravilla, la habitación estaba bien, aunque la ducha al ser fija era muy incomoda. El servicio de habitaciones y la limpieza estupendos, aunque en recepción no son muy amables.

title: Very impressive staff! Thank you Julieth
text: I was here one night on business. Julieth checked me in at the front desk. She was very personable and showed me all the amenities around the lobby and where the elevators were. First class for a Courtyard. Great location for events at Javits center!

title: Great location and clean!!
text: Great location!!! just a few steps from times square, 5th avenue and train stations. Rooms are small but very clean. The restaurant is good and the staff is kind. I definitely recommend this hotel when you visit New York.

title: Don't stay on the 2nd Floor
text: We checked in for a special birthday celebration weekend and were assigned rooms on the second floor.  As we were getting ready to go to sleep, a loud, constant high-pitched sound emanated from the air conditioner system.  The noise was oddly loudest in our bathrooms.  We complained to the manager who moved us the next day, but it made for a horrible night as that loud sound kept going on and off all night.  If you choose to stay here, make sure you don't get stuck on the 2d floor.

title: Do not think this hotel is part of Marriott
text: I have stayed for this hotel for Marriott reward, but it went bottom and worst experience in Marriott bland. I always had good expeience staying at Marriott hotels, but this hotel was worst experience so far.  No towels and no extra toilett papers, no shampooes or conditioners if you stay more than two nights. Every time, you need to go down to pick them up or ask to bring them to you. You do not need to pay for Marriott bland for his hotel. Do not expect it.

title: Ottimo hotel buona posizione
text:
Ottimo hotel vicino alla stazione metropolitana di Penn Station sulla 34^ strada. A piedi si raggiunge Times Square in circa 8/10 minuti di cammino.
Hotel molto pulito e personale cortese e disponibile, costo nella media di quattro stelle a Manhattan.

title: Parfaitement bien situé
text:
Pour une 1 ère visite à NYC l hôtel est très bien situé : à mi chemin entre central park et l empire state building. Pas trop bruyant pour le quartier surtout les chambres donnant sur la cours intérieure et en 20 min à pied on se trouve au cœur palpitant de Time square pour vivre la folie new-yorkaise. Pour passer une soirée plus calme, l hôtel est proche de Bryant Park, ou on peut déjeuner sur les chaises installées autour du park ou bien dîner sur l herbe en admirant l Empire State . 
Un Starbucks dans l hôtel. 
Personnel et prestations sont très bien.

title: Sehr gutes Hotel in dieser Preiskategorie, prima Lage
text:
Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral und dennoch ruhig in der 37. Straße auf Höhe der 8th Av. Man ist zu Fuß schnell an allen wichtigen Punkten. In der Lobby ist ein Starbucks, wo man auch frühstücken kann (haben wir aber nicht genutzt) und Abends als Bar dient. In der Nähe befindet sich Hells Kitchen, wo man immer ein tolles Lokal finden kann.
Die Zimmer sind wirklich geräumig, super sauber und das Bad auch in einer ordentlichen Größe. Die Betten sind sehr gut. Personal war immer freundlich und hilfsbereit. Für uns bisher das beste Hotel in New York in dieser Preisklasse, werden wir gerne weiterempfehlen.

title: Awesome stay in Manhattan!
text: After reading so many reviews of hotels in NYC, I was a little wary of staying anywhere in Manhattan.  SO glad we picked Courtyard on W 37th!  The staff was VERY friendly and helpful.  They let us keep our bags there when we arrived at 10:30am and our rooms were ready right on time.  Everyone was very nice and the customer service was some of the best I have seen.
