Rooms were clean and a decent size for NYC.  Highly recommend this for a stay in Manhattan.

title: Ottima posizione a Midtown
text: Io e mia moglie abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 4 notti, la camera è spaziosa, sempre molto pulita e il letto comodissimo! L'hotel si trova in ottima posizione per la visita di Midtown, quindi Time Square, Rockfeller Centre, Empire State building. Inoltre si trova a due passi dalla stazione di Port Authority, comodo se poi ci si sposta in bus in altre città della costa est americana. Wifi gratis in camera, un plus che non in tutti gli hotel di catena è possibile trovare. I prezzi sono nella media di New York. Il personale è abbastanza gentile, un po' scostante quello della reception al momento del check out. Consigliato!

title: It was pretty good!
text: For a nyc hotel room it was not that small, great location, we could walk to times square in like 8 minutes. We could pretty much walk everywhere from there, central park, 5th avenue, etc. It has two metro stations pretty close that could take you to soho and other places that where "far". A good experience!

title: J y retournerai
text: Très bien placé, proche times square et nombreuses station de métro. Belle chambre avec 2 lits doubles. Propre. Personnel efficace mais pas du tout francophone! Possibilité petit déjeuner sur place pas essayé. 40st plusieurs resto bien au pied de l'hôtel

title: Decent location. Clean but tiny room!
text: As expected the rooms were super tiny, but they were clean. Very loud outside, but that's to be expected in NYC. Good location as it was right downtown and near everything. A bit pricey for what it was, but overall good stay.

title: Cancelled our room on the day of our arrival.
text:
We flew from Aus to London to New York for our honeymoon.  Booked this hotel in January 2017 for end of July attendance. As we landed in New York received an email saying we needed to confirm our credit card and if we didn't call them by 6pm the booking would be cancelled. We were flying at 6pm - and had emailed them to say when we were landing - which was at 11pm. My husband called once we saw this email and were told the hotel was fully booked and our room was given away. We had family who had flown to New York staying in the same hotel. I then called the hotel in anger asking to speak to a manager, the clerk happily connected me to a voicemail which asked to leave a message, which i did. We waited 30 min then had to stand at the airport and book another hotel. The following day in the afternoon while on a tour i received a missed call. Point of story is we were standed in New York at 11pm on a Friday night trying to book a hotel from the airport. 

We eventually booked another hotel which was better and i'm definitely not staying at the Marriott again. Such unprofessional and rude staff working at an incompetent hotel that can't even hold a booked made 7 months prior!

title: Gran ubicacion, excelente relacion precio calidad
text: Les recomiendo este hotel. Precio moderado, ubicacion excelente. Entre la tranquilidad y la belleza del Bryant Park y la locura y adrenalina de Times Square. El hotel tiene habitaciones bien equipadas y modernas, el personal es muy amable, Este año accedi a un paquete con desayuno, bastante completo, que pedi siempre me lo empaquen para llevar y disfrutarlo en mi parque favorito, el Bryant Park.

title: Extremely pleased
text: Wonderful place to stay while visiting NY.  Everything within walking distance. Staff extremely friendly, fun.  Every effort made to make your stay with them a pleasant one.  Rooms are clean and "roomy".  Even though we had 4 in our room, we weren't crowded.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Gran Hotel, empleados y ubicación
text: Me alojé durante 7 días la semana pasada en este hotel, que desde el primer momento me sorprendió con la amabilidad de su personal, quienes accedieron a nuestras peticiones e incluso nos dieron una habitación con mejor vista. La habitación, para ser New York, es bastante grande, limpia y con todas las prestaciones de un hotel moderno. El baño, al igual, de buen tamaño y limpio. Sin embargo, lo mejor fue la ubicación. A cuatro cuadras de Penn Station y del metro, a cinco de Time Square, en el corazón de Midtown, cerca de las mejores tiendas y grandes restaurantes. Excelente elección, aunque tome la opción sin desayuno incluido, tiene un sector en el cual se puede comprar excelentes comidas para iniciar el día, y en las tardes ofrece Happy Hours. No puedo dejar de destacar la amabilidad y compromiso de todo el personal del hotel, quienes muchas veces fueron más allá del cumplimento de sus cargos para ayudarnos. No duden en reservar aquí su próxima estadia en la Gran Manzana.

title: Excelente en todo!
text:
El hotel está ubicado a varias cuadras del Times Square pero muy cerca del Empire State, es cómodo porque hay varias farmacias donde se pueden comprar desde medicamentos hasta gaseosas.
La habitación del hotel no era muy grande, pero casi ninguno en New york lo es, cómoda, muy limpia, no se escuchaba ningún ruido.
Es moderno, con un bar muy lindo y cómodo para desayunar o tomar buenos tragos. El servicio de Wi Fi funciona a la perfección.
Respecto al personal...no puedo decir nada más que EXCELENTE! Todos y cada uno de ellos, nos atendieron super bien, hablaban español, solucionan cualquier tipo de duda que tengas y muy serviciales.
Recomiendo este hotel 100% en todos los sentidos.

title: Good value for 1 night
text: We arrived late on a Friday night. Super quick check in, and a room on the 26TH floor. Tiny room, but quiet , clean and well located.  We ate breakfast at a little hole in the wall Italian place straight across the street. Check out was just as quick and friendly.

title: Typical Hotel with Excellent Staff
text: This is your typical decent big box hotel, but the excellent staff made it well above average. They were all welcoming and helpful. Everyone from the front desk staff to the housekeepers clearly demonstrated a "I want to do my best" attitude. When the bell hop was helping others, the front desk person went and retrieved our 3 heavy bags. She did it with a smile, even though I know what a pain it was. The other pro for a large hotel in a busy city is we never waited long for an elevator. This is a big deal when you have to get somewhere quickly. Location was great for Times Square and Penn Station (and the Ripley-Grier Studio where we had to go everyday). Our room faced 37th St, but was quiet by NYC standards. It was also helpful to have a small bar fridge in the room and a microwave downstairs in the lobby to reheat leftovers (from all the great nearby restaurants).

title: Not too impressed, but not terrible
text:
I'm pretty easy to accommodate, so I'll start with the good. It's clean, it has great a/c, friendly staff, big rooms, nice gym and is quiet. 

The location is just OK. It's a block that is sketchy toward 9th and fine toward 7th. By sketchy I mean we walked by crack pipes and strung-out folks. If you have kids, just go the other way.

The worst part was the maid service. And by maid service I don't mean the maids themselves, who were always delightful and did a great job on the rooms. I mean the cheap folks who refuse to hire more of them. There must have been one or two maids for the whole building at the rate the rooms were being attended to.

We stayed here for a week. One day I really wanted to room made up. By 1:30 pm, no one had come by, so I asked the front desk. They put a "rush order" on the room and by 4 pm it still wasn't made up. Most days it would hit 4 pm with no sign of a maid. Sometimes at this point I would just say forget it and put the Do Not Disturb sign out, because I didn't want them barging in at the time of day I like to relax. I would go out ALL DAY and still come back to a messy room. 

Some friends of ours flew in at noon, room wasn't ready (that's OK, wasn't time to check in) and luggage collected. But by 7 pm the room was STILL NOT READY. That is just not acceptable. This is a service that is built into the cost of your stay. Hire more maids. Seriously. I've never had this issue at an NYC hotel before. When you go out, the room is made up, and you come back to folded towels, a nice bed, trash emptied, new little bottles of shampoo, etc. Here: Forget it. Weirdest thing is: The hotel was not even full.

I did laundry here -- it's $4/load. There is no change machine in the laundry room so you'll have to find somewhere to buy quarters. But it is nice that you can do it here.

More friends of ours were staying across the street at the Hilton Garden Inn. They had free breakfast. We didn't. They had tea and cookies sitting out in the lobby. We didn't. They had a nice rooftop deck. We didn't. They had a nice lounge area that fit a lot of people and big-screen TVs. We didn't. They also had a nice gym and free wifi. If there is just a marginal difference in cost, I would highly suggest going across the street and staying there. The breakfast alone is worth it.

title: "Aspereza com que fomos tratados pelo encarregado"
text: O hotel é muito bom mas ficamos decepcionadíssimos com o tratamento do funcionário Isaac, que trouxe nossas malas do depósito de bagagens (e para lá as tinha levado). Desde o início ele nos tratou de forma rude, grosseira. Reclamamos com a gerente e ela pediu desculpas em nome dele, sendo que ele em momento algum se retratou. A forma com que fomos tratados, como dissemos a ela, não corresponde a um hotel de tal porte, cujo preço pagamos por todo o conforto e tratamento que imaginamos que receberiámos em um Courtyard Marriot,

title: Nice place to stay
text: Good check in. We were early and desk clerk found a room for us. Staff on checkout was good also. Very efficient. Housekeeper nice and friendly. But, the concierge leaves at 5:00. Pretty early for New York City. Hotel was very clean. Close to Port Authority and subways and buses. Close to tour boats and Intrepid area.

title: Very accommodating
text: Staff was excellent , we arrived early, did not expect our room to be ready,but it was. The room was spotless, and modern.the location was good for us , just a few blocks from the port authority terminal. The staff had excellent recommendations for food etc. the only drawback the rooms are very small based on the room we had. We did face like a courtyard so it was very quiet for a city hotel.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text:
Hotel was easy to find. Very close to Penn Station, which you can get to easily from LGA airport. The Q70-SBS LGA link bus takes you right to the subway station. From there take the E train right to Penn station and its less than a 10 min walk.  Rooms were ready early, around 11am. King sized room, clean and more than you need. Staff were friendly and ready to answer any questions I had.
Close to Times Square and Macy's. Second time staying here and would def stay here again.

title: The hotel cancelled my reservation !
text: The hotel cancelled my reservation the day of my arrival because my card declined and only sent an email as I was about the board the plane. As a platinum member I would have expected a call. My card of file was stolen. luckily I called and they restored my reservation. I was told - we were oversold and cancelling anyone with a declined card.  I've stayed at a Marriott over 52 nights this year and it's not like I don't pay! The hotel itself was average at best. I'm loyal to you Marriott but this makes me question

title: Good but disappointing
text: The location was great. However we were disappointed with the sound of the air condition inside the room. It was way too loud and made a huge sound when it turned on and off. I am a platinum elite member and have always got complimentary breakfast in all the Marriott properties I have visited all over the world. I was extremely surprised that this property denied complimentary breakfast, though they gave me coupons for one day because I requested.

title: Excellent!
text: We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott for a long weekend for our anniversary.  The hotel was newly remodeled and very nice.  The rooms are on the small side, but we didn't go to NYC to sit in the room!  The bathroom was huge and newly updated very tastefully.  The staff was very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable.  The bistro was excellent and the food was as well!  You are a 5 minute walk to Times Square and we were very pleased with the location.  Would highly recommend!

title: Great Location, clean, updated hotel, don't upgrade to included breakfast.
text: We stayed here due to the location near Penn Station. We were able to take in all NY sights from here utilizing subway and Uber. Rooms were nice, it vas extremely hot when we were there and AC worked great. I would not recommend paying extra for included breakfast as it is not a "buffet" but more of a convenient microwave breakfast. There are so many dining options within a few blocks save the money and go out and get a made to order breakfast. Staff was extremely helpful and "Chris" in the lobby went out of his way to make sure we were informed on our travel selections (instructions) as well as help with our luggage. Would definitely stay here again

title: Decent Stay but some confusio/issues
text:
I have stayed at this hotel before and just stayed earlier this week for 1 night related to a business trip.  This trip, we had some issues:

-First, my reservation was NOT supposed to be PREPAID - it specifically stated on my confirmation that it was to be paid at the hotel.  However, when I checked in just before 5:00p 6/26, the desk clerk advised that they had already "pre-charged" my credit card on file.  When I questioned this, he advised that "they do this when they are sold out" - but I did not authorize this.  On top of that, he told me that he not only had one reservation for me, but two and "pre-charged" my credit card for both?  I double checked with our company travel coordinator and only one reservation was made with only one confirmation.  The desk clerk then advised that they supposedly have refunded both of these reservations charging my card for only the one reservation.  I have not had a chance to check but hope that this was done and am very irritated that the hotel would take these liberties with my credit card especially when I am a Marriott Rewards member, travel extensively for business, and stay exclusively at Marriott properties when I can.

-  The armoire in the room has a built-in  "night light" that cannot be turned off without moving the entire unit from the wall and unplugging it.  Suffice it to say, I tried to sleep with this light on but without much success.  I mentioned to the desk clerk at check-out when asked about my stay.

-  Guests need to know that this hotel is a bit off the main cab routes and catching a cab is difficult at best.  We had the same issue last year when staying at this property. This time after having trouble on the day of arrival, we did ask for assistance from the bellman and the process was a bit better but not ideal.

title: Nice hotel with good location
text: I booked this hotel after read many good feedbacks about it. The location is very good ,the rooms are nice and you can find a nice gym  . If you looking for a middle class hotel that you dont spend much time and is in the hearth of NY i would recommend it.

title: Solid hotel, good location
text: The hotel is great if you need easy access to midtown. Subway entrances are three blocks up or down. Close to Times Square and Theatre district. Staff are very nice. Room is small, but this is New York. I didn't want to pay for a bunch of space I didn't really use. I'll be back.

title: Great location
text:
The staff here is outstanding. Great service all the way around..a very quiet hotel.
My room was smaller than usual. Maybe that's because space is everything in Ny.
Close to penn station. Walking distance to other sites as well.

title: Outstanding Staff & Location
text:
Stayed there one night last weekend and couldn't have asked for more as far as customer service and location goes.

The front desk people were all awesome especially Emily Sosa who went above and beyond to ensure that we had a great experience. 

The room was small, but expected from a NY city hotel. The king size bed and pillows were very comfortable and the views of the city were nice. The bathroom was actually quite bigger then expected with all amenities necessary for a good stay. 

This is an excellent hotel located in the heart of midtown right next to Madison square garden and two blocks from the metro stop. I will definitely be back there again in the near future.

title: Midtown Hotel
text: This hotel was the perfect choice for access to Penn Station and Theatre District.  We found the beds comfortable, the room quiet, and friendly hotel staff.  We opted for a high floor which may have kept noise level down.   Though we didn't go there, the hotel bistro looked nice and provides a good option.  Would definitely return.

title: Outstanding Stay!
text: Super convenient location near Madison Square Garden, Times Square (obviously), Empire State Building, etc. Check-in experience was quick and the young lady was very pleasant and accommodating. Like others have mentioned, the rooms are small, but always expected in Manhattan.  The bathroom was actually surprisingly large.    Everything in this hotel is very clean - housekeeping is excellent.  Temperature control, outlets and water pressure were all solid.  Elevators, often an issue in Manhattan, were fast and almost always available when you need one.  Bed was comfortable and decent work space.  Because there are only a handful of rooms on each floor there is hardly any floor noise which is outstanding.  Outside, you'll obviously hear the sounds of the city (which I personally love), but there's really no escaping that unless you bring noise cancelling headphones or some sort of device that creates white noise.  Great value, very pleasant stay - I would definitely return!

title: Lovely and clean hotel
text: Nice hotel at a good price in NYC. Good location and an easy walk to Times Square and penn station. Decent food options around. Staff are excellent but the wifi and entertainment system is a bit slow. Rooms are a little small too but that's New York I guess!

title: Nice and quite in the heart of Manhattan
text: I can not say enough good things about this hotel and the hotel staff lead by Mr. Handler, the hotel manager. In the past I have stayed at the Marriott Marquis in Times Square, which is a great hotel, no doubt, but it's a bit noisy because of the constant traffic. I love this Courtyard location and it's staff. It's just off of Times Square, so it's quiet but close enough to Times Square destinations if you need an NYC fix. I was really impressed with the staff. They were flawlessly friendly and helpful, making for a very low to no effort stay on my part. This hotel staff deserves a standing O for certain. Well done. I look forward to staying at this location again. Bravo' lsmith

title: Gute lage, guter service, schöne zimmer
text:
Wir waren mit Freunden für 5 Nächte in dem Hotel. Wir hatten ein Zimmer zum Hof
und es war für New Yorker Verhältnisse ausreichend gross mit einer grossen Dusche.
Lediglich die Ablagemöglichkeiten im Bad waren zu wenig vorhanden.
Das Bett war super. Frühstücken waren wir immer im mamamo in der 37 St, 9 Ave.
mit einer grösseren Auswahl zum Frühstücken als im Courtyard.
Die Lage des Hotels ist super zwischen Penn station (U bahn, NJ transit, Amtrak) und Times square. Gute und günstige Restaurants in der nahen Umgebung.
Freundliches Personal und sehr sauber. Nur zum empfehlen.

title: Hotel parfaitement situé
text:
Hotel, sympa et pas trop exposé au bruit (difficile de trouver un endroit à New York qui soit au calme).
Les chambres sont suffisamment grandes et la chambre famille pour 4 personnes est correct pour 2 adultes et 2 enfants (8 et 10 ans).
Hotel récent ou qui a été rénové car tout est impeccable et rien ne choque.
Le buffet du matin par contre n'est pas à la hauteur et pour faire chauffer les tasses de chocolat au lait le matin, il fallait se déplacer jusqu'à la réception pour utiliser un micro ondes ....
Personnel agréable sans être très expressif.
Pour résumer un hôtel ou vous serez bien reçu et ou votre séjour devrait bien se passer.

title: Very, very pleased!
text:
Came for a quick Memorial Day weekend trip. We arrived at 6am, dropped our bags off, and spoke with the front desk attendant, Vincent. That is when our great weekend began! He was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. He was able to get us an 11-12noon check-in. The room was very clean, bed comfy and view of the Empire State Building was awesome! The hotel is very convenient to Times Square, Broadway and the ESB. I am partial to the Marriott brand, this property did not disappoint!
Will definitely return! All hotel employees that we dealt with, front desk, Bistro and housekeeping were very helpful👍🏻

title: Settimana a New York perfetta
text:
Avevamo prenotato in un altro marriot proprio prima di partire ad un ottimo prezzo e posizione ma al ns arrivo ci comunicano che per lavori sulla strada, sono privi di acqua dalle 8 del mattino sino alle 16, inaccettabile se si è in vacanza con una bambina di 5 anni. La concierge dopo aver comunicato ciò, al ns diniego nell'accettare la camera segnalandole che non c'era nessuna nota nella prenotazione effettuata con expedia, ci risponde che Expedia o meno, non c'è alcun problema, cercherà in zona alternative, di accomodarci. 
Cosí è avvenuto e allo stesso stesso prezzo ci ha confermato presso il nuovo marriot una tripla con colazione compresa (nel ns non c'era proprio), e ci consegna 10$ da dare all autista privato per raggiungere l'hotel. 
Ottimo inizio, se non fosse che all'arrivo l'autista ci prova e alla consegna dei 10$ ci dice che la tariffa è 25$ ci facciamo una risata rispondendo che sono meno di un km e che entreremo e chiameremo l'hotel da cui siamo partiti per avvertirli, si stranisce a attende ma quando vede che parliamo con il concierge che chiama l'altro marriot probabilmente capisce che non siamo italiani con l'anello al naso e che gli è andata male. l'America non delude mai nel bene e nel male...entriamo e chiediamo conferma dello stesso prezzo e che abbiamo strisciato la carta di credito all altro hotel , che si assicurino non venga addebitato doppio importo. 
Camera al 22*piano, confortevole con cucinotto e frigo familiare purtroppo come al solito senza bidet e bagno un po' angusto. Hotel situato davanti a briant park e alla biblioteca di ny, posizione molto strategica perchè a piedi si raggiunge un po' tutto da time square ma anche central park nel cuore. Camera pulita, colazione intercontinentale molto abbondante con possibilità di consumarla con l affaccio sulla sesta e di fronte il palazzo della bank of china e dal lato opposto briant park. Benché di alberghi ottimi a Ny ce ne siano. Questo per posizione strategica e per la colazione inclusa che invece sembra divenuta una chimera è da tenere assolutamente in considerazione.

title: Nello standard di New York
text: Costoso come un po' tutti gli hotel a New York, posizione ottima per visitare la città. L'unico inconveniente, non da poco ,è stata la cauzione di 500 dollari trattenuta erroneamente dall'hotel.... perciò attenzione all'estratto conto!

title: Marriott Brand Quality
text:
Checked in after leaving another brand hotel that was filthy. The Courtyard has a vibrant lobby, helpful front desk and food service for breakfast and dinner. Clean rooms with plenty of towels and soap
 Coffee maker, iron, small refrigerator and safe. Perfectly located within easy walking  to Times Square, Penn Station, Herald Square,  and the Garment District. Lots of restaurants nearby.

title: Perfect for Conventions at Javitis
text:
Best location close to Javits and Time Square for dining and sites. Easy access f
For Uber or Lyft. Comfortable rooms with a window that opens (street side) for fresh NY air and peaceful sounds to sleep too.

title: staff is just plain rude
text:
To put it simply, the hotel staff at this Marriott location is rude.  This is uncommon for a Marriott.  At first I thought maybe I hit the hotel on a bad day but now 3 days in I'm pretty sure this is a management issue.  The staff here needs some customer service training.  

The room is fine.  It's small, but that's to be expected in New York.  It is clean and newly updated.  The lobby is tiny and they offer nothing...no water, coffee.  There are many better Marriotts in town.  Try another.

title: Goooood
text: Great place to stay during a travel to NYC. Friendly staff that exceeds the needs of guest. Rooms are immaculate, very clean. Housekeeping does an excellent job maintaining room appearance and cleanliness. Elevators are available as soon as you push the button. Fast delivery to each floor. Faster than most hotels I've stayed in. Rooms and furniture are well maintained. With only 5-7 rooms on each floor, it helps keep the noise and traffic levels very low. Quiet atmosphere.

title: Great location & rooms up to date
text: I stay at this Courtyard often and its always clean, has updated rooms, people there are friendly and they have one of the best breakfast lounges you will see at any Courtyard.  Located right on the edge of Times Square so you are steps from all the bright lights but also just off the busy streets where it is quieter for when you want to be away from the crowds

title: Emplacement idéal
text:
Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet Hôtel, très bon retour sur expérience.
Les + : gentillesse, chambre et salle de bain très propres, emplacement idéal, métro à proximité, le Starbucks au rdc, salle de sport
Les - : manque de rangement dans la salle de bain, une petite tache sur les draps.
Idéal pour un séjour shopping visite à NYC.

title: Great location at reasonable price for NYC
text: I stayed here for five nights, and was very pleased with my selection. The location is excellent, just a short walk to Penn Station in one direction, and Times Square in the other. The room was comfortable, and included all the usual amenities. There's a nice gym in the basement, along with a self service laundry room. I didn't eat in the hotel, so I can't comment on the restaurant. The staff were friendly and helpful, and trying to do their best during the week I was there when the hotel had no water from 8am to 2pm due to the city ripping up the street to install new water pipes. The only reason I didn't give the hotel the highest rating is because I was disappointed that they didn't offer guests any discount, particularly Gold members like me, due to this rather annoying inconvenience. Instead we were merely given some extra bonus points. When I complained about this, one staff member did reduce my rate, but only for that one day. Guests were told that it's the city's fault for the pipe replacement, which is technically true. But I don't think the hotel should expect its guests to shoulder the entire burden and pay the normal rate for a room without proper water service (no toilet, shower or running water). And because I was notified just one day before my arrival, there was obviously insufficient time to cancel, and book another hotel in the midtown area.

title: Nice Stay
text: I stayed at Courtyard By Marriott Time Square for 4 nights during May.  The hotel is reasonably priced for New York City.  It is centrally located and everything in NYC is accessible from this location via walking or subway.  The service is good and staff is friendly.  For dining, I suggest you walk a little to places that are a little off the beaten path.  You can get a cab or subway ride to the Village or Little Italy and enjoy a wide variety of restaurants.  Do not forget discounted tickets for Broadway shows and theaters.

title: Excellent Suite, Great Location
text: I had to stay in NYC for a couple of days and the rate for the Marriott was good.  The suite was large with a sofa and chair sitting area and kitchen.  There is a Whole Foods two blocks away so I was able to eat in, which made the stay cheaper.  The suite was very comfortable and the location great--12-15 minute walk to Grand Central or Broadway.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  If the price is right I would definitely stay there again.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
L'Hotel si trova in ottima posizione sia per raggiungere il Javits Center (lavoro) che Time square (piacere).

Prezzi nella media di New York. Camere della misura giusta e pulite. Per la colazione meglio uscire in quanto c'è solo un mini Starbucks.

title: Cerca de todo
text:
Un muy buen hotel, cerca de todo!. Madison SG, RAdio City, Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller Center, Central park...etc!.
Muy limpio, comodo y personal muy amable y bilingue.
Habitación un tanto pequeña para varios dias, pero suficiente, baños de primera.

title: Ottimo per visitare NY
text:
Ho soggiornato per due notti in questo hotel a NY.
La posizione è ottima, si trova nella parte nord di Manhattan, vicino a Times Square e a 30 minuti a piedi dall'empire ma vicino anche a tutte le altre attrazioni dell'Uptown.

Le camere sono un poco piccole (come del resto in buona parte degli hotel di NY), il bagno è molto spazioso e le camere sono pulite.

title: Great long weekend
text: My wife and I stayed here and the hotel and staff were fantastic. We will stay here next time we are in NYC. Great location and great atmosphere! The staff was more than willing to assist us with anything. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but we had drinks at the bar during happy hour. The bar tender and the drinks were on point.

title: Boo
text:
I am renovating my mother's apartment and have travelled to NYC three times in the last month and stayed at different hotels on each occasion.

Upon my arrival at Courtyard Marriott Hotel on West 37th Street around 9pm on May 15, I was told that the water would be turned off at 8:00am the following day. I declined the offer to find another hotel because of the late hour. 

I complained to the manager that I should have been notified of the problem and was offered a 10% discount. I continued to complain and was offered a 25% discount. I added, "Would you pay $150. for a hotel with no water?"

In response to my request for a quiet room, the desk clerk assigned me a room and commented, "No one goes up there!"
(A bit creepy).

The assigned room was clean and spacious, but it was for the handicapped so had no tub! Again, there was a significant omission of information. Things went from bad to worse as I found myself coughing throughout the night. When I told the contractor about my cough he stated that the room was probably rarely used and the a/c filters were dirty! 
Hmmmm, makes sense!!!

In addition, the mattress was very soft, lumpy and uncomfortable.

I have to thank hotels.com for crediting me for the cost of the night. Frankly, I would have preferred water,  clean air filters and a decent mattress.

Shame on the manager of Courtyard for offering poor service!

P.S. I stayed at The Lexington, another Marriott the previous weekend and noted it was "entirely adequate".

title: Great location. Really small rooms.
text: For a short visit on my own, the room is fine. If I had to have another person in there with me, it would be a tight squeeze. The staff is helpful and friendly. I love the free Starbucks coffee on the second floor.

title: Better choice than Courtyard Manhattan/5th Ave a block away!
text:
I stay at a lot of Marriotts and I've been trying out different ones in midtown Manhattan. Not only does this location have a closer proximity to the 42nd St/Times Square Subway lines, but it has been renovated more recently than it's neighbor a block away. 

As expected in NYC, the room was small but well appointed with comfy Marriott beds, expected minifridge (something I cannot say of the 5th Ave location), and fast internet (full disclosure with status, I receive the enhanced connection for free). We didn't turn on the TV (it's NYC...too much to do) Bathroom had nice shower (no tub) and plenty of room for two women to do makeup at the same time.  

Staff was helpful and friendly (there was absolutely no judgement from the staff when it was CLEARLY user error causing issues with the Keurig in the room). I will be back

title: Great Location to see all the Manhattan sites!
text: Visited with my 3 grown children in spring of 2017.  We were able to jump right on the subway, walk to restaurants, see Times Square and Rockefeller Center, do all the things you want to do in NYC without spending extra $ on cabs and Uber.  Location is fantastic, comfy room with good front desk service.

title: Un hôtel au calme dans une ville toujours en mouvement
text:
Cet hôtel est très proche de Times Square, de la High Line, sa situation géographique est franchement très appréciable.
Nous avons aimé:
          - la propreté générale de cet établissement, 
          - la gentillesse et la disponibilité du personnel. 
          - le confort de la literie
          - les volumes de la chambre et de la salle d'eau
          - la qualité du mobilier
          - l'insonorisation au sein de l'établissement
          - une fois que nous avons compris le fonctionnement du petit déjeuner et la qualité du café  américain, nous y avons parfaitement déjeuné
Si nous devions souligner un seul point négatif, ce serait l'isolation phonique des fenêtres donnant sur la rue qui pourrait être améliorée

title: Comfort in NY
text: Stayed here with my teen son.  We loved it.  Staff was very accommodating and friendly.  Room was very clean and beds were comfy.  Got a good rate for a weekend thru Travelocity.  Location is perfect in the heart of Yimes Square.Would surely stay here again.

title: Mycket bra läge närma till allt!
text:
Hotellet och rummen var inte så stora men totalupplevelsen var mycket bra!
Väldigt trevlig personal och bra sängar och rummen var tysta.
Städningen var bra, tyvärr så missade dom att städa en dag.
Frukosten var så där och ganska dyr.
Mitt förslag är att gå ut på stan för frukost många alternativ runt om.

title: Good Location
text: The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Location is good. Metro station is only a 1 minute walk . A couple of convenience stores are close by .  The room are very small I was there with my family (2 kids/ 2 Adults)  Room are in need of update. Carpet is old and Bed Frames have a lot of scuff mark on them .   Lobby was always crowded , which front desk help was very hard to get .. Overall for the Price and Location .. its a OK' place to stay

title: Wonderful week
text:
A very wonderful week we spent in this hotel last july. We were me, my wife an daughter (first time in NYC for her).
We stayed very well. The room is large and beautiful, my daughter loves the green wall of the bathroom ;-))
We booked the hotel with booking.com and we choose a king size bed room for two people with breakfst beacause my daughter at time had two years old and she didn't pay.
But for the breakfast, the manager of the bar every morning served the breakfast also at the baby without any pay. We were so happy and funny (she eated every morning two bagels)

title: Localização excelente! Atendimento mais ainda!
text: O hotel é muito agradável, a localização sem comentários o atendimento foi no meu caso, realmente sem questionamentos.O quarto atende bem a expectativa pelo preço cobrado,ou seja, ótima relação custo benefício!

title: Postage stamp sized room, slow elevators, no on-site parking
text: I had a queen bed room for two nights. The room was very clean, and well decorated. The bathroom was immaculate. I guess the feature that knocked down the rating was the 3 elevator bank.  27 floors, and a full house, makes for long wait times to catch an elevator up or down. Parking is in a commercial garage about 1.5 blocks away at $45 a night. Another strike. Spotty WiFi in the room on my laptop. Couldn't get my smartphone linked to it.

title: This hotel steals money from the safe in the room. Staff is idle.
text:
I stayed with my family at the Courtyard by Marriott Hotel New York Manhattan / Times Square from 21.03.2017. to 01.04.2017.I had an unpleasant incident with this hotel.
The crux of my problem is when I get into the room, I put cash in the safe. During my stay I did not count them. Before the eviction I counted my money. I was stolen from my safe by 1100 American dollars in cash. I opened and closed the safe every day 2 times in the morning and in the evening. At the reception, they listened to me, took my testimony from the safe, the door of the room and everything ... ( My problem was not solved and my money was not returned to me.
The hotel spoiled wonderful impressions about the most picturesque city in the world.
I did not expect such a relationship from the Marriot.((((

title: Good location
text: We stayed there for a trip to New York City where we attended some broadway shows. It is in a good location and is well kept and clean. Parking is a bit of a hassle. It is a bit pricey for what it is, but everything in New York seems to be like that.

title: Very convenient
text:
Great location, convenient to most everything including subway locations.  Not a grand hotel but it is certainly a great deal.  Rooms offer everything you need or want for a night or two. Price is reasonable (for NYC).
There is a very popular roof top bar that offers appetizers and it's open until 2am.
Clean and convenient.

title: First Trip to New York
text: Had a wonderful stay at  this Courtyard.  Very centrally located to walk to many attractions and points of interests in New York City.  Restaurants and pubs very close.  Were there for the Nor'easter of 2017.  Had to extend our stay as the airports cancelled flights.  Fortunately, the hotel was very accommodating.  Will definitely book again.

title: 地點方便，房間很小
text: 我們在 2017/3 月到訪，在這住了兩天，地點非常方便，離 Penn Station 不遠，不過優點也只僅於地點，房間很小，同時空調不算安靜，高樓層也沒有什麼 View。

title: Great stay
text: Only stayed for one night but it was nice and comfortable. This hotel is great location to Times Square and the Hammerstein ballroom for an event that we were there for. It was clean and the front staff was very nice. Especially Chris the bellman! Thank you!

title: Great service
text: Needed a room after missing the last train out.  Vincent was running the desk and went out of his way to get us a good room at a great price.  Very professional and attentive. We had tried to get rooms at the Hilton across the street but front desk employment was a piece of work.  Thanks to this experience, I will focus my hotel stays at Marriott/SPG. (Gold member with both Hilton and Marriott/SPG)

title: Great customer service.
text: So we found ourselves without a train to get out of NYC after the Gators basketball game in MSG at 1AM, and Vincent at this Marriott was extremely courteous and accommodating and ensured us a great room for a reasonable price. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Friendly reception!  Comfortable rooms!
text:
Stayed for the first time at Courtyard Marriott/Times Square West.  I was completely impressed with the personal attention and friendliness of the hotel reception staff both for checkin and checkout.  On checkin, the reception agent took the time to personally explain my Marriott rewards benefits, show me the restaurant/bar areas and elevators.  On checkout, there was a mistake made with my form of payment (Marriott gift card).  They promised everything would be corrected within the hour and sure enough, it was when I checked the card balance from the airport.  Kudos to Emily and Bryan for their "can do" attitude and friendly smiles.

I had stayed at another nearby hotel the previous night whose rooms did not feel comfortable.  My stay at the Courtyard was completely relaxing.  I got a good night sleep.  And, I liked the roominess of the bathroom compared to my previous hotel.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Value for money
text:
I'm a big fan of Courtyard Marriott hotels, I like how they are able to provide excellent value for your money (most times). This was my 4th time to NYC and I have stayed in some small hotel rooms, but nothing as small as these. My childhood bedroom was larger, and more comfortable.  We didn't go to New York to sit in a hotel room, so it was ok, but I would have preferred a little more space. 

Most reviews raved about the staff. I found them to be mediocre at best. I did go to the lounge for a drink and Mario was a very nice and professional bartender. Everyone else was unmemorable. 

Next time, I will likely go back to the Distrikt hotel if we stay in this area again. Once I converted our room rate to Canadian, it was $450 per night, or about $100 an hour for the amount of time we spent in the hotel.

title: Great hotel!
text:
I had a Great stay in this hotel. The staff is, like everyone else is saying, extremely nice and helpful! The rooms are a decent size, you are in mid town Manhattan of course.. the bathroom is big, I would like a normal bath tub but this is the American standard sizing.
The tv is great, lots of channels and good quality.
Everything is really clean and well looked after.
It's also very quiet, the heating worked well as it was very cold outside and it didn't even make a lot of noise. I had a nice view on the street side, I do suggest earplugs if you're a light sleeper like me as you will, of course, hear some city noise.
The location is awesome, 4 streets from penn station for trains and subways, Times Square 10 min walk, the park is close from there. 
I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, there are a million places around you to have anything your heart desires!
I got an amazing deal through Booking.com and I would definitely stay here again!

title: Center of town
text:
Greater location, excellent in hotel services open breakfast and lounge area was excellent. Great price for the location in the center of The city. Rooms were well appointed, new and clean.
Staff were very helpful at all points.

title: Tiny room great service
text: Arrived very late during the winter storm into a very welcoming staff that let me check out very late the next day, that made a elevator ride so much more relaxed. The room was tiny, I was barely able to fit 2 suitcases in the room. I hear it is a typical NYC hotel room :)

title: Great location and staff
text: This hotel does exactly what it promises in a friendly and efficient manner. The rooms are small enough but have every comfort available. The staff are well trained and provide excellent customer service. Within walking distance of Penn station which provides easy subway access to all of Manhattan and beyond. You can also get a Long Island Rail Road package to the Tanger shopping outlet in Deerpark Long Island. If you are a shopper this is not to be missed. Many of the big apple attractions are within easy walking distance such as the Empire State Building, Rockerfeller centre, Intrepid Sea, Air, and Space museum (my favourite).

title: Excellent Value
text: I stayed for a meeting. Small room but didn't stay in so who cares. It was clean and convenient. Not much more to be said. There was a small restaurant for breakfast but there are so many good places in the neighborhood I would go out.

title: Stayed at this Hotel for a week in January 2017
text: The Hotel Staff was excellent, the room was nicely appointed and fairly large by NYC standards.  The location of this Hotel is just a few blocks from Penn Station.  Lots of restaurants nearby.  Easy walking distance to the Jacob Javitts Convention Center

title: Approved
text: Tutto nuovo: stanza di dimensioni accettabili, bagno grande e pulitissimo, staff disponibile. La strada in cui si trova è abbastanza tranquilla considerando che stiamo parlando della zona più caotica di Manhattan. La nostra stanza era affacciata sul cortile interno, certo non un bel vedere ma sicuramente silenziosa.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: El hotel realmente queda en una excelente ubicación, esta a cuadras caminando de Central Park, y también a cuadras caminando de Times Square y Broadway. Tuve la posibilidad de ir caminando al show de broadway ida y vuelta, paseando por lugares lindos como Times Square o Central Park. Es un excelente hotel, el cuarto es bastante cómodo, quizás un poco pequeño pero para pocas noches uno está cómodo. El baño es bastante bueno.

title: What everyone else has said.
text:
Top notch staff, from check in to check out, housekeeping, front desk, bellman. etc. You could not find a fault amongst them, Special shout out to Chris, bellman, who was informative and always a smile on his face. Thanks.
Won't go on as most of the reviews echo, what we also experienced.
We will return and we will recommend to friends.
Thanks for making our NYC experience, a great 5 days.

title: Great location
text: Amazing 5-stay. Great location, near Times Square, bus stops and subway station. Penn Station is also close-by. Megabus and Bolt bus stops are also 3 blocks away. The rooms are generous and wi-fi connection is excellent. Breakfast is not included.

title: Close to Javits, very clean, excellent staff
text: We recently stayed here for NY Toy Fair. We had two rooms for our staff. The hotel was very clean and easy walking distance to the Javits Center. Staff were very friendly. Will probably stay here again next year.

title: Staff are the Highlight!!!
text:
From start to finish - the staff here were absolutely top notch. They couldn't do enough for you! I was particularly impressed with the concierge/bell boy. He ran circles around to give information and help you. They were all attentive and polite, and did their very best to help you, and most of all they were proactive - second guessing what you might want next to make your stay more comfortable.

The room - very small - but nicely furnished with a good bathroom. This in NYC though and it was what we were expecting so no dramas! But you do cringe a little paying ~450USD per night at the weekends when its so small. But its the same all around! Thats NYC!

The location - easy walking distance to everything and very centrally located. Nice little deli on the corner and good bars on the next street.

Overall - I would DEFINITELY stay again - primarily for the excellent staff. I stayed at another NYC hotel here and the difference was huge!

title: Excellent stay
text:
I would like to join the  long queue of writes here praising that Hotel, and all of them are definitely right. 
From the time you walk in until check out, all was perfect. 
The room had a good size, was clean and nice. The Hotel, despite the good location, was not loud and we could have a good nights sleep in a very comfy bed. 
Breakfast in the little bistro, was very good and reasonable priced. 
Location wise you couldn't ask for more, short walk to times square. We came in by train to Penn Station and it was just a short walk to the Hotel as well! 

I want to say again how friendly and helpful all the staff was I dealt with, great customer service. 

Even as I discovered a problem after we have left, a short call to Marriott customer Service and within a matter of minutes I had an email from the Hotel helping me to sort the problem out, they even care after you left, that's true customer service and shows that you are important to them even after you left. 

Should I be back in NY I would definitely stay there anytime. 
Go there, sit back and relax you will be taken care of.

title: Director materiel support Airbus ret.
text:
Active  GM and also very nice person
Nothing to complain . Would visit again
For sure .Reception a little bit "upper lip"
but i saw worth in 40 years aviation business where i had to sleep in hundreds  of hotel. Thanks it was worth the money.
Kind rgds p keemss (german) & wife

title: As Good As It Gets
text:
Every single person I encountered, from the staff at the front door, to the bellhop, to the workers in the elevators, to the people in the restaurant, to the tech support fixing my WiFi....was excellent.  I've never had such a pleasant experience.  Room was in pristine shape, everything worked as expected, and it was comfortable.

I believe it was Kenneth who, in the morning, called me to wake me up, and when I got downstairs, had a cab ready for me, my bill, and a newspaper to send me on my way to the airport.  Can't say enough positive things about this hotel.  Really was a great experience...definitely my best experience ever.

title: Nice hotel - centrally located
text: Comfortable and clean room, very friendly staff at the front desk and the bar. Great stay for the price. Excellent location as it is walking decent to all the sights but 8th Avenue can be a bit sketchy and dirty. Overall we enjoyed our stay

title: Another excellent visit
text:
We were here in 2013 and wrote an excellent review.  Our experience was great this time too for a weekend and then another day a couple of weeks later.  Staff is terrific and it is clean, quiet and in a great location between 8th and 9th.  Checking in and out was very quick. It is a short cab ride to the cruise ship terminal. The 05 rooms have large bathrooms and a good view.

An added bonus is that two excellent restaurants, Il Punto and Tavola, are right around the corner on 9th Avenue.  We will definitely stay here again when in New York.

title: Central to all the attractions, a very pleasant place to stay
text: Stayed for 4 nights in a king suite, a very comfortable bed, a large bathroom all kept immaculately clean. The staff were fantastic from the minute we arrived. They found out it was my birthday and when we returned from a walk there was a bottle of red wine, two glasses and a card from the receptionist on the desk. Always  a warm welcome when we came in and able to offer advice when requested. The bistro  on ground floor offers a limited menu but provided an adequate early breakfast,this didn't prove a problem as there are plenty of great eating places close by.On our last day we checked out but having a late fight left our cases in their store. I asked if they could arrange a taxi to the airport for 5.30, to my amazement we were directed to a Lincoln stretched limo waiting outside.A luxury trip to the airport to end a great stay ( and cost less than the Yellow cab that we hired from the airport) £480 for nights was great value and was secured through Booking.com

title: Decent hotel, great location
text: Very comfortable room, friendly and helpful staff, was given option to purchase breakfast for $10 via Booking.com and this was very basic (I would recommend you have breakfast elsewhere). Overall a pleasant experience and would most likely stay again if competitively priced.

title: hotel à conseiller
text:
chambre spacieuse ,très propre, 
petit déjeuner très copieux 
personnels très professionnel 
ordinateurs avec imprimante pour imprimer ses cartes d'embarquement ou autres 
wifi gratuit 
très bien placé pour visiter New York

title: Excelente
text: Hotel é muito bom,não faltou nadinha..Ótima localização,perto de tudo mercados restaurante farmácias,pontos turísticos,fizemos praticamente tudo a pé,camas confortáveis quartos limpos atendimento cordial.super recomendo!

title: 3 jours à NYC
text: Hôtel récent situé au cœur de Manhattan. Nous étions au 15 étage , côté arrière. La chambre était de taille correcte pour NY avec tous les commodités attendues. La réception est très fonctionnelle et le portier est efficace pour gérer les valises et les taxis. Fixez bien à l'avance le prix de la course si c'est un Uber qui vous conduit à l'aéroport. Nous n'avons pas testé mais il y a un bar avec petite restauration au rez de chaussée face aux ascenseurs. En bref, rien d'extraordinaire mais un bon rapport qualité prix.

title: Good choice.
text: Been there 3 days for business, booked at a very reasonable price through my travel agency. Check-in and check-out very smooth. Room a bit tiny, with very good condition and very well clean. Got high floor room and very peaceful during the night. Just a bit surprised that in a rainy day they are not giving the service of borrowing umbrellas. Good value for money and the hotel is 10 mins walking from Times Square and Madison Square Garden.

title: Right in the Center of NYC
text:
Courtyard New York Manhattan is right smack in the center of everything in NYC. It's minutes away from Times Square, Madison square garden, st Patrick's cathedral, Bryant park and many other destinations. 
Many restaurant are found around the hotel, from Shake shack to many other specialty restaurants. 
Although a bit pricey, it's location is its most important feature. You are near everything including bus stations, airporter terminal (on 8th and 40th) and shopping at Macy's .

title: Fine Property, Useful Location, Great Staff, Good Fitness Centre
text:
Was here for two nights in Feb.  Hotel is clean and well appointed.  Rooms lean on small side.  The bar at the bottom has the standard Courtyard restaurant which has a limited menu, but if you are on a time-budget like I was it is very helpful. 

Staff were awesome - friendly, happy to help.  Both at the front desk and bar.
Fitness center is fine - well equipped with entertainment on the cardio.

I'd stay again if I needed to be on this side of the City.

title: Great Weekend
text: We had a great time in New York. The hotel is in a great location where we walked everywhere. The people who work there were top notch. A shout out to Chris Reed who made sure everything went smoothly with bags and our car to airport. The man running the bistro (feb 2-4) was also so helpful! We will stay there again.

title: Great exprience
text: The most satisfied thing for me is, as a gold member, I requested 2:00 PM early check-in and this hotel made it. I can spend whole afternoon on local attractions without worry about my luggages. The one king bedroom is good enough for solo travelers, clean and decent. Although it looks small, it's in the heart of NYC.

title: It has been a long time since I have stayed at the hotel, it is a solid hotel, but I like the one on 40th and 5th better
text: I have not stayed here in maybe 5 years.  Its a typical Courtyard Marriott. It is solid, safe, clean and comfortable. The staff is pretty good. Internet is pretty fast.  Gym is a bit too small and hard to get equipment.  There are a few decent restaurant options around. However, on balance, I prefer the Courtyard Marriott 500 yards away of 40th and 5th.

title: Week long stay in summer
text: Very good value for NYC.  Nice, clean rooms.  I would request a floor on a lower floor so you have stairs as an option.  It can be crowded and elevators in the morning can take long.  Nice cafe in lobby with starbucks coffee in the morning and a respectable happy hour in the early evening.

title: Boa pedida!
text: Ótima localização, muito bom hotel, perto da Times Square, perto de metrô, se quiser tomar café na rua , ótimos locais próximo. Dá pra ir à pé para vários locais: Central Park, Times Square, Grand Central Station, Museus, Madame Tussauds, Teatros...e muitos outros locais. Não tem por que não ficar hospedada nesse hotel. Super indico.

title: Fairly modern, clean pleasant hotel a few blocks from Times Square
text: A typical Courtyard with several distinctive characteristics.  First is the warm, friendly and energetic welcome by Julieth who goes beyond the expected to make arriving g (and staying) guests comfortable.  The rooms are fairly small if there is a king bed in them.  The work space is excellent.  The bathroom is good but small.  The only downside is that the closet furniture has very very limited space to hand any clothes beyond sweater or shirt length.  The ironing board in the closet has to be taken out if one wants to have one or two suits, an interesting problem as there is no room to out the ironing board.  But in this informal age, maybe no one wears suits an more.  Lots of drawer space.  Overall, a very pleasant experience.  During non-high season times, a very good value.

title: A great option to visit NYC
text: In general, the hotel is a perfect location for travelers with medium budget ($300 to $400 US per day). It has great rooms for up to 4 persons. The personnel its nice and always available to help you for anything you need. The only thing that I wuld change is the room service, cause sometimes it appears that the cleaning personnel does not clean the bathroom.

title: Comfortable Budget Hotel
text:
The Courtyard Marriott Hotel on West 37th. Street in Midtown Manhattan is well located and well run.
This is not a luxury hotel but the rooms are comfortable, reasonably well appointed and very clean. The staff are superb.The bar tender, Mario, in particular is totally on top of his job of not just dispensing beverages but also engaging in intelligent conversation.
The food offering is limited but with a wealth of good eateries nearby that is not an issue.

title: Only a few blocks from Times Square
text: I chose this hotel because my daughter had a weekend class at Grier-Ripley Studio which was right across the street. There were 4 of us in the room. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean and up to date.  The room was on the smaller side but we didn't spend a lot of time inside. We  walked to Times Square for dinner and shows each night. Walking straight down 8th all the way to the Theater District was a well populated area at all times... even late at night after the shows. We would definitely stay in this location again. Penn Station was close by as well as Dunkin' Donuts & Starbucks for a quick bite before venturing out.

title: Behagelig Oase midt på Manhattan
text: Hotellet er et behagelig sted å overnatte midt i smørøyet av Manhattan. Serviceminded og svært hyggelig personale, gode  senger og komfortable hotellrom med egen kaffemaskin. Kort vei til Hop On - Hop Off- stasjoner for  Sightseeingbusser ,Empire State Building og Broadway m.m. Rent sengetøy m.m. hver dag.

title: perfectly comfortable and great location
text: The rooms were tiny as usual, but perfectly comfortable.  We were there only one night so not much chance to enjoy the amenities, but I can say that the bartender was excellent, since he was still serving at 11pm when we returned from dinner and site-seeing and made us some excellent cosmos!

title: Best place to explore New York City
text: I had a pleasant 2 day stay at this courtyard, located in between New York Times Square and Penn Station.  So, if you want to watch an event in Times Square or Penn Station, it is an ideal location.  I traveled from Washington DC using Amtrak and after getting off at Penn Station, the hotel was just four blocks away.   The rooms are smaller compared to other metro areas, as it is New York City.  But, they were clean had security in the elevators.  One needs a key card to activate the floor they live on.   The front office staff was cheerful and helpful.  Breakfast is just opposite the elevators and standard courtyard food.   The hotel is located on 37 street between 8 and 9 avenues on the west side.  There are plenty of parking garages located close by.   Many different types of cuisine restaurants are available and the Port Authority Bus station is a block away with its restaurants.  On 9th street there are plenty of restaurants that are not that expensive.  Taking the Hop on Hop off bus is convenient, as there are many stops close to the hotel.   Since, I am a platinum member, I was offered late checkout.   But, could not get a higher floor.  Coming from the airport is convenient too as it is easy to get using shuttle buses that stop near the area.  There is a stop for the Bolt bus a few blocks away.

title: Pleasant stay in NY
text: Nice modern Hotel in excellent location. I attended a fair at Javits center, which is just a few blocks away, as well as many restaurants and clubs. The rooms are very clea, bed is comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpfull. Can recomend it to anyone.

title: excelente ubicación y servicio
text: Buen hotel, quizás un poco costoso para lo que es pero está bien. Habitaciones algo pequeñas pero razonables más aun teniendo en cuenta que estamos en Nueva York. La habitación y el baño modernos, nuevos. La limpieza bien. Todas las personas que nos atendieron allí fueron amables y bien dispuestos. Mucamas, conserjes y también en el desayunador. La habitación cuenta con frigobar, tv, teléfono y calefacción. Tabla de planchar y una cafetera con variedades de té y azúcar. Personal de conserjería siempre encontramos alguien que hablara castellano. Se destaca la ubicación del hotel ya que está a 15 minutos a pie de time square y a 5 de la estación central y de la terminal de ómnibus. El desayunador, que se encuentra en planta baja, es un Starbucks. No hay restaurante, única alternativa (si lo es) es el starbucks.  Es un hotel sencillo, moderno, más bien pequeño y con algunas restricciones en los servicios (desayuno limitado y falta de restaurante), pero todo lo demás que se ofrece es de muy buena calidad.

title: Nice hotel with a great location
text: This is a modern hotel in an excellent location, within easy walking distance to Times Square, Madison Square Garden and Broadway. The rooms are a good size and maintained to a high standard, as is the rest of the hotel. The entire hotel was clean and spacious.

title: Super Lage!
text:
Wir waren über Weihnachten/ Silvester hier und die Lage war top! Times Square locker zu Fuß erreichbar, ebenso wie Central Park, Rockefeller Center, High Line - wir sind sogar bis zum Ground Zero gekommen (zu Fuß) :) dennoch, eine U-Bahn Station 2 Blocks entfernt.
Personal sehr hilfsbereit. Kleines modernes Zimmer (klein in New York völlig normal) Kingsize Bett erfüllt fast den ganzen Raum. Alles vorhanden was man braucht. Bad geräumig, Schrank allerdings bisschen ungünstig aufgeteilt, wenn man Sachen aufhängen möchte. 
Kostenloses, sehr schnelles WIFI und Fitnessstudio nutzbar. Frühstück hatten wir nicht gebucht, aber in der Umgebung gibts genug Restaurants um die Food-Hauptstadt der Welt kennenzulernen. 
Ruhig, trotz der zentralen Lage, unser Zimmer lag im 19. Stock im Hinterhof. 
Wüsste nicht warum ich das Hotel nicht empfehlen sollte. :)

title: Very clean and polite staff
text: The hotel is very good! Super clean, super cozy. It has 3 lifts so you will hardly get a crowded lift (as it has happened to me at another hotel where I had to wait an incredible 38 minutes to get off in the morning). The rooms are super fresh and clean. Wonderful bed! Bathroom with shower and no tub (I hate bathtub). Soap and shampoo by Paul Mitchel's (provided by the hotel)! LED TV in bedroom, with various channels in hd! Great location (one block from Madison Square Garden). Would definitely stay there again and recommend to all.

title: Excelente ubicación, buen descanso pero escaso servicio
text:
Maravillosa ubicación, a 5 minutos caminando de times square, habitaciones con cama grande y buen servicio de limpieza. Los desayunos son de Starbucks así que es una buena opción si quieres salir desayunado del hotel, servicio amable y camareros hablan ingles y español sin ningún problema.
Ahora bien, soy una persona que trabaja en la hostelería y se lo que es trabajar en una recepción por eso he de decir que el servicio de concierge y recepción de este hotel es si mas no escaso. 
Os voy a contar mi propia experiencia: llegamos al hotel, me hacen el check in todo correcto, mi sorpresa llega cuando veo que en mi visa me han cargado 200$ sin avisarme! Resultaron ser en concepto de depósito y encima no te los reembolsan hasta 2/3 días después de tu check out, no es su trabajo informar a los clientes?
El servicio del Concierge...no da ningún servicio, nosotras le preguntamos donde comprar los city pass y no mando a un sitio erróneo... 
Y por último, contratamos un transfer para ir al aeropuerto de regreso, se tenia que llamar a un teléfono gratuito para concertar la hora de recogida 24h antes, cuando pedimos ayuda al recepcionista nos dice que llamemos desde nuestra habitación. Sinceramente he sido recepcionista y si me han solicitado ayuda he sido yo la que he hecho las llamadas para atender a mis clientes y ofrecerles un buen servicio.
Eso si, disponen de ordenadores y impresoras totalmente gratuitos para que puedas gestionar tus tarjetas de embarque, transfers...

title: Chewingum e overbookin
text:
Hotel moderno, con WIFI gratuito FUNZIONANTE. Ottima posizione. Peccato il personale alla reception SCORTESE. Al nostro arrivo ci ha accolto un ragazzo in addestramento che masticava e faceva palloncini con la cicca.
Prima ci ha detto che avevamo 2 camere prenotate (una era stata cancellata 10 giorni prima) ma "che non ci avrebbero addebitato nulla" e poi ci ha comunicato che l'hotel era pieno e che pertanto ci avrebbero trovato un altro hotel per la prima notte.
Senza parole

title: Thanks giving in NYC
text:
Perfect location as its located in the mid of  Manhattan. Walking distance to Macy, Port Authority, Penn Station and Times Square. Was staying there for Thanks Giving, great distance to walk to the parade. 

Comfortable bed. Fast check in. Free wifi. Overall it's a good experience.

title: Girls 5 night stay
text: Great location! Fantastic staff! Lovely clean room! We went on the 1st of Dec for five nights and I would really recommend this hotel! They booked us on trips and couldn't have been more helpful especially Chris!

title: Fiquem Longe!
text: É a 4ª vez que viajo para New York e nunca me tinha acontecido tal. Após a nossa saída o hotel bloqueou dois valores diferentes no nosso cartão de credito de cerca de $1000 cada um! Após o nosso contacto sempre disseram que a culpa era do nosso banco e que não tinham cometido erro nenhum, até que, uma semana após recebemos um email em que finalmente assumem que tinha existido um erro e por que forma o poderiam resolver. Tivemos o dinheiro bloqueado uma semana no nosso cartão (o prazo que o mesmo fica retido no nosso cartão em Portugal), em que o nosso banco informava que teria de ser o hotel a dar ordem de desbloqueio e o hotel a mostrar os emails que tinha enviado para o seu banco a pedir para desbloquearem o valor e mais não poderiam resolver. Teriam resolvido em muito se não tivessem utilizado o meu cartão indevidamente! Sinto-me lesada e conseguiram estragar o resto da minha viagem pelos EUA. Não voltarei nem aconselho este hotel a ninguém, até porque além de ser muito mau o que fizerem que inicialmente não tinham culpa, uma semana após o acontecimento e o meu banco ter resolvido o problema, finalmente assumem o erro cometido.

title: A clean and comfortable place in the middle of the city
text: We stayed 4 nights in that clean, cosy and comfortable hotel from where it was easy to walk to almost every spots we wanted to go in Mahattan. The service were kind and efficient and we did not ear any sound from the rooms nearby. Very peaceful! We couldn't find a better place to stay as the price was also very reasonable.

title: Excellent NYE stay....
text: Hotel is fairly new, excellent location to Times Square, clean, staff was very friendly...would definitely return when in the area, rooms were fairly large compared to other hotels in the area, and affordable.

title: Cozy hotel in the middle of NYC
text: We were trully suprised, noticing that our room is super quiet, not something you would expect next to timesquare. Rooms is a little bit small, but really cozy. Nice Courtyard and definetly worth staying.

title: Good & reasonable priced hotel near Times Square
text: Hotel is nicely located in a walking distance to Times Square, Penn station, Empire State building but on quiet street. Hotel is not big, clean and comfortable. Room size is may be  not big by common Americans ideas but is fully fit to Europeans expectations. Beds are convenient and comfortable. Bathroom is big and equipped with everything needed. There is a small bistro on the ground floor that is good for  breakfast or glass of vine in the night. Staff is professional, polite, kind and ready to help.

title: Nice hotel.  Great staff!
text: Very friendly employees. Lots of rooms with limited elevators but not an issue. Small rooms but its New York! Good value. And nice amenities like breakfast and happy hour. Somewhat off the beaten path but not an issue.

title: Hotel à conseiller
text: Idéalement situé, cet établissement mérite le détour: les chambres sont confortables, très propres et au calme. Le personnel(réception, ménage et restaurant) sont toujours souriants, disponibles et prêts à rendre service! Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cet hotel et avons été très satisfaits. Nous y retournerons sans aucune hésitation.

title: Hotel de excelente ubicación y muy cómodo.
text:
El hotel se encuentra en una ubicación muy buena, dado que está cerca de varios de los puntos neurálgicos del turismo como Time Square, 5ta avenida, Bryan Park, acceso al Metro, cerca de los teatros. 
La habitación que nos dieron fue cómoda, no inmensa pero realmente no necesitamos más y en Nueva York, el tamaño medio de las habitaciones no suele ser generoso. La cama era muy confortable. 
El baño era muy grande y la ducha espectacular. Una delicia bañarse a la vuelta de un día de caminata. 
La atención de todo el personal de recepción (y los de limpieza que nos cruzamos) es de destacar. Muy amables y atentos a nuestras inquietudes. La mayoría hablaba español lo que simplificó terriblemente la comunicación. 
Tiene instalaciones como gimnasio pero que no llegamos a utilizar. 
Muy recomendable.

Sería mejor poder contar con un desayuno buffet para poder resolver la primera comida del día antes de salir del hotel. 
Un punto especialmente negativo para el servicio de compra de tickets para espectáculos. 
Dentro del lobby del hotel hay un punto de atención de una empresa que ofrece venta de tickets para los teatros de la ciudad. Hemos tenido una pésima experiencia con ellos porque nos ofrecieron entradas de 3 niveles de precio siendo la más cara los asientos del nivel escenario, siguiendo los del primer piso y por último los asientos del segundo piso. Compramos las entradas más caras (nivel escenario) y nos enviaron asientos del primer piso. 
Reclamamos (en esta gestión nos ayudó muy amablemente Stephanie de recepción) y nos engañaron diciendo que fuéramos a una dirección a cambiar los tickets y cuando llegamos, desconocieron que los fueran a cambiar. 
Ya los tickets los cobraron un 60% más caros que su valor por el servicio (¿!) (pagamos usd 160 por cada uno y el valor del ticket era de usd 99) y encima nos engañaron con las ubicaciones y nos hicieron perder más tiempo. 
Realmente una vergüenza. No utilicen este servicio. Compren sus entradas por internet. 
Finalmente el hotel, honrando su buena disposición a los clientes, al ver que la empresa de tickets no se hizo cargo del problema nos hizo un descuento en la cuenta final de la estadía compensando la diferencia entre el tipo de ticket que compramos y el que nos dieron. 
Un aplauso para ellos por este gesto pero un punto a revisar con la empresa a la que permiten vender tickets dentro de su lobby dado que ensucia su buen servicio.

title: Girls Trip to NYC
text:
We took a girls trip to NYC and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It was a great experience. Location is convenient to Macy's, Time Square, Empire State Building, etc.  

The room was  immediately across the hall from the elevator. We were initially worried it would be loud because of the high traffic area but it wasn't; we never heard the first noise from the hall (and we're light sleepers). Also, the room was clean and well serviced each day when we went out to sightsee. The in room heat/air system kept the room as warm/cool as we wanted it to be. 

The front desk staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and customer oriented. The concierge, Amber, was extremely helpful as well. Specifically, one day we were going to take the subway to Chinatown and she gave us specific directions on how to get there and back via the subway system (being tourist the subway can be intimidating but she took all the intimidation out of it and was so helpful!). Lastly, the hotel was safe and secure because a room key was required to access all guest floors. 

We enjoyed our stay and will be back.

title: Not suitable for winter and bad cuisine
text:
I've been staying in this hotel for 5 days and have negative experience due to:
1) the room is not equipped with proper heating system. There is an air conditioner that blows hot air, but a) it's located just on the level of bed and pulls the air directly into you and b) you quickly get stifling feeling. As a result, sleeping under the conditioner 2 nights in a row caused severe cold and I fell ill which completely spoiled my trip and impaired my performance. I had to get by without the conditioner for the rest of my stay of course, which was no more pleasurable - it's cold in the bathroom as well as in a bedroom.
2) The choice of food in the buffet leaves much to be desired

In addition there were payment issues. Overall, a place to sleep if you go in a warm season (during summer the use of conditioner will get you sick as well) and if you plan to eat outside.

Price is high as everywhere in Manhattan.

Do not recommend.

title: Descanso y proximidad
text:
Aunque hay que reconocer que en el Hotel vas a estar poco tiempo estaba preocupado por las malas críticas que tenían los hoteles en New York pues buscaba un hotel bien situado, cerca del metro con una habitación suficientemente amplia, cómoda y limpia y a un precio aceptable y aunque el  Hotel  Courtyard New York Manhattan/Times Square West, barato no es, comparado con otras ofertas, ha sido un verdadero acierto.

Hotel muy bien situado a muy poca distancia de Madison Square,  del  metro, con posibilidad de llegar con el metro desde el aeropuerto, próximo a la estación de autobuses y con bastantes lugares, muy cercanos, para desayunar o cenar. El personal de recepción y bar encontrarás de todo, la mayoría  realmente amables predispuestos a ayudar y alguno/a,  todo lo contrario.

Aunque los dos primeros días nos alojamos en una habitación con unas medidas bastantes amplias no era la mejor opción para pasar 7 días por la falta de intimidad que tenía, se nos ofreció la posibilidad de cambiar la habitación por otra más pequeña  pero más luminosa y con vistas despejadas y aún así las medidas de la habitación y del baño fueron más que suficientes para no estar  incómodo y poder tener las maletas, abrigos, etc, sin que molestarán ni sentirte agobiado. Si tienes la posibilidad pide las habitaciones más altas, vale la pena. La cama muy cómoda y pese a que el ruido de la calle es inevitable,  nos permitió dormir y descansar a gusto. La limpieza, unos días mejor que otros pero aceptable.

Si tienes claro que vas a New York reserva con tiempo para conseguir una buena oferta porque este Hotel tiene lo que necesitas para poder disfrutar de unas buenas vacaciones.

title: Our stay at Marriott Courtyard Times Square West was STELLAR!
text:
Arriving just the day before the Rockefeller Plaza Christmas tree was lit, and in NYC for the whole 'Holiday Experience', our home for the week at this Marriott property exceeded expectations.

I've stayed in NYC on 3  other occasions and assumed that small rooms, smaller bathrooms and detached, uninterested staff were the Big Apple norm. Not here! From the moment we arrived, we were treated wonderfully. The staff managed to find us a room with 2 queen beds (at the time of booking there was only a king. I like my travelling companion-- but not THAT much 😀) . They were so helpful and patient during what was going to be a very busy week for them. Make sure to get them to book you car service to La Guardia or JFK, when you leave. Our trip in via Viator shuttle bus was disappointing. Not worth the 8 or $10 you save in money. Trust me, your time, the waiting for a van that's late and a driver that doesn't give a rat's patootie, not worth it. Especially if there's more than one of you. 

So back to the hotel:  standard room size that you'd find in a good property in nearly any other city, with a large bathroom. Very unlike other New York hotel, unless you want to pay double! Clean, clean, clean. Hooray, for that. And amazingly, while located in the busy 'Garment District' they must use triple pane windows in that hotel. We were on the 5 th floor of 30-- and once you closed the window it was so quiet.

The gym was good, not huge but certainly had good equipment, different cardio machines, weights, headsets, water, etc. Open 24/7 which served me well.

A small dining room, open for breakfast till 10:30 am and that reopens at around 5 pm. But with so many dining options in NYC, from super cheap to very expensive, I think it's silly to eat there, unless you're really pressed for time. The Essen deli (a great little eat-in or grab ' n go place has breakfast sandwiches made fresh, a juice bar and a hot/ cold buffet that is a great way to get going.

The hotel is located so centrally to the rest of Manhattan that it would be hard to justify going to a place that is buried deeper uptown or downtown, unless you have a few weeks to explore. You just choose a section of the city and it's a lovely 1.5 hour walk north/south. We had 7 days so being close to shopping, the theatres, the High Line and so many other attractions meant we weren't stuck far away from anything.  We took the subway once, during the whole trip. And that was only because we had walked the Brooklyn Bridge one way, it was getting dark, and we were hungry.

So, far all the reasons here, I would highly recommend the Marriott Courtyard Times Square West.

title: muito pratico
text: hospedei-me neste hotel de 25/11/16, a 01/12/2016, nao o conhecia, fiquei impressionado pela praticidade por estar muito proximo da time square, o atendimento, tanto no chek-in, como no chek-out, foi sensacional, muito atenciosos,inclusive tive problemas com o ar condicionado, que estava com defeito, reclamei, tentaram arrumar, nao conseguiram e me trocaram de quarto, muito bom voltarei

title: Dissatisfied.
text:
I am a Marriott rewards member looking for a hotel in December 9 weekend this hotel ,
Will take advantage of you do to the Christmas holidays.
They CLAIM to have views of the city,not so your room is so small it is hard to believe,the view will be brick walls,time square is blocks away,
My rate was 695.00  A night, now if I had any idea what I was I for not a chance I ever stay at that Marriott courtyard again. 
By the way the price per night would have been ok if you got a  Quality  Hotel.

title: Reasonably priced and close to Penn Station
text: Enjoyed a one night stay in this very clean and comfortably appointed hotel. Service at check in and their breakfast staff were very courteous. Kudos to Chris their bellman! He was extremely kind and helpful with luggage, information and obtaining taxi service. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Quick trip
text: Great overnight stay at this hotel.  Front desk staff were welcoming, professional and provided a great recommendation for a quick bite to eat around the corner before a last-minute show.  Arrived back from the show late at night, after walking through a downpour.  Although the gentleman at the lobby restaurant was counting his register to close up, he gladly accommodated my request to grab a quick beverage.
