text: Es un hotel centrico de NY (cerca de times square, penn station, teatros- puedes llegar caminando) ademas puedes salir y comer en los alrededores. Tienen servicio de pago de wi-fi. Preferimos tomar alimentos fuera del hotel. El servicio del personal, es excelente. Hay quienes hablan español para quien lo necesita. Puede visitarte en cualquier tipo de viajes (familiar, amigos, en pareja, de negocios).

title: Muito bom
text: Hotel muito bom. Bem localizado. Ao lado de uma estação de metrô. Um mercado bem ao lado. Fizemos quase tudo a pé.  Atendimento prestativo.  Boa area de lazer com academia,  lanchonete,  espaço de convivência etc

title: Location is very good
text: The rooms are small but very nice. Don't expect to throw a party in a standard room. A very nice place to stay, close to subway stops and some good places to eat as well as a 7eleven around the corner which is convenient if you don't want to pay $3 for a coke. Parking nearby is expensive but service is great.

title: Nice hotel short visit
text: Stayed here one night to attend a trade show. Hotel was what you would expect for a Courtyard; good service clean comfortable room. No complaints at all. I stayed in a room ending with 05 it had a different configuration to most rooms it was small be very efficient and had a large bathroom. Did not experience much else. I am not use to NYC's high prices but was told that 278.00 a night is pretty good for the area. It was a breeze to walk to and from Jevits Center.

title: Tiny rooms
text:
We spent a night here between our stays in Boston and Washington before coming back for a full week in NYC, for which we'd rented an apartment - this was centrally located, and the main reason I booked this hotel specifically was that it was close enough to the Midtown sights we planned on seeing on that day but also in walking distance from where our bus came in and from where our bus to DC was leaving (different stops).

Check-in was fast though not very welcoming (check-out was a different concierge, and much better) and the room... I've never seen a smaller room, and certainly not for the price they charged. We had two suitcases, and didn't even have enough space to comfortably open the one. One of us would have to sit down on the bed for the other to access the bathroom (which, on the other hand, was very nice, though the water pressure in the shower could've been better). The wifi was also very, very poor.

It was fine for one night, but I don't think we'd consider staying here again - the room would've been perfectly fine for a solo traveller, but definitely not for a couple.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Room size was large and well appointed for a NYC hotel. Well maintained, accommodating staff. Location overall was great if you are in town to see a show. Unfortunately, next door to the hotel was a needle drop off site so during the day it seemed to be sketchy group of individuals.

title: Hidden gem
text:
Nestled on 37 th street right off of the main strip at 8th, this hotel was a prize. Check in was a breeze and the concierge, Inez was a pleasure asking the nature of our getaway and kindly offering directions to the nearby attractions. Room was smallish (but not for New York City) but nicely appointed with a desk, fridge, comfy chair, lots of ports for charging devices, and free wifi. It was both clean and updated. There is also a small bar/lounge/Starbucks off of the main lobby. The only negative was that we could here the flushing of a toilet(s) in a nearby room(s), but no real inconvenience. 

Overall a great stay.

title: FANTANSTIC!!
text: The hotel looks fantastic. The lobby is very modern, along with the rooms. The bed was quite comfortable with plenty of pillows, the air conditioner is super confusing though. Tons of food to order that deliver, just ask the front desk. The bistro food was very convenient also, Julian and his drinks at the bar are amazing. All the staff were nice and friendly. Check in went smooth, plenty of staff to check people in.

title: Ótima escolha em NY
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, fica no coração da cidade, próximo à Times Square e da Macys. O quarto tem tamanho muito bom para NY e era muito confortável, cama king excelente e banheiro muito amplo (fiquei em um quarto adaptado para deficientes). O atendimento em geral foi cordial. A academia do hotel era relativamente boa. Com certeza ficaria novamente no hotel.

title: 小さいホテルですが、ハードもソフトも及第点
text:
家族で２部屋に宿泊しました。
旅行代理店を通しての予約で、３ヶ月前に３泊の予定を１日遅らせて２泊に変更して予約を完了させていましたが、当日チェックインの際にフロントの女性から「前日からの予約で昨日チェックインしていないから予約が消えている」と言われました。
私が持っていたので現地旅行代理店発行の「Hotel Voucher」を提示して「予約の変更が完了している」ことを伝え、何とかチェックインできました。
しかし、予約時に確約できていたはずの『コネクティングルームでツイン２部屋』ではなく、『隣り合わせ』でもなく、向い合わせの２部屋となってしまいました。
このようなことは、海外では日常茶飯事でしょうから「Voucher」の所持は必須ですね。

ホテルのお部屋自体は、設備もチェックイン時以外の対応も及第点でした。
ホテルの場所は、ダウンタウンに近い場所に有ってホテル周辺は少し汚いです。
セブンイレブンがすぐそばにあるので、日本人にもおすすめできると思います。

title: Off Broadway but easier to get to..
text: Will continue to stay here!  Staff was amazing and very helpful!  Even though they are not on Broadway, it actually makes it easier to get in and out of!  Alex was an amazing help and very friendly!  We did have to hire a car one day and it was so easy for him to park right out front on a very cold day to pick us up.  Love the happy hour in the hotel and the staff was so kind to surprise us with wine and fruit to celebrate my birthday.

title: Good location
text: Well located in the middle of Manhattan, you won't be far from anything. Lot of restaurant located nearby the hotel since limited outlets available. The rooms are well appointed and cleaned. Staff is charming and very helpful. Does the job

title: One nice hotel.
text: We like smaller hotels and more quiet hotels but we always wish to be in good parts of the city for sightseeing and Courtyard was exactly this. For visiting all the important attractions of the New York city it is the excellent you want close to Empire building, Rockefeller Centre and Central Park. If you go to Central park look inside the Plaza hotel which is very famous and very expensive and this is where you see in most films.

title: Great location and clean room!
text: The mobile check app is fantastic. We checked in while still on the train and was sent a message when the room was ready. We were able to check in early and after a 9 hour train ride, that was great. Check in was easy. Just picked up the keys. Celebrated my husband's milestone birthday and received complementary breakfast coupons. The room was clean, but smaller than we were use to, but from our understanding that is probably the standard. We had a king sized bed. Bathroom very clean and well maintained. The small refrigerator located in the closet did not work well. Ice is only located on floors 3, 5, 7, and 9 and we were on 23, but the elevator zipped me down and up in a jiffy. All the staff we encountered were pleasant and respectful. Marie from house keeping was great, but the plastic shower liner was outside the tub and I turned the shower on and got water on the floor, but it was my fault for not checking. We were street side so the view was only of other buildings and with only 27 floors there was not much to see. I asked for an upgrade to a higher floor, but was advised it would cost about $400 more which I did not feel was worth it. It was easy to get to from Penn Station. After a family member drove us through the city, I needed a glass of wine to calm my nerves and the gentlemen working in the Bistro was kind and quick. He had a wonderful smile and asked me to sit back and relax and he brought out the wine and our order and everything was okay. Only concern is that there appears to be a health clinic next door and there was some unsavory looking characters standing on the street, but did not particularly feel unsafe. You need your key card to access any floor from the elevator except for the lobby so the extra security is a plus. Overall, great folks, great location and if we return, we would stay again.

title: Clean, comfortable and great location
text:
Stayed at this hotel for the weekend. The room was small but that is how it is in New York City. More important than the size of the room, it was really clean. The bathroom was spotless. The room was quiet (we were not on the street side), there was no traffic or elevator noise. 
The location is very convenient. It is within a walking distance to a lot of attractions like Times Square, Broadway etc. Penn Station is close by to take the subway.
The parking garage was convenient, close to the hotel and more spacious than a regular parking garage.

title: Here we go
text:
Just arrived and first disappointment. So what do I first? Write this review before I calm down. 
I'm a gold member with Marriott. I've been mistreated in big cities before: the Marquis in SF was the recent one. Never back. 
Now I'm with my son for a day to see Pearl Jam (yay!). Arrive and ask for an upgrade or change to a two bed room... (Which we should get for being gold) No sir. We are completely full. Nothing, not a hint of let me try and see. Nope. Unless you pay for an upgrade? Dude, I'll be in and out of this hotel and not gonna pay a single cent over what the rooms are. Bad attitude and you get nothing from me. 
If I have to pay for an upgrade it means they have them. Cross this one out too. 
Time to go for a walk and enjoy the city. 
Stay out of this one and its tricks.

title: Expensive for what you get
text:
Been there last week for 2 nights, room was too small and disappointed and stuff wasn't helpful.
Had to talk with assistant guest service manager 
 named Jina Lee to get some attention and other room.
She was very kind and the reason we didn't left to other hotel.
Breakfast is Good, about 5-8 minutes from subway.

title: Superbe hôtel
text:
Très bon hôtel. Le personnel est vraiment très gentil, serviable, à l'écoute et accueillant. Chambre spacieuse, ménage impeccable, très propre. calme.Très bonnes prestations
petit déjeuner très bon...
Hôtel super bien situé pour visiter New York.

title: Lifetime
text:
Very friendly and helpful staff. I found that the wardrobe space was inadequate and there was  no room to put your wash bag or ladies makeup bag in the bathrooms. However I spoke to staff and they where aware of this problem...
The hotel in a good position for sight seeing ..

title: Clean with Friendly Staff
text: Room was small but very clean.  Staff was very helpful and friendly. Location was a convenient walk to Penn Station and Port Authority which made it easy to get to the subway. Not being that familiar with the city, I found the location wasn't right in the middle of Times Square but rather felt like a more quiet side street.

title: Amazed by how bad it can be
text: I am a platinum premier member and spend 150-200 nights In Marriott propertis around the country. It says that it is a time square hotel but it's 2 blocks and 5 streets away. Also on the Marriott app, there is no address or phone number to call. I have to call other Marriott in the area to find the address and contact for this hotel. When I reached the hotel, I asked why is that and they said oh it's weird and that was the end of the conversation. Room looked nice but bed sheets and pillows had many stains. I doubt that they even wash it before giving the room to next guests. So far any Marriott I have stayed, a manager or someone In charge will call to make sure that every thing is ok but no sign of any one to ask about the feedback. I would stay away from this so called category 8 hotel which has qualities of less then category 1. I wish they had requested to write a review in the Marriott website but they didn't.

title: Great Location, Great staff
text:
We stayed in this hotel last weekend. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in New York City. But more importantly they were immaculate. King bed room had a beautiful walk in shower. Nice breakfast to buy in the lobby with spacious and lean tables. 

The most impressive thing about this hotel was the staff. I have traveled quite a bit and I have never encountered a nicer group of people, including the front desk, the housekeeping staff, the restaurant staff, and even the staff people we met in the elevator. It was such a pleasant change from the usual. 

There is parking available in a garage three doors down for $45 a night. They were extremely pleasant also. 

The location is excellent especially if you want to take the train from Penn Station. It is also close to many attractions and shopping. 

All in all a good hotel for a reasonable price (for New York City.)

title: Good comfortable hotel
text: Stayed with my partner for 4 nights in November 2015. Had a great stay. Very small room which I believe is standard for New York City. Great location in Manhattan, close to Times Square, Broadway etc. Clean room, good shower, friendly staff. Would stay here again.

title: A Good Experience
text:
The room was nice, but small. Everything was very clean -- the staff was helpful, and there is parking nearby - we stayed from Friday to Sunday and the parking was $90 and a few feet away in a garage. 

The cafe (The Bistro) was very nice, a little pricey, but they have a happy hour everyday. The environment was modern and beautiful, but they were only open in the morning and evening and close during lunch hours. 

 There is also a 24 hour area to get snacks. The fitness center was very nice - and clean as well.

title: Comfy and Cozy
text: We stayed at the hotel for its convenient location to the Javits Center. We stayed the first week of March for the IBS Exhibit. Very convenient location . Staff was nice. Off the beaten path, so it was remarkably quiet at night even with the windows open in the room. The room was a good size. We had a refrigerator in the room which was convenient for snacks and leftovers.The room was clean and ac worked well, as we had a warm March day. Dunkin Donuts at the end of the block for coffee although he hotel had a nice breakfast bar. We did get a couple of yogurt parfaits for breakfast which were very good. A short walk to Times Square and to Penn Station. Would definately stay again.

title: NY Easter Break - In the Heart of the Big Apple!
text:
We stayed four nights at this hotel over Easter. 2 adults and 2 children in a 1 room with 2 double beds.

This was a very reasonably priced option. The hotel is clean and quite quiet considering its locations to close to Time Square. Many attractions are in walking distance and the subway is just around the corner. I am sure there are many great hotels in NYC but I considered the Courtyard as good value for money and predictable quality.

title: No complaint
text:
Typical Manhattan hotel that goes up vertically. Each floor has only a few rooms. Very small lobby. the front desk is basically three separate reception desks. Did not spend much time in the hotel besides sleeping so the amenities did not matter.  I did not expect this to be a typical Marriott Courtyard in the suburbs.

Room was small and a bit dated but very clean, which was all I needed.  I would stay here again for the location (which is only a few blocks to Time Square and Penn Station).

title: Hotel de calidad mediana
text:
Este hotel está bien ubicado pero carece de un lobby aceptable los serviciodps del hotel son mediocres 
La habitación es extremadamente pequeña y el baño no corresponde al estándar marriot 
Lo único que salva a este hotel es la excelente ubicación eso sí la aislacionista del ruido de l calle es excelente

title: Chrismas in nyc
text: Prenotato tramite booking. Doppia matrimoniale poco prima di natale 3 notti a 270 dollari. Cosa pretendere di più?  A ny i prezzi medi ben più alti. Hotel in ogni caso ottimo pulito e in posizione strategica. Unica pecca manca la colazione ma cosa vuoi di più?

title: Great value, clean and good location
text: We stayed 5 nights on our honeymoon in March. For the price, this is an excellent hotel. Good location, minutes from Times Square and just alone from Penn Station and the shops on 34th Street. Our room was a decent size for a city hotel and was very clean. Very quiet hotel, we were never disturbed. Staff friendly on check in and helpful when we had a few questions. Would recommend.

title: Good value for NYC
text: Up to Courtyard standards for neat, clean, and value.  Convenient midtown location.  Rooms are small, and a bit cramped...not good for families with children.  At least the room I had which was suitable for me as I was on business traveling solo and spent very little time in the room beyond sleeping.  For that purpose it was fine.  I do appreciate they provided a micro fridge inside the armoire.

title: Molto buono MA...
text: Posizione centrale, camera adeguata,silenzioso, letto confortevole, purtroppo il personale di reception non cortese, la camera non veniva rassettata se non su esplicita ed insistente richiesta ed il bagno era privo di riscaldamento nel senso che mancava proprio...

title: très bien !
text: super emplacement pour visiter New York, le personnel est très gentil et serviable, nous avions une chambre familiale avec 2 lits queen size confortable, au 16eme vue sur cour  pas terrible mais aucun bruit, très propre. Tout était très bien hormis un oubli de passage du service ménage... pas bien grave mais vive la boite de kleenex car 2 jours de suite pas de papier toilette :-/ et les 3 derniers jours pas de café...

title: Nice hotel, probably not ideal for families with young children
text:
It's a Courtyard, and it lives up to the brand.  

Pros:  Rooms good size for NYC, well-kept.  Safe neighborhood.  Bar in lobby, along with a cafe for breakfast.  Never saw the menu, but they do serve other meals.  "Quiet" neighborhood.  Secure access to floors.  Nice gym.   In Garment District. 

Cons: A little too far from a subway stop for my liking.  This was rough when you have spent the day out.  No complimentary breakfast.  Wish there was a deli or a breakfast/bagel/sandwich shop closer for a real NYC breakfast. Front staff was very aloof, not very welcoming or friendly.

title: Small Room, but Modern and Clean, Decent Location
text: I wound up staying here for business and it was good choice. The location is decent, a little on the fringe of bus station and Times Square, so just keep aware of where you are going.  The hotel itself was very modern.  The room was small, but typical for NYC.  The bathroom was super clean with modern fixtures, which is huge for me.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Had a very good stay.

title: A good hotel in the heart of New York
text:
I was only supposed to be in New York for a couple of days and hence, decided to stay in the midst of all the fun and stumbled upon Courtyard by Marriott. The hotel has an amazing location, just a few blocks from New York Times Square and Central Park. 
The hotel does not have a super luxurious feel, but more like a business hotel. The rooms are small, but nice and clean. The bathroom size is pretty good. Food has good flavor, but the reception staff could be a little more courteous. Beware that the hotel is pretty strict about its check in timings, however the lounge & restaurant is a good place to spend your time while you check out the buildings that surround the hotel.
If location is important for you, this hotel more than fits the bill.

title: Buen hotel
text: la ubicación es, desde luego, su mejor característica. El personal es atento y muy correcto. Las habitaciones para ser NYC están muy bien de tamaño y están bien decoradas. los baños tienen buen tamaño. todo muy limpio

title: Clean and safe
text: Though the rooms are small and the view from our room was not good, it was very clean and we felt safe. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was helpful in answering questions and making plans for transportation. It was within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway shows.

title: Excelente ubicación, hotel normal.
text:
Lo mejor del hotel es su ubicacion: queda a sólo 2 o 3 cuadras de Penn Station lo cual te permite movilizarte por toda la ciudad. Ademas, está a una distancia razonable de Times Square por lo que se puede caminar hasta ahí.
A pocas cuadras del hotel también está el Macy's de Herald Square, el más grande del mundo. También hay un H&M y UrbanOutfitters por si son tu estilo.
A media cuadra hay un 7 eleven, lo cual me parece un buen plus pues siempre resulta útil este tipo de tiendas, sobretodo si te provoca una bebida o snack de último momento y no quieres pagar los precios súper inflados del market del hotel.
Muy cerca también encuentras un T-mobile, por 40 dólares te ponen chip con 3gb, esto fue indispensable para mí pues así pude usar google maps durante el viaje y no perderme (al menos no tanto).
El wifi del hotel nunca conectó.
El hotel mismo es bueno, pero nada espectacular, al menos mi habitación que era de las simples. Por el precio esperaba algo más, pero supongo que la zona es un factor determinante para el precio que ponen, así que no me quejo.
Tiene ducha de pie, lo cual fue una decepcion. Después de caminar por horas, hubiera sido genial tener tina.
El personal muy amable y siempre hay alguien en recepción que habla español por si el inglés no es tu fuerte.

title: One of the good services and helfull hotels
text: You  are welcome with a smile cant do enough for you and the rooms where very good , well spaced out for a main city room good food on tap and great local info for us who have not been here before  Get a room near the top of the hotel for some great views  Nice room to chill and look out over New York

title: Avery good hotel right on time sq  at the end of the road and the service was the best in town good staff and very clean
text: a great place to unwind after a day of looking round New York   Great location good rooms with great staff  , very helpful  so easy to get around  from the hotel and the locals are so helpful We will say get a bus or tube so easy to get on  and very good service  walk around the sights are so close to time sq  we loved the food here great places to eat . we shall be back soon  well worth a visit .... but mind the tramps

title: Simply VFM
text: For me New York is simply expensive and hence when you get a hotel for less than US$100, you know you got a great deal. Courtyard by Marriott New York Times Square has great location, decent sized rooms and functional amenities. Even gave us a complimentary upgrade to a twin room. Staffs great too. Did not try their food. Overall in New York this is a sold option and one to beat at this price point.

title: Convenient, clean, quiet, comfy
text: This is very conveniently located. Immaculate with the friendly staff and close to everything. Comfortable bed & pillows, small convenience store and a parking garage nearby. It is far enough from the chaos of Time Square to be enjoyable.

title: Très bon hôtel,  dommage d'y servir un petit dej aussi nul....!
text:
Très bon emplacement à proximité des commerces, métro, principaux sites...
Bonne literie, propre, calme, bon agencement de la chambre et équipements tels que fer à repasser, sèche cheveux, machine à café. ...
Wifi très performant...
En séjour en réservation de groupe petit dej NUL...digne de nos anciens Formule1,  café dans thermos ! Viennoiseries limitées - dont un matin des croissants coupés en deux. .! - pas de salé.....attention il convient d arriver tôt petite salle.

Un bon service bagagerie

title: More like a budget hotel
text: Tucked away down W37th street the check-in was easy and the front of house staff brilliant. Our room was at the back so very quiet, not the W 37th is a busy street. Black out shades assure good nights sleep after a long journey. The mini bar fridge is a joke. No stock and is what appewars to be a miniature glass fronted wine fridge.One coffee sachet per day is a bit on the mean side and the toiletry top ups were a mish mash, 2 conditioner no shampoo opn 1 day. There is a guest laundry on the basement level. The instructions are a little sparse as there is no indication of how much a wash or dry load costs. I found out $4 per load in 25 cent coin so be prepared to ask the front desk for $8 of 25cent pieces. Detergent is available for purchase from the "market in the lobby". Overall I would consider this a budget style accomodation but not reflected in the cost.

title: Ottimo albergo in ottima posizione
text:
Ho prenotato questo albergo in occasione di una sosta breve a Manhattan, dopo averlo visto in offerta a un prezzo molto interessante su Hotels.com
La scelta si è in effetti rivelata azzeccata: l'albergo è in posizione centralissima, nel pieno cuore di Manhattan. La struttura è moderna ed efficiente, ben tenuta e con personale preparato.
Le stanze, pur senza mancare di nulla, sono piuttosto piccole, ma penso sia un prezzo inevitabile da pagare per non pagare una esagerazione in pieno centro a NY.
Il ristorante dell'albergo, in cui abbiamo fatto colazione, è l'unico punto dolente (un diner tutto sommato abbastanza ordinario e un po' costoso), ma le alternative in zona non mancano.

title: Good location
text: Clean rooms, courteous staff. Good location to explore Midtown Manhattan: Time Square and subway station, fifteen/twenty minutes to main NY's attractions such as Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, libraries, museums and Central Park. If you don't like Starbucks, you shouldn't take the breakfast (it's delivered from Starbucks). There are a lot of places to take breakfast in this city area: in hundred meters you can find a lot of restaurants.

title: Great location!
text: My partner and I stayed in NYC for our first time in January. We were anxious to get the accommodation right so that we could easily reach all that we planned to do. The hotel is in a FANTASTIC location. It's a ten minute walk from Times Square, about the same to Macys, a few streets down from a large subway station which you can use to access most of the attractions. The beds were extremely comfortable, impeccably clean, lovely bathroom with great shower, and a really good security system where you can only access the lifts if you have a room card. After reading a heap of reviews on other hotels that the staff were often rude or dismissive, we were happy to find that the staff here were so friendly and helpful during our stay. We will definitely stay here on our return to the city.

title: Great manager here!
text: This is a clean and neat property. The rooms are small, as with most properties in NYC. We did have an issue when we checked in which I addressed with an employee at the front desk. No success. I went back and asked for a manger. David Lew was whom I asked again for assistance. "No problem, we can definitely accommodate you". Great customer service, just a great person. I would stay here again just because he's here, and he cares.

title: Stranded in NYC
text: I got "stuck" in New York and found this hotel for a great, last-minute price. It was extremely convenient and an easy location to get to anything! The Penn Station train was nearby. Close to Hell's Kitchen too. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

title: Great Spot
text: Stayed at Marriott for business and enjoyed the location.  Easy to get around and close enough to everything in the city.  The stations are close by and there are lots of great restaurants and nightlife within walking distance.  Rooms are a bit small but fine for 2 people.

title: Spring Break 2016
text:
The hotel was in a convenient location only a 10 minute walk to Broadway. The staff were very attentive and helpful. We had a king room that was clean and well maintained. Our view was of an old office building so we had to leave our curtains closed. It had all the amenities to include room safe, hairdryer, small fridge and coffee maker.
We were within walking distance to many restaurants, pharmacies and subway. We would definitely return.

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
Stayed here for a weekend getaway in February to NYC from Toronto. It was a very affordable price at under $200 USD in the February off-season.

Smallish room, but nicely decorated and appointed. Got a high-floor and a view of the Empire State building which was appreciated. Convenient location for walking around, but a bit of a walk from the subway. Service was friendly at the desk, was able to get a late check-out, and overall enjoyed myself. Would stay there again happily.

title: Hidden gem o' the city
text:
We stayed here for a long weekend for a 30th birthday celebration (and decided to celebrate it in NYC) but also decided to try another hotel.
This hotel was more than excellent value for money but it is practically smack-bang central, not too far from the famous/busy Times Square but a five minute walk from Madison Square Gardens, The Empire State Building and depending on your room can see Macy's just opposite.

The room was comfortable and clean, an added bonus of a fridge which is great compared to other hotels that we've stayed in, considering the location, I cannot complain about the noise as I heard nothing! Staff were friendly and very approachable. Although the small cafe on the lobby floor is only opened for a limited time was the only thing I can fault the hotel for!
There's also a very small shop 'The Market' that supplies the basics which is handy should you be caught out or can't be bothered to leave the hotel!
The rooftop bar (a bit expensive but in saying that it was a special birthday treat plus the wonderful views), I'd recommend the bar (open to anyone as the access to it is separate from the hotel so there's an extra sense of security).
The shower was massive which surprised me considering we've stayed in NY nearly four times and never had the luxury of space plus as well, the cleanliness was flawless! Hats off to the cleaning staff.
The decor is fresh and modern and there's free wifi! We loved our stay at the hotel, who even arranged a taxi to the airport (they don't do shuttles/transfers but this is stated on their website), should we be visiting the big apple, this hotel will be the first port of call!

title: Small jewel in Nyc
text:
Went there for 3 nights to celebrate anniversary. Really great weekend rates and an amazing location, being within walking distance to Penn, Broadway, Empire State, etc. Rooms were very clean, staff was friendly and helpful. The bistro served starbucks along with many hot and cold options and the dining area was spotless. We will stay there from now on when we go into the city.

W

title: Small but confortable
text:
We got a great last minute deal on this hotel once we realized how late we were getting out of our show. Location is not bad, only three blocks from Penn Station between 8th and 9th avenues.
Staff was very friendly and check in a breeze. Our room was only on the second floor so it had a dreary rooftop view but since it was last minute...
The bed was very comfortable and the room in excellent condition.
Downsides were related to the size. You could not really see the tv from the far side of the bed. The wardrobe had a small side for hanging larger items but that was where they also stored to ironing board so it limited space. No magnifying mirror in the bathroom for putting in contacts, applying makeup, etc. Shower was roomy and (my favorite) the water was hot.
Would I stay here again? Probably. But there are so many hotels in the area you might do better.

title: Just Terrific!
text: Honestly, tripadvisor has never let us down, and the ratings on this hotel prompted our stay.  This place lived up to the hype - very clean, great location, amazingly quiet - the staff were extremely courteous and helpful, a top-drawer experience.

title: Overpriced
text:
There are about 8 courtyard in NYC alone and i was directed wrongly by employees of 2 courtyards to the courtyard which i have originally booked for. 
Not so good when i have to drag my luggage and searched for the hotel in freezing temperature amid the unsafe environment on a crazy Friday night. 

Room size is pathetic for the price you pay and the breakfast is basically a sandwich and coffee set which you can easily get from a Macd. 

For this room rate of USD 240 per night, you can easily get a luxury hotel stay in key capital cities in Asia and more. But hey, this is NYC.

title: Great location
text: Visited here last year and it was a good hotel and good location. Very clean and my room was cleaned everyday. No noise at all from anywhere apart from if I opened the window. Not far from time square and better really if you don't want to be to close to the hustle and bustle. I got the train and penn station very close. Staff friendly and helpful. On last day I left my camera in the lobby and when I went back the staff had put it away for me. Only fault I didn't think much of the restaurant but let's face it there are loads of other places there to eat.

title: AMAZING Stay!
text: I checked in rather late and let everyone know prior to my arrival and was beyond happy they accommodated my late check in, first off! The staff was wonderful and accommodating. The location was prime and close to almost everything you wanted to see in The City! However, last but not least, Vincent from the front desk was WONDERFUL! He answered every question I had and accommodated every special request I had asked of him. If I stay in this part of The City again, I'm coming back...FOR SURE!

title: Muito bom
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, próximo a Times Square e ao metrô. Poucos metros do Bryant Park. Excelente parque que conta com uma pista de patinação e uma fonte belíssima. Além da localização o hotel é novo e possui uma lanchonete e uma conveniência com microondas. Os funcionários são eficientes e super atenciosos, um dos pontos altos por sinal. Não tem café da manhã, mas como citei há uma lanchonete. O wifi é gratuito e de boa qualidade. Alguns quartos possuem vista para o Empire States. Outro ponto que me agradou foi o custo.

title: Very Good, Indeed
text:
Excellent experience overall, from arrival to departure, with minor "deductions" for very small (yet very well laid out, just the same) room and testy front desk agent at checkout. No view to speak of from my backside room but quiet for the most part; adjacent room's door was so close that it sounded like someone was entering my room when the neighbors returned each time (or worse, they'd let the door slam shut behind them for a 1-2 punch of inconsiderateness). Good news was, they weren't in & out much. Immaculate, good sized bathroom. With exception of aforementioned surly clerk, staff was uniformly hospitable and professional.

Recommended and would gladly stay again.

title: Great hotel!
text: Spacious room, great bed, clean bathroom, friendly and helpful staff. Good lift and breakfast bar. Perfect location for city trip. Would  recommend this one to everybody. Visited  in may 2015 as a couple.

title: Nice place and convenient!
text: This was a great find! Nice and modern. Clearly it was updated recently. It is also only nly a few blocks from the train station as well. Rooms are small, but hey it is New York! Would definitely stay here again! Staff was very nice.

title: very impressed
text: very impressed with this hotel, good location close to many amenities, nice friendly staff good clean comfortable room and very large compared to other city hotels we have stayed in. Nothing was to much trouble for the staff my only complaint is the prices of drinks in the hotel bar but that was sorted by going to the bar across the road maybe something the hotel could look at.

title: Central Location is a Plus
text: This Courtyard is in a great location to explore different parts of the city, but the neighborhood itself is a little rough. During our two night stay, the location allowed us to walk the Highline, shop in Herald Square and catch a show in the theater district. Also very close to MSG, Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. The staff was very nice and the rooms clean and reasonably comfortable. I also liked that we got a rear facing room on a high floor so it was very quiet in the room.

title: Nice room
text: Spent one night in NYC.  It's a few blocks from Times Square, close to Penn Station, very convenient for walking.  Room is a decent size for New York (still small), very large bathroom though and a comfy bed.  Service was great.

title: Great hotel for business at Javits!
text: I have stayed here twice to attend trade shows at Javits.  Definitely exceeds expectations for this class of hotel!  Its very new/clean looking which is great.  The staff is also very friendly, we were able to check in quite early, around 9 am which was great!  As a platinum Marriott member we were able to take two items from the mini market inside the lobby.  As soon as we reached our rooms, the staff called to make sure everything was great with our rooms, and it was.  The lighting is very good, even in the bathroom for doing makeup which can be a pet peeve.  Room is small but functions well and bed was great.  Realized I didn't pack toothpaste and called down and they sent it right up!  Overall a very good/easy experience and I will continue to stay here whenever I need to be at an event at the Javits.

title: Such a good experience!
text:
Check in was flawless. They let me check in earlier when I hd arrived- and let me check out a little later.
Fantastic elevators (very quick!) and overall attentive service. Patient, welcoming staff all over.
The gym on the 35th floor is well equipped and the coffee shop on the 4th floor is convenient.
There is NO room service at the hotel, but every room has a coffee machine in it.
The room was clean and comfortable- yet on the smaller side.

A few more toiletries (shower cap, cotton wool) are needed.

Overall great stay, would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great rooms, convenient to almost everything
text: If you're getting off the bus station at Port Authority, this hotel is such an easy walk from there down 8th Ave., and close to so many great areas.  Granted, we like to walk, but I think most people would find some great sites within walking distance, like the Javits Center, Meat Packing neighborhood, Times Square, Broadway and the Village.  I never cabbed or took Uber the whole time, and this was mid-winter!  The staff was friendly, but breakfast was not included (nor were reward points) because I booked through a 3rd-party vendor.  I wish I'd know this before booking, but the stay was lovely nonetheless.  The coffee/snack bar is only open in the mornings and in the evenings, so don't plan on having a glass of wine there before 5pm.

title: Prima Hotel in Toplage
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich im Zentrum von Manhattan. Viele Sehenswürdigkeiten kann man zu Fuß erreichen ( Empire State Building, Times Square, Macy's, Madison Square Garden 200m). Gute Anbindung an Subway und Busse.
Dennoch kein Problem mit der Nachtruhe.
Die Zimmer und das Bad waren extrem sauber.
Frühstück nimmt man besser außer Haus ein (100m Bagel Maven).
Beim Anruf unseres Shuttle-Services zum Flughafen bei der Abreise erhielten wir allerdings keine Unterstützung durch die Rezeption, weil diese nur mit einem ganz bestimmten, viel zu teuren Service zusammenarbeiten.

title: Great hotel
text:
By coincidence, this hotel was the first to pop up on Travelocity, as they were advertising a weekend rate of $76 for a king sized bed.  The hotel itself was superb, and I would stay there again, especially if the rate was so good.
There are two parking garages on the same block of West 37th Street.  A discounted rate is available.

title: Birthday Trip for my girlfriend
text: While the rooms are a little small I would highly recommend this hotel. We got there at 1pm and check in was at 4pm but we got checked in right away without questions. Location is pretty good. 10minutes to Times square, 15 Rockefeller center and right next to Penn Station for public transportation. What set this hotel apart is amazing employees. Everyone from front desk, concierge, room service to the morning ladies that served breakfast at the Bistro were amazing. Make sure you try their breakfast. Its expensive but soooooo worth it. Because of the staff I will always recommend and stay at this hotel going forward. Great Job!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: MOLTO BUONO, CONSIGLIATO
text:
Molto buono e ben pulito. 
Personale sempre gentilissimo e disponibile. 
Ottima anche la posizione: a pochi minuti a piedi da Time Square e dalla 5th.
Unica pecca: la colazione è carissima ma, basta uscire dalla porta e sulla via si trova qualsiasi cosa.
Consigliato.

title: Manca qualcosa
text: L'albergo è situato in una posizione ottimale, a dieci minuti a piedi da Time Square. Pulito, personale gentile, arredamento essenziale, wifi gratuito ottimo. La camera, con due letti matrimoniali (noi siamo in quattro, due adulti e due bambini), era un po piccola per quattro persone, diciamo al limite della vivibilità, comunque pulita. Ma va bene così, come turisti in albergo ci siamo stati poco. La colazione invece pessima. Abituati alle colazioni americane a buffet più o meno grandi, la colazione inclusa nel prezzo consisteva in un buono dove poter scegliere tra una sola bevanda piccola (come se andassero falliti a riempire più volte un bicchiere grande di caffè americano!!!), un dolce e un bicchiere di frutta. E poi cominciava alle 6,30 del mattino: un orario un po troppo comodo per un Marriott!!! Insomma, un buon albergo, ma come dico nel titolo: manca qualcosa per rimanere pienamente soddisfatti.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
My wife and I have stayed here 3 times in 2015 and all 3 stays were perfect. The first time you enter the room you don't know whether to laugh or cry at the size of the room but once inside you see that they are very well designed to accommodate you and your belongings.

The nice surprise was the small refrigerator. Just large enough for bottled water, soda and snacks. The bathroom is spacious and modern with a great shower.

I highly recommend joining the Marriott rewards program and downloading the app for your phone. Checking in was so simple by completing a mobile check-in for our stay on the train ride in. We only had to show identification once we arrived to get our room key. All 3 stays we had nothing but the best possible service from the Marriott staff. All were very friendly and extremely helpful.

Location is one of this hotels greatest assets especially given the price point. On one of our stays our room was not ready because we arrived to early so we left our luggage with concierge and walked about a hundred feet to the Houndstooth Pub for drinks. After drinks, we stopped at the 7/eleven across the street and stocked up on drinks and snacks.

We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relatively inexpensive comfortable stay in NYC. We will definitely be back soon.

title: Fantastic
text:
We came as a family at the start of Jan 2016, after a long and slightly stressful flight then drive from Newark to NYC, we arrived at the Marriott. Now first impressions perhaps weren't great due to what I assume to be a health clinic which had a needle bin outside next door but I appreciated this was nothing to do with the Marriott and didn't let it affect my impressions of the hotel itself. When we first walked in we were impressed by the modern decor, friendly and efficient staff. We were checked in in five minutes, 27th floor! Wow! I want to give a shout out to all the staff, everyone was so courteous and welcoming.  

I liked the fact you needed a key to go anywhere but the lobby, a good security measure. The rooms were fabulous, beautifully decorated and spotless. The view was nothing great, but who cares when you've got a great room! If I wanted a good view, I'd go to the country or seaside. 
The beds were beautifully comfy and there was enough storage space for two. The only thing that perhaps was confusing was the thermostat but it only took a few days to get the hang of. Note to any Brits who like tea, it seemed to be only filter coffee machines available in the rooms! But in the bathroom there was even a bath, the sample shampoos were divine and the towels fluffy. 

The location is perfect for shopping and sightseeing, one member of our party has a walking stick and he was able to get to Times Square and Herald square in ten minutes using the hotel as a starting point.

I can't comment on the bistro as we ate out but I can recommend starlight diner not too far! One of the staff members recommended it and we went a lot, the portions were extremely generous and fair priced compared to the usual chain fairs. 

Overall this hotel is perfect for a shopping break or sightseeing trip as a luxury put your head down sort of hotel. I would definitely return on future visits to NYC!

title: Easy Walk to Javits and Times Square
text: Came to NYC for convention at Javits and stayed here. Not only did I save about $100 per night on lodging vs. the recommended show hotels, I also saved on the frustrations associated with taking buses or fighting for taxis/Uber rides. The hotel is a simple 10 minute walk to Javits and a 10 minute walk to the center of Times Square. The staff was friendly and the room was comfortable. There is a great grocery store called Brooklyn Fare that is just a 5 minute walk away. Watched the football games at Clyde Frazier's Wine & Dine just 2 blocks away -- upscale atmosphere and food with lots of TVs.

title: An oasis in the blizzard
text: My wife and I came in from Bethlehem PA to see a Broadway show.  Unfortunately the blizzard hit and the city shut down.  we went back to the hotel and were amazed by the service.  The young man in the Bistro had a smile on his face while helping every guest with their orders (and there were a lot).  David the  manager was helping serve breakfast, dinner, and helping check people in. Vincent at the front desk was extremely polite and helpful.  Thank you Courtyard Marriott Times Square West for saving our trip!

title: Great Hotel and perfect staff
text:
This hotel is wonderful and in a great location. The staff is even better . From my initial check in to check out, the staff did everything possible to make my stay perfect. Paula at the front desk is a gem. She went out of her way to make my stay remarkable at check in. then everyone else enhanced our experience. Factoring in location, price, p
facility and the excellent staff, this Marriott Courtyard ar 37th St. and 8th Ave. is the perfect place to stay!

title: Great location and customer service
text: I'll like to thanks Paula Tito for all the help provided during my stay. My wife and I appreciate all your support. Great room accommodation . Very well clean. Excellent location. Near metro station, central park, time square, shoppings and restaurants.

title: Perfect location, great value for money!
text: The hotel has an excellent location, only 2 blocks from the subway, 8 minutes from Time Square and 8 minutes from the Javits Center by foot. The room could have been bigger, but it was still spacious, compared to the New York city hotel room sizes. Plenty of stores and dining places around. Perfect value for money in a 4 star hotel.

title: Great Stay
text: This hotel is in a great location midway between Times Square and Madison Square Garden.  We stayed in rooms with two queen beds.  They were a great size and also had mini fridges.  We were a group of 16 and the hotel was extremely accommodating with getting us all on the same floor.  They also allowed us to us the bistro area as part of the celebration of my 40th birthday by giving us plates and forks to enjoy my cake (from Carlo's - up the street).  Would recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again when visiting.

title: Smart Quiet Hotel
text:
We stayed at this hotel from 22nd Dec to 26th Dec

The welcome was warm

The room 612 was very large by New York Standards.

The Bed was very comfy. The room was clean and well maintained

The hotel was extremely Quiet from outside noise.

The hotel does have a place to eat, and this was the only downside.
The food was average, but the prices very very high!
Make sure you go when Happy hour is on, if you want a beer.

The Free WiFi this hotel, is excellent. Very quick indeed

It was only approx 5-10 min walk to Times Square, so really centrally located, but off the main 8th Ave to make it quiet from all the sirens etc.

We would choose to stay at this hotel when we are in NYC again

title: Great location!  Quiet hotel.
text:
This hotel is located very near the "squares" (Times and Herald) as well as just a jump away from Madison Square Garden.  Very seamless check in and, for those with cars, parking was 3 doors down ($42 for the night).  As is typical in NYC, the room was small but very clean and the bed was quite comfy.  It is a very quiet hotel as there were only 6 rooms per floor I believe.  The front desk has a very modern flair, albeit a tiny space.  There is a bar in the back which is a good size and they have coffee, drinks and some food available.  There is a nice patio just off the bar for those warmer days.

The elevator was secure in that it would not move until you inserted your card.  I really like that bit.  The only complaint I have is probably the man working the bar.  He was quite snooty and it took a while to get my coffee, which was supposed to be a latte.  We paid quite a bit for it and it was horrible.  I don't believe he knew what he was doing.  That, coupled with his holier than thou attitude, turned me off of the bar.

For touring, though, it is excellent.  We love the Tick Tock Diner and it is a 1 minute walk from the hotel.  We love Macy's - 5 minute walk.  Just a nice location and we will utilize it again.  We only paid $115 for the night since it was Sunday.  You just don't find that kind of price in NYC for that level of hotel.

title: Great location, quiet room
text:
We stayed for 8 nights (2 adults, 2 children) in room 1910 (2 queen beds).  The hotel is in a great location as it's not right on Times Square but a 5 minute walk away.  Times Square is crazy and loud so if you have children and want to sleep, then stay away from the area.  We had a high floor and no view.  But this worked well for us as the room was very quiet (no street noise and no noise from other guests). Ultimately if you go to NYC you're not there for the view from your room as you're out about all day.  The only minor point was we had breakfast included and when we checked in one of the check in staff gave a little bit of attitude by saying our rate should not have included breakfast (hey not our problem, that's what we booked and we had proof of the booking).  Also the fruit cups were sometimes a couple of days old (so not very fresh at all).

Overall, I would stay there again if given the opportunity to return to NYC.  It offered great value for money.

title: удобно
text:
этот отель расположен очень центрально на Манхеттене, все удобно - метро, Times Square, Starbucks, etc
Если попросить номер с окнами во двор - то очень тихо! Правда номера маленькие, особенно для 4 звезд, очень напоминает этим Париж :))

title: Visited for Rockettes
text: Good location, clean room, staff was very friendly.  There's no restaurant or room service but it was just what we needed a clean room in a good location.  I traveled with my daughter and a group of 6 families.  They were very accommodating with us and booked our rooms ahead of time even though our group wasn't large enough.  Would definite recommend.Would stay here again

title: Muy buen hotel, ubicacion privilegiada
text: Podrian mejorar el trato de sus empleados el wifi no es del todo bueno. Se corta con frecuencia.yo le agregaria un desayuno y creo que seria muy beneficioso para los pasajeros. Tiene la mejor ubicacion posible,cerca de todos los negocios, zonas turisticas y subte

title: Muito bom
text: Localização ótima pra quem quer ficar perto da Time Square com um preço acessível. Atendimento ótimo e quartos espaçosos. Há bastante opções de restaurantes e lanchonetes por perto. Próximo ao Madison Square Garden e Macy´s.

title: It was my first time in New York
text: This hotel made us feel very welcome from start to finish . The maids did everything they could to help if they could . Very clean hotel and everything is close by so easy to walk to bars , shops and Resturants

title: Capodanno
text: Ho soggiornato presso questa struttura dal 29 dicembre per una settimana , hotel centralissimo 5 minuti a piedi e si è in time square  comodo per gli spostamenti là metro è vicinissima . Avevamo una camera al 20 esimo piano vista Empire camera comoda pulita unica pecca il personale della reception poco cortesi e disponibili ad  aiutare il cliente ... Al momento del check out abbiamo chiesto il taxi per l'aeroporto è in un primo momento ci hanno detto che non avevano il numero per chiamarlo , siamo ritornate e magicamente il taxi si poteva chiamare ma in un modo "alternativo" , non come fanno tutti gli hotel che telefonano alla compagnia taxi ma hanno chiamato un loro dipendente che si è messo in strada e ha fermato un taxi e ha voluto anche la mancia .... Se dovevamo fare così , cioè fermarlo per strada... Eravamo capacissime da sole ....

title: $139/night is right price
text:
Just spent two nights here
A very good hotel for $139/night
Anymore money, I think you can do better

The front desk was very busy and not friendly or willing to spend more than 2 minutes for our check into two rooms

Rooms themselves clean, fine but not great
How could a bathroom have no hooks?

And why is coffee maker in a closet??
Thus requiring moving things around each am

A copier took up a lot of space
Who needed that?

I normally only write positive reviews, but when frig was at 55 and curdled my milk for coffee this was a sign that you get what you pay for for $139

title: Amazing!
text: I visited New York in November (around thanksgiving for 8 days, I must say that Courtyard Marriott is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Firstly, the staff were absolutely friendly and helpful, always greeted me with a smile every time I walked pass reception. Also, the staff was very knowledgeable about the city, which is always helpful when you're new to the city. Our room was on the 33th floor, we had the empire building view right in front of us, the view at night was amazing. In addition, the bathroom and rooms was cleaned everyday without fail! The location of the hotel was great, it was literally a 5 mins walk from Times Square and 10 mins away from Macy's. Also, there is a subway station 2 mins from the hotel, which was so convenient. Finally, the cafe downstairs had a variety of food from fresh fruit to sandwiches. This was my 2nd time in New York and I fell in love with the city again. The next time I'm in New York I will definitely stay in Courtyard Marriott. I would like to say a big thank you to staff at Marriott, you made it a very pleasurable stay. Thank You!!!

title: Long waits for elevators
text: Busiest week of the year was between Christmas and New Years and one had to wait half an hour to get the elevator.  On the other hand, complimentary breakfasts were good, room was clean, staff was helpful.

title: Reasonble and close enough to theater district
text: Reasonably priced (for New York) this modest hotel is within 10 or 15 minutes of the theaters on 44th and 45th. My room and bathroom were spotless and the bathroom, though Spartan, had no bath but a large walk in shower. Small fridge (empty) and safe provided. The small market on the ground floor was handy for water and snacks as well as meals if wanted. The Bistro on the ground floor served breakfast and dinner. Only complaint is that the three elevators are very slow (mainly, I am guessing, because the doors are very slow to open and close). Expect long waits at peak times.

title: Great location and nice-sized room
text: We booked as a very-last minute stay (as our first hotel was a dump). The front desk was incredibly helpful and placed us in a quite large room (certainly by Manhattan standards). The location was great, as it was close to Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, and the subway station. Room was clean and overall very quiet. I would definitely consider staying again!

title: Good Hotel & Location
text:
This hotel is in a good location, was clean and safe and I would rate this hotel as four stars based on price, location and cleanliness.  

With that said, as far as being a marriott platinum member the service was lousy and I was extremely disappointed with the service I received and will most likely not stay at this hotel again mainly for those reasons.

title: Very Convenient for NYC Sightseeing
text: I used Marriott Points for a room for my 2 daughters and granddaughters for their 1st NYC overnight 5 days before Christmas.  They were given a handicapped room on the 2nd floor, a room with no view, but they said it was so quiet, the beds were really comfortable and with the 2 teenage girls the oversized bathroom with a floor drain was perfect!  They were a quick walk to Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, Macy's, the Empire State Building, and the Christmas Market in Bryant Park.  The Mom's were able to get their Starbucks fix in the Lobby, so everyone was thrilled with their fun adventure and the Courtyard by Marriott!  I was happy to provide this experience for them.

title: Appreciate
text: We are a little bit early when we arrived NYC, so its unexpected, we went to find out hotel because were tired and cold due to the weather. Around 7am, we tried checking in early but I know there's no luck. I pre checked in with the very kind Vincent at the Front Desk, took our luggages too for free. After going around the city, around 11:30 Natally finally told us that we are the first in line for an early check in. She called us that our room is ready. Thanks for that. We checked into room 2714, which is the top floor as requested. The room feels and looked clean but there's a little bit of flaws, as I am a Housekeeping Inspector. There's a gum sticked onto the luggage rack, heavy dust on the top of the cabinet and some dusts on some furnitures which are noticable. We're currently here and enjoying our few days in NYC. Guest services was nice I forgot her name.

title: 位置超棒的酒店
text: 万豪集团旗下的酒店，万怡在美国算是3星的品牌吧，房间不大，但是位置很好，机场大巴终点站下来走3个街口就到了，离剧院，火车站都很方便

title: Excellent location
text: Very clean hotel! The staff is friendly and helpful in providing phone number for delivery restaurants. I just simply highly recommend it!! Is a good place to rest after spending a long day sight seeing Manhattan. Peaceful and quite away form the crazyness of Times Square but close enough to walk. My family enjoyed their stay in the courtyard.

title: Great Location
text:
I am a frequent traveller (Platinum Level) and this property upheld the Marriott brand.  Rooms were clean and comfortable and it was very quiet at night.  Common and eating areas are updated and spacious offering room to spread out for work or play.  A few blocks from Midtown and Times square, location is also very close (literally two turns) to the Lincoln Tunnel.    It took us only a few minutes to exit the city!   The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  

Only one small complaint - parking is advertised as $45 per night.  The hotel uses a loosely affiliated garage down the street and charged me $50 per night because I had an SUV.  It would be good to have this communicated by the hotel because you never know in NY if someone is trying to pull on over on you.  Again - not a huge deal but just a heads up for those visiting this fine hotel.

title: Tiny Room but Great Location and Staff
text: The location was great -- 3-4 blocks form Madison Square Garden and 5 blocks from Times Square.  Even Radio City Music Hall was easy walking distance.  The room was a bit tight, but that was fine for NYC.  Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Jewelry Wallet stolen from luggage by bellman. Then he left  bags alone in lobby .
text: I've never written a review before, but after having my jewelry wallet stolen, I felt I should warn others. The weird/odd thing is the bellman apparently took my bag from trunk of Taxi when we pulled up, while I was still inside the car talking to the driver. Then I find my bag left unattended in the middle of lobby and no bellman in sight . When I unpacked, my wallet was gone from the zipper compartment. I reported this, but by the time the manager returned my call, he said the lobby video was already "taped over."  No one can explain why my bag was left alone, nor why the bellman was no where to be seen. My carry-on bag never left my possession until bellman had it without me knowing. My things were not very valuable, it's just I knowing that no one in management really cared to look into it until I asked to have a report taken on my 3rd call.

title: buen hotel
text: muy buen hotel, ubicado cerca de time square, cerca de las principales atracciones, el desayuno es bueno, en invierno tienen maquinas para sacar chocolate caliente ideal para el frio de la ciudad, excelente opcion

title: Dreadful staff
text:
Location is excellent however the staff are extremely rude particularly in the bar and reception area.
The bar is only open from 6 until 9pm and extortionate prices
Rooms are small and stuffy.
Air conditioning units are so noisy that it's impossible to sleep with them on
At over £200 a night plus tax there are much better Hotels available in the same area for similar price

title: Birthday girly weekend
text:
The hotel is spotless. The staff are really friendly, I must mention Robert on the front desk, He was very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The room had 2 queen  size beds which were very comfortable. A short walk to Times square or Macys. One thing I will mention the coffee making facilities in the room are very good, however you get a pack containing sugar, sweetener, and creamer. We only used the creamer, it seems such a waste to discard the sugar etc.. Would it not be more cost effective to supply these separately? 
I would also recommend using the hotel car service for the airport transport. It was excellent.

title: Cozy = small
text:
The hotel is nice and clean. However, the rooms are very small.
The lobby cafe is not open in the evening, thus making in not very convenient if you need a quick tea, coffee or snack.

The room did have a nice-ish view from the room of a church.

I asked for a restaurant recommendation, and got a recommendation to a place where concierge gets a kickback for referrals rather than something quaint.

title: Very enjoyable stay
text: This hotel was ideal for us on our stay in the big apple, it's close to all the main tourist areas without too much mayhem in the immediate vicinity. Rooms are spotless, modern and comfortable, whilst the staff were always on hand offering help and advice. This hotel will be my choice to stay when we return and I'd recommend it to others. Many thanks to all staff!!

title: GREAT nights rest at a great location
text:
I don't think we could have asked for a better location.  It was a short walk up 8th Ave to the hotel.  Check in was super easy & the staff are all very friendly & helpful.  The room may have been the smallest room I have ever stayed in but given this is NYC, that is the norm (I suppose?)
I will say that the room was CLEAN & extremely comfortable; I managed to get over my anxiety of being on the 17th floor rather quickly!  The window DOES open, just barely enough that a small child MIGHT be able to squeeze their head thru... if you have kids you may want to keep them not so close.  I doubt that they could reach the windows but better safe than sorry.  Either way, I was VERY thankful for the fresh air.
The room has most amenities that one can expect, a small fridge, ironing board & iron, hair dryer, TV, clean shower/bathroom & the most comfortable bed I have slept on in a long time.  I seriously need their pillows. The hotel also participates in an eco friendly program where they will only give you fresh towels if you leave towels on the floor.  If you are like me, reusing a bath towel or wash cloth is NOT a big deal, better to save the water to wash them.  Kudos to you Marriott!
There is a bar on the ground floor with a seating area behind it.  Plenty of TVs to watch the game.  I am not sure if there is a pool but there is a fitness facility in the cellar that has a few treadmills, ellipticals & a couple bikes.  There was 1 weight machine to cover most muscle groups & a few free weights.  They also provided mats, water, wipes & ear buds.  VERY cool.
They do offer some foods at the bar area, they have breakfast in the morning, not included but there is a Dunkin Donuts across 8th Ave if that is your thing.
We were a short walk from an outdoor market (8th ave north till about 42nd St) & from there Times Square is a hop & skip away (no need to jump too).
Reasonable priced wraps up this deal for me, I would DEFINATELY stay here again!

title: New Your Stay
text:
This hotel is in a great location.  About 10 minute walk from Macys department store and it is also about 10 minutes from the centre of time square.

The hotel is very clean the bed rooms are spacious and the bar / eating area is light and airy and modern.

The reception staff were very attentive and friendly.

title: 2 night stay in November
text: This hotel is very well placed near Times Square. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were very good. All the staff we met were very friendly. The price we paid was very reasonable for New York city and we would stay here again when we visit New York. The WI FI was fast and free in all areas.

title: Hidden Gem !!
text: Whenever i tried searching for Marriott properties near Times square, this never showed up as there are many other courtyards nearby but Im so happy to have found this as its a perfect hotel to relax even in the fast pace of NYC. Though its just few blocks away from times square, its very peaceful, big rooms and amazing staff. Would love to stay again !!

title: Comfort and location
text:
Requested a high floor on booking made 6 months in advance and disappointed to be allocated one on the second floor instead. 

Despite this, we were very pleased with the comfortable beds, largish room and great location. It's tucked away in a relatively quiet location but still literally just steps from the NYC madness.

Apart from the room floor allocated the only disappointment was having the maid service knocking on the door at 7.30 am to seer if we were still in the room. I guess partly our fault for not using the DND sign but still ...

Would definitely stay here again if the price was right and I wanted to be right near the action.

title: Great for the price and location!
text: Four blocks from Times Square, reasonable price, comfortable rooms, nice staff, what more should you want of a Manhattan hotel? We visit New York City at least yearly and have stayed in a vast variety of hotels over the years. I look for value and comfort, and this hotel has both. I asked for a corner room on a top floor a day before our visit and got it. The room was comfy and quiet, and had none of the problems you can experience in NYC hotels--clanging pipes, stifling heat, outside noise, dirt in corners, etc. In fact, there were these plusses: big HD TV with HBO, comfortable bed, Paul Mitchell toiletries, AC controlled in room, small refrigerator, noon checkout, Starbucks available in the lobby, very nice staff. Don't be put off by the relatively small hotel front. Inside there's all you need. We'll come back to the Courtyard Times Square West.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text:
This hotel is in an excellent location. Super close to Madison Square Garden, Penn Station etc... 
The staff were most welcoming and accommodating. The hotel common area isn't huge and they don't have breakfast on site. Not to worry as there are plenty of places nearby.
Hotel room was small but very well appointed and very comfortable. Had a great night's sleep!
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Buena situación.
text: Relación calidad precio magnifica. Aunque no es de lujo el nombre Marriot es una garantia. Habitación amplia y cama gigantesca. Muy confortable y muy bien situado.  El único pero es que el personal de recepción no haga el mas mínimo esfuerzo por decir una palabra de castellano. Es decir, trato correcto pero no amable

title: Our first trip to New York
text: This was our first visit, the hotel was very central to most tourist spots, subways and Times Square, it was very clean and our room was spotless, many thanks to Jasmein, we were on 20th floor and traffic noise was minimal, the only criticism was the prices at the bar, very expensive, needless to say we used the many bars and restaurants which abound around the locality. The concierge Dwayne was very helpful when booking trips and James was really helpful in all things regarding our room, storing our luggage after checking out. We do intend to visit New York again and would most definitely consider staying at this hotel.

title: Excellent location, could do better
text:
The location of this hotel is fantastic, just a short walk to Times Square, the bus terminal, Macy's, Rockerfeller etc.
Great little café down a block towards 6th avenue that serves bagle and coffee for $5, much cheaper than the hotel.  There's also a Starbucks a block down.
We walked everywhere from here, Central Park is 15-20 minutes and very easy to find with the blocks and street layout.
Our room was 1412 directly opposite the lifts which was annoying when you wanted to sleep or people outside your room early hours waiting for the lift.  Request to be away from the lift
As 2 girls travelling we requested twin beds but were given king, this didn't matter as the bed was so huge so don't be too worried if the same happens.
The disappointment comes from the bathroom, the shower is weak and the plumbing in our room was very noisy when you flushed the toilet and the sink leaked.  We only however reported this on check out as the last night was by far the worst so I cant comment if this was fixed immediately.
The staff are friendly, there's an area to buy essentials and also to check in and print boarding passes.
We did have a drink in the bar on our first night and to our horror we were charged $20 per glass of wine.  Shocking considering a glass in the bars around Times Square only charged $13 max!  Beware and use the happy hour :-)
Excellent free wifi throughout the hotel

title: Great value, centrally located
text:
This is a great hotel at an even greater price. It is located in the Garment District, but is a few blocks from Times Square, Herald Square and Penn Station making it perfect if you plan to use the subway or see the sights. 

The Garment District is often not a favorite for many as it is all fabric shops and such that are closed at night, so the area can seem dead after 6 PM...but it is well lit and conveniently located. 

The rooms are very nice and give you everything you need - spacious bathroom, king bed, TV, desk, chair, closet and night stands. 

The staff is incredibly kind and friendly from the front desk, concierge to Lisa, who cleaned our room. 

As always with NYC request a room on a higher floor so you do not hear street noise below (cities can be loud if you are not used to it).

I would happily stay here again. A nice, centrally located gem in the Garment District and a great value.

title: Excellent
text: Found this hotel through our travel agent. We always wanted to visit New York & decided to for our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel was very clean & the staff very friendly. We had two rooms our room was 22nd floor facing the front had a lovely view, very spacious & traffic noise was minimal &  my brother-in-laws room was 23rd facing the back their room was slightly smaller. In both rooms the beds were very comfortable &  the rooms were cleaned to perfection by Karen. Hoping to come back to New York in a few years &  would definitely stay at the Courtyard west again. It was a 5 minute walk from Times Square &  central for almost everything

title: Lovely, clean and friendly hotel. Close distance to Times Square, Madison Square Gardens, Macy's and Empire State
text: We did a lot of research when planning our first time in New York. The price, ratings and location of this hotel helped us in deciding to stay here and we was not disappointed. We stayed in a queen room on the second floor, which had a big bathroom. There was no view outside our room however, for the small amount of time we actually spent in there this was not an issue what so ever. The room contained a small fridge, free use of safe, hairdryer and iron which was all very useful. We have never travelled to the states before so did not know exactly what the hotel rooms provided. The location of itself lies a few blocks away from Times Square and literally up the road from Madison Square Gardens etc. There are other hotels that are situated directly in Times Square however, for the rating and price we payed it is worth the short walk into Times Square. The staff was very friendly and happy to store our suitcases for us once we had checked out. We also booked their car to take us to JFK on departure. This was about $72 dollars which I initially thought was expensive but cabs charge around $55 and that's not including fees and taxes so we thought was worth it. Would not hesitate in returning to this hotel and was a great base for our discovery of New York.

title: 場所も良く、快適に過ごせるホテルです
text: 友人が予約してくれたホテルがここだったので自動的に宿泊することになりました。初めて利用させてもらったホテルでしたが、思った以上に総合点の高いホテルでした。先ず場所が良く何処へ行くにも便利でした。部屋はシンプルだけど機能的で洗練されていました。スタッフの方たちも快適な距離感を保ちつつ完璧な対応をして下さったのでよく教育されていると感じました。

title: City that never sleeps
text: The hotel is in the garment district, if you don't mind the seedy characters next door in the day, it's a great little place. The room was bigger than I thought and very nicely decorated. I'd suggest a higher floor if possible. Our room overlooked a rooftop that workers used to take smoke breaks. But. We kept the drapes closed. We weren't in the room long any away.  There is a little snack bar that's open til 10, they serve Starbucks there as well as wine and beer. There is a small outdoor patio by this, and it's cute. The lobby isn't big, it can get a little crowded but the front desk staff knows their stuff. There is not a long wait. I would visit again for sure.

title: Wonderful Thanksgiving Weekend
text:
Just returned from a wonderful trip in NYC for my sister's 30th birthday and Thanksgiving. Our flight arrived early, and we were expecting to drop off our bags and explore the city until our room was ready. However, we were delighted to learn that our room was ready! We were asked if we preferred a room lower down or up higher, and we chose to be higher. We were given a room on the 23rd floor, directly across from the elevators. We were offered a handicap accessible room, which is slightly bigger than normal rooms.

The room was clean and bright. We overlooked the surrounding buildings and the courtyard below. The bathroom was big, clean and bright. I really enjoyed being higher up and we almost always had our window cracked open to enjoy the fresh air as well.

One major reason we chose this hotel was it's location. It is walking distance to pretty much anything you want to see. We walked to Central Park for the parade, to Bryant Park for the Holiday Market, to Times Square, to The High Line. It's extremely convenient.

There are many good restaurants nearby as well. Tavola is right around the corner and has very good pizza. The Houndstooth Pub is nearby and has delicious pub food as well. 

Check-in and Check-out was super easy. And James helped us get a car to the airport on our way home.

I would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Sleep well
text: This hotel has all of the details right. The rooms are New York sized, but don't feel that way. The beds are extremely comfortable, and if you get a room on the back of the hotel, you can sleep with the window open without being woken by sounds of Manhattan. From very friendly bar staff (with delicious breakfast) to a bellhop who remembers your name and where you're from. I'm normally a Hilton girl but make an exception for this exceptional hotel when I need a Manhattan hotel.

title: Don't plan on using this place if you expect help with your luggage and parking!!
text: The website for this hotel shows off site valet.  THERE IS NO help checking in and no help or signs showing where the parking is located and NO help on website for HOW to check in with NO place to park

title: Amazing Hotel near everything
text: Currently staying in the hotel...and have to say the hotel is fantastic. The hotel in a great location between 34th and 42nd street, but also walking distance to all main metro stations. Round the corner from Macy's and Madison Square Gardens. The hotel staff are all amazingly friendly at all times of the day. The hotel is ultra clean and modern and the rooms are lovely and fresh. Hotel has great facilities with gym and guest laundry room. Really can't find any fault with this hotel. You don't need to choose any big hotel just cus its in timesquare (and I have stayed at many). This hotel will always be our first choice for hotel when in NYC.

title: Had a pleasant stay
text: Stayed at this property for one night. The room is spacious, with comfortable bed and good amenities, including free wi-fi. Walking distance to Times Square and Broadway as well as a lot of food catering options nearby. Check-in/check-out process was easy and staff were helpful.

title: Hôtel plsu que correct et bien placé
text: Accueil agréable et professionnel, chambre familiale spacieuse et très propre, bonne literie, très grands lits. Petit déjeuner non à volonté, mais copieux et de bonne qualité. Times square et subway à proximité.

title: very nice stay
text: very nice hotel, extremely clean, no issues at all. The staff was nice and helpful and check in and check out was a breeze. The location is good, there is a subway stop on 35th St and one on 40th St very short walk. All kinds of businesses close by short walk to Macy's and Time Square- hotel couldn't be much better!

title: Have stayed here 30 nights, my "go-to" place in the city.
text: Impossible to find a more reasonably price hotel in NYC w the staff and location this one provides. Staff goes out of their way to make sure you have a good experience. Not your typical Courtyard experience. Sure the rooms are smaller but honestly they are as big as what you get in this city and at a reasonable price. Definitely worth it!

title: Glimrende byhotel
text:
Vi besøgte hotellet ugen op til thanksgiving, vi fik to dobbeltværelser, vi var to par og et barn. Værelserne er fine og rene, men sindssygt små. Selv efter europæiske standarder er det småt. Når det er sagt, så får man her alt hvad man kan forvente af et by hotel. Det ligger snublende tæt på Penn station (5min til fods) og Times Square (10-15min). Hele New Yorks herligheder venter lige om hjørnet.  Kvarteret har også en del hjemløse og misbrugere, så det er ikke kun glansbillede udgaven man får, men den fulde pakke. Fravælg morgenmaden på hotellet, der er massevis af spisesteder i nærheden.  Vi brugte flere steder, men var mest glad for Evergreen Diner (på 37th mellem 7. Og 8. Av) vi fik lov at blive på værelset den sidste dag indtil kl.14 selvom der var fuldt booket dagen efter. God service.
