Vi havde en dag hvor vi ikke fik ordnet værelset, selvom vi var væk fra kl.11 til 1630. En lille anke, er at det mangler makeup spejl på badeværelset (siger en af damerne) 
Men kun en lille ridse i lakken. Vi vil klart anbefale hotellet til andre.

title: Better than it has to be.
text:
Tiny/nonexistent lobby right off of 37th street, with a well-trained, obedient staff.  If you have business at Javits, it's basically ideal, at about 6 blocks away but still close to all of the NYC amenities that you'd want.  New York is great that way - rare is the convention center that allows you to stay somewhere you'd actually stay on a leisure trip. 

The host immediately suggested I trade out a King room for 2 queens, saying that the 2 queen rooms are bigger.  Genius call by him - it's a well-sized a room as you'll find in NYC for the money.  View?  Nah.  But who cares - you're in the belly of the beast in a very clean, well-maintained hotel.  All of the regular room features were up to Marriott standards. 

They have a lounge/restaurant with a 'happy hour' that brings ludicrous New York prices to just ludicrous any-other-city prices.  I only visited once, and they were understaffed and confused.  For breakfast, they were much more organized, and the food was solid. 

I'd stay here on a pleasure trip - nice location from which to explore the city, and well-kept.  For business, it's a no-brainer.

title: Don't stay here
text: The hotel is in a very noisy location. The staff are unhelpful. There is no decent food available, it was even difficult to get a cup of tea. The rooms were clean but the whole hotel smelt of cleaning fluid. Overpriced and underwhelming!

title: "Broadway weekend "
text: We just returned from last weekend in NYC and stayed here. Overall a great stay! The staff were very friendly, the room(tiny but it's NYC!) was very clean and did the trick! We didn't use the breakfast or bar area but as we passed through to the elevators it looked busy and nice. The only thing I would say is that it is a good 10 minute walk from Times Square. Seeing as we were doing an overnight with the main focus of seeing 2 Broadway shows it was a bit out of the action , seems like we spent more time walking the 11-12 blocks to get to where we needed to go! If it was a general NYC weekend and you were happy to walk/ cab to where you needs to go it does the trick! Parking was $45( $50 for what they considered an oversized SUV???) and it a few doors down, pretty convenient. Overall a nice stay!

title: Would give this hotel 4.5 stars if i could....
text:
Stayed here one night and found the staff very friendly and helpful. Desk staff was on top of things, Bistro personnel as well.

When arriving I requested a higher floor - rear facing room expecting it would quieter than lower, street facing. Was given room on 23rd floor and it was SO quiet, which is a tough find sometimes in NYC. I would avoid those lower floor front rooms

I like this area of NY as it is great location for getting anywhere but not too close to any of them, tons of restaurants close by, and it has a little more old NY feel to it.

Great hotel, no issues. Only reason it is not 5 stars is because it is not a luxury hotel

title: Decent central place to stay
text:
My Girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights.
Arrived here a couple of hours earlier than check in suggested, expecting just to drop our bags off and then go out and come back to check in. However we were informed our room was ready.

Room was spacious, clean and bigger than I expected for a hotel in New York. Enough room to walk around and store luggage. The bathroom was nice too, with a walk in shower. Room was a little on the darkside, mainly due to lack of sunlight, but not so much of a problem. We did ask if there were any rooms with a view. Front desk informed us that none of the rooms had any views of the city. They even took me to the 19th floor, just so I could have a peek. Other than the sun coming through there wasnt much difference. In fact original room looked better.

We were given a map at the front desk and they told us the best way to get to any attraction we wanted to visit. Very helpful

The hotel is very was well located. 5 mins walk to nearest tube and Empire State Building. 5-10 mins walk  to Times Square and less than 5 mins walk away from hells kitchen which was good for dining.

Although the price didnt include breakfast, across the road is a Dunkin Donuts and near by close to Penn Station you can sit down at a place called Tick Tock Diner which was great. Didnt try the breakfast at the hotel although they do do it 

Happy Hour at the bar was nice as was the free wifi available everywhere in the hotel.

Booking early helped achieve best rates, and with the right price I would stay here again

title: Would stay again
text: We were staying with family out in queens and came to stay here a couple nights to enjoy the city and late nights etc. We arrived at about10-1030 am to store our bags and come back to check in later. Surprised we were told our room was ready and we could check in. Fantastic! Everyone was so helpful and friendly. Excellent staff. Even those we encountered in the elevator or hallways. They have a happy hour in the evening but should get extra staff to accommodate. We waited a while to be served and then even longer to get our drinks. There was a supervisor or manager around and I felt maybe he could have simply got behind the counter to help out more. That was the only fault we saw. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Loved the shower! Great location and safe street. We would definitely stay here again or recommend it to others

title: Good location but poor service
text:
I had just stayed in this hotel from Nov 11 to 14. The location was good and near to Times Square, Empire States Building and lots of food and shops in the neighbourhood. However,  the street, similar to other streets in the city,  can be quite dirty and lots of homeless people.

The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We had a king size bed for two and there is sufficient space for us. The complementary WiFi is good too.

The great stay was destroyed by the bad service we received at the end of our trip. We booked an airport transfer to the airport for our departure day Nov 14 at 3pm from the hotel concierge Anne on Nov 11. However, due to the Paris incident on Nov 13, we decided to move our transfer earlier to 2pm on Nov 14 in case the US tighten their airport checks.  

We tried to request for the late checkout on Nov 13 night but was told to request on our checkout day after 7am. I called the front desk at 7.50am and was granted the extension to which I was very grateful. I further requested to see if we can change our initial airport transfer to an hour earlier. I told the lady that I had booked with the Concierge Anne. She told me she doesn't know who is Anne and I reinstate that it is the concierge in the hotel.  She then told me she will change my transport. 

Upon checkout,  we were informed that the car is waiting for us at the driveway. The car had our room no. 2006 pasted on the window. So we proceeded to load our bags into the car and wenmmt to the airport. 

When we arrived at the airport, we were told to pay USD70. We were surprised and told the driver we had paid the hotel USD46 and showed her our receipt.  She said it  was a different arrangement.

After much discussion with the driver and calling the hotel to check,  we learnt that the hotel concierge and the hotel are two separate companies, although the concierge desk is just next to the front desk. We were not told before and totally unaware of this. 

The front desk lady did not point this out to me when I request to change my transport. She just proceeded to book a new transport for us and did not even inform us of the price. She most likely will have to cancel our 3pm transport but couldn't find any on their record and just book a new one without bother to check back with us. Her actions caused us much inconvenience and monetary lost!

When I tried to speak to the front desk again after we realised the error,  the hotel staff kept saying it is my fault for double booking.  They refused to claim any responsibility at all. How would a guest be aware of what is the internal arrangement in the hotel and the concierge? 

In the end, I had to pay USD116 in total for my one way transfer!!! This is ridiculous and totally spoilt the end  my wonderful trip in USA and my impression of Marriott. I am a frequent traveller and uses Marriott quite often. I was thinking of becoming their member after this trip as we had stayed in 3 of the hotels in this trip and was impressed until this bad service. 

WARNING: Please be extra careful when dealing with the staff and concierge in this hotel!

title: Good hotel, great location
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a night and had a good experience.  The staff were very helpful, the rooms were well-maintained, and the location is excellent.  They also called us from the front desk to make sure we liked our room.

title: Such a great place with outstanding staff
text: Stayed three nights while attending a conference. It was easy to get to the hotel. Check in was a breeze. The staff is awake and awesome. The Bistro has very nice offerings and Starbucks coffee. The concierge will hold your bags if you have time between checking out and your actual departure time. This was such a blessing. One you should remember to tip the staff for. Very, very clean rooms along with everything else. And the bed was very comfortable. Great experience.

title: Great location
text: Great location and price.  We stayed from Sat to Monday and the location was prime.  There were a number of restaurants, shops and theaters in the area.  Also very close to the metro!!! We went to the theatre twice and took the metro to Williamsburg and Bushwick.  Easy commute from the hotel.  They also have a restaurant and stub hub on site.  Used the restaurant and the food was good but here are several restaurant right out the door so we opted for a variety and not just the same old thing.  I would give his a try when heading back to the big apple.

title: 편리한 위치와 깔끔한 서비스의 호텔
text: 뉴욕 맨하탄에서 가장 유명한 타임스퀘어와 접근성이 아주 좋은 호텔입니다. 메리어트 체인 특유의 안정되고 깔끔한 서비스를 받을 수 있으며, 룸 컨디션또한 나쁘지 않았습니다. 방의 크기는 뉴욕 답게 아담한 사이즈였지만, 머무는데 전혀 불편함이 없었습니다.

title: 매우매우 친절한 스탭, 사랑합니다.
text:
위치는 완벽~걸어서 5분 거리에 지하철 펜스테이션역이 있습니다. 그래서 그런지
가격은 좀 있네요 ^^;.. 근데 스탭이 엄청 친절하시네요. 호텔에서 뭐를 잃어버렸는데
정말 성심성의껏 도와주셔서 너무너무 감사했습니다. 객실은 딱~ 새것같은 느낌은
안들지만 정갈하게 정리정돈 되어 있구요. 로비는 좀 작아서 사람이 많아지만
너무 붐비는 느낌은 듭니다.

title: A Good Stay in NYC
text: Loved this hotel. Great location, room was bigger than most NYC hotels I have stayed at. Bed was comfortable, bathroom spotless and everything was new and modern. Staff were friendly and accommodating and wifi worked great. Walking distance to many places such as Macys, Madison Sq Gardens and Times Square. Would be more than happy to stay here again

title: Tight space yet great place
text:
Only downside, obviously the tight space but the combination of the ease of checking in online, amazing service, and great location made this stay worth while. Ten minute walk away from Times Square and there were plenty of places to eat around the hotel. It got a little confusing though trying to tell the Shuttle Bus which Courtyard Marriott in Times Square I was staying in, apparently there's more than one? (Don't quote me)

Service, especially in New York, was surprisingly amazing. Everyone in the hotel greets you, not just because it's in their job description but because they actually want to. Refreshing! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Need to train front line staff
text:
We had booked a corner room so it was very spacious. The room was very clean. The hotel is very central, very near Times Square, so sometimes a lot of noise from traffic etc. This did not bother me, hey it is New York and for me that's part of it, but if you like it quiet this is not the hotel for you. The rooms are very nice.

Some of the reception staff could do with retraining. My son found a face cloth jamming the revolving door. He picked it up and handed it to one of the receptionists (he was not aware I was watching) he obviously did not want to touch it and was making faces behind my sons back. A bit unprofessional.

title: Fine. Not more than that
text:
We were 3 persons, the twin bed was good but the sofa bed was very uncomfortable.
The breakfast was diverse but not tasty. 
The best thing of this hotel it the location, 5 minutes walk from time square.

title: Excelente experiência
text: Localização excelente. Café da manhã bem servido, não tive maiores problemas com filas conforme foi relatado por outros hospedes. Próximo ao Madison Square Garden e Macy´s. Possui uma balada/rooftop muito bacana e concorrida. O servico de apoio ao hospede muito simpatico e bem paciente com quem não domina o idioma local.

title: Kinda run down , no restaurant
text:
We like Marriott as a chain and they are usually just fine.
This hotel we found to be a bit shabby.
The showers are very basic, and the bed was worn out and lumpy.
Downstairs they have a very basic place for breakfast but all just like yogurt, protein bars and coffee, nothing cooked.
I know its tough to find a Decent well priced place in NYC. I expected more from Marriott.

title: Great stay!
text: Location is awesome. Hotel is nice, friendly staff. Room was clean and surprisingly spacious for NYC! Would definitely stay here again. Courtyard has nice perks like wifi. This is the kind of hotel you look for in a big city, great value for price.

title: Хороший вариант, проверено
text: Отель оказался оптимальным вариантам, чтобы переночевать в Нью Йорке. Пешком да пятой авеню и Таймс Сквер минут 5-10, отель чистый, бизнес стиль, номер хороший, кровать удобная, вай фай работает, персонал вполне адекватно реагирующий. Цена оказалась привлекательной. В общем достаточно положительно!

title: Short but sweet
text: In town to visit our son. I selected this location because it was near his work but also because it's in the garment district. Perfect location for both, as well as a short, easy walk from Penn Station. Hotel is new, clean and safe. Staff was friendly and helpful! Will definitely stay here again!

title: Highly Recommend
text: Great location, within walking distance to Times Square but far enough away from the noise.  Service was excellent, they let us check in early, room was clean and spacious.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Glad I stayed here!
text:
I was only here one night, but I found this to be a better property than ones I had paid more money for in NYC. I will definitely return. I had a really nice room that was actually a good size for NYC hotel rooms. The bathroom was two or three times as large as others I've had in NYC at other hotels, with a modern walk-in tiled shower. I really liked having a small refrigerator. The room was spotless. I slept well and didn't hear much hall or street noise. The only negative was the view, which was of the brick building next door. But that's not a huge deal to me when I'm in NYC for work, as I'm not in the room that much. I found the free wifi to be a little slow, so I was happy when I realized I could upgrade to the faster speed wifi with my Marriott Rewards Gold status. That was an improvement.

The location is very good -- walkable to lots of sights and about a mile from Javits Center.

title: Good location
text: The hotel looks ugly and old from the outside and also in the lobby area. The lobby looks like a Kiosk or a shop. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is great and it is very close to Times Square and Macy's on the other side.

title: My Favourite Place to stay in New York
text:
I was on the 30th Floor. 
Every Staff Member was welcoming and always willing to help. 
The 24/7 Market was perfect for anyone who is travelling from overseas. 
The Hotel Coffee Shop is perfect for Breakfast and a morning Starbucks Coffee.
I will definitely stay here again.

title: Ottimo Hotel vicinissimo a Times Square
text:
E' un ottimo hotel vicinissimo alla 8^ Avenue ed a quattro blocchi di Times Square. Camere ampie, pulite e ben insonorizzate. Prezzo considerata la posizione competitivo.
Un hotel da suggerire senza ombra di dubbio. Personale molto gradevole e servizievole.
Wifi gratuito e ben funzionante!!

title: Near Port Authority and Penn Station
text: We stayed here because of the price and location.  Near two important transportation hubs, we were happy with the room and the location.  No breakfast included in this one, but coffee was available for purchase (Starbucks brand) and people at the front desk were nice and helpful.  Would stay here again if it was the best rate available.

title: Kaotisk indtjek men ellers OK
text:
Fik den værst tænkelige start på opholdet, idet en meget stor gruppe gæster skulle tjekkes ind, og nøglekortene ikke var klar. Ventede to timer i den lille hall i kufferter til halsen. Ikke godt nok. Gangen foran elevatorerne er meget trang, når der er mange, der venter.
Ellers ikke noget at udsætte. pænt stort værelse og god, central beliggenhed.
E.L.

title: bon hotel mais ATTENTION
text:
je faisais partie d'un groupe de 40 personnes en séjour à New York et nous dormions dans cet hôtel bien situé.
Excellent petit déjeuner, sucré et salé, chambre grande et confortable, wifi GRATUIT performant, TV mais pas de chaines en français MAIS ...
Ma femme avait un doute sur un vêtement manquant lors de notre départ. Et en effet, il nous a bien manqué un vêtement à notre retour. Avant d'écrire cet avis, j'ai envoyé un mail à l'hotel pour leur signifier, mais aucune réponse de leur part. Donc un conseil, ne mettez pas vos vêtements dans les tiroirs sous la télé ou dans l'armoire mais laissez les dans vos valises fermées à clé. 
J'attends toujours la réponse de l'hotel qui ne manquera pas de répondre à cet avis, je pense ... c'est bien dommage

title: Justo lo que necesitas para disfrutar NY!
text:
Este hotel esta perfectamente ubicado. Esta a unas cuadras de Times Square y muy cerca de la estación de trenes. Si venis en tren desde el aeropuerto es una opcion ideal.
Los mas destacable a mi parecer es la calidad de las camas. Increiblemente cómodas y suaves. La habitación resultó ademas espaciosa. El lobby es moderno y el personal de recepcion amable.
Los amenities y productos de cosmetica son de primer nivel y la opcion de la cafetera con buen cafe en el cuarto es valorable.
El bar de abajo es práctico, aunque la oferta de desayunos en NY es tan grande y tentadora que yo caminaría unas cuadras para disfrutar otros sabores.
Es un hotel limpio, moderno y de buen gusto. Volveria a este o a otro hotel de esta misma cadena sin duda.

title: Visit last weekend
text: We went to a family gathering last weekend and stayed at this Courtyard. It was a very nice experience. I thank Mr. David Lew, guest service manager, who personally made our stay a quality one. His kindness really meant a lot. James DeLosReyes, one of the bellman, was also outstanding. We are not real city people, so both Mr.Lew and James help really made us feel more secure. Hotel lucky to have such great staff. Our stay was made only better, as the room we had was nice, very clean, and very comfortable!

title: Great New York Hotel
text: Recently stayed at this hotel for a mother-daughter weekend. Hotel was in a great location, walking distance to Times Square, Theatre District and plenty of nearby shopping. Rooms were well kept and staff very friendly. Would stay here again.

title: Très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très correct, chambre propre, petit déjeuner normal et surtout très bien situé, idéal pour découvrir The Big Apple!
Une salle de sport, et un happy hour abordable 😊
Seul défaut: lit d'appoint horriblement inconfortable

title: Wonderful weekend wonderful location
text: Great staff-very helpful. The hotel is located in the garment district not far from Times Square. They rooms were very clean and well appointed. But most importantly it was quiet - a miracle for Manhattan. We could walk down Fifth Avenue to Central Park (long walk), over to the High Line Walkway, and then to Penn Station. Thanks for making it a great stay!

title: Marriott Delivers!
text:
They just know how to do it. Their staff is so friendly and accommodating, especially the housekeeping ladies on the 27th floor. They took extra special care of us: they folded my daughters blanket and place it neatly on the bed with her stuffed animal nod they gave us extra shampoos, conditioners and lotions. The only downside was the fact that the concierge desk closed early. 

The

title: Nice, clean, simple
text:
Nice hotel well located for conventions or Javits centre.
Clean and well furnished room. Look new.
Staff is helping. Except that rules are rules they are not going to assist even if they can (like opening the breakfast few minutes earlier because you have a plane to catch).
But they did assist and are nice when it's in their function.
I will come back.

title: Great stay! Thanks Marriott team.
text:
The staff at the hotel are fantastic. Everyone at the front desk gets a huge kudos for their efficiency, friendliness, and thoroughness. From the greeting at check-in to our retrieving our bags as we returned from the Javits Center they were quick to help however they could.

Hotel is convenient to Times Square & Javits. Far enough away on 37th where it's quiet at night but just a short 5 minutes walk to all action. Room was very clean. Beds comfortable. Mini-mart around the corner. Hotel is close to the Lincoln tunnel entrance so getting out of Manhattan was a breeze.

Parking is a few doors down the street at a public garage. It's about $45/day which is pretty common for the city.

title: Good Location/Friendly Staff
text: Good location, nice small property. You can walk just about everywhere midtown.  The staff was friendly and polite.  I requested a late check out at the last minute and they were very accommodating.  The rooms are small, but for one night I'm not complaining, I received an excellent rate for NYC prices, and booked directly thru the hotel. The wi-fi however was indeed slow.

title: Al centro di Manhattan
text:
L'hotel gode di un'ottima posizione. A pochi passi da Penn Station perciò ottimo per chi deve prendere il treno per recarsi in aeroporto o per chi deve muoversi con la metro.
A piedi, si trova a 10 minuti di cammino da Times Square e a 5 minuti dalla Fifth avenue. Circondato da mille caffetterie, pizzerie, ristoranti, negozi...basta scendere in strada per trovare quello di cui si necessita.
L'hotel è abbastanza moderno, camere non grandissime ma pulite e funzionali. 
Fortunatamente la nostra camera si affacciava sull'intercapedine del palazzo perciò zero rumori e per la qualità del sonno non è male!
La vista non era un granchè...ma quando si rientra la sera dopo tutto il giorno a spasso...della vista diciamo che te ne dimentichi dalla stanchezza!
Bagno abbastanza grande con vasca / doccia.
Staff disponibile, soprattutto il concierge che consiglia le visite da fare...e parla l'italiano.
Non posso giudicare il servizio colazione, perché abbiamo preferito farla fuori ma ho visto che hanno prodotti Starbucks e il banco dolci si presentava abbastanza invitante!
Provatelo!

title: Great Location
text: Great location. Checkin staff were pleasant. With the checkin app our room was ready on our arrival at 11:30 am. Room was a little small but the beds were comfy as expected. Extra coffee mugs & towels were supplied quickly. The bistro choices for breakfast were great.

title: good location and quiet after midnight
text:
The location is this hotel best feature.  It is a few blocks from Penn Railway Station and underground.  A few blocks more to Times Square and the underground there.  Its a comfortable walk to Grand Central Station, with a stop at Byrant park for a coffee.  It is close to the start and end of the hop on/hop off bus stops.

The concierge and the front desk were  always helpful and friendly, even though the hotel was experiencing high occupancy when we were there.,  This made the lifts slow to arrive but the security on the lifts is good.

The room has a tiny fridge just large enough for water and juice bottles.  The bed is comfortable and takes up most of the room.  

Being in a side street that does not usually have much traffic and with our room facing the street, as well as being on the 14th floor, we found the sirens usually had stopped by mid night and the room was quiet.

Being close to Penn railway Station (we walked with luggage) to catch the NJ transit train to the Newark Airport Shuttle was a bonus.  The shuttle drops  you at the terminal  you are using or to car parking.  It is much quicker than taxi, and cheaper.  There are lifts available at Penn but they can take time to find.

title: Boa opção em Midtown Manhattan
text: Bom hotel, com localização central em Midtown Manhattan. Quartos relativamente espaçosos para os padrões de NYC. Banheiro muito bom e espaçoso, recentemente renovado. Apesar de estar em uma área bem movimentada, impressiona pelo silencio dentro do hotel e dos quartos - garantia de uma ótima noite de sono! O hotel possui um pequeno restaurante que server cafe da manha (starbucks coffee) e também happy hour. Preço um pouco salgado para as ofertas do hotel (noa tem serviço de quarto, porem internet é gratis em todos os quartos)

title: Great location
text: Very nice property,  staff was very pleasant. Fantastic location - walking distance to many great places. Rooms are tiny - not a complaint just a reality for the area. Would not hesitate to return. Didn't find the street noise to be an issue and 4 dunkin donuts within a block

title: Expensive night but City Centre Hotel - Great Location
text:
It was an expensive weekend to stay but the Hotel itself was good - a one night Stay, small room but clean and well thought out - Service at the front desk was excellent - Efficient and attentive.

Location is ideal for a City Centre Visit, Didn't use the Restaurant and or Bar as there is so much close by to experience

title: Stayed 3 nights after Northern Transatlantic Cruise
text: Great location and very comfy beds in 14th floor room with 2 double beds, empty fridge meant easy to store drinks and snacks. Coffeemaker a bit basic and very stingy with coffee and tea, cheap plastic tumblers and polystyrene coffee cups took the fifth star. Not really expected in a room costing $420 per night but I guess the rate reflected the location! Lobby lounge areas with TV's in alcoves were great whilst we waited for our taxi to JFK. Didn't try the Nosh cafe but lots of places nearby. Best meal was at Tony's de Napoli - their seafood pasta familystyle was easily enough for 4 and great tasting.

title: Excellent business stay!
text: I stayed at this hotel for business and I have to say I enjoyed it!  A little off of Times Square, which I like.  Everything you need is around you for business needs.  The staff was SUPERB.  Anything I needed they were attentive to, they welcomed me in a professional manner.  I will say the room as a bit dusty and I had a few hairs in my bed, but other than that it was everything else was exceptional.  This hotel is a GEM!

title: Situation parfaite!
text:
Personnel tres agreable, bon accueil!
Chambre propre et fonctionnelle (petits produits de bienvenue, vrai seche cheveux, fer à repasser). 
Petit supermarché à coté ouvert H24
À 2 rues de times square
Tres bon rapport qualité prix
Wifi gratuit meme dans la chambre !

title: Pleasant stay
text:
Stayed here for three nights last weekend at the start of our road trip. The hotel is conveniently located for most things, and doesn't take too long to walk to many of the major tourist attractions. Handy for Penn Station too as we came in on the LIRR and left on an Amtrak to Boston.
It was well decorated and maintained, everything was a decent standard, the beds were comfortable and all the staff we spoke to were pleasant.
I can't comment on any of the other facilities or food as we didn't use any or eat there.
Served a purpose for us, I would recommend to others.

title: Excelente
text:
Excelente hotel com atendimento e serviços de primeira qualidade. Funcionários super atenciosos. Ótima localização situado na 34 street entre as 8 e 9 ave, fica a menos de 50 mentros da 8 ave. Bons restaurantes e cafés perto. 
Com certeza voltarei a me hospedar.

title: Friendly and welcoming staff
text: I stayed one night on a business trip. Location was great. Rooms were super clean and bed was comfortable.  Bathroom was up to date fashion wise. Bright and clean. Staff was super friendly and welcoming, especially the bell man named James. Great smile and style.   I checked my bag there after checking out so I could travel about the city unencumbered.  Appreciated being able to buy breakfast onsite.  With Uber it was easy to get a taxi.  Parking garage a few feet away. Very convenient.  It felt very fresh and not worn about the edges.

title: Super Bowl Staff
text:
During a recent visit to this hotel I had a serious health problem. The staff in the breakfast room and front desk were unbelievable, calling an ambulance, taking care of my wife such as getting needed information from our room, packing breakfast and other food and water to take to the hospital, and going way above the call of duty. They followed up with her during my absence, and greeted me on my return a day or two later.
This was concerned and capable first class personal service, and the manager should be proud of everyone on his staff.

title: conveniently located
text: Had a confirmed room, but arrival was delayed because of severe weather across the country. Finally arrived at hotel at 2am and found out they had over booked and our room was not available.  The staff gave us a voucher for a suite, and breakfast at another hotel. So at 2 am, my sons and I, pulling our luggage behind us, walked with the security guard a block and a half to hail a cab.  We checked in the next day for real and found our room to be comfortable, convenient and the staff very helpful.

title: Decent hotel off Times Square
text: Stayed a total of 10 nights in this hotel with daughter and wife in end Aug/early September. The hotel is in the garment district of NY and while the immediate neighborhood is not as plush as the 5th/6th/7th avenue, it is an excellent location - just 5 minutes to penn station and Madison square garden, and 10-15 minutes to Times Square and the theatre district. we stayed in a triple room of decent size by NY standard. However, don't expect much of a view from your room. The hotel coffee shop serves decent breakfast (that is the only F&B outlet) though you will have many more options around the hotel. We were impressed by the efficient check in and check out process. However, we had issues in terms of the hotel trying to back out from keeping our luggage for a few days (which they did agree on writing earlier) and refusing to upgrade even for a 10 nights stay, so there was no clear benefit of being a Marriott Rewards member.

title: Относительно недорого
text: Останавливались на 5 ночей. Отель расположен на Манхеттене, но не в самом хорошем районе - на улице рядом много бродяг. Номер небольшой, ванная комната - достаточно просторная, кровать удобная. Было одно существенное неудобство - кондиционер дул прямо в кровать. Уборка ежедневная, очень качественная. На первом этаже работал Старбакс - можно было позавтракать, но по вечерам он не работал. Рядом с ресепшн расположен компьютер с принтером, на котором можно только зарегистрироваться на рейс и распечатать посадочный талон. По соотношению цена-качество - очень неплохо.

title: викенд в Нью Йорке
text:
неплохой отель в 10 минутах от Times Square.
-номера довольно маленькие (как и везде в центре НЙ)
+бесплатный WiFi
-завтраков бесплатных нет (впрочем, как и везде в центре НЙ)
-заезд после 16 часов, выезд в 11-12

title: Good centrally located hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel which was centrally located. It is not a luxury hotel but had all amenities we needed and was well located. We didn't have breakfast included so went to nearby places, i would recommend 'best bagel and coffee' for a filling tasty and cheap breakfast. Staff were nice and the gym was good.

title: Excellent rapport qualité/prix
text:
La situation de l'hotel est très pratique pour découvrir NYC. L'accueil est très agréable, les chambres sont assez spacieuses (pour NY) et les lits, Queen size, super confortable. Possibilité d'imprimer les boarding pass gratuitement. Petit bémol : petit déj sympa mais cher et accueil au 'Bistro' pas tjs très avenant.
Nous avions une chambre au 26iè, côté arrière, donc très calme !

title: Great location, easy to get anywhere in NYC
text: Great location, easy to walk just about anywhere.  Your a 10 minute walk from Times Square and another 10 minute walk from the Empire State Building [in the other direction].  So close to everything...just love this place.  I will definitely stay at this location again when I am in town.  The staff was great, very helpful.

title: Best Location to see New York
text: Lovely hotel, clean, friendly, helpful staff.  Always ask for a King room with a kitchenette if you need extra space for your suitcases.  We managed to get the extra room which gave us more space for our suitcases, and a tiny area for food and drinks.  For me Consulting in the fashion business it was perfect as it was right in the Garment District of New York. Short walking distances to Time Square and Macy's etc.  Close to restaurants, tour operators etc.  Perfect location!

title: Great hotel and a great location
text: We had a great room, small but very clean and modern.  The staff was friendly and very accomodating.  It was very quiet - could not hear the street traffic. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.  Great restaurant around the corner and a nice English pub across the street.  This hotel was very close to Penn Station, Macy's. Our view was the pits, but then we were gone all day and didn't come back til late, so it didn't matter to us.

title: 10 Year Old Birthday Weekend
text: Went to NYC over the 9/11 weekend for my daughters 10th birthday. My wife and I were extremely impressed with the property and how clean it was. There are so many amenities close by. (had to walk to CVS at 1:30 in the morning) The heart of Times Square is only a 15 minute walk with three kids in tow. The rooms are super clean and the staff is very friendly. We parked our car a few buildings down and Marriott will stamp your ticket so  you can go in and out if needed. We did not we used the taxi service and Uber to get around. There were five of us in a room, we brought a small blow up mattress for our 7 year old and it fit nicely between the two beds. The view we had from the 22nd floor wasn't anything special but the kids liked being up that high. I would stay here again! WiFi worked like a champ!

title: New hotel in the centre of the city
text:
We chose the hotel based on the location and the reviews. It is 5 mins walk from the Penn Station which is very convenient indeed. The king room was on the small side (smaller than on the photos on their website), but new, clean and nicely arranged. Big comfortable bed compensated for the lack of other space in the room. The room was on the higher floor and on the back side of the building, so it was quiet and the sleep was really good. 
Service - quite friendly and helpful, not to mention efficient. 
Wi-Fi was free and working well. 
Worth visiting again.

title: Ottimo hotel in Manhattan
text:
Hotel pulito ed elegante e in ottima posizione.
Personale gentile e arredamento moderno, la camera non è enorme ma comunque comoda per un soggiorno  a New York.
Abbiamo girato Manhattan completamente a piedi, la posizione consente di raggiungere in pochissimo tempo Times Square.

title: Bueno
text:
Buenas habitaciones
 Un poco caro para el sector pero esta bien ubicado. El desayuno poco variado cuando se está  más de 3 dias .. no es del hotel, es concesión de Starbucks  con opciones muy limitadas.  Atención muy buena y servicios muy buenos . El desayuno podría mejorar.

title: Great hotel A+ Location
text:
Check in was a breeze.
We received a room with a view to a building behind us so nothing special there :)
Room was huge compared to other hotels I have been to in NYC.
Baby crib was comfortable and so was our king size bed (extremely comfy!!!).
Bathroom was big as well.
Hotel is located 2 mins from starbucks, dd and 7/11.
5 mins from times square and port authority.
Price was pretty ok for sat eve. Approx. 240$.
Go there if you get a good price!

title: confortable, bien situado y buen precio
text:
me gusta mucho la cadena Marriot, y este Courtyard es un formato mas econimico, conservando todo la elegancia , atención, y comodidad que siempre los garantiza.
esta a 2 cuadras de times Scuare, y muy cerca también del central park. la Ubicación es la mejor. también tienes una linea del metro a 1 cuadra. la atención y amabilidad de los empleados es excelente, algunos hablan español. a pesar de estar en un sitio tan céntrico , dentro de la habitación es un silencio absoluto, muy bien aislado el ruido.
el sistema del desayuno es con unos menus establecidos, no buffet, pero es muy variado, hay cereal, fruta, omelette, sanduches, etc. y esto hace que te sientas mejor atendido. también lo elegí por el precio, yo opte por pagar habitación con desayuno incluido y sale muy cómodo, en comparación con otros hoteles del área y de menor categoría.
ah....y otra cosa, el wifi esta incluido en la tarifa y es  muy bueno.
definitivamente lo recomiendo al 100%

title: Overnight Get Away
text:
I went to NYC last Friday evening to meet friends for sooner. My fiancé and I stayed overnight at The Marriott Courtyard on West 40th Street. It is located a few walkable blocks to Times Square. The location is much quieter! The hotel staff were very pleasant and efficient. When we checked out, our bags were stored while we went to the theater. 
I would recommend you find another place for breakfast. We had bacon, egg and cheese sandwiches. The bacon was basically raw since the whole sandwich was microwaved. They do have Starbucks coffee.

title: Awesome Hotel Awesome Location felt very safe
text:
I think this is a very new hotel, a couple of years
But what a find
Central location so awesome for doing New York
Short walk from Macy's
Right across the street the main NYC Traffic Police Station
We felt so safe coming and going to the hotel
The only downside would be the number of cop cars parked on the street but that's nothing the hotel can control, these a Traffic Cops and they seem to park where they want.

title: Good location & staff, smelly room & bites
text: Stayed here for 2 nights. Arrived early at bout 7.30am after our night flight and was pleasantly surprised that our room was ready and we were able to get a few hours sleep before starting the day. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Good location about 15 mins walk from the chaos of Times square and 5 mins from Penn station subway. Loads of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Thing that let it down was room smelt funny, bit like sweat, woke up covered in itchy bites and fire alarm went off at 1.30am on first night.

title: Perfect location, close to everything, including LGA
text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during the first week of US Open.  Our room was spacious, with 2 queen beds, overlooking the street, and there was no noise coming from the street either at night or early morning (as long as you do not open the windows). The room was very well maintained and clean,  bathroom nice and larger than you'd expect.  Housekeeping service was great: discreet, but prompt. Reception staff was friendly enough and definitely, efficient.  The only bad thing was that on the very night before our early morning departure, we were suddenly awakened by false fire alarm at about 1:30am, and once it was established that there was no fire, the safety manager kept startling us with PA announcements for another half hour asking guests to remain in rooms and not go to the lobby. I would have considered giving it an excellent rating if it were not for this 'last minute inconvenience' causing us to leave sleep deprived and tired.

title: Great Hotel
text: We loved this hotel. Rooms are very clean and staff is helpful and courteous.  Everything is within walking distance from this hotel. We had a hardtime getting reservation at a restaurant and the hotel staff took care of it for us. We will stay again.

title: Impresionado
text: Muy buen hotel súper bien situado me ha encantado trato estupendo no supe poner el WiFi y enseguida vinieron a la habitación a enseñarme a ponerlo nuestra cama era comodisima si vuelvo a ir alla volveré al mismo hotel asegurado

title: Fantastic location
text:
Wow...I couldn't recommend this hotel enough.  From check in till check out the staff were excellent, friendly and extremely helpful.
The hotel is excellently located with just a few minutes walk for many of the New York tourist attractions.
The room was an excellent size.  I travelled with my mum and we had a room with 2 queen sized beds with walking room to.  There was a good sized wardrobe and desk with chairvto and still didn't feel cramped.  There is a small fridge in the wardrobe which was brill to keep fresh milk and small bottles of water.
The bathroom was also a good size with a decent powered hairdryer.
We didn't use the gym or coffee shop so can't say anything about these.
The WiFi is excellent which made it easy to stay in contact with family back in the UK.
I really can't recommend this hotel enough and wouldn't hesitate in staying here again.

title: Lindo Hotel
text: Lindo hotel a pocas cuadras de Times Square. El servicio es bastante bueno y el personal es muy amable. Las habitaciones son un poco pequeñas, pero confortables y muy limpias. El desayuno no esta incluido como en la mayoría de los hoteles. Recomendable.

title: Great Location
text: Great Location. If you want to be near Times Square and Broadway it is a quick walk. The rooms were clean, standard Marriott and the staff was helpful. The advertised dining at the hotel was closed but that didn't effect the trip as there are many eating establishments nearby.

title: Last minute stay
text: Was a last minute booked   And checked in within 10 minutes was able to checked in as soon as I checked in within walking distance of where we were staying beautiful hotel extremely friendly staff clean rooms and the best part compliment breakfast best ever buffet selection amazing staff

title: Estancia  muy agradable
text:
Buena situación.  Buen servicio y muy amables. Habitación y cama confortable. Quizá  un poco  pequeña. 
La única pega es que te retienen dinero  de la tarjeta que das como fianza  sin avisarte. En mi caso,  desde el día  13 que  dejamos el hotel. ¿ Y si yo contaba con  ese dinero  para mi  estancia?

title: Great Room, Centrally Located, Good Price
text: Except .... The Elevator was always full.  We had a heck of a time getting the 3 of us downstairs, even trying to catch an up elevator so that we could take it down.  Added a lot of delay time to getting our day started.

title: Awesome
text: I highly recommend this hotel. The price was great! The staff couldn't have been nicer. It's only a few minute walk to Time Square which is so convenient. I was expecting a small room due to the price but was surprisingly surprised at the size. Beautiful and clean! This is where I will be staying on my next trip to NYC.

title: Location is perfect for major NYC attractions
text: I stayed at this hotel for one week last month ( July 2015) . The  staff was great except for one young lady who worked the morning breakfast .I came  down five minutes before closing and was met with a bad attitude for requesting to purchase  a simple cup of coffee.  The  King room was small but comfortable . My daughter loved it and  the oversize bathroom  The  location is great ---times square in one direction and herald square  in the other . Major transportation such as subway, port authority and penn station only a few blocks away . One drawback to be prepared for is the building next to the Courtyard . It appeared to be some type of drug clinic or dispensary that operates every morning.  Quite uncomfortable passing by there every day .

title: Freundlich, Zimmergrösse und Barbereich gewöhnungsbedürftig
text:
Wir haben hier drei Zimmer für je vier Nächte bewohnt und waren alles in allem nicht so zufrieden. Beim nächsten Besuch in New York City würde ich allerdings für diesen Preis ein anderes Hotel wählen. Warum ?
Zimmer in dem wir (meine Frau und ich) wohnten (Zimmer 1008) hatte hinterhofaussicht und war extrem klein. Für Koffer auspacken musste schon Bett verwendet werden. Des weiteren war die Klimaanlage so positioniert dass Sie nachts die Kälte Auf das Bett blies. Ein Ausschalten war wegen der Hitze aber nicht möglich.
Gut und kostenlos funktioniert WLAN 
Auch die Lage des Hotels - ca 10 Minuten - Gehweg zum Times Square hört sich besser an als es ist - Das Hotel liegt in einer Straße mit vielen Lagergebäuden ständig waren große Trucks in der Straße.
Bar kann man das auch nicht so richtig nennen - am ersten Abend (Samstags) ganz geschlossen und ansonsten konnte man via Selbstbedienung am Tresen seine Sachen einkaufen. Das gleiche morgens zum Frühstück. Da sind wir in Hotels dieser Klasse in New York besseres gewohnt.
Hotel ist sehr sauber und Personal wirklich sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit, ansonsten wäre Gesamturteil schlechter ausgefallen

title: Fab hotel in a perfect location
text: The hotel is the tallest hotel in North America and was built in 2014. We stayed for 5 nights and it was really was super. I originally booked the Waldorf but changed my mind based on the number of negative reviews. I am so glad that I did. Our room was lovely and modern and the bathroom was the perfect size. We were located on the 14th floor with typical city views.  We had breakfast included in our deal and it was well worth it. Not a million choices but it's quality over quantity right? Wi-fi was free and the access speed was good. Don't bother with the faster connection supplement because honestly, you don't need it. We were here for our friends wedding and staying here helped make our experience of New York a perfect one. So if you are looking for a hotel with a perfect location and great amenities, stay here. You won't regret it.

title: Fulfill my key requirements
text: The hotel managed to fulfil my key requirements for hotel stay - Simple, clean and pretty centrally located.  Room price is also reasonable for me given that this is New York City.  Would recommend thus hotel to others to stay.  Keep up the good work!

title: Will stay here again!!!!
text:
This is a smaller hotel with some flair.  A great location, being only 2 blocks from the subway (Penn Station), 15 minute walk to Times Square.  

The room was spacious compared to other New York hotels I've stayed at.  Room was very comfortable and clean.  All the staff at the Marriott were pleasant and attentive.

As an added bonus, the NYPD is located across the street, so it's a safe neighbourhood.

title: Great hotel, even better location
text:
It's difficult to find good, quality hotels in NYC without paying a fortune.  We like Marriott and Starwood properties, so we picked the Courtyard based on location and the reviews.  Our room was fairly good size for NYC. The view was non-existent from the 19th floor, but I suspect if you are near the top (30-31) you probably have a view.  I had requested it, and with Gold status, I was hoping we would have a shot.  We arrived early and our room was ready which was a bonus.  The hotel is clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful.  The location is a huge plus. The subway entrance is only a few steps away from the hotel entrance.  It is near Times Square so depending on your likes/dislikes that is either a positive or a negative.  If you have never been to NYC before, Times Square is great to experience, but you dont want to hang out there or eat in the area.  The restaurants are marginal and grossly overpriced. Be strong and venture out just a bit to 9th Avenue or to the many Boroughs like Soho to get some food even locals enjoy.
I recommend the Courtyard for sure.

title: Nice Sister Co to Marriott Marquis Times Square
text: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Being the "little sister" of the Marriott Marquis Times Square where we usually stay on our NYC jaunts, this little jewel does not have all the flash and extras as its big sister but what it lacks in "extras", it makes up for in cleanliness and a great staff! The rooms are much smaller than you get at the Marriott Marquis but if you're only going to be sleeping there, who cares? Normally, we have my elderly mother and aunt along for the ride. I would not suggest this hotel if you are traveling with someone who can't walk far as even though it is very close to Times Square, it would be a little much for an elderly or disabled person to walk to. Other than that, kudos to this hotel. They even had Starbucks available in the dining area. I just stayed at another hotel that was much more costly and they unfortunately did not hold a candle to this little piece of paradise in NYC.

title: Ótima escolha
text: Ótima localização, próxima do metro. Quarto e banheiro espaçosos, ficamos em 4 no mesmo quarto sem problemas.  Estrutura do hotel é fantástica e inclui lavanderia. Staff atencioso, tive um problema com meu cartão de crédito e ofereceram todo auxílio para tentar resolver a questão.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé pour qui veut visiter New-York en toute autonomie.
Station de métro à 10 minutes.
Le petit-déjeuner est parfait et très varié. Les chambres sont spacieuses. La wifi fonctionne bien.
Peu de nuisances sonores.

title: Average
text:
Well the hotel is nicely located given that the distances are much longer in the U.S. 
Two blocks from port authority, two blocks from Penn station. 
Staff are nice but not as all the reviews mentioned. 
Hotel is clean and rooms are good side compared to NY.
Prices are average or a bit below compared to NY in August and booked only two weeks in advance. 
I'd recommend the hotel if it's your second time in NY or on business trip

title: Hotel très bien placé !!!
text:
L'hôtel est très bien placé. Il est proche de Times Square, macy's, la station de metro/train Penn station.

Le personnel est agréable.

Les chambres sont de taille correcte et biens aménagées. 
La literie est confortable. Tout est bien propre.

La wifi est disponible dans l'ensemble de l'établissement.

J'ai passé un très bon séjour dans cet établissement.

title: Very average as most hotels in this area
text:
Poor check-in. Only after i had checked-in did they tell me the room was not available...great start.

First room smelly, so moved and was put next to a room under repair and got no rest!

Room did the job. Comfy beds and coffee.

Gym also better than average.

Stuck for good choices in this area. This is prob slightly bettet than the norm.

title: Near and easy access to attractions
text: Found a centrally located hotel that offered two queens in a room...what a find.  Clean, stylish and comfortable.  Would stay there again.  Staff was very friendly and informative.  We were there to go to museums, take in a jazz show on a ship and of course to shop!  What fun and despite being a short trip it was refreshing not exhausting...kudos New York!

title: Clean and Comfortable hotel. Would stay again
text: Nice Marriott property a few blocks off Times Square. So fairly quiet and not a ton of street traffic. Was Excellent for our trip. Close to subways so we went to Both Mets and Yankee games. Plenty of restaurants close. The nightly price was reasonable for NY without prepay only option. This was great as many hotels require non refundable payment for all nights to get a decent rate. Good for families. Rooms clean. Elevators were fast

title: Excelente ubicación, hotel confortable
text:
Hotel ubicado en pleno Manhattan (West) cerca de Times Square, PennStation, Macy´s, The Empire State, calle 42,

Habitación limpia, cama amplia y cómoda para descansar de las duras jornadas del viajero, baño impecable.

Tamaño de habiotación algo reducido, así como el armario (estamos en Manhattan y el precio del m2 a megamillonario)

title: Clean and excellent Hotel
text:
- Clean room and Bathrooms
- excellent staff - Checked us in and checked back if room is fine
- Alex the usher is excellent and knowledgeable
- excellent facilities
- Top class location
- Rooms are a little small(i guess thats ok for a hotel in Times square)

title: Comfortable hotel with three blocks of Penn Station and near Theater District
text: My daughter and I spent two nights at this hotel so that we could see a show and do some sight seeing and shopping. It was convenient to take the train into Penn Station and to walk three blocks to our hotel. The hotel is new-ish and comfortable, with quiet rooms, good air conditioning, and a good cafe on the first floor. Breakfast is not included but it was fine, though expensive, to eat in their cafe. The staff and service were excellent. The only draw back of this place was that you had to walk over the 8th Avenue to catch a taxi. Overall, we had a good experience.

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Buena situación, limpio, la cama es muy cómoda y ancha, la temperatura perfecta ya que cuentas con aire frío y caliente. Es muy tranquilo, no oímos ruido ninguna de las noches q nos alojamos. Ponen a tu disposición utensilios en la habitación como secador, plancha y caja fuerte que se agradecen. Las habitaciones no son muy amplias pero el tamaño es adecuado.

title: Family Friendly Vacation
text: Located southwest of times Square was a good central location for us to have as home base for our day trips. Close to Times Square and the Empire State building. We walked to Central park, the Rock, and Fifth Avenue easily. The hotel was clean new and fresh. Service was excellent by all staff. We will return when back again and definitely recommend. Rooms are a bit small but well appointed with large TV, bar fridge and in room safe. We did not use the gym, and no pool at this property.

title: Top location
text: As party of 4 adults on 5 day trip to N York, this was an ideal location. A stone's throw from Bryant Park, the subway and Times Square we were able to travel with ease. Rooms were plenty spacious for 2 sharing adults. Staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. The small shop was useful for quick pick ups although there is plenty of choice in the local drug store. We walked to East 44th for breakfast at The Red Flame....great value spot. Central Park is good walk away. Taxi to Ground Zero worked well. Perfect central location.

title: Great location, clean and comfy room
text:
We stayed there for 8 nights and received great customer service throughout. The standard king bed room on the 2nd floor was clean, quiet with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. The free Wi-Fi was reliable and very handy.

The hotel is situated 5-10 minutes walk from Times Square, which is very close yet far enough from the jostling crowds.

Will definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent hotel for the price
text:
I have just spent 5 nights at the Courtyard by Marriott with my family. The hotel really is excellent for the price range and in a great location for the mid-town sites - about 10 mins walk from the Empire State Building in one direction and 10 minutes to Times Square in another.

Room: Our room was very clean on arrival and our chambermaid was like the magic cleaning fairy - every morning we left our room looking like a bit of a bomb site (there were four of us in it after all) and every evening we came back and it was cleaned, tidied and polished to perfection. In fact we were so chuffed we left a sizeable tip. The air conditioning was very slightly intrusive noise-wise, but as it was 90 degrees for the whole week, we were forced to put up with it. To be honest, after a full day of sightseeing, you are so tired it won't keep you awake anyway. There was no kettle in the room which was a bit irritating, but there was a small coffee machine which we contrived to make tea with after a bit of head-scratching (although it did taste slightly coffee'ish!) There is also a small fridge in the wardrobe which was an absolute godsend, especially in the heat-wave we experienced.

Another really important thing was that there was virtually no noise at all from other guests - we were barely aware that other guests were on our floor apart from the odd plumbing noises. Getting a decent night's sleep can be very hit and miss in a hotel, but this place has somehow got it sorted - in fact we all commented on how well we were sleeping throughout the week. And the bed was really comfy!

There is a small diner downstairs which serves very respectable (although quite pricey) basics. Fried egg and bacon comes in at a pretty costly $13.95, but the good news is that one plateful is really enough for two, unless you are a complete gannet :) 

Staff: The staff throughout the hotel are incredibly helpful, courteous and friendly. The reception staff are incredibly welcoming, various maintenance staff leapt out of the lift if we needed to use it and resolutely refused all efforts to persuade them to get back in and go before us, the concierge is worth his weight in gold and so is the lady who serves breakfast. (I've forgotten her name but she is an absolute star). The barman (bar manager?)  is also a complete star and provides good banter over your pre-dinner tipple.

Location: Although conveniently placed for all the mid-town sites, I would say the area (the part of West 37th street where the hotel is located) is a tiny bit downmarket. There was an unfortunately placed syringe disposal unit about 12 feet from the front door of the hotel and more than once there were one or two tramps slumped against the wall just along the road when we came back at night. This didn't bother us, but it might upset some people.

Overall we were thoroughly pleased with our choice of hotel and would definitely recommend for value, sleep quality, service and cleanliness.

title: great location
text: Our family of 4 enjoyed a great overnight stay at this hotel. Great location to roam the city from.  Hotel staff  was courteous and prompt with getting us to our room. We arrived at 11am and with luck our room was ready. The rooms were spacious  w 2 queen beds and :very neat & clean!  I will return to this location as it was perfect for our city escape.

title: Clean Hotel near anywhere you need to go in NYC!!
text: I stayed here with my family of four (two young daughters)..Clean, very convenient to all you need in city. Front desk was very helpful especially Dwayne who recommended we eat at Tick Tock for breakfast. Outstanding recommendation!! Two blocks away and was perfect! Thanks Dwayne (Keith and Natalie).. Street out front of hotel is a little sketchy, but what neighborhood in middle of city isnt..

title: First Time to NY
text: Room was very nice. We stayed for 5 nights. We had a double room for 3 adult and 1 child (age 10). Not a lot of room, however we were not in our room other than to sleep and shower. The hotels location is awesome. Right in the heart of Time Square. Walk out the door of the hotel to purchase and board the Hop on Hop off bus. Theaters are within walking distance. Located near the Today Show, Rockefeller Center and many more wonderful sites. Close to shopping too. The Marriott staff was always pleasant and the rooms were very clean as was the hotel.  The only reason I did not give this hotel 5 stars was the restaurant service and price. We only are their once for breakfast and did not have the buffet.  We ordered off the menu and it took forever for is to get our food.  I would stay at this hotel again just not eat at the restaurant. When it was time to leave we hailed a cab as soon as we stepped out our door and off we went. We had a great trip. Hotel is only 11 Miles from LaGuardia airport depending on the time of day the trip from the airport was 20 minutes. This was a very nice hotel.

title: This is another nice Marriott rehab turning an old hotel into a new Courtyard.
text:
Nicely rehabbed Courtyard.   Great Location for Garment District / Madison Square Garden  / Times Square.   One Great restaurant around the corner Casa Nonna on 38th.  Not the greatest neighborhood, but not the Worst.   Hotel offers all that a Courtyard should and is a great value compared to many other NYC Hotels.
As a loyal Marriott Rewards member; I preferred to stay there than any comparable hotel.

title: Hotel acogedor y muy buena localización.
text: Nos hospedamos en este hotel durante 10 días, la habitación no muy grande pero acogedora y el baño amplio. Todo impecable. Aunque el desayuno no estaba incluído en el precio de la habitación tiene un bar con precios moderados y también dispone de varios establecimientos cercanos. Si tuviera que hospedarme de nuevo en New York sin duda volvería a este hotel ya que pasamos unos días muy agradables aunque no puedo decir que fuera barato, aunque en New York es todo muy caro.

title: Good
text: Good location and nice rooms. Breakfast is a la carte menu rather than buffet though. Bar seems to have strange opening hours too. Overall nice though only a few minutes stroll from Times Square. We thought it was a little pricey but it is New York I guess.

title: Excellent MSG, Times Square Access with Local Diners to Enjoy
text:
My buddies and I stayed at this Courtyard (Times Square West in Manhattan) and had an outstanding stay.   This hotel is a few blocks to the west of the heavy traffic and tourist areas of Times Square and what a difference a few blocks makes (for reduced noise, traffic and general congestion).   

One of my buddies had never been to NYC and we picked this hotel for the easy access to Times Square and Madison Square Garden.   We were in town for the Wounded Warriors Basketball Tournament in late November 2014.   Access to these two places was perfect....a few blocks (walking) and we were on top of the action.   

What made our trip even more enjoyable was the concierge level service provided by Maria Pozo, Marriott Guest Manager.   On multiple days and times, she provided perfect recommendations for local diners for breakfast and lunches.   Each of these spots was within two or three blocks from the hotel and allowed us to enjoy great food while not having the chaos of touristy locations in Times Square.    

My room was sharp - I love the consistency of the experience at the Marriott - and even though my room overlooked 37th street, noise wasn't a problem.   Kudos to Maria and staff for making our trip to NYC a huge success - we're already planning our trip for this fall (November 2015) and will be staying at this hotel again.   

Final note - didn't realize this until we left - this hotel is about three or four blocks from the tunnel that gets you from Manhattan to NJ - this made our Uber from the hotel to the Newark airport even easier.  So, location is definitely a huge plus.   

Cheers!

title: Excellent staff, Clean Rooms, Fabulous Location
text: Great hotel! Warning - the rooms are very, very tiny - very typical NYC - so it's not a complaint, just an advisory note. We had a lot of luggage, so it was a tight fit. Overall, an excellent hotel. First, it's relatively new so decor is updated & trendy. Second, the bar is both a coffee/breakfast eatery as well as a meeting spot to grab a night cap. The hotel staff is what rocks this hotel. They're friendly, but not intrusive, alert and helpful. The cleaning staff rocked. BTW, how great is it to stay in a place where everyone is happy to work there? Seriously. Their satisfaction showed in how they treated each guest with courtesy and pleasantries - all genuine. Our front desk clerk Paula was first rate. I didn't care for our first room - it was sort of dark and on a low floor and I wanted more sunlight because I was working out of the room while attending a business conference. She found me another room that met my needs immediately. The hotel is in great proximity to many restaurants, fast food restaurants, Duane Reade/Walgreens (groceries) the subway and the bus station. It's a ten-minute walk to Times Square for all that fun shopping and Broadway plays. The hotel has free high-speed WiFi that worked well at all times. Some floors had ice makers and filtered water to refill water bottles. It was great tasting water. Rooms had coffee makers, too. The hotel had great security, and you needed a key card to work the elevator, so riffraff couldn't get above the first floor. There are only a few downsides to the hotel, but they are very minor. The first is that the business center is off to the right of the front desk, so it was loud at times when trying to work, but there are 2 available computers whereas some area hotels only have one. The computers are password protected which prevented non-guests from using them, so that is a plus. The other downside is that the hotel was in near proximity to a Tobacco shop so you had to weed through some unsavory folks with their vapors to get to the front door. It's NYC, so you expect that street element and that was only during business hours. I would most definitely stay there again. Loved it. Highly recommend.

title: удобное место расположение
text:
у отеля очень удачное место расположение ( 5-7 мин до times square и 25-30 мин до центрального парка). рядом есть магазинчики , где можно купить воду, снеки, кофе.
Номер в отеле очень маленький, но достаточно приятный, чистый. С собой берите тапочки, тк в номере нет ни тапочек, ни халатов.

title: Good location
text:
The hotel is in easy walking distance from Penn Station and a stroll from Times Square, but thankfully, in the Garment District and away from the noise of Times Square itself. After two hectic days, we were glad to turn into a quieter street.

We arrived at noon and were allowed to have our room, in spite of official check in time of 4pm, which then gave us the afternoon free. We used it to follow the lovely concierge, Dwayne's advice, on the excellent Hop On Hop Off bus.

Our room was fine, with a very comfortable king size bed and high quality bedding. A huge double shower was a pleasure.

My only slight carp was that the bar area, shared with the breakfast room/ bistro, was somewhat drab.  It wouldn't stop me choosing the hotel again, though.

title: Good hotel.
text: The hotel is located close to the popular tourist attractions and has a modern feel to it. The rooms are spacious and the staff are friendly. Beds are comfy and rooms are well air conditioned. Would definitely recommend. The closet tourist attractions are the Empire State Building and Times Square.

title: Fantastic Service!!
text: Was in town for concerts at Madison Square Garden and wanted something within walking distance to the venue.  I was absolutely blown away by the phenomenal service.  I'm a former conference planner and am accustomed to very high end properties.  Every single person we encountered was extremely friendly, knowledgable and professional, especially Michael, the bellman/concierge/jack of all trades.  Bravo, Marriott.  You've won a loyal customer!

title: Don't expect space
text:
Form and function are about it ---- typical clean marriott courtyard but literally the bathroom was bigger than the room. I laughed when I saw a folding luggage stand and realized you couldn't open it.

It's a decent locale behind the garment center not too far from Penn Sta but as a lifetime marriott platinum I was a bit taken aback----- cruise ship cabins are bigger

title: "free" cancellation but not free
text:
As a marriot fan, I booked this hotel last year for stay in NYC during early July through booking.com.    Cancellation was stated to be free unless made last minute.   I cancelled the booking in March this year and received confirmation from booking.com that no cancellation cost would be charged.    However, the hotel has mistakenly charged my credit card by US$335 for no-show recently.    I raised the issue to booking.com and provided all the requested information for verification.    I thought it should be straight forward but after more than 1 week back and forth, I am just told that the two parties (agent and Marriot) cannot reach conclusion yet.   It seems that the two parties are passing the buck to each other.   No party can commit that I can get refunded.    

Without knowing the full picture, I can't say which party is to blame, but it's absolutely not my fault with all the written evidence on hand.   Even if the two parties cannot agree with each other, they should not put me as the victim of their problems.   I hope that Courtyard Marriot can react promptly and refund the no-show charge to me as soon as possible.

title: Very nice and quiet hotel near Times Square
text: This is a very busy part of New York, only 3 blocks from Penn Station and 5 blocks from the center of Times Square.  But this was one of the quietest hotel rooms we have ever had.  We found the location to be very convenient and the concierge was helpful and knowledgeable.  Broadway shows were within easy walking distance.  If you want to stay in the Times Square area, this is an excellent choice.

title: Excelente custo benefício!
text: Excelente localização: próximo ao Madison Square, Times Square, lojas Macys...serviço e atendimento impecável! Infra estrutura muito boa...estávamos em 4 pessoas dividindo o mesmo quarto e foi uma experiência muito boa, pois o quarto era amplo, as camas king size e os lençóis deliciosos!

title: What a lovely Hotel
text:
This hotel is really lovely and in a fantastic location to explore the city.  The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating and we would definitely recommend it and stay again ourselves.

The restaurant is really nice too and the happy hour makes the drinks a decent price.

An added bonus was loads of USB ports in the light fittings to charge our devices.

title: Bien situé, entre Times Square et Central Park
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé. A pieds, il est à : 10 min. de Times Square, 10 min. de Top of the Rock, 20 min. de l'Empire State Building, 5 min. de Central Park. Il est également proche d'une station de métro.
L'hôtel est propre, la chambre que nous avions était assez petite mais avec une vue imprenable sur la ville. La literie est très bonne. Le Salon-Bar est spacieux et assez sympa (nous y avons dégusté un excellent Margarita). Il y a un espace avec des ordinateurs et imprimantes à disposition des clients.

title: Bem localizado e atendimento cortez
text:
Hotel bem localizado, no fashion district a duas quadras do metro, proximo a times squares. Quartos limpos e silenciosos, atendimento super cortez e eficaz também no atendimento no bar para happy hour.
Fui no verão e o ar condicionado estava perfeito. Outro ponto a destacar é o banheiro. Bom tamanho a ducha do banheiro era muito boa. Possui banheira também.
Destaque para o pessoal (staff), atentos e super gentis.

title: Excelente servicio! y Buena Opcion
text: Es un hotel muy bien ubicado a escasas cuadras del Times Square, New York Time y  Penn Station, Empire state. Es una zona muy tranquila con muchos restaurantes, bancos  y sitios de comida rápida,  el personal de la recepción es muy amable y atento. Hablan español, las habitaciones son amplias y muy limpias, en general las instalaciones  tienen un ambiente bastante agradable. Sirva para viaje de placer, negocios y con familia. Sin duda en mi próxima visita seleccionaría este mismo hotel.

title: Hotel meraviglioso
text:
Posizione dell hotel ottima, stanza pulita e a mio parere spaziosa, eravamo al 27 piano e di notte non si sentiva alcun tipo di rumore, personale molto gentile, grazie a James per la disponibilità! nonostante il nostro inglese è stato molto gentile a spiegarci tutto per il meglio! Abbiamo fatto 6 giorni di solo pernottamento veramente ottimi!
Grazie

Jessica

title: Great Place pretty central - if not use the subway
text: I found this place to be very helpful.  The customer support was excellent and Melania, the dining room supervisor, was exceptional.  Its never easy to travel but when you are supported but great people it makes for a wonderful trip.  The place was clean and the gym facilities were outstanding!

title: Great HoteL in New York
text:
Hi, I visited New York 6 times, but when I was in New Your in November 2014 for Thank Giving Day I stayed with my son for a week at the Courtyard Marriot Times Square West and I was amused by it.
In few word you got: Very friendly and helpful staff, at the front door, at the bar and even the cleaning staff was always smiling to us, huge bedroom ( we had a  twin bedroom) with an amazing shower, very quiet and we were in New York! Very good breakfast, everything is sparkling clean, and you are really safe because all works with your room key, lift as well. This hotel is near everything: Madison Square, Macy's, Times Square and Broadway You got free Wii-Fi in the room and a computer at the reception where you can check in your flight and print your boarding card free of charge!! Since then this is my favourite hotel in New York, see you soon

title: Clean and spacious room, friendly staff, decent location, parking and room odor are opportunities for improvement.
text:
Room: Pros-large for New York, very clean and the bathroom was especially big for a nyc hotel room.  
Cons-while the window was big it did not offer a view of the city and room 2312 smelt very musty as if water had been sitting for a long time somewhere in the room.
Location: Pros-10 minute walk to theatre district, 5 minute walk to penn station, 20 minutes to Central Park.  Cons-it is listed as a time square hotel but you actually have to walk ten minutes to time square. Parking: Pros-they have a parking option that cost what you would expect to pay in this part of nyc.  Cons:  you have to walk half a block to the parking garage and it is not owned or operated by the hotel.  You can't just valet your car in front of hotel.

title: Wirklich zu empfehlen
text: Wir waren 4 Tage zufriedene Gäste hier im Hotel. Einerseits das freundliche und hilfsbereite Personal, andererseits die sauberen, gut ausgestatteten Zimmer. Auch die Möglichkeit zu frühstücken haben wir als angenehm empfunden. Noch ein Vorteil des Hotels: die super Lage: Subway, Hopp on Hopp Off Busse, Time Square, Empire State Building, die vielen guten Restaurants,...

title: Niente male davvero
text:
Sto soggiornando qui per il viaggio di nozze,quindi non conosco di preciso i prezzi.....pero' vi assicuro che vale la pena venirci!!!
Personale alla reception eccellente,camera effettivamente piccola ma pulitissima,bagno efficente e limpido.....all'interno c'e' anche lo starbucks per fare colazione(leggermente piu' caro di quelli in strada)!
Leggevo le varie recensioni prima di venire e c'e' chi si lamenta dei rumori notturni.....ma scusate,volete l'albergo a 2 minuti da time square.....e che pretendete che un po' di casino nelle traverse dove si trova non ci sia?!?!?
A me fastidio non ne ha dato,anzi sentire le sirene mi fa' molto stile new york!!!!!
L'unica critica e' sull'elevato costo delle bevande.....giu' al bar una birra bud piccola non puo' costare 8$ circa + tip!!!!!!
Questo non e' corretto!
Comunque se volete albergo pulito e strategicamente perfetto veniteci,un po' di attenzione soltanto la notte quando tornate in albergo perche' purtroppo come in tutte le traverse delle grandi citta' bisogna avere mille occhi!

title: Happy staff, clean hotel, great location
text: Super convenient location near Penn Station and lots of sights. Staff was very friendly and nice and everything was very clean. Surprisingly quiet rooms. I enjoyed my stay and the convenience of the casual restaurant and bar. Bell staff went to heroic lengths to hail me a cab at rush hour!

title: Great location!
text: The hotel was very clean and friendly.   We had a view of the Empire State Building.   Walking distance to everything we wanted to do and a subway station on every corner!  The price was very reasonable for New York and even though we drove it wasn't that hard to get to.  The lobby was very comfortable for taking breaks during the day and they kept our luggage locked up for us before we checked in and after we checked out because we wanted to go exploring with our 2 kids.  We will definitely stay here again!

title: Great hotel at a great location!
text: Just a few blocks from MSG, this hotel seems close to everything! The subway station is just a short walk to 34th. We've stayed here twice this summer, and the staff has been very helpful and friendly each and every day. I found the rates to be very competitive. We will be back!

title: Recomendo!
text:
Ótima localização, próximo a Pen Station, Time Square. Quarto, bom, banheiro também, camas confortáveis e o serviço de limpeza também. 
Não usamos o restaurante do hotel, pois a variedade de restaurantes e cafés (Starbuks no outro lado da rua), é grande. 
E para as mulheres - próximo a  melhor Macys e Sephora dos EUA. Adoramos é certo que voltaremos!

title: Clean and Quiet Courtyard
text: Needed room near Times Square for a Saturday night.  Hotel is on 37th but just past 8th toward 9th.  It is centrally located and you can walk to many things from here or easily connect to a subway.  The area is not as loud or busy as those right in Times Square which can be pretty congested with tourists.  Had room 1012 and was concerned with location across from the elevator, but front desk reassured me that rooms were quite soundproof.  They were correct!  Room faced the back of the hotel which was not scenic, but was quiet.  Bathroom was surprisingly large for NYC, comfortable bed, in room mini fridge, coffee maker and so clean.  Front desk staff went out of their way to greet you and assist you.  I  couldn't get late checkout, but bell staff did a great job in making luggage storage and later retrieval  quick and painless.  (Amazing job given the number of bags they were holding for customers).  When needing to stay in this part of town, I would return.

title: Great location.  Great rooms
text: Stayed at this hotel a few days ago with all my adult children.  We reserved 3 rooms.  Everyone commented on the rooms and felt they were large for New York City.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Rooms were not only large but clean and quiet.  The hotel is located within walking distance of Penn Station and Grand Central Station. Will stay here again when visiting the Big city.

title: Excellent place to stay hands down
text: Had a wonderful stay, clean, friendly,  star bucks coffee, did I say clean! "Conveniently located to go shopping uptown ,downtown and all around. Absolutely a delightful experience from entering to exiting. Loved my room,  the coffee , close to anything. Safe!

title: A hidden gem
text: This a fairly new hotel built into an old garment factory.  It was very modern, clean, organized, and well appointed. Our room was comfortable.  The staff was amazing.
