Parking was offsite, but right next door at an independent garage that was clean and safe.  We left our car for three days with no problem.  James the valet was very polite and helpful.  He walked us and our bags the 100 yards down the street to the garage and waited with us while our car was retrieved.  Then he loaded our bags and sent us safely and conveniently on our way.  It was if the hotel had valet parking.  This is the gem of hotels at a fraction of be price of the others.  It was a ten minute walk to Times Square.

title: Great location!
text:
The location of this hotel is great. Close to multiple attractions, yet far enough out of Times Square that you can leave that ridiculously hectic crowd a bit behind. There is a housing authority office a few buildings down and the people in there can be scary, but it is NYC. You kind of have to deal with sketchy homeless people, the smell of urine and insane crowds when you are there.

My only real complaint is that the A/C units in the rooms that have 2 queen beds are so close to one of the beds that you freeze, even on the warmest days. We had to design some contraption to make it so that the air blew up and over the bed. It was a bit crazy, but in the grand scheme of things it's still minor.

title: Good location
text: Lucky choice for a one night stay. Found this online and would book again. Good location and well presented room -very spacious for NY. Good service also. Oils recommend for singles or families or couples.

title: Fantastico!
text:
5 giorni a New York, con base in questo perfetto Hotel/Residence. Posizione perfetta, vicino a due fermate della metro, 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square, personale gentilissimo per ogni informazione,pulito e con un'ottima colazione al mattino.
Rapporto qualità prezzo da 10!

title: One of the best!
text: I was a little hesitant to stay at the Courtyard in the city, because sometimes "pocket hotels" can be so mediocre and not worth the cost. However, this Courtyard superseded my expectations. Upon arrival, the doorman quickly helped me with my baggage as I unloaded everything from a cab. Check in was fast and easy, too. While getting into my room, I was struggling with my giant suitcase and a staff member quickly jumped to my aid without me ever saying a word. The room was fresh and clean with a lot more space than I had anticipated. I really loved the giant bathroom! So hard to find in NYC hotels! During my first night, I realized that the pillows were feather and my allergies couldn't handle them. I called the front desk and within five minutes, I had new pillows! When I checked out, I had some time to kill before my flight, so the staff offered to hold my bags for me and call a cab when I got back. I kicked around the neighborhood and enjoyed a lovely breakfast. I returned and I had my luggage and a cab in minutes. I truly loved my experience in this hotel!

title: The worst experience ever at courtyard Marriott on 37th street bet 8/9 ave
text: I arrived at the hotel at 4pm & was told all the rooms are still cleaning & 1 to 1 1/2 wait unless I take a room on 10th floor. I was too tired to wait, so I took a room on 1005. It was a nightmare. First I noticed that the outside window, there's a roof and a machine that makes huge noise. I called a front desk & asked to changed the room but was told that none of the rooms are avail. I was angry that they treated me even though I'm a Marriott reward customer for many years. at night time, the noise was too loud I couldn't sleep & made me wake up many times. Those types of room should be given to the guest using the third party booking not the valued customer like me paying a retail price for the room. I'll never return to this hotel ever again and try to avoid Marriott property at any cost.

title: Good location in NYC
text:
The hotel is in a great location in NYC - close to Times Square, Madison Avenue, Bryant Park. The staff is very friendly - always ready with a tip or two about the city. Very quiet despite being so close to the city.

Only issue is the breakfast - it is not included as usual hotels do. There is a restaurant where you need to buy specific breakfast items - can be a bit of bother.

title: close to everything
text:
very nice hotel, with great staff, helpful and friendly. Robert at reception is very forthcoming, and got us thru manager Jina Lee what we needed. Everything is in walking distance, albeit the neighborhood is still a bit rough and dirty, but hotel is impeccable. Rooms typical midtown size, but comfortable, bathrooms very good.
Breakfast at the Bistro is ample and good, albeit a bit on the pricey side. Snacks in the evening at the Bistro are good.....try the flatbread pizza, it is superb.

title: Good location. Very friendly staff. Highly recommended!
text: We stranded in this hotel because our flight was late and our booked hotel cancelled our reservation because of late arrival. The staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The rooms were cosy and nice. Every interesting spot is reachable in a short time. You can walk to Madison Square Garden or the Empire State Building. The breakfast is good. I would definitely go there again. Thank you!

title: Good hotel
text:
Location- The hotel is well located and about 10 mins walking distance from Times Square and the nearest subway. It is walking distance from many downtown attractions. There are numerous restaurants you could walk down to for breakfast and meals.
Rooms- Clean and neat. There is a couch which doubles up as an extra bed. The view is negligible but you don't really stay in the room so much. The bathrooms are large and everything seemed to work well. 
Service- Great front desk which is very helpful. There are computers and printers in the lobby which help you with bookings etc. There is a washer and dryer in this hotel.
Breakfast- Basic but sufficient. Not included in the room rates. One can eat out.
Wi-Fi- Fast and included in the room rates.
Overall, a great hotel for the price and a fab location.

title: Great location, great room, friendly staff...
text: I stayed here for a week during a trade show at the Javits Center. I had a king bed room on the 16th floor. The room was on the small side, but it was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable, the shower was huge and there was an in-room fridge. As far as the room in concerned, the only complaint I have was the iron... it leaked water like a sieve! The hotel was only a three block walk to the convention center. Not having to flag down a taxi every day to get back to the hotel was a HUGE convenience. If you walk three blocks in any direction you are going to pass about 30 good restaurants. The staff was very friendly and the price was very reasonable... for New York City. We plan on staying here again next year.

title: Great location and value
text: We stayed here in early May (weather was perfect for our entire trip!).  Arriving early to the hotel, our room unfortunately was not ready.  The staff was friendly and advised that they could hold our luggage until a room was available.  Located on a side street, the hotel is only 3 blocks away from the closest subway station (A, C, E lines).  It was also only 5 blocks away from Herald Square where I was able to catch the N, Q, and R metro lines.  This was convenient since we have visited NYC before and didn't necessarily do anything in the Times Square area.  The area was quieter than central Times Square and I felt safe even at night.  The room was nicely appointed and modern.  We faced another building but we didn't spend much time in the room so that was fine.  It was understandably small but roomy enough for two people with opened luggage (I've stayed in smaller in Asia).  I liked the walk in shower  which had good water pressure and drainage.  There was free wifi, in-room safe, ironing board, and flat screen TV with tons of channels. I was concerned since we had the ice machine next to our door but it was relatively quiet since there were only so many rooms on each floor.  Also, the ice machine had a water dispenser which was super handy for refilling our bottles.  A great property that I have no concerns staying in again!

title: Great place, great value, great hospitality
text: I'm a member of Marriott rewards and this property reinforced why. Was very happy with the value, the location and amenities. The staff was super friendly and helpful. When I checked out they asked if I wanted them to hold my bags till I left the city which was nice. Another fantastic Marriott property.

title: Toll
text: Sehr freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal, Sauberkeit auf den Zimmern, ordentliche zeitgemäße Ausstattung, extrem zentrale aber dennoch ruhige Lage, sehr gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis, immer wieder gerne!!

title: Central to everything  the subway
text: Clean rooms, nice decor and modern baths. Front desk friendly with a concierge avail to help you plan your outings.  This was a high school graduation trip with the bestirs along onparents tab. It could not have beenany better. BIg thanks to all the staff for putting your best forward for your city. Well done.

title: Excellent location, tops in service
text: The location was perfect - walking distance to several of the attractions we wanted to see, e.g. Times Square, Broadway shows, Empire State Building, Macy's, etc, but not noisy. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

title: Enjoyable stay but dreadful breakfast.
text:
Central location close to Penn station, the bus terminal and Times Square - but in a less attractive side street. Comfortable, modern rooms with tea making facilities. Friendly staff (reception, concierge, housekeeping). Windows could be opened. I would come again!

However the breakfast experience made me doubt whether this hotel is worth a 4 star rating.... It was mediocre in contents and presentation. We had the choice between hot breakfast (sandwich from the menu and one drink) and cold breakfast (one piece of pastry, one drink, a joghurt or fruits) which is very repetitive for seven days. All was served in paper cups (Starbucks) and plastic packaging. But the real annoyance was the staff working at the bar / breakfast room: unfriendly, unattentive, grumpy! All together a real lack of style. Apparently private groups can make use of a buffet and get real dishes (ceramic cup/ plate/ bowl...). I would strongly recommend not to book the complementary breakfast but get something around the corner: wider choice, better service, better atmosphere.

title: awesome long week end in New York
text: stayed here with Husband for a long weekend get away -- Arrived from Canada at 1045am and room was ready so we checked in early with no issues. We we also able to check out late (to accommodate a late flight home) receptionist Stephanie was very helpful in recommending restaurants near by and best ways to navigate the city. Hotel is within walking distance to major site seeing places (Rockefeller centre, Empire state building, times Square). About 3 blocks north of Penn station. The hotel is incredibly clean and although rooms are small the bathrooms are very spacious and beds are very comfortable. Only down side in my opinion is the elevated prices for items in the restaurant but I guess you pay for connivence factor. Overall would not hesitated to book her again for our next trip. (hope it is soon :) )

title: Great location clean rooms
text: Have frequently traveled to NYC for a "Broadway" weekend and have often been disappointed with accommodations. This hotel provided s great location, by NYC standards the rooms wet large and well kept. The staff was friendly and helpful. All in all a good experience.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel is 5 blocks from time square I am just back from a 6 night stay. My husband my 22 year old son and myself found the hotel very clean and comfortable with very helpful staff. Close to the port authority bus terminal  ans time square. Great for sight seeing and shopping as its a great location. I would recommend this hotel if you want a mid range price with comfortable beds and fluffy white towels and great staff

title: Excelente relación precio/calidad
text: Hotel con ubicación excelente, a pocos minutos caminando de times square, y a media cuadra del metro. Buenísimo hotel, limpio, recientemente renovado. Habitaciones de tamaño normal, muy cómodas, bien aisladas del sonido de la calle. Buena relación precio calidad considerando los altos precios de NYC. Bastante bueno, recomendable totalmente. Muy bien wifi, incluido en la tarifa. Abajo, dentro del edificio, cuenta con una cafetería starbucks muy buena.

title: Clean, safe and central
text:
Booked for a four day family break at the end of May and can't find any faults with this hotel. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready but the hotel held our bags while we went for a walk around the area. The check-in was very quick and professional and the staff very helpful. We were given our room and our bags were sent up later. The room we had (a double queen) was spacious and very comfortable with a large bathroom and, even though we were on the fifth floor, we didn't find it particularly noisy.

The hotel is situated in a perfect position, 3 minutes walk from the subway at Penn station, 5 minutes from Macy's, Heald Square and the Empire State Building and ten minutes from Times Square. To eat, the Houndstooth pub across the road was good but Jack Doyle's on W35 was better for atmoshpere and service.

On the final day the we asked the hotel for a cab back to the airport and they had a private hire car waiting for us at the time we had requested. All through the stay the staff were pleasant, attentive and very quick to help in any way.

I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are a first time visitor like us.

title: 5 minutes walk into the heart of Times Square!
text: The hotel was literally just around the corner from Times Square. Our rooms were spacious (there were 4 of us sharing 2 double beds!) the beds were comfy, the shower was good, The restaurant downstairs served great bacon and tomato rolls.  The booths all had tvs in them. The foyer had a little shop with wine, juice and crisps etc. A lovely hotel and I'd definitely use it again.

title: Get away
text: Reserved 2 rooms for the family.  Quiet rooms but the hotel is in the middle of everything you could possibly want to do.  Close the subways etc.  Very clean and housekeeping was a dream.  You won't regret staying here.  Well done.

title: Loved It!
text:
This was a first trip to NYC and after searching for quite a while to find a quality well located hotel at a reasonable price, we settled on the Courtyard.  We could not have been happier.  As we were coming from JFK, the air train and Long Island Rail Road took us right to Penn Station in 30 minutes.  From there it was a short walk(less than 10 minutes) to the hotel.  Our room was a good size(as compared to other big city hotel rooms we have been in) and as it faced the interior courtyard, it was very quiet.  In fact, we were never disturbed a single time by the noise of another guest and the hotel was extremely busy.  The staff was welcoming, kind, and always very helpful(every employee greeted us whenever they encountered us).    

The location of the hotel for walking around midtown is great.  Times Square, Penn Station, and Madison Square Garden are all very close.  We found that it was easily walkable to Chelsea Market, Greenwich Village and the southern part of Central Park.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Pas mal
text:
L'hôtel est très bien placé à deux pas de Times Square.
Ma chambres était très propre bien qu'assez petite. En effet, il n'y avait quasiment pas assez de place pour poser 2 valises.
Le petit déjeuner est honorable.

title: 100% satisfação
text:
Hospedagem em NY te custa os olhos da cara por isso, procurei muito até encontrar algo que coubesse no meu bolso. Quando achei esse hotel no booking e vi o valor, quase não acreditei. Reservei e não podia ter ficado mais satisfeita. A localização é perfeita, apenas 3/4 quadras de duas estações de metrô (sendo uma delas a Pen Station, uou), do lado de Starbucks, outros cafés, restaurantes. Ah, e a apenas 5 quadras da Time Square (o que na sua primeira vez na cidade pode ser bem legal).

A limpeza do hotel também é excelente, nosso quarto era limpo todos os dias. Achei tudo meio novo, não sei se o hotel tinha sido recém inaugurado ou reformado, mas tudo estava incrível. Destaque para o banheiro com portinha de vidro (frescuras desnecessárias, mas muito bem-vindas). O staff era simpático e muito prestativo. Fiz uma confusão na hora de colocar o endereço do hotel na Amazon (são dois hóteis com nomes iguais, sendo um na 37th e outro na 40th) e eles me ajudaram a resgatar todos os pacotes no outro hotel. Check-in e check-out também tranquilos, estadia perfeita.

Pena que eu fui olhar pra reservar de novo e está o dobro do que eu paguei.

title: Excellent staff and very clean!
text: This hotel was a wonderful surprise. Finding a reasonably priced hotel in New York that is updated, clean, and has attentive staff can be difficult. This had it all! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I was able to check in early and found my room to be extremely clean and updated. Despite the small size, they made excellent use of space and I didn't feel the least bit crowded. Had a nice size bathroom, a good little fridge and it was very quiet, even though I was close to the elevator. I was not able to stay for breakfast, but the area where it is served is spacious. Location is also good, especially if you are traveling by train. A quick walk to Penn Station. Highly recommend this hotel for a good value and excellent service.

title: Almost perfect
text:
The location of the hotel is very good, it's situated in Midtown, It's on a walking distance of Times Square, Broadway and many of the museums.
The only thing that has troubled me very much, they charged me $ 36,72 for one 2 minutes call to Belgium, that I found very very exaggerated.

title: Five Star Service
text:
The thing that struck me most during my stay at the Courtyard in Manhattan was the extra mile I saw on service. At check-in, time was taken to show me the elevators, layout of hotel, location of breakfast, etc.  The bell man was always willing to hail a taxi for you, even though he had to run up a block and flag them down for you. Every person I passed in the halls or elevator had a smile and a greeting.  There just seemed to be an overall warmth or extra mile in the customer service here.

For the rooms, they were just fine.  Average size for New York.  My bathroom was actually a bit larger than expected. This is a good location for events at Javits Center.  It is very walkable to and from the convention center. I also walked to Times Square area a few times with no issues. It is a little farther walk than I am used to, but it wasn't too bad.

Overall, I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Central location and terrific staff
text: I booked here because it was less expensive than nearby options and we needed a convenient last-minute room, but we were so impressed with this place. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and attentive. We checked in early and got great restaurant recommendations, they answered lots of questions, and the next day let us keep our luggage at the hotel while we toured sights. Every employee we encountered was warm and helpful. Our room was cozy, clean, and quiet. I have recommended this hotel to many friends, and I can't wait to stay again!

title: Hoping for the Best.....
text:
And we got it! The hotel was very clean had all the things we were looking for at a decent price and in a great location. The rooms look like they had just been done over from new paint to bedding to fixtures - all well done.  
We got to the hotel much earlier than we expected and one of our rooms were ready so we were ready to go - very fast check in and with a cupcake - exploring in no time. 
The staff were helpful, friendly and offering suggestions for our 3 day stay.
The elevators had issues the day we left (these things happen) which caused delays but the staff did well handling the situation and trying to assist everyone.
We all agreed we would use this hotel on our next trip.

title: Comfortable and clean hotel
text: Stayed here with family as it was a present for my mums 50th birthday fantastic hotel very clean all the staff are very friendly and in the perfect location defiantly will stay here again on my next visit

title: Surprising!
text: Very nice stay for NYC! Clean, spacious, bar and breakfast downstairs. Great location, close to Times Square but not too close.. Very enjoyable. We also appreciated the staffs help in finding out way around and restaurant suggestions. Well stay here again!

title: Comfortable stay!
text:
Stayed here for 10 nights in July 2014 and had a reasonably comfortable stay. 

The Good:
- Our flight landed before the check in time and we made it to the hotel around noon to find out we could be checked in early. Yay! 
- Room & Bathroom is extremely clean, comfortable and well equipped.
- Central location, within walking distance to Broadway and lots of shopping on 34th street
- Friendly staff, especially the bellboy who would be waiting outside with open umbrellas to help guests get into their cabs or into the hotel without getting drenched in the rain

The Bad: 
- Noise levels from the room next door and road were quite bad and at times interfered with our sleep which isn't pleasant after a long day in nyc
- Hotel is located on a somewhat dingy/trashed looking midtown street, so as soon as you step out it can be a little gross

The Ugly:
- 'Free Wi-fi' was basically non-existent, my device could mostly not find any internet connections and when it did connect you could barely whatsapp or check email let alone browse the internet or do anything more bandwidth heavy, I spoke to the management about it but they just said oh ok we'll look into...nothing changed. 

Overall, we had a pleasant stay but will probably stay in a nicer looking area next time.

title: Great stay at Marriott
text: Our trip was shortened by a cancelled flight and even though I had pre-paid for the room, the Marriott credited my Visa with no problem.  All of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and the beds comfortable.  We went to The Bistro for breakfast the first morning and went back the next morning - it was that good!  The free wifi was a plus too!

title: Exceeded my Expectations
text: Trying to find an inexpensive hotel in midtown Manhattan is difficult, so you bite the bullet and pay. The Courtyard was a great place to stay, the location was outstanding. You are within walking distance of many downtown attractions (Broadway, Times Square, Circle Line, Intrepid).The room was very nice, the bed quite comfortable. We arrived with luggage around 11:00AM, and hoped to store our bags while we spent the day out. To our surprise, we were able to check in very early, which I very much appreciated. They have a bistro area, which is very popular with the breakfast crowd. But once breakfast was over, I never saw another customer in the bistro. Guess there's just too many other places to eat and drink in the city. Overall, if the Courtyard's rates are competitive with other hotels that you may be considering, I would recommend it. It exceeded our expectations.

title: Few days away in NYC
text: The hotel was central to Times Square everything on hand easy access. The staff were really friendly and would help with anything we asked, the room was plenty big enough for us and was spotless . It is ideal if you want a base whilst  out sight seeing or on a business trip.

title: Hôtel entre Times Square et l'Empire State Building
text: Bien situé entre Times Square et l'Empire State Building. Hôtel propre.Personnel agréable. Petit  déjeuner à volonté (groupe). Belle chambre avec un grand lit bien confortable et une salle de bain avec douche à l'italienne.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text: Hôtel situé en plein coeur de New-York, emplacement vraiment idéal. Belles chambres bien qu'un peu petites. Salle de sport très bien. Attention arrivez au moins une heure avant la fermeture du petit déjeuner car une demi-heure avant tout est déjà enlevé et nettoyé...

title: Trevligt hotell
text:
Bodde här en vecka i april/maj, trevligt Hotell med hjälpsam personal!
Rent med sköna sängar, Restaurangen liknande ett Starbuckscafé helt ok, man kunde även ta med  egen mat och sitta där.
Det enda negativa var att vissa av rummen var väldigt små.

title: Unhelpful receptionist, outrageous price, nothing to recommend it.
text:
Normally I am impressed by Marriott staff but unfortunately not on the two nights we spent in this Courtyard. On attempting to check in at 11:30 am, we were told by Patrick that our room would not be ready until 4 pm. No welcome, no apology. When I asked where we could change for a business meeting we had at 2pm, I was told " the  restroom" are you kidding me? We, as Platinum members, expressed our displeasure. We were told to wait in lobby and then informed that or room would be ready in an hour. When I asked to use the restroom I was told it was downstairs. Of course one needed a key to open door to downstairs and Patrick did not provide this. Another receptionist eventually came over and opened door.
After about 15 minutes Patrick called housekeeping and they found a room. When I asked about our welcome gift I was told I could pick it up anytime, 24 hours a day. But I had to ask! Price including tax for a king bed in the usual small NY type room for 2 nights was in excess of $1,000, possibly because of large fair in Javits Center nearby. Wi-fi went out after one night. Outrageous and disappointing.

title: Perfect Location - Excellent Value
text:
Great hotel in a really great location. It was less than 10 minutes from Times Square.
I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room (two queen beds) as well as the  modern and very clean feel of the rooms. Great value for money. The free wifi is also a huge bonus. 
Breakfast was ok, nothing special. I found it a bit disappointing that I couldnt have a latte with my breakfast and that it was bottled orange juice OR a tea/coffee. You could not have both, and the staff were very quick to inform us that our coupon would not allow us both, or anything other than a 'drip coffee'. The bistro area serves  Starbucks coffee, at the usual rate, but it was great to have it right there in the lobby. 
The bedrooms were cleaned and made up daily and the towels always replaced - we never had a shortage. The other staff were also very friendly, willing to partake in a giggle, which I always appreciate from hotel staff. A great choice for the trip (4 nights) methinks!

title: Wifi + location
text: Bra Wifi på hotellet, speciellt i rummet. Hotellet ligger väldigt nära Penn Station vilket är bra om man tar tåg från flygplatserna. Fint och fräscht rum. Verkar vara nyrenoverat. Trevlig personal i bistron samt i lobbyn. Maten var god.

title: Best Choice of NYC.
text: Stayed there between April 22 - May 01, all rooms are renovated. Hotel is very nice looking and new. Our room was a king bed room, we had a crib for our child, everything was spectacular for us. Large room, fast wifi, clean room, friendly staff.
